We’re thrilled to have been recognized as a 2018 Bay Area Best Places to Work by San Francisco Business Times and the Silicon Valley Business Journal. Being recognized means that we have happy and engaged employees who look forward to coming to work at Firewood. We accomplish this with our employee-driven culture, zero paycheck deductions for our full suite of health benefits (including insurance for your pet), commuter benefits, and many other benefits.

Now, about the opportunity: In the Senior Business Analyst, Data Infrastructure position, you will be the go-to expert on data and infrastructure for our client, looking at customer and stakeholder record data and seeing meaning, insights, ideas, opportunities and at the same time elevating the analysis and strategic thinking to become a true partner to our clients. The ability to think on your feet, be scrappy and dive into the unknown will be your biggest asset. This is a role where you’ll partner with a client UX research team and work cross-functionally to develop data pipelines and to provide clarity on performance of various marketing channels, cutting through the noise to deliver actionable and important information or recommendations to our senior-level clients. Sound like you? Then let’s get acquainted!

The ideal candidate match for our culture is a go-getter who jumps on new opportunities, gets nerdy about what they do, and works fast and flexibly to get the job done. Humility and collaboration are also a big part of their DNA.

Your time will be spent at a large tech client’s office in New York City, with approximately one or two days in the Firewood NYC office in Chelsea.

What you’ll do:
Support a mix of strategic and operational projects such as developing automated data analysis, creating dashboards, deriving insights from complex data, service metrics tracking and analysis.
Own regular cadence of reporting and analysis of our client’s organization’s operational performance.
Analyze key operational metrics and provide inputs for annual business planning. Perform ad-hoc analyses to answer various specific business questions and provide actionable insights to inform operational decisions.
Create and maintain dashboards to provide insights and visibility into key strategic and operational performance of the organization
Design and execute automation for tasks that improve the quality, speed and cost-effectiveness of our recruiting programs
Work with team leads to identify key metrics we can use to track the health of our recruiting operations. Set benchmarks and ensure we have the necessary dashboards to track progress and are reviewing progress regularly.

Who we're looking for:
Bachelor's/ Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Quantitative Finance or other analytics related field or 5 years of demonstrable predicate experience in quantitative analytical work across finance, risk modeling, marketing or a similar discipline
Outstanding literal and verbal communication skills with an ability to chronicle and depict stories of complex result-sets to technical and non-technical audiences
Deep analytical and data-driven problem solving skills, including data visualization.
Confidence while navigating large business data-sets.
SQL, database and spreadsheet expert: Ability to extract, analyze and manipulate data in a variety of applications and formats.
Experience in experimental design, causal inference, regression and classification models
Experience managing cross-functional technical projects for the complete life cycle, with competing resources and priorities.
Comfort operating and excelling in ‘gray areas’ with uncertainty, ambiguity or loosely defined requirements with a solve for X mentality
Ability to learn complex internal systems quickly to assemble and package required datasets for analysis, including cooperatively building and owning data pipelines that scale
Self starter capable of executing on high-quality work within tight deadlines with decision making mindset centered on complimentary business acumen
Technical skills using SQL, advanced Sheets, Data Studio, or Tableau
Proficient with Google Sheets, Google Docs & Google Slides.

It comprises more than 200 locations throughout the New York area, including five inpatient locations, a children’s hospital, three emergency rooms and a level 1 trauma center. Also part of NYU Langone Health is the Laura and Isaac Perlmutter Cancer Center, a National Cancer Institute designated cancer center, and NYU School of Medicine, which since 1841 has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history. desc:
JPMorgan Chase & Co. is a leading global financial services firm with assets of more than $2.9 trillion, over 240,000 employees and operations in over 60 countries. It operates across four business segments including Asset & Wealth Management, Corporate and Investment Banking, Commercial Banking and Consumer and Community Banking.

J.P. Morgan Asset & Wealth Management, is a global leader in investment and wealth management. Its clients include institutions, high-net-worth individuals and retail investors in every major market throughout the world. The division offers investment management across all major asset classes including equities, fixed income, alternatives, multi-asset and money market funds. For individual investors, the business also provides retirement products and services, brokerage and banking services including trusts and estates, loans, mortgages and deposits.

Asset Management:
Asset Management is a leading investment manager of choice for institutions, financial intermediaries and individual investors, worldwide. With a heritage of more than two centuries, a broad range of core and alternative strategies, and investment professionals operating in every major world market, we offer investment experience and insight that few other firms can match.

The Team:
The mission of the Business Intelligence (“BI”) team is to apply creativity, rigor, and data-driven thinking to help plan and execute the business growth of J.P. Morgan Asset Management. Our work is a blend of strategy, technology, data analysis, and execution with a key focus on defining data-driven distribution strategies for J.P. Morgan Asset Management.

In this role, you will make important contributions across a diverse array of projects and will be expected to develop a broad skill-set in business strategy, marketing, data science and technology. The role will require in-depth data manipulation, exploration and structuring as well as strategic vision and execution with management. We are a highly collaborative team - so you will have significant potential for learning and impact.

Your Primary responsibilities will include:
Strategic projects with high business impact
In-depth exploration of data to develop strategies
Partnering with senior distribution stakeholders and business partners
Partnering with individual Client Advisors on time and territory management
Working with technology teams to define data strategy and build data models
Conducting data analyses and prototyping basic statistical or machine learning models
Fostering a data-driven, innovative culture

Qualifications:
At least 1-3 years of experience in roles within the fields of business strategy, consulting, technology, data analysis, and/or asset management
BA / BS degree – majors or minors in business, engineering, computer science, data science, finance, or related fields
The ability to write basic code or conduct basic data science analyses (eg. SQL, Python)
Strong proficiency with Excel and all other Microsoft Office applications
Strong communication/interpersonal skills
A passion for technology, financial services and asset management
A willingness to approach problems from first principles, with the support of rigorous quantitative and qualitative analyses
A balanced approach combining judgment, analytical rigor, curiosity, open-mindedness and creativity

Create sales reporting, trend analysis and dashboards for our sales teams and management working with Salesforce and other similar systems and data.

Collaborate cross functionally with different departments to solve / scale sales solutions.
Automate inefficient processes within our team and broader Sales infrastructure.,Qualifications

You are a problem solver - you have the intuition to identify inefficiencies and take initiative to solve them.
You are a rockstar with Excel.

SQL and Tableau experience

WebMD is searching for a driven, self-motivated Associate Data Reporting Analyst and Report developer, for our Business Intelligence division in New York. This person will have access to cutting edge VLDB (very large database) Columnar Databases and MPP technology and business analysis tools including Omniture Site Catalyst and Tableau to support their data analysis and exploration. job_title: Senior Analyst - Sales Strategy and Operations
desc:
About Twitch
Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on LinkedIn, Twitter and on our Blog.

About the Position


Twitch Advertising Sales is a global organization dedicated to providing major brand partners with compelling and effective customized media, sponsorship and event programs. The global sales organization is comprised of business leaders, sellers, creative teams, engineers and product managers located globally across the US, EMEA and APAC regions (cities including San Francisco, Chicago, New York, London, Hamburg, Sweden, Japan and several others). This role will focus on preparing daily, weekly and monthly reporting for the sales organization. The role will assist with driving revenue-generating projects, conducting opportunity assessments, and helping to shape overall sales strategy and prioritization. During a typical week this role can expect to utilize multiple data systems to compile data sets, review data, uncover insights about the business, and present findings and proposals to management. The role will also be responsible for managing operational tasks and resolving business-related matters on an ongoing basis.


The ideal candidate will feel equally comfortable heads-down in data and leading projects to completion, and will thrive in an environment of rapid context-switching. In this role, you will work cross-functionally across the entire organization including Partnerships, Content, Marketing, Ad Product, Engineering, Finance and Legal to develop and understand deep knowledge of Twitch's business. You will translate this knowledge into building key parts of the Advertising Sales organization. Current and ongoing work spans the following areas: sales strategy, strategic planning, operations, process creation, process improvement, international expansion strategy, as well as internal and ad hoc reporting. As one of the first key hires to support a growing senior business team within sales, you will be playing a key role in shaping the way the global organization reports on activities and ultimately grows its business.

Responsibilities
Administer Salesforce.com data work including opportunity management and detailed analytics; continue building out and reporting on data for various stakeholders; support sales operations team with territory assignments, quota setting, commissions calculations and adjustments; ensure high data quality standards for Salesforce.com.
Assist with co-authoring highly visible and extremely important business reporting to senior management.
Work closely with team and management to identify systems, data or process needs that can drive revenue growth; draft and maintain detailed documentation of policies and processes; streamline sales processes.
Drive performance improvements across the sales organization and build the foundation for it to scale. This will include building and executing go-to-market playbooks, revenue optimization strategic initiatives to enhance productivity, process redesign, product roadmap and launches, resource allocation and pipeline analytics.
Requirements
Self-motivated, highly analytical, data-driven, and has exceptional interpersonal and relationship-building skills
Deep experience in financial modelling, data analysis, and the ability to see beyond the numbers to drive sound decision-making
Exceptionally strong written and verbal communication skills, including experience effectively communicating with senior management
3 - 5 years of experience in Sales, Sales Operations, Sales Strategy, Consulting, Professional Services, Planning, Analytics or related field
Experience working in high-growth, performance-focused environments
Experience with Salesforce.com, specifically around reporting, Salesforce Einstein and Salesforce Analytics
Bachelor's Degree required
Expert in Excel, PowerPoint, G Suite
Bonus Points
Understanding of financial concepts, including financial statements (namely the P&L or Income Statement)
Expertise working with large datasets and digging through data
Background in consulting, finance, investment banking, project management
Advertising / Media / agency experience is a plus
You are a gamer; you understand the gaming world; you are a streamer/partner; you love Twitch; you know the Twitch product
About You
Naturally curious You're always looking for ways to innovate and improve the status quo
Bias towards action You take initiative and feel compelled to add value
Builder mentality You do not shy away from raising your hand for projects; you love to build
Gritty You roll up your sleeves and do whatever it takes to make things successful
Perks
Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability Insurance
401(k)
Maternity & Parental Leave
Flexible PTO
Commuter Benefits
Amazon Employee Discount
Monthly Contribution & Discounts for Wellness Related Activities & Programs (e.g., gym memberships, off-site massages, etc.)
Breakfast & Lunch Served Daily
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We are Chalhoub Group, a leading family business in the world of beauty, fashion and gifts. We have blended our Middle East expertise and intimate knowledge of luxury to offer service excellence to all our partners and a unique experience to all our customers for over 60 years

As we continue to grow, it’s our vision to become a hybrid retailer, bringing luxury experiences to the fingertips of customers everywhere.

Our passionate teams drive our vision forward, without them, we couldn’t create luxury experiences for our customers. Through opportunities, development and support, we empower each and every employee to achieve their career goals – and beyond. It’s an exciting journey we’re on, and one you could be part of.

As an Omni-Channel Business Analyst you will be responsible for establishing and designing future omni-channel business processes. You will have great analytical skills and will carefully build alignment and agreement between different teams to establish new practices. You will create and maintain a library of business process and will be responsible for translating and communicating the processes to all relevant stakeholders. You will be able to effectively communicate with technical as well as business teams.
In addition to this, you will possess very strong senior stakeholder management skills and will be able to manage through conflict and pressure.

What you'll be doing:

Understand existing business processes
Identify impacts on existing processes and resolve inefficiencies
Recommend improvements
Act as Product Owner for Omni-channel solutions
Create and document business processes using Process Engineering tools
Measure and report on business process performance
Communicate and build alignment between all stakeholders
Define use cases and test scenarios for Omni-Channel software solutions
Execute testing activities and communicate issues, risks and defects
Ideal Skill set:

Tools: MS Project, MS Office, Jira, Slack, LucidCharts or similar.
Business Process Design & Engineering
Business Process Analysis
Reporting and Analytics
Omni-channel Retail Fulfilment Operations
Software Testing
Project Management (nice to have)
Agile/SCRUM
We especially would like to hear from you if you have:

University degree in computer science, business management or related fields
5+ years of relevant work experience in Retail, Wholesale or Distribution of consumer goods
Experience in Business Process Design as a Process Owner or Consultant
Critical thinking and analytical skills
Ideas - Excited to draw findings from figures
Experience in managing stakeholders
Hands-on experience with eCommerce, fulfillment or other operational systems
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Proactive, responsible, and attention to detail
Fluency in written and spoken English
Ready to join our exciting transformation to become a hybrid retailer, bringing luxury experiences to the fingertips of our customers everywhere? Now’s your chance. By being part of our journey here at Chalhoub Group, you can make a real impact on customers and some of the finest brands in the world. In return, you’ll have everything you need to innovate your career.

What we can offer you

We will help shape your journey with us through enriching experiences, learning and development opportunities and exposure to different assignments within your role or through internal mobility.

Our Group offers the opportunity to support careers that may span different teams, different job roles, different categories and even different countries. We offer diverse career paths for those who show drive and passion as well as the desire to learn and grow.

Amazing benefits

We recognise the value that you bring, and we strive to provide a competitive benefits package which includes health care, life insurance, child education contribution & exclusive employee discounts.

company: Achieve Beyond Pediatric Therapy & Autism Services
desc:
Come join a team of passionate therapists providing excellent pediatric therapy to children throughout the United States! Achieve Beyond was founded in 1995 and is continuously growing to meet the needs of developmentally disabled children through our ABA, speech, occupational, and physical therapy .We currently offer our services in the entire metro New York area (including the five boroughs of NYC, Hudson Valley and Long Island) and Albany, New Jersey, Connecticut, the greater Los Angeles area, Florida and the Virginia/ Maryland/ DC area. We specialize in conducting initial evaluations and providing ongoing services in home, community and clinic settings. Achieve Beyond is centered around our culture of collaboration and support to ensure our services are of the highest quality and adhere to our strong ethical standards.
All of our clinicians will have access to the following benefits:
Training and use of our paperless billing and data collection system
Full practice management – we take care of intake, staffing, billing, tracking authorizations, insurance correspondence and maintenance of your certifications, so you are able to focus on providing our children with the best services!
Access to continuing education workshops and trainings (we are an ASHA and BACB ACE provider)
Team-building meetings, events, and trainings
Now Hiring: Fee For Service, Hourly and/or Full Time Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
LOCATION: New York City – Manhattan, Queens, Brooklyn, Bronx, Staten Island
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Conduct assessments for children diagnosed with ASD and work with caregivers to create meaningful goals and treatment plans
Design behavior intervention plans
Create functional specific, observable, and measurable goals for behavior therapists and caregivers to implement.
Provide at least 10% direct supervision of behavioral therapists assigned to cases, incorporating behavioral skills training and specific performance feedback while ensuring clinical integrity of the programs.
Clinically review session notes on a regular basis for assigned behavior therapists
Analyze data and implement data-driven program changes
Ensure that progress is generalized and caregivers are active participants in therapy through specific goals, training sessions, and communication.
Conduct reassessments at least twice per year while summarizing data and progress for each client supervised
Regular communication with parents, behavioral therapists, and the Achieve Beyond office is required
Maintain confidentiality of information regarding children and families (in accordance with HIPAA and State & Federal regulations).
Ensure that all programs are socially significant, functional, and lead to independence and happiness!(services, programs, schedule, staff, etc.)
REQUIREMENTS:
Must have a passion for ABA and working with children, families, and therapists!
Master’s Degree in (Behavior Analysis, Special Education, Educational/Health/Human Services, Psychology).
BCBA and LBA REQUIRED
Minimum of one year of ABA client/teacher field supervision
Must be self-motivated, a team player, and exercise patience/professionalism.
Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail.
Compensation depends on experience and will be discussed during the interview process.

Overview
The Orchard is a leading music distribution company operating in over 40 markets worldwide – distributing music from independent artists including Ozuna, Skepta, Jorja Smith, John Prine, and Kelsea Ballerini. With cutting edge operations and an unparalleled global team, The Orchard partners with labels of all sizes to make their music and video available across hundreds of digital and physical retailers around the world. At The Orchard, the focus is to provide a comfortable, social and engaging environment to encourage productivity and creativity.

The Orchard, Sales Analyst, Analytics will report to the Director, Analytics and is responsible for analyzing and forecasting all sales and streaming data.
Responsibilities
Provide insights regarding individual releases and overall catalog performance across all music streaming services; provide contextual feedback to be utilized by the sales team
Triage and service all data related requests from the sales team
Serve as a subject matter sales expert for larger modelling projects carried out by the analytics team
Provide general strategy for the US digital and physical Account Management team by using internal tools and systems to provide label, artist, and release analysis
Lead a weekly meeting with the account management team, reviewing priority releases, identifying trending releases to be highlighted with accounts, and helping solidify rollout strategies for to set performance and placement expectations with label partners
Generate streaming and sales forecasts for all priority releases on a weekly basis; develop a system of grading forecasts to monitor and improve accuracy
Build and maintain internal reports and tools for the sales and label management teams to use in their day to day operations
Use visualization software (Looker, Tableau) to conduct case studies and other ad hoc internal analysis with the account management team, as well as provide decks for label and account meetings
Liaise with the Analytics and Data teams to create efficiencies and automate operational processes
Participate in the daily workflow of both the analytics team (daily standup, roadmap planning) and the sales team (marketing meetings, label meetings, etc)
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree required
Prior experience with forecasting and/or sales analysis in the music industry
Familiarity with current music industry trends surround streaming and sales of recorded music
Excellent time management, organization, and communication skills
Detail oriented with strong analytical skills
Proficient in Nielsen Music Connect, Microsoft Excel, Google Slides
Working familiarity with business intelligence tools, such as Looker, Tableau, etc.
Knowledge of SQL a plus
About The Orchard
The Orchard is a leading music distribution company operating in over 40 markets worldwide. With a comprehensive artist & label services offering including full-service marketing, sync licensing, comprehensive video services, transparent data analysis, advertising, rights management, digital and physical distribution and more, The Orchard empowers creators and businesses to grow and adapt in the dynamic global industry. For further information, visit www.theorchard.com.

Manager, CRM (Salesforce)


1700 Broadway, Suite 1400

New York, New York, 10019

United States


West Monroe isn't a start-up consulting firm, but we act like one.


From day one, our people have the opportunity to make a definitive personal impact for their clients and their careers. What does this mean? It means we seek out the best of the best, and then we challenge them to make us better. We celebrate driven professionals who thrive in a collaborative environment. Our consultants work on the front lines - partnering with clients to deliver game-changing solutions in the most dynamic industries. Sound interesting? Then West Monroe Partners just might be the place for you.


West Monroe's OneCX Approach


At West Monroe Partners, we collaborate across practices and offerings. Within our Customer Experience (CX) practice, we take a OneCX approach by delivering offerings to our clients that are not built in a silo, but are more transformational across teams and capabilities. CX team members get the opportunity to transform our client's customer experience journey through multi-disciplinary solutions including High Performance Contact Center, Salesforce (CRM), and Strategy. As a new hire, you'll gain exposure to other non-core areas within CX, while continuing to build depth and expertise within your specialty.


Think you're up to the challenge?


West Monroe Partners is currently seeking a talented Manager with expertise in CRM business consulting to join our Customer Experience practice in Dallas. The Manager will be responsible for leading project teams gathering requirements, designing solutions, and implementing configurations on Salesforce.com. The Manager also develops methodology and best practices with the national Customer Experience practice team, and actively leads and participates in CRM business development opportunities. The ideal candidates will have a minimum of six years consulting to Fortune 500 and/or middle-market companies and will have lead and managed CRM engagements across several industries.


Here's what you'll be doing:
Serve as act as Project Manager for several key clients responsible for day to day operations on one or more projects.
Communicate and report project status to client leadership and IT management, including budget, risks and general business issues
Report budget and finances
Mentor and manage teams of Junior Consultants to be able to keep project on time as well as review work done by the team.
Understand CRM technologies being used on a project to be able to direct how to design, develop, test, and implement a technical implementation project
Quickly respond to client requests for immediate issues while also being able to drive projects to completion
Analyze each client's specific request and determine the underlying problem and recommend proper solutions
On larger engagements, be able to work with larger management teams and determine independencies between the WMP project and other initiatives
On smaller engagements, be able to work hands on in creating deliverables which could include strategy, design, development, testing application and delivering training
Identify strengths and issues; drive and develop better behavior to create strong consultants
Participate actively in the recruiting process for other consultants
Drive the development and enhancement of WMP's methodologies and approaches to client delivery and provide thought leadership for internal practice development
Coach and manage other consultants and participate actively in the performance expectation process
Participate in business development with prospective clients including solution definition, pre-sales, estimating, negotiating and project planning
Present solutions and proposals to clients and prospects
Understand business needs and requirements and help turn those goals into tangible deliverables including projects and detailed proposals, requirements specifications, design deliverables, status reports and project plans
Create work plans, pricing estimates, and risk assessments for prospects
Actively build a professional network and affiliate network in the local community
Successfully manage alliance relationships
Participate in key client relationships and growing those accounts within Customer
Experience practice and cross selling to other areas within WMP
Other responsibilities:
Manage client relationships and meet with clients to determine business and functional requirements
Assist in re-engineering business operations and system processes around Sales & Marketing, Customer Service, Customer Self-Service, and Partner Channel Management
Lead teams in performing configuration and customization of the Salesforce.com platform, including templates and best practices specific to Private Equity/Alternative Investment,
Asset Management, and Banking/Credit Unions
Participate in and/or lead efforts to develop and execute testing, training and documentation
Facilitate effective change management programs within the client organization including creating and administering communication plans to promote end-user adoption
Act as a user advocate to ensure overall system usability and adoption
Here's what you'll need to bring to the table:
Experienced candidates must have 6+ years of experience working for a consulting firm or a professional services division of a software company in a business analyst/consulting manager role
Experienced candidates must have at least 2-3 years of hands-on experience working on the Salesforce.com platform
Experience in leading and delivering end to end solution which could include strategy, design, development, testing and training
Candidates will be considered for depth on other CRM packages (Microsoft CRM, SAP CRM, SalesLogix, Oracle On-Demand , and the like)
Excellent organizational, verbal, presentation/facilitation and written communication skills
Ability to work well with people including project stakeholders and project team members
Proactive desire to continue to broaden and deepen business and consulting skills
Ability to work both independently and within a team environment backed up by strong communication skills
So, if you're looking for an opportunity to flex your technical muscles in a high-energy, team-oriented environment where you own your career, we'd love to hear from you.


Think you've got what it takes? Join our team and make us better.

Vroom.com is a venture-backed, fast-growing start-up focused on revolutionizing the car buying experience. Our approach is unique in that we recondition pre-owned vehicles to a high standard, sell online, and deliver anywhere across the US. We have experienced tremendous growth in our first 5 years of operation and have become a disruptive force in the automotive industry. Vroom is an exciting, accelerating workplace, and there's no better time to join the team than right now.

Vroom is seeking a Strategic Marketing Operations Analyst with the ability to combine a top-notch subjective understanding of sales operations with objective data to generate consistently exceptional budgets, reports, presentations, and opinions while improving operational efficiency. The Strategic Marketing Operations Analyst is expected to make significant contributions to the success of Vroom by enabling executives and team leaders to make better business decisions and will work closely with them to evaluate, plan, execute and measure strategic business initiatives.

To succeed, you will need to develop creative solutions to abstract strategic problems, deliver your work in a clear and compelling format, and balance big picture thinking with exceptional attention to detail. This position requires a driven self-starter who is able to work comfortably with stakeholders across the organization, take tasks from start to finish and someone who enjoys working in a fast-paced, challenging environment.

Responsibilities
Contribute to and own sales operations analytics strategy and execution with a focus on call center sales and processes
Develop and produce reports and analysis on financial and operational data, KPIs, and trends
Work with key stakeholders to review and present weekly and monthly performance analysis, helping to identify weaknesses and opportunities, as well as solutions for both.
Run any ad hoc / ‘what if’ analysis informed by operational and financial analytics; including in-depth impact of new processes and products, vendor expenses or headcount projections
Own weekly workforce staffing and management forecasting metrics to deliver high converting and cost effective call center sales and finance operations (partnering with external call center vendors or internal call center partners).
Lead and contribute to business case development of new initiatives and product roadmap to evolve sales operations efficiency
Manage all budgets and associated auditing and reconciliation associated with third party vendor sales call center(s)
Constantly maintain an understanding of both the fine details, and abstract implications, of the above types of workDevelop and execute strategy to tap into a vast array and quantity of Voice of Customer and Voice of Business (e.g. call center sales agents) to identify and inform priorities the opportunity for, and aid in the execution of projects that will help increase sales conversion, expand margin, cut costs, and otherwise improve our bottom line.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in a business discipline in accounting or finance2 to 4 years of experience in sales operations or a financial role
High aptitude using CRMs and SalesForceStart up experience a plus
Substantial experience with financial modeling and proficiency in Excel
Superior analytical, critical thinking and quantitative skills
Ability to forge strong relationships with business partners at all levels of the organization
Drive for results & high sense of urgency
Ability to multi-task & prioritize
Ability to present and story-tell complicated information in a simple and easy to understand manner to all levels of management
Rigorous attention to detail
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Flexibility (open to change) and ability to learn on the fly
Familiarity with Looker or Tableau a plusA combination of EQ and IQ – always balancing creativity, situational awareness and objective information
Ability to take on, and succeed with, a diverse array of projects that require varying skills and approaches
Appetite to take on increased responsibility and grow career quickly
Create order out of chaos
Benefits

This full-time role offers competitive compensation; health, dental, and vision insurance through United Healthcare; a 401k plan; fully company-paid short term disability, long term disability, and life insurance; access to a healthcare concierge service with virtual visits; and 15 annualized days of paid vacation.

NBCU Sales Strategy is responsible for designing and execution of strategic sales initiatives in the NBCU Digital Partnerships team along with the wider Ad Sales organization. Acting as strategic consultants to our sellers, this small, but dynamic team supports the needs of both the sales teams and the individual brands across a wide range of dimensions including product innovation, sales optimization, go-to-market strategies, budgeting and planning analyses, and market insights and sales team education.

Duties and Responsibilities

Work closely with cross functional areas of business (Planning/ Marketing/ Sales/ Strategy/ Research/ Operations) to ensure seamless execution of initiatives and smooth operation of business as usual processes

Use and maintain an in-depth understanding of key ad sales and planning systems (e.g. Salesforce, NBCU Internal budgeting systems) and tools

Expansion to new Partners

Conduct competitive market analysis for digital advertising and synthesize, distill and socialize key trends that influence areas of growth and risk for the organization

Corporate planning and communication

job_title: Data Analyst - News Partnerships, Media Partnerships
desc:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
Facebook is seeking an experienced data and research professional to provide data driven insights around how News media partners can leverage Facebook's products to perform successfully. The position will drive key strategic data initiatives and market analysis, as well as providing actionable recommendations around optimizing partners performance in the News ecosystem. The role will be part of our News Partner Solutions team and is based at the Facebook New York.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Drive research and measurement strategy and manage prioritization of initiatives across internal and external stakeholders
Be able to interpret data and structure analyses to identify trends and actionable insights to drive strategic partnerships and industry communications
Build/maintain reports, dashboards and metrics to monitor the team's key performance indicators
Work with global team to scale programs
Deliver insights and make recommendations to partners
Work closely with Partner Solutions Managers and Strategic Partner Managers to educate and act as a consultant for internal stakeholders, scale data analysis in the region
Ability to analyze data to tell a story and make recommendations
Query internal data and provide ongoing reporting/analysis about News partners and ecosystem performance for new product launches or company priorities
Build dashboards to support News Media Partnerships, both within the US and globally
Analyze and segment partners to better understand our ecosystem and allocate resources
Create and manage data pipelines to aggregate data for News Media Partnerships team
Manage requests and priorities while creating presentations for internal use with cross-functional teams
Work with other analysts to understand how major media publishers, journalists, and the News industry are using Facebook and Instagram to connect and share with people around the world
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
BA/BS degree or higher
5+ years experience, including leading research/measurement projects
Experience working in Hadoop/Hive, SQL and Excel to drive analysis and reporting of trends
Experience working independently and a track record of taking initiative
Communication and presentation experience
Experience thinking strategically about issues, leading to recommendations and action plans
Experience working cross-functionally with all levels of management, both internally and externally
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Understanding of Tableau or similar software and experience with a statistical programming language (R, python, etc.)
Understanding of Comscore and other digital analytics tools
Experience in a consumer technology and/or media company
Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Overview
Sony Music Entertainment is a global recorded music company with a roster of current artists that includes a broad array of both local artists and international superstars, as well as a vast catalogue that comprises some of the most important recordings in history. It is part of a portfolio of Sony brands creating blockbuster films, consumer-friendly electronics, and innovative technology.
At Sony Music Entertainment, we are passionate about helping our artists succeed in an industry that sees constant change and innovation. The Global Business Development team is on the front lines, ensuring that we make the most of our relationships with major digital distribution partners, and also work with the most exciting music startups around the world. We strive to be ahead of the curve, negotiate deals that create value for artists and shape how customers connect with the music they love.

The Business Analyst position is a critical part of SME’s Global Digital Business Development team and the role will focus on analyzing new and existing digital revenue opportunities and making recommendations to drive SME’s digital strategy. This is a rare opportunity to have deep insight into – and influence on – the digital future of the music business.

Sony Music is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of age, disability, national origin, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, veteran or military status, marital and civil partnership/union status, alienage or citizenship status, creed, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.
Responsibilities
Conduct business case and deal scenario modelling and analysis in support of deal negotiations handled by colleagues based out of New York and London across a range of potential commercial partnerships—from seed-level start-ups to SME’s core partners and major industry players
Work with other business analysts in the team to create, maintain, and improve tools tracking market data and key deal parameters across SME’s major partners globally
Identify and analyze new business models that result in new revenue streams for SME
Identify opportunities to collect, process and surface data to improve efficiencies and collaboration across the Global Business Development team and beyond
Present data-driven recommendations to the Global Business Development teams in New York and London
Interface with SME’s local teams around the world to collect and share data and insights for analysis
Conduct research and assist with creation of presentation materials for senior management across a broad range of projects
Qualifications
Undergraduate degree and 1-2 years’ experience post-grad
Outstanding analytical and quantitative skills
Excellent Excel proficiency is essential, knowledge of business intelligence and / or data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau) recommended
Proven experience in financial analysis and modelling in presenting outcomes clearly, thoroughly and concisely
Strong people and communication skills, and an ability to work collaboratively, with both business analysts and internal SME teams
Time management skills that enable you to juggle multiple priorities at once and execute on action plans within defined timelines
Passion for music and for the digital media sector a must.
Preferred experience in one or more of the following industries
Management consulting
Investment banking
Corporate finance at a large, international group
Economic research
A digital media company in a comparable position that required extensive data analysis work

job_title: Data Analyst Lead, Global Business Marketing
desc:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
We are seeking an analytical, process/detail-oriented analyst who can partner effectively with the leadership within Global Business Marketing. The Analyst will work cross-functionally with several teams at Facebook (including marketing, operations, software engineering, and data engineering), with the objective of driving Global Business Marketing’s effective, analytically driven, and strategic growth and innovation. This role will have the opportunity to work across several verticals such as Gaming, Sports, Media, and Journalism. This individual will work across multiple focus areas including web, media, and face to face events analytics. This is an individual contributor role that requires exceptional analytical skills, a background in data-driven decision-making, and strong partner and communication skills. The candidate will have an analytical background and experience in managing data pipelines and dashboards, ability to make recommendations based on imperfect data pulled from multiple sources (internal and external), strong business intuition to guide their analysis, and ability to work both independently and cross-functionally. The ideal candidate will be passionate about Facebook, view the world through an analytical lens, be interested in a broad range of performance and marketing data, be intellectually curious, learn quickly, and be able to move fast while maintaining focus on high-impact projects. This is a full-time position and is located in our Menlo Park, California office.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop a deep understanding of existing business using data to build insights about our advertisers, products and competitors
Create, maintain, and improve key data sets, pipelines and reporting to track and manage Facebook Global Business Marketing's activities
Develop new and iterate on existing dashboards and reporting tools to automate reporting
Drive consistency in execution to maintain and improve reporting and analytical quality
Work with Digital Marketing stakeholders to provide analytical support for ongoing needs and large initiatives
Effectively communicate complex analytical concepts to non technical stakeholders to drive data driven decision making
Provide business analytic strength to help drive initiatives critical to ongoing growth
Conduct insightful analysis using internal and external data (e.g. revenue, product, market, industry) to derive insights that will drive business decisions
Focus on process and continuous improvement of core projects through automation and process enhancement
Analyze current channel, vertical, and sub-vertical performance and identify levers for driving revenue growth
Drive operational excellence in the marketing organization through identification and execution of opportunity areas that create efficiency, remove obstacles, or create improved processes and approaches to the business
Ability to synthesize impact on financials/economics on our business and provide business analytic strength to help drive initiatives critical to ongoing growth
Project manage improvements to drive higher efficiencies in day-to-day operations using a data-driven approach
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
BA/BS in Engineering, Statistics/Math, Business or related field
6+ years of work experience in Marketing or Web Analytics, or 4+ years experience with MBA/Master's degree
2+ years of experience in SQL
2+ years of statistical experience (creating attribution models, A/B tests or lift analysis)
Experience with a scripting/templating language (ex. Python, JavaScript, JINJA)
Demonstrated experience problem solving and providing business insights and recommendations from data
Demonstrated experience in presenting technical content across different stakeholder audiences
Excel and Tableau experience
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
MBA or graduate degree in a quantitative field
Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and drive initiatives in a cross-functional environment
Experience or familiarity with CRM platforms (ex. Salesforce, Oracle CRM, SAP CRM)
Experience with online advertising
Knowledge of other programming languages
Experience working with or in support of diverse communities
Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

ABOUT US:
CBS Interactive is the premier online content network for information and online operations of CBS Corporation as well as some of the top native digital brands in the entertainment industry. Our brands dive deep into the things people care about across entertainment, technology, news, games, business and sports. With over 1 billion users visiting our properties every quarter, we are a global top 10 web property and one of the largest premium content networks online.
Check us out on [1] The Muse, [2] Instagram and [3] YouTube for an inside look into 'Life At CBSi' through employee testimonials, office photos and company updates.

Visible links

DESCRIPTION:
Division Overview:
Data plays a central role at CBS Interactive, and as part of the Data & Insights Group (DIG), our Business Intelligence team is a crucial part of our success. It drives business, product, and operational decisions by providing rich data, strategic insights and analytical products. We are looking for an exceptional Business Intelligence Analyst who is passionate about data and entertainment and who thrives in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. The position is anchored around CBS.com with our growing SVOD service CBS All Access, which includes a wealth of established network shows such as NCIS, Blue Bloods, Hawaii Five-0, Madam Secretary to name a few and its increasing Originals’ slate, such as Star Trek: Discovery, The Good Fight, The Twilight Zone, Why Women Kill and many more.
Role Details:
The Business Intelligence Analyst will work within the Entertainment division of CBS Interactive’s Digital Insights Group in our New York office location, providing analyses, insights around the digital performance of CBS’ broadcast programming. Specifically, this analyst will take charge in identifying opportunities and communicating recommendations based on internal and industry trends to various stakeholders. They will be key in synthesising broadcast, digital and social performance to provide stakeholders with a holistic view into our entertainment programming's performance.
Your Day-to-Day:
Define and deliver content related KPI reporting, that will inform programming and creative strategy
Support content strategy, marketing, social, editorial and content teams with needed campaign reporting and analyses
Act as a primary entertainment analyst for content related requests
Present insights and recommendations to the business in a clear, confident and understandable manner
Utilize reporting/visualization tools such as Tableau, Data Studio, Sprinklr to create dashboards for users to self-serve
Research industry trends and communicate how these could potentially impact the business
Key Projects:
Refine and standardize reporting across entertainment programming to provide the business with regular feedback on digital performance
Synthesize broadcast ratings/digital/social to provide holistic picture on programming performance
Forecast the potential impact that programming shifts could have on digital performance and provide recommendations based on findings
Measure performance around show premieres and tentpole events and their respective marketing campaigns
Design reporting templates in analytics tools and service to various departments
QUALIFICATIONS:
What you bring to the team:
You have -
Bachelor’s Degree in a related field or equivalent experience
2-3 years experience in digital marketing/entertainment sector
Demonstrated experience in translating data into insights
Knowledgeable in SQL; Tableau; Adobe Analytics
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel; Powerpoint)
Proficiency in Nielsen TV and Social Ratings
Experience in social analytics tools such as ListenFirst, Sprinklr, Spredfast, Sysomos
Great presentation skills
Great communication skills and ability to articulate concepts to stakeholders at all levels
Ability to work in a fluid environment, against tight deadlines
Interest in television, entertainment and pop culture

job_title: Senior Analyst - Sales Strategy and Operations

desc:
Medidata: Conquering Diseases Together


Medidata is leading the digital transformation of life sciences with the world's most-used platform for clinical development, commercial and real-world data. Powered by artificial intelligence and delivered by #1 ranked industry experts, the Intelligent Platform for Life Sciences helps pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device companies and academic researchers accelerate value, minimize risk and optimize outcomes. Medidata serves more than 1,000 customers and partners worldwide and empowers more than 100,000 certified users every day to create hope for millions of patients. Discover the future of life sciences: www.mdsol.com


We know that diverse teams win and are fully committed to selecting leaders and employees that represent the markets in which we operate. We are still led by our Co-founders, Tarek Sherif and Glen de Vries, and have global operations in US, Europe and Asia with over 2000 employees.


Your Mission:
Work independently under the direction of business leaders and product management to provide feature-based solutions that support Medidata product strategy
Develop product requirements and processes for tools that make it easy for customers and internal teams to integrate and map to our services
Work with product members to finalize product priorities, including bug fixes
Create and own the business/product requirements documentation, including user stories
Interact with other Business Analysts, Product Owners, and internal stakeholders to understand new business requirements and enhancement requests.
Collaborate with the User Experience team to design amazing workflows for our customers
Interact with architecture, engineering, and quality assurance teams during the software build and/or configuration process and testing process.
Be the subject matter expert and product expert for multiple products/services
Directly interface with business users by responding to support calls escalated by the Help Desk.
Ensure efforts to continually improve domain knowledge.
Ensure the quality of the deliverables as per the defined defects meet specific standards
Provide accurate and timely information and escalates when there are issues.
Actively participate in meetings, including all agile ceremonies, and make valuable contributions.
Your Competencies:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to interact with technical resources and effectively communicate technical information and processes to relevant stakeholders
Ability to translate business needs to a technical team, including creating user stories, documenting use cases, acceptance criteria, and feature overviews
Critical thinking: Analysis and problem-solving skills to address core business problems; Ability to effectively evaluate a problem or situation from all angles to determine the most appropriate solution
Ability to prioritize your own time and juggle many competing priorities
Technical/software development experience a plus
Possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy
Skilled at creating business cases that meet product and strategic company objectives
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, continually evolving environment
Your Education & Experience:
Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 8 years of related experience; or an advanced degree 5+ years experience
Relevant experience with SaaS products, Life Sciences, and/or highly regulated industries strongly preferred
Agile experience strongly preferred
Medidata is making a real difference in the lives of patients everywhere by accelerating critical drug and medical device development, enabling life-saving drugs and medical devices to get to market faster. Our products sit at the convergence of the Technology and Life Sciences industries, one of most exciting areas for global innovation. Nine of the top 10 best-selling drugs in 2017 were developed on the Medidata platform.


Medidata’s solutions have powered over 14,000 clinical trials giving us the largest collection of clinical trial data in the world. With this asset, we pioneer innovative, advanced applications and intelligent data analytics, bringing an unmatched level of quality and efficiency to clinical trials enabling treatments to reach waiting patients sooner


Medidata Solutions, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Medidata Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by the law. Medidata Solutions complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

About the Job

BeenVerified has an immediate opening for a BI Analyst who will help our growing team to influence strategy and improve decision making throughout the company. We are looking for self-starters who attack business problems with curiosity and effectively navigate gray space to deliver results. You will be expected to challenge the status quo and use data to formulate recommendations that improve the business. You must be able to effectively communicate those insights and drive results across the organization, at all levels. The ideal candidate is comfortable working with complex datasets using SQL and BI tools, and is thoughtful and creative when solving data problems and designing data visualizations. Our team is driven, passionate, creative, energetic, and fun. We love to challenge each other by asking difficult questions and collaborating to solve problems together.

What You'll Get to Do
Influence business and product strategy through data-driven insights
Work with product teams across the company to design and execute experiments
Perform deep-dive analyses and translate results into actionable business insights
Develop metrics relevant to each business area and help teams to measure results
Create compelling visualizations and presentations
Present findings and make recommendations to management and stakeholders
Design dashboards and reports for partner teams in Looker
Create and maintain analytical presentation layers in our SQL database
Build models used to drive important business decisions

What You Bring to the Table
Bachelor's degree in STEM, Finance, Economics, or similar quantitative field
2+ years of relevant work experience, ideally as an analyst in technology, finance, or management consulting
Ability to tell a story using data, make actionable recommendations, and drive changes that improve the business
Strong business judgment and entrepreneurial drive
High attention to detail and ability to balance multiple priorities
Strong knowledge of SQL and the desire to work with large, complex datasets
Prior experience using Looker, Excel, Tableau, or other BI tools is preferred
Prior experience with subscription-business models, marketing-driven businesses, web analytics, and e-commerce payments are all nice-to-have as well

Your Reward For Greatness
Highly competitive compensation packages
Opportunities for professional growth and advancement - as we grow, you grow!
Great Health Insurance including Medical, Dental, and Vision
401(k) Match
Volunteer days
Professional development training
Company Outings, Sponsored Healthy Hours/Happy Hours
Subsidized ClassPass Membership
Catered lunches weekly, fully stocked kitchen
An innovative, energetic culture with great people to work with!

Why BeenVerified?

If you have ambitions to be a part of a high-growth, results-driven, industry-leading organization, BeenVerified is the place to be. BeenVerified builds exciting data products and then we market them with passion. We're a fast-growing company in New York City that balances the culture of a startup with the stability of being an established, profitable company. We want to work with people that strive to be in the top .01% of their field. We understand that getting to the top takes hard work, constant improvement, and by making data-driven decisions. It's a thrilling time to join the team, as we're expanding our product offerings in exciting new ways, driving innovation through data, marketing, and web & app development.

We believe in diversity and hiring people from all backgrounds and walks of life. You must be energetic, inventive, a team player and looking to help build and grow the company each and every day. You must have an inner desire to win and the idea of losing is a non-starter. If you are looking for a position that allows you to work with a group of smart and dedicated people who will support you but still provide the autonomy you need to execute your strategy, then you should probably apply as soon as you're done reading this!

More About Us

BeenVerified was founded in New York by Josh Levy and Ross Cohen in 2007. At the time their mission was to provide easy and affordable access to public records. Something that in 2007, was only really accessible to corporations. Since then their mission has expanded to developing products and services that grant access to information and data across a number of verticals. In service of this mission, BeenVerified has launched multiple consumer brands including BeenVerified, NumberGuru, PeopleLooker, NeighborWho, and Ownerly.

In today's ever-changing world, filled with fake news, deception and a lack of transparency, we believe equal access to unbiased data and information can allow our customers to empower and protect themselves. Our mission is to develop a diverse portfolio of technologies, products, and services, that gives that access to all people.

Barrel is a creative and digital marketing agency in New York. We work with growing brands to build digital platforms and launch marketing campaigns. Clients include KIND Snacks, Barry’s Bootcamp, Wanderlust, Dr. Jart+, Well+Good, Amazon, and Scholastic as well as various emerging consumer lifestyle brands such as Cocofloss, Medlie, Hu, and more.

We are looking for a driven and talented individual to join our Growth Marketing Team. The Growth Marketing Team supports Barrel’s clients by providing research, recommendations, strategic planning, and execution on digital marketing initiatives that directly enhance and optimize the client’s business performance. The Growth Marketing Team collaborates closely with clients and other Barrel team members to find ways to increase e-commerce sales, email sign-ups, and brand reach across different channels.

The Growth Marketing Analyst will support our Growth Marketing Strategists and collaborate with designers, copywriters, and engineers to tackle a wide range of challenges including web analytics, social media, paid media, conversion optimization, and customer retention.

Skills
We are looking for candidates with some or most of the following skills, but we will also train in areas where the candidate does not have experience.

Paid search / paid social: experience running paid search (especially AdWords) and paid social (especially Facebook) campaigns including keyword/ad copy planning
Email marketing: experience planning and running email campaigns on platforms such as MailChimp or Klaviyo
E-commerce: understanding of e-commerce platforms such as Shopify and BigCommerce
Web analytics: understand how to implement and draw insights from Google Analytics and other web analytics software; understand segmentation, conversions, and user behavior metrics
SEO: understand search engine page rankings and optimizing for better results; experience using tools such as Google Search Console, SEMRush, Moz, or Raventools
Conversion rate optimization: experience running A/B tests, creating landing pages, and improving overall conversion rates
What we’re looking for
Optional: experience working in an agency and/or startup environment with exposure to digital marketing and e-commerce
Analytical and detail-oriented; must be very comfortable using Excel or Google Sheets to organize and analyze data
Strong communication skills especially in explaining complex concepts in an understandable manner
Excellent presentation and speaking skills; this position will require a great deal of client-facing communications
Tech-savvy and quick to pick up new software tools
What you’re excited about
Collaborating closely with talented team members on fast-paced projects that see immediate impact
Advising new and exciting brands on their marketing and e-commerce activities and working directly with the client to roll out enhancements and new campaigns
Generating fresh and creative ideas on ways to raise the profile of the brand and to turn audiences into new customers
Barrel offers competitive salary, health/dental/vision coverage, TransitChek, paid vacation, free lunch daily, and a professional development stipend. Most importantly, we work on projects that truly impact our clients’ businesses and attract team members who love to be challenged with tough problems and fast-paced work.

Analyze industry trends, conducting discussions for insights, interpreting data from AMl's extensive global primary research repository, examining market models and tools, formulating studies and making recommendations.
Interact and work with client (either internal or external) to understand, define and address the overarching goals.
Draw on qualitative and quantitative techniques, to analyze and interpret the data and other insights and create actionable deliverables and present the findings and recommendations to the client.
Contribute to topical research bulletins, white papers on industry trends.

Overview
Join PLI and represent the legal community’s premier provider of continuing education and research services as a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst in our New York office. Work in a collaborative environment that prides itself on a genuine commitment to a work-life balance (3+ weeks of vacation days!). Grow your career and support operational efficiency through actionable, insightful data analysis and visualization.

For more than 80 years, PLI has served the legal community with innovative products and quality programming, building a sterling reputation spanning the country.

Your responsibilities as a BI Analyst
Provide reports, analysis and build dashboards upon request.
Monitor and maintain existing reports and dashboards with emphasis on surfacing new business insights that could drive improved company performance.
Perform business analysis on each request, identify and implement new ways to run reports using modern technology; train users to generate self-service reports when applicable and retire older report technology.
Develop new Cognos reports using SQL.
Modify ETL (using MS SQL) to support the data feed to PowerBI and Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW).
Other duties, as assigned.

Qualified candidates will have:
A bachelor’s degree with focus on information systems, computer science or a related field.
2+ years’ experience working with large data sets to extract and surface actionable findings.
Proficient with business intelligence systems such as Power BI, Tableau or Business Object.
High level of proficiency with MS SQL required.
Experience with Cognos, Salesforce and NetSuite highly preferred.
Curiosity about how data can support various business functions with the ability to identify the most efficient ways to extract and report data.
Strong business analysis skills with the ability to understand the business problems to solve and translate into detail technical requirements
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate with employees across all levels and functions within a company.
Ability to analyze and present complex information from multiple data sources concisely.
Your benefits at PLI

PLI offers a generous benefits package and is committed to creating an interesting, collegial, and supportive work environment:
Medical, dental and vision plans for employees and their families
Generous employer contribution to employee retirement savings account
Ample paid time off and holidays, summer Fridays
Career development opportunities and work-life balance initiatives

About PLI

Practising Law Institute (“PLI”) is a nonprofit learning organization dedicated to keeping attorneys and professionals at the forefront of knowledge and expertise, as well as preparing them to fulfill their pro bono responsibilities.

Chartered by the Regents of the University of the State of New York, PLI was founded in 1933 by Harold P. Seligson. The organization provides the highest quality, accredited, continuing legal and professional education programs in a variety of formats. PLI publishes a comprehensive library of Treatises, Course Handbooks, Answer Books and Journals also available through the PLI PLUS online platform. job_title: Senior Analyst, Sales Strategy and Operations
desc:
Twitch Advertising Sales is a global organization dedicated to providing major brand partners with compelling and effective customized media, sponsorship and event programs. The global sales organization is comprised of business leaders, sellers, creative teams, engineers and product managers located globally across the US, EMEA and APAC regions (cities including San Francisco, Chicago, New York, London, Hamburg, Sweden, Japan and several others). This role will focus on preparing daily, weekly and monthly reporting for the sales organization. The role will assist with driving revenue-generating projects, conducting opportunity assessments, and helping to shape overall sales strategy and prioritization. During a typical week this role can expect to utilize multiple data systems to compile data sets, review data, uncover insights about the business, and present findings and proposals to management. The role will also be responsible for managing operational tasks and resolving business-related matters on an ongoing basis.

The ideal candidate will feel equally comfortable heads-down in data and leading projects to completion, and will thrive in an environment of rapid context-switching. In this role, you will work cross-functionally across the entire organization including Partnerships, Content, Marketing, Ad Product, Engineering, Finance and Legal to develop and understand deep knowledge of Twitch’s business. You will translate this knowledge into building key parts of the Advertising Sales organization. Current and ongoing work spans the following areas: sales strategy, strategic planning, operations, process creation, process improvement, international expansion strategy, as well as internal and ad hoc reporting. As one of the first key hires to support a growing senior business team within sales, you will be playing a key role in shaping the way the global organization reports on activities and ultimately grows its business.
Responsibilities
Administer Salesforce.com data work including opportunity management and detailed analytics; continue building out and reporting on data for various stakeholders; support sales operations team with territory assignments, quota setting, commissions calculations and adjustments; ensure high data quality standards for Salesforce.com.Assist with co-authoring highly visible and extremely important business reporting to senior management.Work closely with team and management to identify systems, data or process needs that can drive revenue growth; draft and maintain detailed documentation of policies and processes; streamline sales processes.Drive performance improvements across the sales organization and build the foundation for it to scale. This will include building and executing go-to-market playbooks, revenue optimization strategic initiatives to enhance productivity, process redesign, product roadmap and launches, resource allocation and pipeline analytics.,Understanding of financial concepts, including financial statements (namely the P&L or Income Statement)Expertise working with large datasets and digging through dataBackground in consulting, finance, investment banking, project managementAdvertising / Media / agency experience is a plusYou are a gamer; you understand the gaming world; you are a streamer/partner; you love Twitch; you know the Twitch product
About you
Naturally curious – You’re always looking for ways to innovate and improve the status quoBias towards action – You take initiative and feel compelled to add valueBuilder mentality – You do not shy away from raising your hand for projects; you love to buildGritty – You roll up your sleeves and do whatever it takes to make things successful

JOB SUMMARY

The Senior Analyst for Marketing Intelligence uses data collection, analysis and reporting toprovide clear and actionable insights for the Marketing Intelligence team.

In this role, you will work to maximize Charter's competitive performance and market share for both the Residential business and the SMB (small-to-medium sized business) segment.


Your rigorous discipline around intelligence gathering, verification of syndicated data, and analysis and reporting, will allow Marketing Intelligence to act as the Company’s subject matter experts for local market dynamics of all competitors in each of the communities we serve.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Actively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience

Perform analysis and reporting to assess competition’s impact on the business, identify opportunities, and evaluate key business performance indicators and business initiatives

Work closely with managers in the collection and processing of competitive data

Work collaboratively with colleagues in corporate marketing and peers in the other regions

Leverage a variety of tools including Micro-Strategy and Tableau

Develop impactful reporting and data-driven presentations.

Identify trends and fact-based, actionable insights; clearly articulate findings in written reports using charts, graphs, tables and other exhibits

Create detailed maps for reporting and competitor research; Develop and document new processes with regional peers as needed.

Troubleshoot existing Micro-Strategy and Tableau reports; assess accuracy, propose solutions and confirm corrections

Provide customer activity analyses and the impact competition may have on subscriber growth, migration trending, churn trending, etc.

Responsible for ad hoc reporting and analysis as needed

Provide support, including budget and monthly forecasting, invoice processing, and assistance with inventory management and logistics (e.g. rate cards, channel lineups, and other collateral)

Perform other duties as requested

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Skills/Abilities and Knowledge
Ability to read, write, speak and understand English
Ability to analyze data and interpret information into actionable insights
Knowledge of database/reporting systems (SQL, Oracle, etc.)
Working knowledge of Tableau or similar program
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to self-train and pick up new skills quickly
Proficient use of PC software applications (Access, advanced Excel and PowerPoint)
Strong analytical skills and the ability to present information in an understandable format
Knowledge of marketing research, data analysis and related functions
Work with and develop collaborative cross departmental relationships

Education
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing Analysis, Analytics, Business or related field or equivalent experience

Related Work Experience
3+ years Marketing Analysis or Business Analytics experience

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Skills/Abilities and Knowledge
General cable industry industry

WORKING CONDITIONS
Office environment
