ROLE: Business Analyst, MIDAS® Relief at Source

DEPARTMENT: Recovery Services

TYPE: Full-Time

WORKING HOURS: 9:00 am-5:00 pm


WHAT WE LOOK FOR

1-2 years of experience within financial services and/or fintech
Must be familiar and confident with the Relief at Source process at all stages
Knowledge of Relief at Source, Long Form, and Client Services processes.
General understanding of internal GlobeTax databases interaction within MIDAS
Excellent attention to detail and analytical skills
Desire to innovate and improve upon processes
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, particularly Excel
Basic background of system experience (SQL)
Ability to organize, prioritize, and manage deadlines
Ability to work both independently and within a team
Ability to maintain professionalism with colleagues and clients
Demonstrates dependability in difficult circumstances and ability to persist with sense of urgency despite obstacles
Commitment to providing the highest level of service for client satisfaction
Ability to think quantitatively and solve problems analytically
Ability to perform a wide variety of tasks and change focus quickly as demands change
Ability to calmly adapt to varying customer needs and assist other team members, if needed, in order to meet crucial deadlines
WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

The Relief at Source Business Analyst serves as an interface between the Information Technology, Product and the RAS teams to improve internal processes’ usability and efficiency.
This person will also serve as liaison between all DTC, non-DTCC, and Global Relief at Source team members as it relates to systems development.
The Business Analyst must also be capable of answering client inquiries at any stage of the Relief at Source process.
BUSINESS ANALYST ROLE OVERVIEW

Serve as a RAS account representative to stay current on all RAS processes
Assist RAS Team Project lead with system improvements, project plans, and coordinate development with the designated IT resources
Assist with user test cases across all MIDAS database updates
Assist RAS Project Leads with educating and training RAS team on any MIDAS database updates
Suggest new ideas to improve the operational flow
Liaise with RAS team members to suggest ongoing systems improvements
Collaborate and communicate across GlobeTax departments with the intention to gain more insight into processes and systems
Provide technical expertise to the Product and Systems Development teams
Interpret and understand design input requirements, the impact of these requirements, and provide guidance to Product and System Developers in meeting these requirements
Support efficient working of all phases of product development, including sprint planning, retrospectives and managing tickets in JIRA
Demonstrate adaptability and judgement when shifting priorities due to industry, product, or user needs
Perform special or ad hoc projects required to support business needs
Adhere to strict deadlines for tasks throughout the day, and resolve any team member or client issues as they arise, while maintaining professionalism


WHO WE ARE

GlobeTax is the leading provider of withholding tax recovery solutions for financial institutions and their clients worldwide. We pride ourselves on cultivating subject matter expertise, pioneering innovative solutions, and maintaining industry leadership to achieve our vision that “No Investor Overpays Withholding Tax.”


WHY GLOBETAX

TRAINING

All new hires are provided with rigorous training that offers a comprehensive view of the services industry, GlobeTax’s product offerings, and division of departmental responsibility. After onboarding, employees are offered frequent opportunities for training and education to foster continued career growth and development.
COMPANY CULTURE

In our recent Employee Satisfaction Survey, employees reported “Company Culture” as their favorite part of life at GlobeTax. Past events include a reception atop the World Trade Center, Mets, Yankees, and Rangers games, bowling night, comedy shows, trivia, and more.
During our “GlobeTax Gives Back” week, employees volunteer during work hours at a charity of their choice. Philanthropic opportunities are also organized on a quarterly basis.
GlobeTax promotes health and wellness by hosting weekly workout classes, sponsoring intramural sports teams (soccer, kickball, and volleyball), organizing an annual Wellness Week, offering an annual company softball tournament, and more.
BENEFITS AND PERKS

GlobeTax is proud to offer a comprehensive Benefits Program, including medical, dental, vision, a 401k with company match, commuter savings, paid days off, sick days, corporate gym memberships, and more.


ACCOMODATIONS

The role requires sitting for extended periods of time and the ability to speak and hear. Specific vision abilities include close vision for data entry.

Generate EmblemHealth Provider File reports and data analysis for a variety of internal and external customers. Create basic Provider dashboards pertaining to Product participation by service areas. Create models to forecast growth and retention performance and financial outcomes

Develop applications and reports using SAS/SQL, Microsoft Excel, and other pertinent databases

Experience in a similar role

Understand and translate highly complex concepts to a wide range of audience

5 years of experience in a similar role

Who we are:

EHE has led the way in preventive medicine for more than 100 years. EHE is a national preferred provider organization that engages employees with a complete preventive physical exam by board certified physicians and year-round lifestyle behavior management. Delivered through our nationwide Centers of Excellence in Preventive Healthcare, EHE serves as the medical foundation of well-being programs. We focus on prevention, performance, and productive longevity that provides early detection of significant health issues as well as reporting on hard and soft costs of healthcare, delivering value for companies and their employees.

EHE is backed by Summit Partners, the investment engine behind many of the world's leading technology and healthcare enterprises. Summit's strategic involvement has helped EHE reach new heights as a pioneering force in preventive care

What we're looking for:

EHE is looking for a talented Data Analyst who will support and implement EHE's database applications during the design, build and maintenance phases of large projects and prepare datasets for modeling. The Data Analyst will become an integral part of the analytics team to design and develop the necessary processes in order to deliver high quality insights that enable EHE to improve how marketing investments impact business results.

We are looking for an individual who will immediately become a valuable member of the team. You will work closely with our Marketing Analytics team to design, develop and manage all marketing analytics functions.

In this role, you will:

Design, build and deploy database applications
Document data architecture requirements and quality assurance guidelines
Retrieve, compile and format large volumes of data
Assist in resolving database architecture questions
Use standard methodologies and design patterns to build highly scalable data products
Contribute to performance metrics definitions that drive our business
Reverse engineer data models and document standards, metadata and entity and domain relationships
Utilize syndicated research tools to retrieve various types of data (macroeconomics, marketing, business, etc)
Design and implement marketing performance dashboard using Tableau or other visualization tools
Prepare and refresh datasets for the different cycles of Marketing Mix Modeling
Build applications writing SQL and/or SAS scripts to manipulate data and/or writing specific instructions for an offshore programmer to write the scripts
Ensure applications are properly maintained by working with off-shore maintenance teams to ensure all cycles are properly completed, with strong emphasis on Quality Assurance of data and settings
Define the strategy and principles for data quality management, data governance (security and access), and data archival and retention – working with our VP, Privacy and Security
Partner with internal and external constituents to learn about their processes and department specific KPIs to design solutions that solve real problems
Partner with Business Analysts, Data Engineers, and Data Analysts to build the full lifecycle of data products end-to-end

What the role requires:

Bachelor's in Computer Science, Engineering, business or related field
5-7 years' experience working on a data science team
Architecture and security certification preferred
Experience with visualization tools including Tableau, Spotfire, Looker, Sisense, Omniscope and MicroStrategy
Ability to articulate data findings with concise charts and graphs using data visualization tools
Experience in ETL/ELT workflow scheduling with Matillion, Talend ESB, Airflow, AWS Data Pipelines, Lambda, SQS, etc.
Proficient in common programming languages including R and Python
Ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions and develop actionable recommendations
Proficient in system architectures (translating application design to operational requirements)
Prior knowledge of advertising ecosystem, understanding of marketing metrics, and analytical products offered as a service is preferred
Proven experience designing and building a data warehouse, streaming architecture and machine learning pipelines
Demonstrated patience when working with poor quality data and lack of existing documentation
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment

What we offer:
Competitive salary
Medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance
Employer-matched 401(k) plan
Tuition reimbursement
Employee access to our preventative exam and services
Gym membership

EHE is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and to attracting and retaining the most qualified employees.

The primary focus of the Hedge Fund Analyst is to provide analytical research support for the Hedge Fund Research team and to take responsibility for all tasks related to reporting, data management, creating presentations, etc., for the Hedge Fund team.

The successful candidate should be a consummate team player who seeks a highly rigorous and challenging environment for their career development. This candidate should possess excellent quantitative, verbal, and written communication skills – ideally, with knowledge of the hedge fund industry to investigate research questions, and an in depth quantitative finance background for establishing confidence around specific investment conclusions.

The ideal candidate will be attentive to detail, organized, results-driven, and a motivated self-starter. This candidate should demonstrate excellent inter-personal and multi-tasking skills, and the ability to work independently and collaboratively.

Produce ongoing internal and external reporting, encompassing a variety of formats, at the direction of senior members of the Hedge Fund Research team

UtiliSave has been an industry leader in utility bill auditing and energy efficiency services for over two decades, and we are growing rapidly as we expand our business. UtiliSave is seeking qualified candidates for Senior Business and Data Analyst position. This is a business critical hands-on role and the ideal candidate will have a record of success in a role focused on gathering data, cost analysis, analyzing complicated laws and regulations, and identifying cases, opportunities and solutions. This position interfaces directly with customers, so strong communication, presentation and client management skills are also essential. Previous familiarity with utility regulations, rates and billing is a must.

Responsibilities

Apply your analytical skills and general business knowledge to identify cost savings opportunities for clients.
Using UtiliSave’s proprietary software applications, conduct financial, utility and business analysis of clients’ operations, and initiate action to obtain cost savings for clients.
Interface with clients, utility companies, tax authorities, regulatory authorities and government agencies to obtain appropriate information to successfully implement savings opportunities.
Match details in complex utility tariff codes against our clients’ usage and practices to identify new savings.
Collaborate with our MIS group in implementing tools to improve our client account review process.
Requirements

3-5 years of experience in a relevant auditing or analyst role.
Have deep knowledge of Utility tariffs in any of the States in America.
International Utility tariffs knowledge a plus
The ability to grasp and explain technical and legal concepts and business issues is a requirement.
Strong oral and written communication skills, and the demonstrated ability to negotiate and influence decision makers, are required.
Previous experience working with or for a regulated public utility, especially dealing with rate billing analysis and customer interaction, would be a strong plus.
College degree with business major preferred.
Able to independently solve problems and think creatively
Ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
Additional Information

Candidates will receive the necessary training to understand our methodology and analytical techniques.
Our company is growing, and this position has significant growth potential for an aggressive self-starter.
Competitive salary commensurate with experience; excellent health, dental and vision benefits, 401K with company match; 3 weeks paid time off to start, plus 9 holidays.
We are located on West 27th Street, between 6th and 7th Avenues.


About UtiliSave, LLC

UtiliSave has been an industry leader in utility bill auditing and energy efficiency services for over 26 years. Our clients are large organizations with significant energy and utility usage, such as hospitals, nursing homes, commercial and residential buildings, universities, hotels and government facilities and by utilizing our unique and unmatched knowledge of utility tariff structures, we have successfully recouped over $450 million dollars for our clients. We are growing rapidly as we expand our business, and we seek talented professionals to join our team. We are looking for candidate who will play a key role in our forensic utility bill analysis, and who will help our clients to manage their energy utility expenditure more efficiently.

Apply via email to recruit@utilisave.com. Please include a resume & cover letter that explains why your background meets the criteria we seek.

job_title: IT Technical Business Analyst - Data Integrations

desc:
New York, NY / Full-time
Join a small, dynamic team that's raising the bar for health center analytics.
Relevant’s mission is to support community health centers in their drive to improve patient health. We do this by providing smart, friendly analytics software, along with hands-on support and consulting to help health centers tackle all kinds of data challenges.
Health centers love working with us, and our data analysts are a key reason why. They lead implementations of our platform, often helping to resolve long-standing organizational pain points around data and reporting along the way. After implementation, they act as a resource for the health center’s internal data team, helping them solve hard problems, sharing knowledge and best practices, and building up their internal capacity.
This job is both technical and people-oriented. Successful applicants may come from a variety of backgrounds, but if you have a track record as an outstanding analyst, analyst-manager, or director of data at a health center, hospital, or ACO, we’d particularly like to talk to you.
Main responsibilities
Lead new health center implementations.
Conduct stakeholder meetings; develop a detailed understanding of customer business processes; extract, clean, and analyze EHR data; write lots of SQL… and get folks excited about collaborating with Relevant!
Provide analytics support to our health centers.
Ensure that our platform is being used as effectively as possible to improve patient outcomes and health center operations. Conceive, manage, and execute data initiatives for health centers; build reports and data visualizations as required; lead regular stakeholder meetings; provide advanced training and technical assistance to health center data teams.
Help us build the best possible analytics platform.
Identify improvements and new features for our platform based on feedback you've gleaned from customers, market research, insight into industry best practices, and your own domain expertise.
Preferred qualifications
3+ years' experience extracting clinical, operational, and financial data from electronic health record systems. A track record of successfully navigating messy database schemas and organizational politics to produce analytics that drive organizational change is a big plus.
Ability to write complex SQL queries. We’re looking for comfort with concepts like subqueries, temp tables, and window functions.
Excel wizardry. For example, we'd love for you to know everything there is to know about Pivot Tables.
Thorough knowledge of a BI platform such as Tableau, Qlik, Cognos, or Crystal.
Knowledge and interest in the landscape of healthcare quality improvement and population health management.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. The ability to lead effective conversations with a variety of health center stakeholders, including technical folks, clinicians, and executives, is a key job requirement.
Some experience with scripting languages such as Python or Ruby, or a desire and aptitude to learn.
Be nice, and value collaboration.
Working at Relevant
Join a small team of people (currently, there's just under 20 of us) who love what we do and continually strive to delight our customers.
Help us build a company culture that's friendly, respectful, and encourages continual learning.
Competitive salary, excellent benefits (we pay 100% of employee healthcare premiums), 401(k) with employer contribution, generous vacation policy, and a general emphasis on happiness and sanity.
Our office space in downtown Manhattan is provided by WeWork, which means we get all sorts of nice amenities, including social spaces with couches, lots of natural light, and free coffee and beer.
How to Apply
Send an email to jobs@relevant.healthcare with the subject line "Senior Health Center Data Analyst." When responding, include a resume and a note in the body of the email explaining your interest in the position. Please also include the phrase "hyena pesto" in your note, so that we know you read this.
We're committed to building a diverse company. Applicants who identify with groups that are under-represented in the technology industry are strongly encouraged to apply.

2020 Data Science Intern - (19001927)
Description

Internship Overview
Our Internship Program is a paid 10-week learning experience where you will be immersed in the daily environment of a thriving Fortune 250 global financial services company.

You will gain invaluable industry and organizational knowledge through daily business interactions and job assignments, in addition to engaging in projects that directly affect our business, interact with senior leaders in conversational settings, and network with employees and interns across our regional offices.

Lead by Vice President, Enterprise Analytics, this group is responsible for leading and innovating on the long-term data and analytics strategy for the organization. The team engages in highly visible and dynamic business projects partnering closely with technology, actuarial, marketing and others to develop an integrated approach to developing and implementing data-driven solutions. The team comprises of highly skilled data scientists from a cross-functional and academic background (computer science, mathematics, physics, technology, actuarial, MBA, etc)

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
In process of receiving a UG or graduate degree in an analytical area such as Machine learning, Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or similar.
Experience in Analytics or other quantitative disciplines.
Experience with modeling and analysis including machine learning, statistical analysis, operations research and management science and data mining.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Must be able to explain technical concepts and analyses implications clearly to a wide audience and be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses.
Experience with SQL (any variations thereof), Python/PySpark and/or Scala preferred; though experience with other analytics software (SAS, STATA, MATLAB, Mathematica, R/SparklyR) is acceptable.
Using SQL to transform and utilize data in the data warehouse by creating, automating and documenting new tables in a post-load process.
Proven analytical and quantitative skills to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses.
Capable of taking responsibility for an initiative and self-starter even when assignments are vague or undefined.
Creative in finding new solutions/designing innovative methods, systems, and processes.
Reporting:
Role will report to AVP, Analytics Translation, Enterprise Data Analytics

Qualifications

Preferred Tech and Prof Experience
Data Science/Technology, Financial Services, or related STEM field

Experience with data visualization tools

Position Summary

Reporting to the Director, Capital Budget and working as part of the OMB team, the Financial Analyst assists in the development, monitoring, and review of the operating and capital budgets for the University.

Responsibilities

This work includes preparing reports and materials for University committees; analyzing specific issues, budget requests, and policy changes. The analyst summarizes and interprets the results for financial officers. The analyst provides support to departments in their preparation of multi-year budget submissions, quarterly updates, including interpretation of University financial reports and other sources of relevant data such as personnel systems. The analyst utilizes University accounting system information and database and spreadsheet programs to verify the successful completion of monthly, quarterly, and annual capital and operating processes. The analyst monitors performance against budget; creates new financial report formats and tracking tools, and improves existing ones, to analyze, project and record financial results. He/she helps to resolve funding requests from departments and maintains records of budget allocations. Performs other related duties and special projects as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's degree or equivalent in finance or accounting, plus a minimum of three years related experience required.

Preferred Qualifications

Advanced degree desirable. Experience with relational database software a plus.

Other Requirements

Must be detail-oriented with excellent organizational, interpersonal, written and oral skills, and have the ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff and management. Strong computer proficiency (Microsoft Word and Excel) and a demonstrated ability to prepare reports, summaries and analyses, along with the ability to collect and analyze data and evaluate information, required.

The ideal candidate must have a passion for excellent customer service and a commitment to exceptional quality.

Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran

Position Overview
QS Investors, LLC is an investment firm providing asset management and advisory services to a diverse array of institutional and retail clients. An independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Legg Mason, QS Investors manages over $20 billion in quantitative global equity and multi-asset strategies. The multi-asset platform offers a range of outcome oriented investment strategies that deliver on investor needs in a risk managed framework. Our multi asset capabilities include strategic and tactical asset allocation, portfolio optimization, as well as drawdown and volatility management. We implement our portfolios using ETFs, mutual funds, segregated mandates, and derivatives.

We are seeking an Investment Analyst to join our Investment Solutions team in New York. This position is responsible for working across the firm to create, support and determine viability of custom portfolios for QS prospects and clients. The investment analyst will help support those offerings by contributing to research, sales, marketing, and thought leadership to create and promote portfolios. The Investment Analyst will also contribute across teams to ensure execution against the broader strategic plan of QS Investors.
Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate with the investment team to design products which leverage QS and LM investment capabilities, meet client needs, and maximize product suitability across different distribution channels
Utilize quantitative tools for the construction of custom portfolios based on client needs and defined parameters
Provide investment insight while working collaboratively with research, implementation, and strategist teams to both enhance existing strategies as well as develop new client driven solutions
Support highly consultative and solutions-based discussions with existing and prospective investors
Assist in creation of marketing materials, client review materials and RFP content for the custom strategies, together with the Investment Strategy and Marketing teams
Develop thought leadership in conjunction with strategy, research, portfolio management and communications staff.
Serve as a member of the investment team, attending and participating in research and client meetings
Review market trends, client needs, and the competitive landscape to identify areas of opportunity
Develop a keen understanding of industry leaders in key product categories, how the products are structured and key points of differentiation
Have a passion for and an expert understanding of markets and investing
Qualifications:
Minimum of 7 years of work experience in asset management, preferably with related experience building, analyzing and/or representing multi-asset investment strategies.
Knowledge and comfort with quantitative concepts and quantitative multi-asset strategies
Experience using third party applications to analyze data
Python knowledge preferred
Bachelor’s degree required, CFA/MBA preferred
Drive to succeed and help to grow a business;
Strong communication skills, both with clients and internal partners
Work well under pressure with ability to meet specific deadlines and make decisions
Ability to work effectively and efficiently in a team-environment

Until economic and social rules work for all Americans, they’re not working. Inspired by the legacy of Franklin and Eleanor, the Roosevelt Institute reimagines the rules to create a nation where everyone enjoys a fair share of our collective prosperity. We have become a leading voice in economic policy debate—with a focus on corporate power, public power, inclusion, and the changing economy. We promote bold policy reforms to redefine the American economy and our democracy.
The Research Analyst will be responsible for project management and deliverables, with a critical role in our projects on labor focusing on workforce development. In addition to conducting research and writing analytical reports on findings, the Research Analyst will manage projects through our internal process, working with fellows/researchers and coordinating with other departments. The Research Analyst will also contribute to the strategic direction of projects, working with our development team on funding proposals. Additionally, the Research Analyst may work on institutional papers, events, and other projects.
The Research Analyst will make sure that all project activities are aligned with defined outcomes. The Research Analyst will also advise on program effectiveness and progress; troubleshoot problems related to projects’ implementation; convene meetings with stakeholders to define and resolve issues; assist with project evaluation and reporting, and determine methodologies.
The position reports to the Managing Director of the Think Tank and is collaborative with other departments.
This is a non-management, unionized, team leader role.

The Research Analyst’s main responsibilities include:
 Gather and help produce information that will be useful at the outset of the project. Oversee the design, planning, and implementation of assigned research initiatives. Create processes to manage and analyze data (quantitate and qualitative). Write and edit reports, memos, strategy briefs, blog posts, and other documents. Track and manage project deliverables to ensure on-time delivery and budget. Laterally manage team members to complete logistics and tasks for projects. Plan and manage logistics for meetings and events that involve internal and external audiences. Synthesize key feedback and information from managers, fellows/researchers and others (quantitative and qualitative). Engage and collaborate with national, state and local partners, which may include community organizations, academic institutions, direct service organizations, think tanks, professional associations, government officials, and media. Potentially manage an associate if there is growth in the program.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the person holding this position. It is not an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities. The Roosevelt Institute reserves the right to amend and change responsibilities to meet organizational needs as necessary.

Educational Requirements: Master's degree in Social Science, including Economics, Political Science, Sociology or any other related field. Possess knowledge of a discipline that is generally associated with the attainment of a master's degree in the Social Sciences, including Economics, Political Science, Sociology, or other fields.
Work Requirements: 5+ years leading research projects in a Think Tank, academic, government or non-profit environment Strong grounding in the research and policy debates surrounding the US labor market, economic inequality and low-wage work, with experience or familiarity with workforce development and/or skills-training programs strongly preferred. Demonstrated ability to drive own projects. Excellent analytic and research skills, including in-depth policy analysis; ability to shape arguments for complex policy proposals; ability to synthesize findings from technical research literature across multiple social science and legal disciplines; and ability to manipulate and analyze labor market data. Excellent writing skills. Strong oral communication skills and ability to make public presentations Proficiency in using research and data analysis tools and resources (STATA, Compustat, Jstor, LexisNexis, Proquest, NBER) a plus. Willingness to be a team player. Passion for the Roosevelt Institute’s mission to illuminate and contest power in the economy.
Roosevelt is equal opportunity employer and, as affirms in policy and practice to consider all applications in all job classifications, without regard to race, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, familial status, military status, height and weight, genetic predisposition or carrier status, arrest record, or other legally protected status. We strongly encourage people of color, people with disabilities, women, and LGBTQ candidates to apply. There is a handicapped-accessible, all gender/gender-neutral bathroom on site.

job_title: Business Analyst II /Senior Business Analyst - GRS Actuarial...
desc:
Advance your career at Liberty Mutual - A Fortune 100 Company! Global Risk Solutions, Home Office is seeking a Business Analyst II or Senior Business Analyst to join the team. GRS Actuarial HO is responsible for maintaining balance sheet integrity by ensuring reserves are enough to meet our obligations to our policyholders. The HO team partners with key stakeholders to ensure the necessary methodologies and tools are in place to analyze our reserve adequacy by providing critical information and tools on a recurring basis and continuously finding ways to improve the effectiveness of reserving methods and processes.
In this role, you will use your analytical skills to assist in resolution of thought provoking business problems and bring value to various internal teams. You will be directly involved in the maintenance and improvement of existing reserving processes, methodologies and tools, working closely with different stakeholders throughout the company.
This position will be located in New York (potentially Boston).
 Responsibilities:
Supporting the quarterly reserving process by maintaining and validating data for use in tools and systems.
Enhancing and preparing reserving and reporting tools.
Assisting Reserving analysts with ResQ reserving software, other reserving tools and output results.
Validating data results, partnering with the data strategy team to investigate, quantify and communicate drivers of data changes and their resulting impacts and potential risks.
Supporting numerous ad hoc projects.
Driving opportunities to improve process improvement initiatives in support of GRS reserving team goals and cross-functional needs.
Develops, modifies and distributes standards and ad hoc reports/dashboards to better understand the overall business and/or unit. Develops presentations and shares findings as well as recommendations.
Working collaboratively with internal parties such as finance, IT, audit and other partners and stakeholders using strong communication skills.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree required.
2+ years of relevant experience to include business analysis work.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Effective communication skills.
Ability to work independently or part of a team.
Solid knowledge of business practices and processes.
Strong proficiency with Excel spreadsheets and data manipulation is expected.
Proficiency in SQL is required.
Familiarity with VBA, R, Python a plus
Strong knowledge of available data sources, strengths and shortcomings.
Benefits: We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits Overview: At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed. We’re dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

JOB TITLE: Business Intelligence Analyst

REPORTS TO: VP, Product Management, Student Success

JOB SUMMARY:

The Business Intelligence Analyst works closely with functional stakeholders that include product, finance, marketing, and operations to create and develop the scope of the business’ analytical reporting. This role bridges technology and business to provide data insights that support decisions made with Barnes & Noble Education’s products and services. Our company’s mission is to help students learn better. As our Business Intelligence analyst, you will analyze business processes and requirements that allow us to make informed strategic decisions.

You have a bias toward action. You can understand complex questions, frame them as metrics, and have the technical sophistication to retrieve and package the answers. You have insight, as well as some programming and computing sophistication. You will be part of an Ed-Tech team that is shaping the future of education. As a Business Intelligence analyst, you will contribute to the mission of delivering higher-ed. web apps at scale. You will inform product strategy and partner closely with cross-functional teams to define and deliver on the next phase of education technology products for students. You will develop product solutions and collaborate to develop go-to-market strategies that drive adoption and usage, maximizing the impact on students and our business.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Facilitate and align key business stakeholders to sharpen KPIs that drive the business; review key findings with senior leadership on regular basis providing commentary and key insights, translating the data into a narrative
Create reports that allow product and development to respond to student behaviors and trends
Perform ad hoc micro and macro analysis to uncover insights around user acquisition, engagement and retention
Participate in projects with data science and product to inform product roadmap
Operationalize reporting
Translate business needs into technical requirements
Demonstrate the Voice of the User via the data that they generate.
Collaborate with the Agile (Scrum) development team as they bring new features to life, ensuring the measurement apparatus exists behind the deliverables.
Ensure reporting is packaged and produced in-line with stakeholder expectations and user needs.
Participate in shaping BI analytics stack
Develop, create, and augment data-focused repositories of user activity.
Collaborate with teams to integrate data systems/streams for use across the business
This position will require some flexibility in your schedule to interact with the off-shore team (early morning, late evening conference calls).
REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Economics or equivalent in work experience and at least 3-5 years’ experience in the same.
Experience with the Google Cloud Products (GTM, GA, BQ) — Preferred but not required.
Experience with mathematical programming languages: R, Mathlab, SPSS, Python, SQL, etc.
Exceptional understanding of rudimentary Statistics, Sets, Grouping, Data Structures.
Some knowledge of advanced data formats, JSON, Neo4j – Preferred but not required.
Exceptional analytical skills and attention to details with the ability to process large and complex information, derive specific actionable insights, produce statistical illustration.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Experience working directly with partners, across multiple stakeholder types of various cultural & organizational background.
Strong verbal and written communication skills to produce clear and comprehensive reporting.
Excellent work ethic; self-starting personality with the ability to problem solve and develop creative solutions; works well and stays focused under little supervision.
Experience collaborating with design and product teams.
Experience reviewing and analyzing data across multiple sources and identifying what’s important.
Possess ability to effectively communicate data findings to various stakeholders across the business.
Experience working for an online B2C company offering subscription services to access content – Preferred but not required.
FP&A experience – Preferred but not required.


Barnes & Noble Education, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

As an Associate, Data Science & Analysis person on Marcel’s Data Science and Analytics (DSA) team you will work closely with the Product, Marketing, Experience and Search teams. Core to your day-to-day, you will be responsible for transforming data into information, and information into insights and recommendations, thus evolving the way that we engage Marcel’s [app] user base; from both a product and feature lens, as well as at an omni-channel level.

About Marcel: https://www.publicisgroupe.com/en/news/press-releases/publicis-groupe-unveils-marcel
Responsibilities
Coming from a quantitative behavioral science discipline, you will be driven by curiosity and will have an appreciation for qualitative inputs. With a focus on user experience, business and brand outcomes, you’ll enjoy using your statistical experience to uncover opportunities and meaning from the data, as well as making forward-thinking strategic recommendations and communications to Marcel’s cross-functional work-streams.
Uncover opportunities, impacts and performance drivers through advanced analytics
Monthly and ad hoc reporting, including performance recommendations and budget optimization
Utilize data and marketing science techniques to enhance Marcel’s capabilities, go-to-market strategy and brand interactions
For example “and / or” factor analyses, regressions, conjoint, binomial, NLP
Persona creation, linking to context-relevant user experience
Assist with the development of measurement frameworks and report on key performance indicators
Creation of visualizations and compelling presentations to communicate data and metrics
Background & Skills
1+ years of experience in a quantitative analytics or consumer behavior role
STEM degree (advanced degrees or additional massive open online projects/ certifications are a plus)
Experience in at least one scripting language (Python, R, SQL)
Solid understanding of statistical methods and an awareness of the data lifecycle
Experienced collaborator and communicator across business, technology, and analytics teams
Excellent written and verbal communications skills; the ability to translate complex analyses into well-structured and simple to understand presentations and recommendations
Desirable
Familiarity with building media mix models and / or multi-touch attribution models
Experienced with reporting app-based user behaviors
Behavioral analytics platform expertise, such as Google 360, Adobe Marketing Cloud and Microsoft Azure
The Data Science & Analytics Team
Vision: To bring superior data science capabilities, and rigor, to the intersection of creativity and opportunity in a way that harnesses “The Power of One” and enables value creation.
Mission: To push the limits on the innovative application of data as we connect a multitude of data points, ethically and transparently, to learn more and share more across Marcel, for Publicis Groupe and Marcel’s users.
Strategy: By treating data as an asset, we are continuously shaping and evolving the suite of scientific tools that power the analytical capabilities of Marcel, while preserving data consistency, completeness, correctness, conformity, continuity and currency.
LI-SC

job_title: VIE Business Analyst, New York, H/F
desc:
Curriculum et lettre de motivation en anglais requis.

VIE Business Analyst, New York, H/F
Concrètement votre quotidien ?
Vous intègrerez directement l'équipe Front to Finance, responsable de coordonner les projets Finance directement lies aux systèmes de la banque.
Les activités seront divisées en 3 principaux domaines :Organiser et coordonner différentes taches au sein de l’équipe (réunions, documents et supports de présentation, planification des projets, suivi des statuts, communication des problèmes).Participer à la veille, le développement et l’analyse des besoins propres à l’utilisateur ainsi que les spécifications fonctionnellesAider à faire le lien entre les fonctions transversales et son équipe (métiers, IT, PMO) a New York, jersey City, Californie, Montréal, Mumbai, Londres et Paris
L'environnement de travail, c'est important !
Vous rejoindrez l’équipe Liquidité North America, l’une des divisions de Finance and Tax, responsable de nombreux sujets lies à la liquidité comme : les stress testings, les reporting reglementaires, la coordination et l’organisation des projets liés à la liquidité.
L’équipe est composée d’un directeur, un VP, 5 analystes et 2 consultants.
Les locaux de BNP Paribas sont situés sur la 7e avenue à New York, en plein cœur de Manhattan et sont facilement accessibles par le métro.
Et après?
Vous aurez l'opportunité à travers cette expérience de comprendre le fonctionnement interne d'une banque d'investissement active à l'international, en étant directement intègre au sein d'une équipe transversale ayant pour principales responsabilités de traiter l'ensemble des sujets lies à la liquidité et la trésorerie.
Le candidat sera au contact de projets stratégiques requérant la plupart du temps l'approbation d'importants comites de BNP Paribas. Le candidat évoluera dans un environnement dynamique et technique en étroite collaboration avec son management et interagira de manière quotidienne avec différents services comme les équipes : Finance, ALMT ou encore IT.
Pourquoi rejoindre BNP Paribas ?
Notre monde change ! Aujourd’hui, ce qui compte dans un job, c’est de vivre de véritables expériences, d’apprendre, de partager objectifs et résultats avec ses collègues. Bref, de tracer son propre chemin, différent, responsable et durable. Chez BNP Paribas, nous recrutons nos collaborateurs avec l’idée qu’ils nous aideront à concevoir le monde et la banque de demain.
Vous voulez connaître toutes les raisons de nous rejoindre ? Rendez-vous sur : https://group.bnpparibas/emploi-carriere/bnp-paribas
Et la rémunération ?
Elle est fixée par Business France et consultable directement sur leur site.
Etes-vous notre prochain VIE Business Analyst, New York ?
A vous de nous convaincre !
Oui, si vous êtes titulaire d’un Master 2 en Finance.
Vous justifiez d’une expérience de 6 mois minimum dans le domaine bancaire et en project management.
Vous parlez couramment anglais et avez des avez des connaissances sur la performance financière et le pilotage de budgétaire.
Par ailleurs, vous maîtrisez le pack office notamment Excel.
Votre adaptabilité et votre rigueur des atouts essentiels. Ajoutez à cela votre capacité d’organisation, votre capacité à collaborer ainsi que votre capacité à communiquer pour finir de nous convaincre.
Enfin, nous attachons une importance particulière à ce que nos futurs collaborateurs agissent au quotidien avec responsabilité éthique et professionnelle.
 Durée et disponibilité
VIE à pourvoir dès que possible pour une durée de 18 mois.
Les conditions d’éligibilité au contrat VIE (selon les règles fixées par Business France) sont consultables sur : http://www.civiweb.com/

The role of the business analyst is to define business functions, processes and requirements for client marketing and commerce systems. Business Analysts enable the transformation and performance improvement of an enterprise, with respect to people, process and technology, by providing relevant capabilities, processes and tools. Business Analysts structure, analyze and visualize an enterprise’s current state, design and functional gaps. They visualize the future state, design and guide the change process from current to future state.

Candidates should have experience working with clients to elicit functional requirements, define user experience needs and effectively communicating those requirements to the technical team.

Key Responsibilities:
Responsible for gathering business requirements from business users, and helping them flesh out those requirements to a detailed level that all can easily understandResponsible for documenting those business requirements in a way that effectively conveys the required functionality to the customer and to the technical staff.Responsible for insuring that the technical staff thoroughly and accurately understands the business requirements and interprets those requirements correctly into technical specifications.Responsible for tracking progress on delivery of specific features to the customer and addressing any business issues that arise during the development process.

Key Skills and Experience:
5+ years of relevant professional experience and a bachelor’s degree in a relevant area; or without a degree, three additional years of relevant professional experience (8+ years in total)Ability to apply consulting skills to solve a client business problemAble to communicate and present complex issues with assurance and confidenceDemonstrates the use of consulting skills including questioning, listening, ideas development, permission and rapport, and influencingStrong written and oral communications skillsAbility to understand complex business problems and offer meaningful solutionsExperience with web marketing and commerce systems, Adobe Marketing Cloud and Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) preferredAdobe Certified Expert (ACE) Business Practitioner a plus

Candidates should be flexible / willing to work across this delivery landscape which includes and not limited to Agile Applications Development, Support and Deployment.

Please note that there are two openings for Research Analyst position in GJNY that require different qualifications and responsibilities, and make sure you apply for the right position you would like to pursue.

The Research Analyst in this role will work collaboratively with GJNY staff to conduct qualitative research, including court observations, focus groups, interviews among other responsibilities.

Who We Are
The Vera Institute of Justice, founded in 1961, envisions a society that respects the dignity of every person and safeguards justice for everyone.

We study problems that impede human dignity and justice.
We pilot solutions that are at once transformative and achievable.
We engage diverse communities in informed debate.
We harness the power of evidence to drive effective policy and practice.

We work with others who share our vision to tackle the most pressing injustices of our day—from mass incarceration, racial disparities, and the loss of public trust in law enforcement to the unmet needs of the vulnerable, the marginalized, and those harmed by crime and violence. Vera has offices in New York City, Washington, DC, Los Angeles, and New Orleans. Vera is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity in the workplace—specifically, we value diverse experiences with regard to educational background and justice system contact. We hire employees that reflect our values: respect, independence, collaboration, and commitment.

Greater Justice New York
The Vera Institute of Justice is an independent, nonprofit organization that combines expertise in research, technical assistance, and policy to transform the systems people rely on for justice and safety. We envision a society that respects the dignity of every single person and are fighting to realize this every day. Our priorities are to secure equal justice, end mass incarceration, and strengthen families and communities around the country.
We are looking for a researcher to join our Greater Justice New York (GJNY) team. GJNY was launched as an interdisciplinary effort to tackle the drivers of mass criminalization and mass incarceration in New York. New York State is a microcosm of the landscape of incarceration across our country—arrests and the number of people in jail in large, urban areas like New York City are declining while a quiet but significant incarceration boom is under way in more rural, less populated parts of the state. We use research, policy, and advocacy to shine a light on injustices in all areas of the state and in all aspects of the criminal system—from bail to sentencing, parole, fines and fees, and more—and drive change through piloting innovative solutions and providing technical assistance. Our vision is a leaner, fairer, and more effective justice system where incarceration is the last resort, not the default, across all 62 counties of New York State.

What you'll be working on
New York State recently passed a historic set of reforms to our existing bail laws that go into effect on January 1, 2020. These reforms have the potential to transform many aspects of the criminal system, especially the bail decisions made in the courts and the number of people in jail pretrial. An evaluation of the process in which the new bail laws are implemented in local practices and their impact on local communities are key to identifying next steps of the reform. We are hiring a research analyst to play a key role in an ambitious, three-year evaluation study of these reforms, with a focus on six counties outside of New York City. The goal of our project is to document how the new bail laws are implemented, measure their impact on local communities, and examine any challenges to successful implementation and unintended consequences that arise.

Who you are
You are passionate about social and racial justice, motivated to drive change, and unafraid to challenge the status quo. You are enthusiastic, collaborative, curious, and kind. You have excellent chops in qualitative research and are willing to be nimble and work across multiple projects, often at the same time. The idea of working on a team of people who come from diverse backgrounds and perspectives inspires you. You either know New York State (and not just New York City) well, or you are truly excited to get to know all corners of our state. You care deeply about racial equity—in your research, your work, with your colleagues, and around the office.

In this role, you will:
Work collaboratively with GJNY staff to conduct qualitative research, including court observations, focus groups, and interviews;
Collect, clean, maintain, and analyze data;
Assist in managing research engagements with local justice system agencies, community members, and people who are directly impacted by the criminal system;
Assist in the design and deployment of data collection instruments and surveys;
Assist with grant proposal preparation;
Conduct literature reviews and distil key findings into memos; and
Assist in other GJNY projects and tasks.

What qualifications do you need?
Bachelor's degree in social science including but not limited to sociology, criminal justice, history, criminology, public policy, and two years of relevant work experience; or a Master's degree in a related discipline;
Experience in qualitative research including designing and conducting interviews, focus groups, and observations;
Experience with a statistical analysis package, such as Stata or R;
Excellent writing skills;
Ability to be flexible, multi-task, prioritize, and manage multiple activities in a fast-paced environment;
Interest in working with program and research staff in Vera's strongly collaborative, multi-disciplinary environment;
Ability to work effectively with a diverse array of people and positions, including government officials, criminal justice system personnel, practitioners, people who are directly impacted by the CJ system; and
Interest and excitement to travel frequently outside of New York City.

 When you join our team
You can expect to work with a team of amazing people who have tenacity, are creative, scrappy, and are committed to getting the work done. Why? Because our work is urgent, impactful, and more important than ever.
You can count on doing solutions-oriented and policy-driven research that is innovative and fulfilling. We ask difficult questions and entertain unconventional answers so we can reckon with the uncomfortable truths of our work.
You will have a gym membership you can't turn down, great benefits, and work-life balance. Driving meaningful change is hard work. But we also know that you have a life, places to go, and people to see.

How to apply
Please submit cover letter and resume. Applications will be considered on a rolling basis until the position is filled.

desc:
NYCERS is seeking a Business Analyst with a technical background and superior analytical skills. The Candidate will be a business liaison between the Business Units and IT. The BA is expected to forge strong working relationships between the Business clients and the technology groups in support of the Business Process Re-engineering and Process Improvement Recommendations (PIR). Duties will include leading business process discussions, requirements gathering (elicitation, documentation, and management); identifying disparate and overlapping current and future state workflow requirements; evaluating solutions that most effectively meet the needs of the business; assisting with the Quality Assurance (QA) Testing; and leading the User Acceptance Testing (UAT) efforts. Candidates must be flexible enough to grasp new concepts and paradigms very quickly, present technical and business concepts to Executives, and should be prepared to “out of the box” when necessary.

Primary Responsibilities:
Meet with Division Directors and staff to understand business processes and document operational requirements into
Business Requirements Documents
Ability to facilitate meetings with Division Directors and staff to determine and prioritize their business requirements and the impact of these requirements on existing applications and workflows.Participate in the testing of various NYCERS applications.Provide subject matter expertise to the team throughout the life of a projectSupervise day-to-day operations in the absence of Unit Manager.


Minimum Qual Requirements

1. A master's degree in computer science from an accredited college and three years of progressively more responsible, full-time, satisfactory experience using information technology in computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, database administration, planning of data/information processing, user services, or area networks at least 18 months of this experience must have been in an administrative, managerial or executive capacity in the areas of computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, data base administration, or planning of data processing or in the supervision of staff performing these duties; or

2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and four years of experience as described in "1" above; or

3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's department of education or recognized accrediting organization and six years of experience as described in "1" above; or

4. A satisfactory combination of education and experience equivalent to "1", "2" or "3" above. However, all candidates must have at least a four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's department of education or recognized accrediting organization and must possess at least three years of experience as described in "1" above, including the 18 months of administrative, managerial, executive or supervisory experience as described in

"1" above.

Qualification Requirements (continued)

NOTE: The following types of experience are not acceptable: superficial use of preprogrammed software without complex programming, design, implementation or management of the product; use of word processing packages; use of a hand held calculator; primarily the entering or updating of data in a system; the operation of data processing hardware or consoles.


Preferred Skills

5+ years in a Business Analyst role: experience gathering business requirements and assessing impact on current application landscape in a retirement system environmentAbility to define project scope and technical specifications, facilitate the collection of technical, operational or business requirements, set milestones to successful completionWorkflow experienceFileNetMainframe CICS (Customer Information Control System) Transaction ExperienceKOFAXExcellent interpersonal skills including negotiation, problem resolution and customer serviceOutstanding performers will have high-level business expertise, be able to multi-task, be pro-active in project planning and requirements gathering, set and maintain multiple priorities, and communicate effectively with people regardless of their technical skill setOutstanding written and verbal communication skills including the ability to establish goals and set clear expectations, prioritize activities and follow through to completionExperience with software development life cycle and application release management requiredExpertise with Microsoft Word, Project, Excel, Visio & PowerPointExperience in making presentations to upper management, with the proven ability to present complex ideas clearly and persuasivelyExcellent problem solving skills, and the ability to interact with all levels of technical and non-technical staff.Understanding in Human Factor as it relates to user friendly design of interfaces, maximize usability, and improvement of worker efficiency


To Apply

Please click the "apply" button and submit your resume and cover letter, indicate Job ID 314644.

Analyze, calculate, validate and reconcile Medicare Part D Prescription Drug Event (PDE) files. Partner with other Emblem and Pharmacy Benefit Manager (PBM) to ensure timely and accurate PDE file submissions. Participate in related audits, make recommendations to improve PDE results, and prepare actionable reports used by leadership to monitor and oversee PDE submission and Part D financial payment accuracy. Maintain a current understanding of CMS guidance on PDEs and Emblem customers’ Part D coverage and benefit plans in order to accurately analyze Part D claims and PDE data and supports all components of PDE data and Part D financial payment reconciliation.

Responsibilities:
Lead PDE resolution activities with minimal 99.95% acceptance rate target.
Work across the organization to identify and resolve the issues causing PDE errors.
Proactively manage day-to-day PDE activities and hold/lead meetings with Emblem Enrollment Team and PBM for timely solutions.
Perform timely analysis and reconciliation of PDE entries rejected by CMS, including adjustments related to eligibility, accumulators, cost sharing, gap discounts and LICS (low income subsidy) status.
Identify gaps in the benefit and formulary design structure to ensure prompt resolution of all setup issues that impact claims adjudication and therefore PDEs.
Review PDE error reports and analyze pharmacy claims and PDE reject data as needed to identify root cause of PDE errors.
Establish a positive working relationship with other Emblem Enrollment and PBM teams to timely resolve errors and correct/adjust PDE records.
Understand PBM’s PDE process to align the PDE fixes/updates with PBM’s timelines.
Understand eligibility feed process to assist with identifying potential issues and report them to timely.
Ensure continuous improvement of Part D claims and PDE accuracy through root cause analysis of errors and recommending systems and procedure enhancements as appropriate.
Assist in project management tasks (e.g., prepare business and technical requirements for error resolution, project status updates, checklists, and timelines of key stages to complete corrective actions).
Troubleshoot Acumen Tickets related to PDE issues.
Ensure successful adherence to annual CMS deadlines, and internal timelines for PDE reconciliation, reporting, testing, and corrections.
Participate in Medicare Part D financial audits, as needed.
Perform timely download, compilation, reconciliation and maintenance of PDE related guidance, data and reports, including:
CMS files (e.g., PDE guidance memos, CSSC training, Acumen tickets)
PDE monitoring reports (e.g., PDE FIN report, PDE Management Reports, and PDE Error reports).
PDE data (e.g., CMS response files, CMS rejects, PBM pre-edit rejects)
Process PDE response files and reject data in SAS, compile and maintain outputs in SAS PDE databases to be used for reporting and analyses.
Validate and reconcile PDE data to PDE financial and management reports.
Prepare and maintain actionable PDE dashboards and reports for leadership to be used in monitoring and overseeing PDE submission and Part D financial payment accuracy. Examples include:
Bi-monthly and Monthly PDE errors and acceptance rate dashboard and summary reports
PDE and Part D Financial payment reconciliation
Summary of PDE Acumen ticket findings, member impact, and corrective actions
Updates to Emblem Compliance Online Monitoring Tool/Reports for PDE metrics
Summary of PDE related audit findings, member impact, and corrective actions
Summary CMS guidance updates on PDE calculations and reporting rules
Prepare other Part D reporting, as needed (e.g., HPMS reporting, Annual Part D Direct and Indirect Remuneration reporting, PDE reports requested by other Emblem teams and approved by PDE Task Force Leaders).
Assist in development of PDE submission, reconciliation, and analytics standards related documentation and training materials.
Review and monitor CMS guidance.
Maintain current understanding of the following PDE-related topics:
PDE calculation and reporting rules
Medicare Part D coverage rules (e.g., Defined Standard Benefit, Employer Group Waiver Plans)
Part D financial payment rules (e.g., Coverage Gap Discount Program, LICS subsidy, Reinsurance subsidy)
Serve as subject matter expert for PDE-related topics (above) and participate in interdepartmental meetings and PBM conference calls.
Assist management on special projects.
Support New Plan Year implementation testing.
Support CMS audits.
Support financial statement audits.
Provide support to cascaded projects and goals.
Regulatory Reporting:
456Medicaid Managed Care Operating Report
Special Investigation Unit reports
Retiree Drug Subsidy Reports for USA, NYSHIP, MTA
Other reports:
OMT
Upload and analyze cash receipt rebate files from ESI
STARS and PPA reports
ALPHA GH3, NonGH3, CCI Medicare, CCI HIX/Commercial table creation and maintenance
Inpharmative data analysis and manipulation until vendor is sunset
Various Ad Hoc Reports
Other activities, including creating guides and training new team members.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Health Administration, Math, Sciences, or IT from a four-year college or university
Master’s Degree a plus but not required
Minimum of four (4) to six (6) years’ experience in data analytics required; related experience in a PBM or Managed Healthcare setting preferred
Strong expertise with MS Office tools (including Access and Excel) is required
Programming experience or working knowledge of SAS or Oracle/SQL queries is preferred
Effective verbal and written communication skills is required
Experience working with Medicare Part D is preferred
Reporting/Business Intelligence experience is preferred
Understanding of financial concepts, claims processing concepts and knowledge of healthcare operating systems is preferred

Position Summary
The Senior Forensic Data Analyst is responsible for performing ongoing monitoring of key financial transactions, maintaining the department’s data analytics program, analyzing documents and identifying non-compliant or potentially fraudulent transactions. The Analyst will identify and communicate observations to Internal Audit leadership and draft observations and recommendations in clear and concise reports. The candidate must possess strong communication and analytical skills, adapt to changing environments, be self-motivated, be detail oriented, understand accounting and business processes and be a team player.

Working with forensic teams using fraud detection technologies and data analysis tools.

working understanding of accounting systems and principles, and business processes. Experience in risk/compliance assessments or data science.

Strong problem solving, use of judgment and strategic mind-set with ability to challenge current processes and generate solutions. Highly organized with attention to detail to drive accuracy. Strong analytic skills and experience in staging and analyzing structured datasets, especially transactional data from financial systems. High proficiency in Microsoft applications, such as Access, Excel, and Power BI.

Preferred Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:
Proficiency with data analytic tools (e.g., Alteryx and Microsoft BI) and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau), is a plus. Experience obtaining social media data and applying to investigative procedures.

Job Title: Data Visualization Consultant
Job Description Overview
We Are:
Applied Intelligence, the people who love using data to tell a story. We’re also the world’s largest team of data scientists, data engineers, and experts in machine learning and AI. A great day for us? Solving big problems using the latest tech, serious brain power, and deep knowledge of just about every industry. We believe a mix of data, analytics, automation, and responsible AI can do almost anything—spark digital metamorphoses, widen the range of what humans can do, and breathe life into smart products and services. Want to join our crew of sharp analytical minds? Visit us here to find out more about Applied Intelligence.


You Are:
A data visionary—literally! As a digital business integration pro, you’re fascinated by data, no matter where it comes from. Your superpower? Leading data visualization efforts by creating crystal clear, compelling visualizations of data in clients’ standard platforms—then teasing out and sharing insights from that data. You have top-notch communication skills and you’re in your element managing projects and juggling priorities in a fast-paced setting where results are everything.


The Work:
Build powerful, stand-out visualizations of process and business operations data
Grasp users’ needs and translate them into business and technology solutions
Consult on and help with the making of creative data visualization to give users the best experience possible
Prototype and build new ideas and take part in all stages of the product lifecycle from research to release
Help migrate users’ homegrown data visualization applications to enterprise standard
Analyze “as is” and “to be” processes to define system/technology/business requirements
Be ready to rack up those air miles with weekly travel to client sites


Here’s What You Need:
Minimum 2 years of design or development experience with 2 or more of the following data visualization tools; Tableau, Qlik or PowerBI
Minimum 2 years visualization design experience to include dashboards, executive briefings, or front-end visualizations
Minimum 1 year of data technology experience to include Business Intelligence tools, methodologies, and/or responsibilities (for example, Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) and/or Business Intelligence Reporting)
Proven ability to solve complex business problems using BI tools
Minimum of a bachelor's degree or 2 years of hands-on data visualization experience,Bonus Points If:
You have custom data visualization experience using Javascript, CSS, HTML5 and/or d3.js
You have experience with Business Intelligence and/or Data Management project work and toolsets, such as: master data management (i.e., Informatica MDM), data governance, ETL (i.e., Informatica, DataStage, Ab Initio), business intelligence reporting (i.e., Business Objects, Cognos, MicroStrategy), other data visualization toolsets (i.e., Tableau, Spotfire, Qlik, PowerBI).
You have full life cycle development experience
You have industry experience (financial services, resources, healthcare, government, products, communications, high tech)
You’re a pro with Platforms (Teradata, IBM, TM1, Netezza, DataMirror, Oracle, Essbase, GoldenGate, EMS, Greenplum)
You have previous consulting experience
You have experience leading technical teams

We are a global collective of innovators applying the New every day to improve the way the world works and lives. Help us show the world what’s possible as you partner with clients to unlock hidden value and deliver innovative solutions. Empowered with innovative tools, continuous learning and a global community of diverse talent and perspectives, we drive success in a new business architecture that disrupts conventional practices. Our expertise spans 40+ industries across 120+ countries and impacts millions of lives every day. We turn ideas into reality.
