Strong use of concepts: Understands a situation or problem by putting the pieces together, seeing the larger picture. This includes identifying patterns or connections between situations that are not obviously related, identifying key or underlying issues in complex situations, using creative conceptual, inductive reasoning to apply existing concepts to define innovative ideas. More intuitive than rational approach of situations or problems by first trying to find the abstract meaning of things rather than the concrete nature.
Analytical capability: Able to break down complex problems into simple manageable units, develops solutions for each unit, and integrates them back into the whole. Can absorb ideas quickly and apply them pragmatically.
Adaptability: Able to adjust to new environments, work effectively in varied situations and function in changing circumstances with a minimum of confusion or loss of productivity.

Job Description

Senior Analyst – Data & Analysis

Digitas is a highly-caffeinated playground where brilliant minds come together to bring bold, award-winning ideas to life.

The Data & Analysis team uses data-driven insights to fuel strategic growth for clients. We believe that data should never exist in a vacuum; instead, it should be put to work to bring the best ideas and stories to our clients.

To help with this, we’re looking for an outstanding Senior Analyst – someone who can analyze massive data sets, make insightful cross-channel recommendations, and communicate strategic ideas to clients. Sound like you? Read on.

What you’ll do:

As a Senior Analyst, you’ll build the strategic and tactical foundation for data-driven marketing efforts. You’ll work to achieve client goals through brand and acquisition campaigns, site optimization, and/or online testing strategy.

Day-to-day, your role includes:
Instituting frameworks across project and campaign lifecycles, including measurement plans, primary and secondary research, and performance reportingDiving into large data sets, uncovering insights, and providing impactful recommendations to clientsConnecting the dots across channels through data (including display media, site, search, email, and social) to provide a holistic view of marketing efforts
Communicating with clients regularly on scheduled deliverables and ad-hoc requestsCollaborating with internal teams and external partners to drive success for client’s business goals

We’re looking for strong, impactful work experience, which typically includes:
3-5 years of experience in analytics or strategyA four-year college degreePassion for digital marketing and emerging trends in the digital landscapeExperience communicating with internal and external stakeholders at a variety of levelsFluency with Excel (including pivot tables and vlookups) and/or other data analysis tools such as SQL or TableauComfortable in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment

Got what it takes? We’d love to hear from you.
Digitas is an equal opportunity employer.,Qualifications

desc:
Job Description

Develop expertise and advanced competence in a customized Salesforce platform and as needed familiarity and competence with government databases to enter performance data and to extract data for analysis, build and configure large data files for reporting
Responsible for data reporting and analysis for large-scale pretrial services program using Salesforce and converting to use the Exponent Case Management (ECM) solution on the Salesforce App Exchange
Develop automated data reports to analyze program performance and submit weekly, monthly and quarterly data reporting
Work collaboratively with pretrial services leadership and quality assurance analysts to identify missing, inaccurate, or otherwise problematic data and contribute to oversight procedures to monitor and track the timeliness, accuracy, and usefulness of data
Extract, format and transform data from agency databases into tables, figures, and charts, and data reports according to program contract management and set protocols for invoicing, financial projection analysis, and performance management
 Develop and present monthly and year-to-date program performance using data visualizations and dashboard to provide year-to-date trend analysis and performance trends
Develop and use protocols to identify problems with data entry, datasets and routine extraction processes, rectify issues, and systematize processes for efficient workflows in collaboration with information services and program staff
Work independently and as part of a team and foster team-focused data solutions based on collaboration with pretrial leadership, evaluation, grants and contract and executive staff
Contribute to continuous quality and efficiency improvement to innovate and streamline ways to bring together data for timely, error-free invoicing back-up reports, and performance tracking, and data visualizations in seamless processes
Review data at participant level for contracts management to ensure the data is reported accurately to government funders
Provide descriptive, outcome and trend analysis data for annual pretrial services report to the NYS Office of Court Administration
Conduct regular data quality assurance checks to ensure accuracy of data reports produced and of the data in the database, following quality assurance protocols for random peer-to-peer review of analysis conducted by other analysts and reports before distribution internally and to government and funding agencies
Produce analysis on key program and operational outcomes and drivers that influence year-over-year program performance to enhance agency understanding of underlying program issues, trends and performance to ease the use of data to inform program decision-makers
Execute queries in databases to extract program datasets for analysis to respond to the needs of pretrial services senior leadership and directors and external requests from funders, government oversight agencies, policymakers and other stakeholders
Communicate clearly and accurately in both verbal and written mode concisely describing problems, solutions, specifications and plans related to data reports
 Lead projects on data reporting, analysis, management and planning initiatives
Participate in program planning efforts by contributing insights about program data, to support the creation of outcomes and plans to track and report on benchmarks with pretrial services leadership
Manage special assignments that may include analytical support needed to assist in responses for proposals, foundation reports and fundraising
Deputize for the Director Data Reporting & Analysis at meetings with government agencies and for quality assurance and change management projects
 Perform end user and application support functions including problem solving and resolution of Salesforce and Exponents application function defects. Provide staff training and support.
Perform duties in accordance with CASES’ mission, cultural competency, anti-discriminatory and other policies and procedures
Any other duties as required by the Director and senior staff,Qualifications

Masters degree in related field and at least 2 years of experience as a data analyst, or
Bachelor’s degree in related field with at least 3-5 years of experience as a data analyst working with relational databases
Salesforce experience required
Salesforce certified professional a plus
Advanced proficiency in SQL, SPSS (and other statistical software), MS Excel (Pivot Tables, Advanced functions, Get and Transform), MS Access, MS Project, Visio and other products in MS Suite
Experience with Power BI a plus
Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment and multitask while adhering to deadlines
Project management experience preferred
 Be comfortable in situations where asked to lead projects and participate in ways to innovate creation of data solutions
 Ability to work effectively with diverse teams and remain highly organized
 Commitment to social justice and knowledge of NYC criminal justice system and alternatives to incarceration program


Additional Information

Salary: The salary range for this position is competitive and commensurate with demonstrated experience and skills
CASES is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment with CASES is based solely on qualifications and competence for a particular position, without regard to race, color, ethnic or national origin, age, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or marital, military, or citizenship status. We also actively recruit individuals with prior involvement in the criminal justice system.Your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

The mission of the Office of Performance Management is to create sustainable data-driven operations in programmatic and central divisions in order to increase effectiveness and achieve mission-driven outcomes for children. Performance Analysts accomplish this by strengthening the behaviors and capabilities of leadership at all levels to be data-driven. Performance Analysts fulfill a broad range of responsibilities over their independent areas of focus, which are guided by a shared departmental vision and coordinated in a team. Program areas include early childhood education, afterschool, youth development, health, mental health, child welfare, and others. Typical responsibilities include:

Using logic models, root cause analysis, and continuous quality improvement cycles;
Developing data collection, management, and analysis protocols;
Conducting data analyses, producing reports, and testing hypotheses;
Identifying outcomes, monitoring implementation, and producing results reports for grants and contracts;
Assisting in model development and fidelity measurement; and,
Providing training, technical assistance, and capacity building.
Responsibilities:

Work collaboratively with programs and central departments to implement all phases of continuous quality improvement, including but not limited to identifying indicators, planning data collection, analyzing operational and outcomes data, developing improvement strategies when needed, and monitoring ongoing performance.
Participate in division leadership and staff meetings to build capacity at all levels for driving performance management.
Advise leadership on how to collaboratively advance data-driven culture.
Work with division leadership to define program models appropriate to division operations and funding expectations.
Manage and analyze data in an applied setting. Provide written analyses and visual representations of performance.
Assist programs and central departments in meeting regulatory, contractual, and best practice standards, as well as maximal operational efficiency.
Work with other performance management staff to collectively support departmental work and promote accountability and learning throughout Children’s Aid.
Qualifications:

Minimum three years of experience evaluating and improving program or operational performance in a non-profit or government setting. Direct experience with applied research techniques helpful.
A Bachelor’s in social work, psychology, education, or other field related to the work of the organization; Master’s degree preferred.
Proficiency in MS Office with exceptional Excel skills required; proficiency in SPSS preferred.
Strong analytic skills required. Ability to meet deadlines and creatively problem solve. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Comfort performing hands-on work as well as assisting in strategic planning projects.
Ability to develop collaborative relationships and communicate effectively about data with multiple stakeholders in writing and verbally. Spanish fluency preferred.
Ability to travel to sites throughout Manhattan, the Bronx and Staten Island.

job_title: Senior Financial Analyst, Technology/Data Operations - Corpo...
desc:
We are Warner Music Group, home to a broad roster of new stars and legendary artists through a collection of the best-known record labels in the music industry including Asylum, Atlantic, Big Beat, Canvasback, East West, Elektra, Erato, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Reprise, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Spinnin’, Warner Records, Warner Classics, and Warner Music Nashville, as well as Warner Chappell Music, one of the world's leading music publishers, with a catalog of more than one million copyrights worldwide.
A little bit about our team:
This position is part of the corporate FP&A department reporting into the Warner Music CFO. This role provides financial support and analysis to the corporate services departments with a primary focus on global Information Technology (IT), our largest corporate spend department and the office of the Chief Data Officer(CDO). Primary responsibilities include forecasting, budgeting, financial operations, project cost tracking and monthly close.
Here you’ll get to:
Support the Chief Information Officer, Chief Data Officer and all IT leadership with budget management, tracking of actual results and monthly forecasting. Provide a monthly Global reporting package to the CIO & CDO to report on all variances to budget and forecast on a vendor basis.
Collaborate with the IT/Data leadership on bottom up and top down budget development, analysis and presentation.
Track actual project costs against budget. Work with Project Managers to investigate and provide variance explanations between budget, forecast, and actuals to CIO, CDO, and various senior level executives.
Collect, consolidate, and analyze all Global IT submissions for budgets, major forecasts, and actual submissions and reports results to the CIO.
Perform key monthly close activities such as preparing journal entries, reviewing balance sheet reconciliations and fixed assets management.
Ensure proper approval, coding, processing and closure of contracts/SOWs, PO’s and invoices during the month and as part of the month end close.
Own monthly cash forecast for IT, GDO and various other projects.
Assist in the development and maintenance of financial models and business cases to support capital projects and investment, including determination of a return on investment (ROI).
Provide support during the quarterly and annual audits.
Supports the external reporting team with various ad-hoc requests during the preparation of the 10Q and 10K.
Track and manage key financial data from third-party contracts and work closely with IT sourcing and procurement team to govern spend levels.
Assist with the review of all Global Capital Allocation Request submissions and ensure all requested spend has been budgeted for and reflected accurately.
Work with UK finance team to collect and analyze monthly reporting packages for the UK IT departments and analyze UK specific project spend.
Perform various ad-hoc reporting and analysis as requested by senior management.
It would be music to our ears if you also had:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with ability to work independently and in a team.
Knowledge of accounting and finance.
Understanding of physical and digital corporate technology infrastructure (hardware, systems, applications and verbiage) preferred.
Strong organizational skills with ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.
Detail-oriented self-starter, who has a positive attitude and committed to developing their career.
Commitment to follow-up on open action items/assignments and ability to meet deadlines.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and oral.
High proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint applications.
Experience with SAP or other large ERP systems preferred.
Education Required/Preferred:
2-4 years’ experience with budgeting, forecasting, account analysis, month-end activities, and vendor management, preferably with a Technology department.
Bachelor’s degree required preferably in Accounting or Finance.
Why join us?
Warner Music Group is all about our people. We are one global company made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business.
It is the mission of every member of the WMG team around the world to create a nurturing environment for artists, songwriters, and the people behind the music, every stage of their career. We strive to set WMG apart from the rest of the industry by embracing a philosophy of innovation that is part of our company's DNA.
Consider a career at WMG and be a part of one of the biggest forces in music today.
Love this job and want to apply?
Click the “Apply” link or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile, but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.
Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. We’re taking our time to review all resumes, and to find the best people for WMG.
Thanks for your interest in working for Warner Music Group. We love it here, and think you will too.
We are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of age, sex, sexual orientation, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage or citizenship, disability, marital status, familial status, military or veteran status, or any other legal recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances.
We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the application or employment process, please send an e-mail to Recruitment@wmg.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Michael Kors is always interested in hearing from talented, globally-minded individuals with a passion for fashion.
If you enjoy working in a creative, fast-paced environment, then we would love to hear from you!
Position Overview:
The E-Commerce Business Analyst at Michael Kors will be responsible for monitoring all day-to-day operations within the Michael Kors E-Commerce platform. The E-Commerce Business Analyst will interact with developers, release managers, application engineering and system administrators and all third-party vendors to maintain a strong support team and quality production environment.
Major Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Provides the e-Commerce Division with product management support in the ideation, submission, delivery, and enhancement of the product roadmap globally.
Facilitates Scrum Ceremonies (Daily Stand-up, Backlog Grooming, Sprint Planning, Retrospectives, and Sprint Demos).
Owns the health and wellness of Scrum Artifacts (Sprint Backlog, Product Backlog, and Product Increment).
Works cross-functionally with Product Owners, Stakeholders, and Technology team to design and specify large complex business solutions.
Ensures that goals, scope, and product domain are understood by Scrum Team.
Works with the Product Owner to understand the business priorities and items to be groomed in upcoming sprints.
Fosters an environment of successful delivery and continuous improvement.
Facilitates discussion, decision making, and conflict resolution.
Identifies, escalates, and removes team impediments that jeopardize sprint goals.
Develop a good understanding of the business unit's function and effectively communicate technical issues in non-technical terms to the business unit.
Qualifications:
4+ years of Business Analyst experience in e-Commerce business practice area. Retail is a plus.
1+ year of Scrum Master experience on a cross-functional team in a medium to large organization.
Ability to distill complex concepts and business needs into prioritized, implementable value-based components.
Ability to convert business / functional requirements into logical business rules and functional requirements.
Knowledge and / or experience with Agile techniques such as User Stories, Continuous Integration, Story Pointing, Backlog Tracking, Burndown Metrics, Velocity etc.
Knowledge and experience of business analysis tools such as Domain Modeling, Use Cases, Activity Diagrams, Business Rules / Logic, UML, User Stories, etc.
Candidate should be able to apply specific knowledge of the business and knowledge of systems technology capabilities to business problem solving.
Knowledge and experience of major integration points between an e-Commerce application with Order Management, Warehouse Management, Financial and Retail Systems.
Experience in launching and / or supporting a Global e-Commerce platform.
Experience with ATG e-Commerce platform, order management systems, and CMS platforms is desirable.
Excellent communication and analytical skills.
Must have strong written skills, with the ability to convey clear and concise thoughts and ideas.
Formal business analysis process and methodology.
Proven ability to manage cross-functional team.
Should have good interpersonal skills to deal with user community and vendors.
Extremely organized, diligent, detail-oriented and self-motivated.
Must have a clear vision of a projects objectives and be able to maintain a long term view.
Ability to multi-task and coordinate multiple projects / release concurrently.
Must be willing to travel.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer M/D/F/V

The Business Analyst will report to the Business Applications Manager and play a critical role in ongoing systems analysis, enhancement and implementation projects. The Business Analyst will work closely with departments and regional offices throughout the organization, providing technical support and identifying and executing opportunities to further leverage technology to achieve the organization’s mission. This is a high visibility role, offering extensive exposure at all levels across the organization.
The Business Analyst does all this while adhering to AJC’s core values: Respect, Teamwork, Integrity, Excellence and Accountability.

Major Functions:
Work as part of a team to:
Identify, develop and implement new and enhanced technologies, working closely and collaboratively with end users, IT team members and third-party technology providers;

Troubleshoot technical problems;

Perform regular data checks and maintenance to enhance data integrity.

Bachelor’s Degree
Experience with business reporting such as Crystal Reports

job_title: Grievance and Appeals Analytics and Reporting

desc:
Company Overview
TrueChoice Solutions is a private, Manhattan based, marketing Software Company that develops visually interactive, Web-based applications for brand-name Fortune 500 companies. Our client base is diverse and includes large automotive companies to consumer electronics manufacturers and health care services companies. Our applications typically appear on major, highly trafficked public websites.

Position Overview
TrueChoice Solutions seeks an inquisitive, creative, and gritty self-starter with business analysis and data science skillsets to enhance and expand our preference data analytics platform and provide analysis and insights to our clients. The position is a business analysis and data science role (1-2 years prior experience preferred), with the opportunity to grow and expand your responsibilities and scope over time.

The ideal candidate would have business analysis skills honed in a technology or management consulting company where data analysis is a core activity. We are seeking experience and comfort with data visualization, dissecting and interpreting quantitative datasets, and developing models (e.g., simulation, optimization, and/or segmentation, to name a few).
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and deliver various quantitative analysis requirements associated with TrueChoice client projects, all of which entail the construction of real-time, interactive dashboards that provide data analysis and visualization, modeling, and insight synthesis tools and capabilities.
Help shape and lead the ongoing design and development of new analysis, modeling, and visualization capabilities.
Operate as a key member of a client-facing team to continuously construct, discuss, and refine preference analytics products and insights, engaging directly and collaboratively with executive-level client personnel.
Requirements:
B.A./B.S. with a minimum 3.0 GPA
Preferably in a technical or quantitative area such as computer science, data science, engineering, applied math, economics, statistics, etc.
Evidence of an analytical mind and solid business analysis capabilities, with fluency in one or more business intelligence platforms (Spotfire, Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Understanding and working knowledge of basic statistical concepts such as summary statistics, linear and logistic regression, validity tests, and controlling for biases
Proficiency in SQL, R, and Python required; JavaScript experience desired but not required
Collaborative work style, together with the self-discipline and initiative to work well independently
Ability to work collaboratively and effectively as part of a client-facing team
Comfortable interacting with clients (over the phone and in person), with the ability to effectively communicate complex concepts (both verbally and in writing) to a variety of audiences and technical backgrounds

All applicants MUST have a PERMANENT legal right to work in the United States.

Qualified candidates should live within commuting distance to mid-town Manhattan; TrueChoice Solutions will not cover relocation costs.
How to Apply:
Please send resumes and portfolios to jobs1@truechoicesolutions.com citing "Quantitative Business Analyst" in the subject line.

St. John’s established in 1870, has three New York City campuses; a graduate center in Hauppauge, NY; international locations in Rome, Italy; Limerick, Ireland; and Paris, France; and study abroad locations around the world. The Princeton Review and other top rankings consistently recognize the University’s outstanding academics, diverse student body, dynamic internship and volunteer opportunities, focus on student life, and diverse study abroad offerings. St. John’s University offers more than 100 undergraduate and graduate programs in its six colleges and schools, with a growing number of programs offered online. The University is accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education and 12 other major academic and professional associations.


A dedication to diversity, equity and inclusion is at the heart of our mission. As a Catholic and Vincentian university, St. John’s is committed to institutionalizing practices of inclusive excellence to ensure that we welcome and celebrate the intrinsic worth of all members of our community. We will become an even stronger university as we enhance equity at every level of our institution. As noted in our Vision Statement, our graduates will excel in the competencies and values required for leadership and service in a rapidly evolving world.

Act as a liaison, in a professional and approachable manner, with various departmental representatives in a customer service oriented environment to refine information requests in order to meet end user requireme This will include assessing business and functional reporting requirements and also aid in managing user expectations in order to complete requests in a professional and timely manner.
Cross-train with other members of the department to obtain student data for Advancement use in segmenting and targeting constituencies (i.e. study abroad, student life activities, athletics, and legacy alumni)
Responsible for assisting the Director in managing the student workers and Graduate Assistants within the Advancement Services department including their project assignments to ensure that projects are completed in an efficient and effective
Perform other duties and projects as assigned

At least 3 years of experience that is directly related to the duties and responsibilities
Prior report writing and report generation experience necessary, as well as a demonstrated ability to select, insert, delete and update data stored in a relational database such as Oracle and
This position requires comfort and effectiveness translating between end users with varying degrees of technical ability and database output. Must be able to understand development and alumni officers' needs so as to accurately translate their requests into effective queries and reports. Ability to organize and prioritize requests, take initiative, perform quality reviews, spot check audits and multi-task to meet deadlines in a fast paced time sensitive
Application programming experience in an Ellucian Banner ERP software environment (especially Advancement)

Technical expertise in database management, information systems and financial reporting query tools (specifically MS Access or other report writing and query tool experience, (i.e. Crystal reports, SAS, FOCUS, Oracle Developer, etc.)), used in generating financial, donor and prospect related reports and responding to ad hoc
Excellent project management skills
Highly proficient in the use of Microsoft Office including Outlook, Access, Word, Excel and
Basic knowledge of fundraising and philanthropy required. Prior Higher Education, fundraising or Not-for Profit experience a

Ability to complete assignments individually or participate as an effective member of a project team to complete various departmental


St. John’s offers a competitive compensation program which is commensurate with your qualifications, experience, and contingent upon the departmental budget. Along with exceptional benefits such as medical, dental, life insurance, long term disability insurance, tuition remission, generous 403(b) employer contribution, employee assistance program, and liberal paid time off policies, faculty and staff can also enjoy St. John’s performing arts, libraries, bookstores, dining facilities, campus recreation and sporting events.

Position Summary

The Vagelos College of Physicians and Surgeons (VP&S) Development office (OOD), a part of the Columbia University Irving Medical Center (CUIMC), is dedicated to facilitating relationships that support the vision and mission of CUIMC and VP&S: to advance medical education, achieve scientific breakthroughs, and provide the best possible patient care across a range of specialized departments, centers and programs.

The Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting Analyst will work in a small reporting team and will be responsible for developing dashboard and reporting solutions, that will sometimes require the build out of new data structures and models to achieve performance characteristics, and assist in training department staff in knowledge and use of data reporting tools. The incumbent will work directly with Gift Officers, and other members of the fundraising team, to review reporting priorities, manage and coordinate reporting projects, and streamline delivery of reporting of fundraising data.

The BI Reporting Analyst will require strong interpersonal and analytical skills and a desire to solve user requests and be technically proficient in using Microsoft Reporting Services (SSRS), Excel, and PowerPoint, PL/SQL and T-SQL to write Oracle and SQL Server database queries. Also, the incumbent will conduct analysis into reported errors found in department reports by finding and documenting the root cause(s), and proposing appropriate actions and solutions to mitigate bugs.

Furthermore, the BI Reporting Analyst will work with the OOD staff and the CUIMC IT department to maintain the OOD SharePoint (Online) site and oversee its design, simplifying staff needs to find and consume relevant content in SharePoint easily while leveraging best practices as needed. To that effect, the incumbent will serve as the department's primary support contact for SharePoint.

Responsibilities

Create, maintain, and distribute reports and dashboards for department, provide user support and training, and document business requirements and objectives – 70%
Manage and coordinate department reporting projects, and ensure that standard project management documentation is developed and maintained – 20%
Maintain the OOD SharePoint site, oversee its design, organize its contents, and provide necessary training to OOD staff – 10%
Minimum Qualifications

Requires a bachelor's degree or equivalent in education and experience, plus three years of related experience.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with and proficiency of SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), PowerBI, and Microsoft Project.

Other Requirements

Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication, and creative problem-solving skills
Highly self-motivated and directed and adept at working in a team environment
Proven experience with report writing and technical requirements analysis, methodology development, and proficiency with Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), Oracle PL/SQL, Microsoft T-SQL, and Microsoft SharePoint, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
Have experience managing reporting projects, with first hand report development, and data manipulation using Excel
Communicates incidents/problems, reporting changes, enhancements, and modifications to appropriate parties in a timely manner, with strong customer service skills
Monitors and optimizes the reporting environment to ensure it operates smoothly without issues automating any manual tasks
Builds strong relationships with fellow technology team members, pro-actively sharing relevant information, and improvement ideas to benefit the whole team
Have experience in thoroughly documenting business requirements, and objectives, and maintaining project documentation
Proven ability to adjust quickly to shifting priorities, multiple demands and rapid change
The incumbent must demonstrate sound judgment and discretion in handling confidential matters
Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran

job_title: Epic Applications Analyst (Clinical Business Analyst - Level...
desc:
Marketing Statement

Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible
NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

Job Description

The Epic Clinical Business Analyst, Level I under varying levels of direction and expertise, is responsible for the on-going assessment, design, and development and implementation of corporate –wide clinical systems.
Specifically, collect and transform large quantities of information into meaningful business requirements; develop and modify requirements documentation for the design and implementation of clinical information systems; critically evaluate information from various sources, distinguish user needs from actual business needs and partner with business users, project managers, programmers, consultants and IT leadership in optimizing the scope, benefits and risks of actual and proposed projects as well as assist in managing stakeholder expectations.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Analyze and document business requirements and processes; communicate requirements to technical personnel through the construction of basic conceptual data, process models and flowcharts, and technical specifications.
Interview end users, stakeholders, and project sponsors in order to assess business and clinical needs; create business, functional and technical requirements documents based on captured data and in accordance with departmental protocol/standards.
Convert information gathered into details including data sources, data and user types, interface components, interface navigation needs, reporting needs, and administrative system needs.
Define external interfaces, constraints, quality issues and other non-functional requirements.
Provide project management team with identified risks, concerns, and ambiguities discovered during the gathering of requirements; assist team in developing solutions.
Partner with project managers to complete requirements documentation in accordance with project schedule.
Plan, organize, facilitate, and lead meetings and workgroups as well as oversee and execute follow-up activities.
Ensure software development team accounts for all defined requirements in coordination with quality assurance team. Ensure that all quality standards comply with internal policies and industry standards.
Document changes to baseline requirements through standard change control process. Document software test plans, technical requirements, release notes, user and training guidelines and other materials.
Plan, coordinate, and support unit acceptance testing and subsequent deployments in coordination with other team leaders.
Perform end user and application support functions including problem solving and resolution of application function defects. Provide systems and application training.
Develop and execute project presentations.
Participate in special projects as required.
Provide training to and serve as a mentor for Junior Clinical Business Analysts and/or other appropriate project team members; manage and evaluate work products for assigned team members.
Participate in the development of various departmental training initiatives.
Interview Junior Clinical Business Analysts and/or other appropriate project team members.
Department Preferences

1. A Masters degree or advanced clinical degree from an accredited college or university; or
2. A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university and one (1) year of experience gathering and documenting business, clinical, and/or functional requirements for software applications development and implementation in a clinical, allied health, non-allied health, behavioral health, information technology, information services, business, analytics or related area; or, one (1) year of experience in a relevant clinical and/or healthcare administration role/function; or
3. A satisfactory combination of education, training, and experience.
4. Specialty certification(s) issued by a national commercially available program, state, professional society, academic or technical institution in an area(s) listed above, may be credited on a month-to-month basis toward the required work experience for a total of one (1) year.

Department Preferences

Bachelor’s Degree in related field with one (1) year of related experience or Master’s Degree with one (1) year of related experience or an advanced clinical degree
Specialty certification(s) issued by a national commercially available program, state, professional society, academic or technical institution in an area(s) listed above, may be credited on a month-to-month basis toward the required work experience for a total of one year.
Clinical experience (RN, PA, Pharm D) (Preferred)
Epic Care Ambulatory certification preferred. Epic Certification is required within the first 6 months of appointment to continue employment.
Strong desktop skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio).
Participate in special projects as needed and perform other duties as assigned
Must be able to work independently as well as work as part of a fast moving team
How To Apply

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button or mail your resume, noting the above Job ID #, to:
NYC Health + Hospitals
Talent AcquisitionHuman Resources Department
55 Water Street, 26th Floor
New York, NY 10041
Attn: Talent Acquisition
If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.

About WeWork
WeWork is the platform for creators, providing more than 400,000 members around the world with space, community and services that enable them to do what they love and create their life's work. Our mission is to create a world where people work to make a life, not just a living, and our own team members are central to that goal.
The WeWork team believes deeply in the power of “we” and in the movement we’re a part of. We challenge convention and achieve amazing things through dedication and collaboration. There is a contagious energy in our spaces as we work together toward accomplishing our goals.
Our hunger for building great spaces; empowering startups, freelancers, and small businesses; and connecting interesting people is far from being satisfied. We’re just getting started, and our journey gets increasingly exciting as more team members join the movement!
The Role
We are searching for someone who is passionate about removing barriers between people and the information they need to do their jobs. If you’re a delivery focused self-starter with serious design skills, data visualization experience and an obsession for simplicity and clarity, this is the place for you.
Responsibilities
Translate complex or ambiguous data into intuitive, interactive user interfaces.
Build compelling, accurate, and engaging visualizations that reveal insights and accelerate effective decision-making.
Capture user requirements and develop storyboards, wireframes, visual, interactive prototypes and production dashboards
Participate in usability testing, maintaining visual and user experience requirements
Identify and evangelize design best practices in data visualization that promote user friendly and high-quality visualizations
Build and revise graphic standards and reference documents including layouts, wire frame templates, best practices and standards for communications, knowledge management and user experiences.
Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree
3 years of hands-on work experience with Tableau (Power BI or Qlik experience will be considered)
Tableau Desktop Certified Professional or equivalent preferred
Academic credentials in Graphic Design, Industrial Design or User Experience
Skills
Outstanding analytical skills with the ability to convey complex ideas in easy-to-understand concepts clearly and an elegant design sense.
Ability to work quickly and iteratively to convert business requirements into rapid prototypes to meet critical deadlines
Experience working in finance or operations environment (FP&A, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Payroll, etc.) preferred
A working knowledge of basic statistics preferred
Direct, plain-spoken, authentic demeanor with excellent verbal, written, and visual communication skills
A compelling visual design portfolio showcasing examples of information visualization.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Traffic Business Analyst
Project Control Tasks:
Assist in developing Traffic Engineering project proposals containing scope, schedule, staffing, and budget estimates.
Manage the development and reporting of multiple project task status, including charge code, budget, actual cost, remaining budget, forecast to complete and schedule.
Assist with summarizing resource allocations for project tasks, including Full Time Equivalent numbers.
Manage preparation and updates of Call-In Consultant task orders, in coordination with task leaders and supervisors.
Manage consultant tracking reports that delineate consultant budgets, actual costs, remaining budgets, forecasts to complete, and earned value.
Provide organizational charts updates.
Assist task leaders with consultant process documentation including procurement documents, proposals, invoice payments, and project closeouts.
General Tasks:
Production of excel spreadsheets including data entry.
Assist with producing PowerPoint presentations.
Prepare written material for various assignments (forms, memorandums for approval, weekly highlights, security letters for field work, etc.
Coordinate and schedule meetings and prepare meeting agendas and minutes.
Review and track staff sign-in time sheets and project code allocation.
Organize electronic repository and folder structure for Traffic Engineering project deliverables, including proper archiving of documents, revisions, plans, and master documentation.
Relevant Experience:
Business analyst (3 + years of experience) with resource budgeting/forecasting and scheduling experience, preferably with knowledge of Engineering projects.
Advanced skills with Excel and PowerPoint.
Knowledge of Access is a Plus.
Knowledge of task scheduling, with Primavera P6 is a Plus.
EDUCATION:
Bachelor Degree in Engineering or Business

job_title: P-Card Business Analyst for Monitoring & Reporting
company: New York City DEPT OF CITYWIDE ADMIN SVCS
desc:
Create and generate standard templates for Monthly Transaction and Cycle Spend reporting to provide analysis, identifying trends and flag outliers.
Create and general standard templates for Daily Transaction Declines, categorizing for Decline Reasons to identify trends and provide exceptional customer service.
Prepare Calendar Year and Fiscal Year Spend Projections and Analysis.
Create and generate standard templates for Vendor, Commodities and Other Transaction related reporting to provide analysis and identify trends and flag outliers to analyze and present opportunities for P-Card expansion.
Create and generate standard templates for M/ WBE reporting. Coordinate with M/WBE staff, analyze and distribute reports on a monthly and quarterly basis.
Prepare ad-hoc reporting for internal and external stakeholders.
Coordinate with DoITT Telecom to generate reports and provide reconciliation for all P-Card payments made to Verizon while providing tracking, reconciliation for both DoITT and DoITT Telecom P-Card Accounts.
Coordinate with P-Card Vendors, MasterCard and City agencies to track, monitor and reconcile Large Ticket Transactions. Provide reconciliation, reporting and troubleshoot transactions with P-Card Vendor.
Coordinate with P-Card Vendor to track, monitor and project P-Card Program Rebate. Reconcile Rebate projections with Large Ticket Transactions and troubleshoot with P-Card vendor.
Make recommendations to maximize program efficiency.
Provide Citywide Customer Service in the efficient operation and maintenance of existing P-Card Accounts.


Minimum Qual Requirements

1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university, accredited by regional, national, professional or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) including or supplemented by 24 semester credits in accounting, including one course each in: advanced accounting, auditing, and cost accounting; and one of the following:

(A) one year of full-time satisfactory experience in management auditing, financial auditing, and/or information technology (IT) auditing; or

(B) a valid Certified Public Accountant license issued by the New York State Education Department; or

(C) a valid Certified Internal Auditor certificate issued by the Institute of Internal Auditors (IIA); or

2. A satisfactory combination of education and/or experience equivalent to "1" above. Education and/or experience may be substituted as follows:

(A) two years of full-time satisfactory experience in financial or managerial accounting may be substituted for the one year of experience described in "1(A)" above;

(B) undergraduate or graduate credits from an accredited college or university, accredited by regional, national, professional or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) in management, computer science, public administration, and/or business administration may be substituted for up to 9 semester credits in accounting, on a credit for credit basis.

However, all candidates must have a baccalaureate degree including or supplemented by 15 semester credits in accounting, including one course each in advanced accounting, auditing, and cost accounting, and one of the following: at least one year of the experience described in "1(A)" above or its equivalent; or a Certified Public Accountant license; or a Certified Internal Auditor certificate, as described in "1(B)" or "1(C)" above.

To be eligible for placement in Assignment Level II individuals must have, in addition to meeting the minimum requirements, at least one year of experience as a Management Auditor - Assignment I or at least two years of experience in management auditing, financial auditing, and/or information technology (IT) auditing.


Preferred Skills

A keen eye to detail, an analytical thinking & growth mindset, advanced skills in Excel (Pivot Table, V-lookup, etc) is highly desired.


To Apply

Please go to www.nyc.gov/jobs or www.nyc.gov/ess for current NYC employees and search for Job ID 417277. No phone calls, faxes or personal inquiries permitted. Only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.


Residency Requirement

New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

Overview
The Madison Square Garden Company (MSG) is a world leader in live sports and entertainment experiences. The company presents or hosts a broad array of premier events in its diverse collection of iconic venues: New York’s Madison Square Garden, Hulu Theater at Madison Square Garden, Radio City Music Hall and Beacon Theatre; the Forum in Inglewood, CA; and The Chicago Theatre. Other MSG properties include legendary sports franchises: the New York Knicks (NBA) and the New York Rangers (NHL); two development league teams – the Westchester Knicks (NBAGL) and the Hartford Wolf Pack (AHL); and esports teams through Counter Logic Gaming, a leading North American esports organization, and Knicks Gaming, MSG’s NBA 2K League franchise. In addition, the Company features the popular original production – the Christmas Spectacular Starring the Radio City Rockettes – and through Boston Calling Events, produces New England’s preeminent Boston Calling Music Festival. Also under the MSG umbrella is TAO Group, a world-class hospitality group with globally-recognized entertainment dining and nightlife brands: Tao, Marquee, Lavo, Avenue, Beauty & Essex and Vandal. More information is available at www.themadisonsquaregardencompany.com
Role Summary
The Manager, Reporting and Data Analysis will be responsible for the management of Human Resources (People Practices) data and reporting to provide the department and the business with data and metrics pertaining to the people and organization through the development of system queries and reports. This position will be responsible for regularly generating, analyzing, and sharing data to support the organization’s businesses and leaders. This role's primary focus will be to provide system-generated reports as well as custom data analysis to the People Practices function in the areas of people metrics, reporting, and data normalization.
Specific Functions/Activities Summary
Creates and modifies queries in multiple systems containing human capital management data for use in organization-wide reporting and analytics.
Develops a framework for reporting data and assists with normalization of the data. Merges data from multiple systems.
Collaborates on the development and maintenance of dashboard(s) to provide human capital analytics to business leaders that leverage data to clarify employee-focused metrics for the company and their respective business units. Provides recommendations to People Practices leaders as to the frequency of reporting.
Collaborates with People Practices by aligning on strategic plans and decisions, shares knowledge, and leverages cross-functional resources and requirements to facilitate best possible
Advises People Practices on data needs to address key business questions by developing in-depth knowledge of existing organizational data, including historical normalization and mapping from multiple systems.
Develops and communicates findings within People Practices via formal presentations and standard reporting on periodic/quarterly/annual basis.
Responsible for data integrity and validation during Oracle releases, including regression testing.
Accountable for ad hoc data and report requests in connection with normal business operations, audit requirements, legal & regulatory requirements, etc.
Monitors and improves data collection processes; partners to identify how to normalize data across multiple systems; provides recommendations for enriched reporting and data standards.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Statistics, Industrial-Organizational Psychology or related discipline.
4 or more years of progressive experience in data analysis and
Experience with the Oracle HCM Cloud application, BI reporting and analyses.
3-5 years of experience with HRMS applications, preferred.
Advanced Microsoft Access and Excel skills, including proficiency with complex pivot tables and data analysis Proficiency using Microsoft PowerPoint.
Working knowledge of SQL queries.
Strong analytical and numerical
Ability to translate complex data analysis and research principles into terms that can be understood by a broader
Skilled at manipulating and managing large, complex databases, spreadsheets and queries and generating organizational metrics to assist with business
Desired Qualifications:
Demonstrated expertise with report writing software
Experience in Human Resources preferred
Exceptional attention to detail
Analytical acumen, intellectual curiosity, creativity, a proven work ethic, and good communication skills
Ability to manage multiple projects with demanding time frames
Education
Candidates who have completed 60 credits of college-level coursework (representing 2 years), or have shown similar self-development through certifications, trade school coursework, etc. are preferred.

Educational requirements may differ from job to job based on the role.

At MSG we value diversity and are looking for extraordinary employees of all backgrounds! What's the role?
You love being deep in the data analytics to “tell the story" and can seamlessly translate the findings into meaningful business recommendations and insights. You're a change agent; excited by the opportunity of setting up and developing reporting for Travel & Expense at Bloomberg.
We are currently seeking a dynamic Business Analyst to join our Travel & Expense team. You'll be joining a successful, rapidly growing and ambitious Bloomberg team focused on improving our investment in employee travel, re-imagining the experience, governance, and integrity across the world.
In this role you will lead development, migration, and ongoing execution of our reporting; defining new processes including using automation. We are looking to you to strategically build an internal business function that will collect, analyze, and interpret multiple data sets to create a business roadmap for ongoing execution. You'll interact directly with our business leaders and represent the Travel & Expense analytic practice by providing intelligent, quantitatively-derived insights and recommendations.
We'll trust you to:
Lead and maintain all reporting for Bloomberg's Travel & Expense team
Implement data standards and data quality monitoring tools to filter and clean data; review reports to identify trends and correct unexpected patterns
Analyze success metrics on Travel & Expense initiatives to quantify and explain their financial impact
Build RFP analysis for all programs - including airline, hotel, ground transportation and cards
Stay ahead of insights and trends; making recommendations for improvement across spend, volume and metrics
Create documentation and training for new reports utilized by the team
Work in collaboration with internal business intelligence teams to develop reports based on user requirements and create ad-hoc reports in a timely manner
Partner with core internal stakeholders; including Bloomberg’s CFO community
Participate in quarterly business the reviews of Bloomberg’s travel management vendors to ensure SLA and performance levels are achieved
What do I need to apply?
3-5+ years' of progressive professional experience with travel and expense data, multivariate modeling, segmentation, quantitative methods, database and digital data
Expert knowledge of airline, hotel, ground transportation and Travel & Expense policies
Demonstrated ability to implement solutions for operational improvements and automation
Expertise with SQL-based databases (e.g. SQL Server, MYSQL, Access, Greenplum, etc.)
Expertise in data visualization software tools (e.g. Qliksense, Tableau, Crystal would be preferable) and the shown ability to learn and master new tools quickly
Exceptional analytical skills and creative problem solving, showing ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to build partnerships with cross-functional teams, vendors and facilitate interactions with upper management
Outstanding written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal skills with a consistent track record in presenting findings to C-suite executives and other senior management
Agility: Ability to work independently to deal with ambiguity, tight deadlines, multiple priorities, and demanding environments
Thrives in a fast paced, constantly changing environment
If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this:
https://www.bloomberg.com/careers/about/

OBJECTIVE: To support the lending function by evaluating the creditworthiness of commercial lending requests across all lending platforms including in depth analysis of entities ranging from sole proprietorships to large publicly traded companies. Provide recommendations to strengthen the credit worthiness as appropriate.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

The following is a list of essential functions, which may be subject to change at any time and without advance notice. Management may assign new duties, reassign existing duties, or eliminate a function.

Deliver Fanatic Customer Service: Always Exceed Customer Expectations
Be the POWER of Red! Promises are always kept. One to say yes, two to say no. Bump it Up! Welcome everyone, make them feel special. Exceed Customers’ expectations, every time. Recover the Republic way, make every wrong right.
The Sr. Credit Analyst position is responsible for preparing credit memoranda for complex lending relationships in the Commercial and Industrial sector as well as significant real estate investments including REITs and national credits.
Strong ability to analyze data, draw conclusions, solve problems independently and make recommendations/reports and presentations.
Minimum five years of related and increasingly responsible credit underwriting demonstrating a strong understanding of financial statements, particularly C&I with a strong commercial credit background.
Sr. Credit Analyst is expected to leverage the Lender’s and Department Head/Group Manager’s time by analyzing and underwriting credit requests with little supervision.
The Sr. Credit Analyst may be tasked to work closely with a small group of analysts within his/her lending team to review work and establish priorities.
Ability to interpret policies and procedures, financial statements and credit reports with strong analytical skills.
Flexibility and willingness to assume responsibilities for projects and tasks assigned by the department manager, SCO and CCO, i.e Watchlist, stress testing, asset based lending, etc.
Coordinate and manage outside support and projects with Bank vendors, i.e. Experian, LexisNexis, Credit Quest.
Mentor junior credit analysts and assist in departmental training.
Participate in process improvements and automation/enhancements to current activities/tasks.
Follow RMA Code of Ethics in all exchanges of credit information with outsiders.
Keep abreast of developments in the field through reading and seminars.
REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS

Education and Experience: Bachelors Degree in Finance, Business Administration or related field; At least 5 years of credit analyst experience in a commercial lending environment.

Skills and Competencies:

Ability to manage and prioritize numerous projects simultaneously in a time sensitive environment.
Strong computer skills
Excellent communication skills: written, oral and interpersonal
Competent problem solving skills
Ability to perform job functions accurately and with attention to detail
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Ability to maintain confidential customer and Bank information in a responsible and secure manner.
WORKING CONDITIONS

Traditional office environment with no unusual work conditions

Manual dexterity for computer work

Overview
The Business Intelligence position will help establish and maintain company-wide KPI measurements and associated processes to drive strategic decision making. The role will be critical in providing real time business insights to key stakeholders in order to analyze strategic initiatives and ongoing business operations. In this role, you will be responsible for working closely with a team of department analysts and overseeing data validation and interpretation.
Responsibilities
Lead process around identifying and establishing complementary KPIs across existing business operations and new initiatives that align with overarching organizational goals
Employ qualitative and quantitative reasoning to provide company-wide insights, data validation and reporting to assist management in key strategic decision making
Support MLS/SUM business operations through focusing teams on data driven deliverables and aid managers in data interpretation and business strategy
Proactively identify business challenges and opportunities through data analysis, and work with business leaders to find strategic solutions
Liaise with a team of cross-functional analysts to utilize a set of standardized KPI tracking and reporting procedures, and ensure they deliver real time updates on department progress against performance goals
Design and develop visualization tool templates for key executive reports
Gain a deep understanding of the underlying department strategies and value drivers through working closely with MLS/SUM business leaders
Assist in the preparation of presentations to executives and department leads
Ad hoc business reporting and analysis as needed
Additional responsibilities as assigned
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree
8+ years of experience, preferably in business intelligence, analytics or relevant data driven support roles.
Strong quantitative analysis, problem solving and presentation skills
Familiarity with SQL, statistical tools (e.g. SAS) and dashboard visualization tools (e.g. Tableau)
Ability to transform data into digestible and presentable stories
Superior organization, and ability to manage projects through to completion
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to effectively communicate to a wide range of audiences, both written and verbally
Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, team environment while maintaining a strong attention to detail
High level of commitment to quality work product and organizational ethics, integrity and compliance
Solutions oriented with demonstrated decision making and problem-solving skills
Detail-oriented, self-starter with the ability to multi-task and meet deadlines with minimal supervision
Expert in Excel, Word, PowerPoint
Desired Skills
Knowledge of the Spanish Language (business proficiency)
Knowledge of the sport of soccer
Ability to travel and to work non-traditional hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays

Overview
Founded in 1908, CIT (NYSE: CIT) is a leading national bank empowering businesses and personal savers with the financial agility to navigate their goals. We believe in helping customers turn their ideas into outcomes. Whether those customers are building a business or building their savings, CIT has the experience and agility to empower them to achieve their goals. At CIT, how we do business is just as important as what we do. Our social responsibility programs focus on driving financial and personal empowerment, supporting the environment and advancing wellness. CIT contributes to communities where we live, work and do business through charitable donations, community investments and employee volunteerism.
Responsibilities
CIT is looking for a Business Analyst to engage with our various stakeholders within the Business, Operations, and Technology, focusing on business analysis activities across various strategic business/project initiatives. BA will be responsible for maintaining financials for the key initiatives, following up with project/program tasks, action items, and issues/risks. BA will be assigned to conduct "deep dives" on aspects of the project/program, and analyze results as needed. BA will populate the portal and sharepoint sites with the required artifacts, ensuring compliance with audit requirements. BA will create decks, dashboards, and other visuals for recurring and special meetings, including items for Steering Committee. The BA will report into the program management lead, who reports into the ePMO.
He/she must possess a strong sense of project management rigor, leadership, organization and communication with the ability to respond to a dynamic environment. This position works with stakeholders to elicit, understand, analyze, document, refine and communicate business needs so that business and/or technical delivery teams can build effective solutions. This requires a detailed understanding of internal customer needs, as well as business vision and strategy, to prioritize investment, business value and delivery. This role will also work with the business and IT delivery teams to identify and mitigate risks including business operational risks.
Responsibilities include:
Work closely with stakeholders to identify needs, gather requirements, develop user stories, and propose business solutionsWork closely with the Product Owner, IT/Data teams, and vendors to ensure user requirements, stories, and acceptance criteria are well understoodProduce project materials at all stages of project development lifecycleLead project coordination effort with business and technology stakeholdersManage timely execution of the plan working with stakeholdersBalance short term needs with long term strategic view and wherever necessary create short term solutions until the long term solution is ready

Qualifications
Candidate should be experienced in projects/programs and managing execution from inception to deliveryCandidate should be a self-starter and be able to navigate through multiple lines of businesses, stakeholders and manage delivery across multiple technology teamsAbility to work independently and remain flexible and organized throughout projects in a fast paced environmentStrong analytical background, problem solving and communication skills are requiredExperience in Senior arena (e.g., creating executive summaries, creating dashboards)Proficiency in Excel, MS Project, Visio and SharePoint is necessaryExperience with worksheets/data sets, SQL, writing VLOOKUP formulas, manipulating data with PivotTables, and presenting resultsExperience with project lifecycleExperience with Data, data lineage, financial reportingMore experience in business and finance (rather than tech)Has 5 years experience in the Finance Industry

#LI-JB1

Business Analyst conformité – New York
Localisation

New York


Contexte

En tant que consultant Business Analyst, vous serez intégré au sein de l’équipe Business Analyst IT, afin de gérer, coordonner et prendre en main différents projets liés à la conformité, tels que la lutte anti-blanchiment ou le secret bancaire (AML / BSA), l’évaluation du risque…


Votre mission


Assister / coordonner le développement et l’amélioration des données pour les évaluations annuelles des risques AML, des sanctions et de la lutte anti-blanchiment et anti-corruption afin de garantir que les risques inhérents pertinents et les contrôles d’atténuation sont identifiés et ainsi que leurs domaines d’amélioration,
L’analyse de données, incluant l’analyse des paramètres qui ont une incidence sur les méthodes de notation et de pondération dans l’évaluation des risques liés à la conformité,
Réaliser des examens d’assurance de la qualité des données d’évaluation des risques afin de vérifier l’efficacité de la méthodologie, ainsi que l’exactitude et la cohérence des données dans l’ensemble de l’évaluation,
Analyser les données de résultats par risque, desk, entité et autres critères,
Interpréter l’information et les exigences réglementaires afin de définir et de gérer les demandes de données,
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les technologies de l’information et les autres parties prenantes pour résoudre correctement les problèmes de système, de processus ou de projet identifiés en temps voulu,
Travailler avec les départements de la Conformité et de l’AML afin d’assurer des résultats précis dans les rapports et les données clés d’évaluation des risques,
Aider au développement et à la mise à jour continue d’un inventaire des profils de risque et / ou des déclarations pour catégoriser les exigences réglementaires,
Mettre à jour / rédiger des documents de données stratégiques pour l’évaluation des risques,
Préparer des rapports d’état.
Ce projet est-il fait pour vous ?


Vos compétences:

Minimum 5 ans d’expérience au sein d’une société en service financier et / ou un organisme d’autoréglementation dans le cadre d’une fonction d’évaluation des risques liés à la conformité,
Très bonne capacité d’analyse de données,
Compétences informatiques incluant les bases de données Access / SQL, Excel, Word, Power Point et une capacité à créer et gérer des feuilles de calcul Excel complexes,
Une expérience avec Business Objects est un plus,
Expérience en conformité AML / BSA / OFAC,
Bonnes compétences en gestion de projet, y compris la capacité de prioriser, déployer des ressources afin de respecter les délais et mener à terme des projets complexes de grande envergure,
Expérience professionnelle avec des processus manuels d’évaluation des risques de conformité et des plateformes de conformité automatisées (est un plus).
Vos atouts :


Capacité à coordonner les efforts au sein des équipes de conformité et parmi des unités et cultures d’entreprise variées,
Solides compétences en rédaction, avec le souci du détail et de fortes capacités de suivi,
Volonté et capacité de s’adapter à de multiples demandes, à revoir les priorités et changer rapidement dans un environnement en rapide évolution.

desc:
Cantor Fitzgerald: Front Office Business Analyst & Reporting Analyst

The Front Office Business Analysis & Reporting (BA&R) Analyst will support the Front Office BA&R Manager, Managing Director and global CFO, as well as Business Management across all divisions. Job Description

Within the Dailymotion’s AdTech department, we are looking for someone to join the Business Operations & Analytics team, in our NYC office. The team’s mission statement is to drive growth, deliver insights & scale efficiency for the AdTech, Sales & Content tribes.
As Senior Business Analyst, you will be at the core of Dailymotion’s strategy of being a data driven company. In a team focused on revenue growth as a #1 priority, you will work transversally within the AdTech department and contribute actively to the data lifecycle. Your success will be defined by the quality of the Business Insights shared and used with the department.
You will achieve this in two ways:
Directly, as a hands-on contributor, you will deliver various actionable analysis yourself
Indirectly, as a data enabler, you will drive initiatives to evangelize and standardize the use of data in the department
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
Your responsibilities will cover 3 main aspects:
Business analysis
Perform complex, non-routine analysis to solve various business problems, focusing on delivering clear revenue upsides
Deep dive in the data to help Dailymotion understand it's business better, thanks to your superior SQL skills
Own your analytics deliverables from A to Z: identify a problem, perform complex queries, build and share restitution to relevant stakeholders (including C-level.
 Technical leadership
Be the most technical person on the team, training other members about the best way to query and use data
Challenge our analytics standards, improving the way we work and the tools we use
Reduce data bottlenecks by training various teams on our tools
Data improvements
Know our data infrastructure perfectly and identify the best source of truth for any ask
Partner with our Data Product Managers to improve our data infrastructure
Prioritize needs and build proof-of-concept solutions for the Engineers to put quickly in production
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU
Join Dailymotion during a key period of growth and development, with multiple key projects being launched from the ground-up to achieve very ambitious goals over the next few years
Join a growing team with many processes to improve and projects to implement, with the opportunity to play a key role and bring new ideas to the table
Work in relationship with top management, including the C-level, VPs and team leads
Be a true trusted leader, owning several parts of our Business Insights and bringing a lot of value to the table. We want to leverage your experience!
Work in a very dynamic and complex industry (AdTech), where opportunities to understand and improve our Business are endless
Bring great value to the table, helping more than 100 people get better business insights
All in all, gain a great understanding of the key business factors of successes of a large, international tech company,Qualifications

WHAT THE IDEAL CANDIDATE LOOKS LIKE
Master’s degree from a Top Business or Engineering University, ideally in a quantitative field
At least 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst or Data Scientist
Great SQL skills and knowledge of various Analytics tools (incl. data visualization tools like Tableau)
Great rigor, structured approach to problem-solving and very strong attention to detail
Excellent communication skills and great ability to cooperate efficiently with people from a different background (tech, operations, sales, finance…) and seniorities (from juniors to C-level)
Prior experience in the AdTech / Programmatic industry is a plus
Creative and entrepreneurial mindset, highly autonomous and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Fluent English (written and oral)
Additional Information

Location: New York
Type of contract: Full-time
Start Date: ASAPFlexible time off, vacation, holidays, sick-leave so you can take time off when you need toFitness club membership to NY Health & Racquet Club100% healthcare coverage starting on day 1Commuter benefits401k ContributionPaid parental leaveFully stocked kitchens with free snacks and drinks

Global Hackathon: https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x70val9
Welcome to the Jungle page: https://www.welcometothejungle.co/companies/dailymotion/team

GZERO Media is seeking a Digital Insights Analyst to support the efforts of our growing media company. This position is based in our NYC headquarters in the Flatiron district and reports to the CMO.

The digital insights analyst will be responsible for supporting our portfolio of sponsors, new sponsor activations, sponsorship relationship management, campaign performance, and reporting. The ideal candidate will be an analytics rock star, fluent in digital metrics and reporting.

The insights analyst will also support business development and sales initiatives, managing sales materials, pitch decks, and sales pipeline tracking. The candidate should have experience in sales support, marketing, sponsorship / partnership development, and experience with detail-oriented reporting.

GZERO Media is a company dedicated to providing the public with intelligent and engaging coverage of global affairs. It was created in 2017 as a subsidiary of Eurasia Group, the world’s leading political risk analysis firm. Our coverage takes many forms – print, digital media and broadcast television. Find us at gzeromedia.com.

2 years’ previous experience as an account executive, marketing associate, sponsorship associate, or related position
Superior computer skills, including Microsoft Office, Powerpoint, Salesforce, and Google Analytics.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Up-to-date on latest industry trends and tools; able to articulate trends and potential clearly and confidently
Highly organized, acute attention to detail and a forward planner

Be a part of an exciting, fast-growing media venture centered around the analysis and explanation of international politics.
The opportunity to work with a talented and entrepreneurial team in a global environment.
