Lead and mentor data visualization developers in information presentation & delivery.
Create functional & technical documentation related to Business Intelligence solutions.
Provide thought leadership, best practices, and standards required to deliver effective solutions to clients.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field, or foreign degree equivalent.
2+ years of progressive post-baccalaureate experience in the field of Business Intelligence or Information Management.
1+ years of experience with data visualization implementing high value-add solutions and performing administrative activities across a multi-environment infrastructure.
Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.
Strong written/oral communication and presentation/interpersonal skills.
Highly self-motivated and able to work independently as well as in a team environment.
Demonstrable proficiency with enterprise Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, QlikView, MicroStrategy, Cognos, etc.)
Advanced knowledge of SQL, including the ability to write stored procedures, triggers, analytic/windowing functions, and tuning.
Knowledge of relational and dimensional database structures, theories, principles, and practices

Slalom Is An Equal Opportunity Employer And All Qualified Applicants Will Receive Consideration For Employment Without Regard To Race, Color, Religion, Sex, National Origin, Disability Status, Protected Veteran Status, Or Any Other Characteristic Protected By Law.

Nasdaq Private Market ("NPM") is the premier provider of secondary liquidity solutions for private securities. NPM provides innovative end-to-end solutions to enable seamless transactions for private companies, private equity, and other private assets. NPM operates in a fast paced fin-tech environment that is consistently evolving, and the team is setup to deliver on this growth. For over 40 years, Nasdaq has supported companies through every stage of the business lifecycle, leveraging its technology infrastructure, regulatory oversight and operational expertise.
As a Business Analyst, you’ll work in an environment that exposes you to diverse project experiences across several industries and companies. You will tackle a variety of business problems and will work alongside top private companies and fund managers to help them make decisions regarding secondary transactions. You’ll also assist in determining the requirements of clients’ projects and programs by defining, analyzing, and managing requirements to help fulfill clients’ needs. Specific job deliverables will vary according to transactions’ and projects’ needs, the Business Analyst has the broad skills needed to work on a wide variety of business initiatives. You will be expected to demonstrate strong analytical and critical thinking skills with the chance to solve complex problems and present your findings. You will work independently with different team members and overall with the entire NPM team.

Builds and maintains strong client relationships and provides day to day client support.
Manages on going contractual relationships and the operational delivery of services to clients for an account or group of accounts.
Serves as the primary point of contact with clients and ensures client satisfaction.
Under supervision, assists business owners and stakeholders in describing business and system functionality, creates custom processes for client transactions, coordinates proper team members and leadership for specific transactions/projects as necessary.
Supports Sales, Strategy, and Legal teams with one-off analyses, internal presentations to leadership, and gathers requirements for deals/transactions
Assists in the creation of pitch materials for client meetings, including due diligence research, marketing materials, modeling and analytics.
Education Required: Degree qualified in Business/Finance, Economics, or related discipline, or equivalent work experience.
Experience Required: At least 2-3 years
Special Qualifications: proficient in Microsoft Office suite of tools, previous Corporate Strategy, Management Consulting, or Strategy/Business Development experience preferred but not required
Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.

job_title: Associate Director Data Science, Data Analytics
desc:
The purpose of the role is to work on all aspects of data analysis to distil actionable insight through analytics
Job Title:
Associate Director Data Science, Data Analytics
Job Description:
Associate Director Data Science, Data Analytics (Carat USA, Inc., New York, NY): Primary lead for client media data research analysis that yields unique insights and opportunities. This includes database management, quality assurance, data mining, automation, data querying and data analyzing. Construct and execute media Optimization products for the team to ensure client advertising investment is optimized to drive results tied to business goals. Drive day-to-day analytics efforts while contributing to larger cross-brand learning analytics roadmaps. Lead the leveraging of advanced analytic methodologies to drive marketing and financial performance, isolate key KPI trends and performance pacing, optimize consumer online/offline experiences, predict consumer behaviors, maximize sales conversion, drive media mix optimization and forecast critical business outcomes. Manage the daily responsibilities of data preparation, data analyzing, data delivery to ensure that quality and timeliness of measurement and optimization deliverables meet client expectations. Partner with strategy, planning and media optimization team to help create the appropriate audiences to target across different media strategies. Support measurement execution focused on ad/media effectiveness, real time analysis and reporting, that capture campaign performance, inform optimizations and impact future plans. Manage day-to-day client interaction and expectations of internal and external clients and deliverables from the analytics perspective. Keep up with the latest trends in media and data science / advanced analytics areas to evaluate vendor information that will help us to answer client questions and identify new approaches to ensure our capability is cutting edge. Proactively educate internal and external clients on data science, tools and approaches in the meantime to build positive relationships with them. Help team establish new resources which can benefit our analytics practice and develop business related opportunities. Be involved in team building, provide fresh perspective from both strategic and tactical sides. Attend leadership meetings to present and to develop relationships with business leaders and develop analytics programs to support business goals in a changing media landscape. Provide supervision to team members and assist in the training of junior team members. Must have experience with the following in order to complete the above-mentioned tasks: Ability to demonstrate data interpretation capabilities through strong SQL/No SQL and Python skills; Ability to adapt plans due to changes in client objectives, priorities or budgets while minimizing impact on project momentum; Presentation and automation skills; Deep understanding in advanced statistical techniques including multiple regression analysis, Machine Learning Algorithms, Bayesian methods, Look a Like modeling, and Forecasting methods; Experience with third party ad tracking and site analytics API's including DoubleClick (DART), Omniture, Google Analytics, and AdWords; Experience with SQL (MySQL, NO-SQL, Python), and statistical tools including SAS, Spark, Rapid Miner, TensorFlow; Experience working with large relational data sets; and Clear understanding of the latest trends and developments in machine learning methods. Requires a Master’s degree or foreign equivalent in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science or a related field and one (1) year of experience as a Data Analyst or related Advanced Analytics/Data Science occupation. Little travel may be required to Atlanta, GA (<5%). Please apply online at: https://www.dentsuaegisnetwork.com/us/en/careers
Location:
New York
Brand:
Carat
Time Type:
Full time
Contract Type:
Permanent

company: New York City DEPT OF DESIGN & CONSTRUCTION
desc:
Only candidates who are permanent in the Staff Analyst title or those reachable on the current Open-Competitive list (Exam #5045) or Open-Competitive exam (Exam #9008) may apply. Please include a copy of your Notice of Result Card or indicate if you are already permanent in the title. Failure to do so will result in your disqualification.

The NYC Department of Design and Construction, Division of Finance & Procurement seeks a Planning and Reporting Analyst. The selected candidate will be responsible for creating metrics and developing reports for measuring the agency's capital commitment plan goals; develop meaningful metrics; identify trends and notable performance variances for all capital budget and change order metrics; improve systems and tools used to track and analyze data; re-align operational targets with budget and policy goals. Other key responsibilities include proactively analyzing agency data; rationalize both the indicators themselves and the processes for collecting and reporting data; develop streamlined reporting processes for both internal and external indicators and other oversight-based reporting projects such as the Mayor's Office of Operation's Capital Dashboard.


Minimum Qual Requirements

1. A master’s degree from an accredited college or university, accredited by regional, national, professional or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) in economics, finance, accounting, business or public administration, human resources management, management science, operations research, organizational behavior, industrial psychology, statistics, personnel administration, labor relations, psychology, sociology, human resources development, political science, urban studies or a closely related field; or

2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university, accredited by regional, national, professional or specialized agencies recognized as accrediting bodies by the U.S. Secretary of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) and two years of satisfactory full-time professional experience working in one or a combination of the following areas: working with the budget of a large public or private concern in budget administration, accounting, economic or financial administration, or fiscal or economic research; or in management or methods analysis, operations research, organizational research or program evaluation; or in personnel or public administration, recruitment, position classification, personnel relations, labor relations, employee benefits, staff development, employment program planning/administration, labor market research, economic planning, social services program planning/evaluation or fiscal management; or in a related area.

Special Note:

To be eligible for placement in Assignment Level II, individuals must have, after meeting the minimum requirements, one additional year of professional experience as described in "2" above.


Preferred Skills

Candidates should possess capital budget, procurement and project delivery experience; the ability to manage multiple priorities while assisting in coordinating the work of a professional analytical team and working under tight deadlines. In addition, the candidate should have excellent analytic skills, advanced Access and Excel expertise, and FMS knowledge.


To Apply

For City Employees, please go to Employee Self Service (ESS), click on Recruiting Activities/Careers and Search for Job ID # 397921.

For all other applicants, please go to www.nyc.gov/jobs, go to Search for Open NYC Jobs and click on Non-Employee Login to search for Job ID # 397921.

Do not e-mail, mail or fax your resume to DDC directly. No phone calls will be accepted.


Hours/Shift

35 Hours


Work Location

30-30 Thomson Avenue, LIC, NY


Residency Requirement

New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

company: The Leading Hotels of the World, Ltd.
desc:
Title: Senior Business Analyst

Location: New York, NY 10017

Department: Information Technology (IT)


Position Summary

The Senior Business Analyst will work in a cross-functional Agile team environment to methodically and comprehensively translate opportunities and problems into solution requirements. The candidate will test that requirements were implemented correctly, clearly report defects, and help triage issues. The candidate will work closely with IT & business leaders, stakeholders, Product Owners, developers, architects, system analysts, and ScrumMasters to ensure that solutions meet business & technical needs.

Key Objectives

The candidate will be a single point of reference for project scope and business rules, and will ensure that project teams and technology partners deliver accordingly.

Responsibilities

Document requirements as user stories with detailed acceptance criteria, including stories for front-end applications, back-end systems, and data interfaces
Be a dependable reference on project scope, enterprise business processes, and data models
Conceptually understand & explain data mapping, data flows, and data migration activities
Document and methodically organize requirements
Independently define and execute functional test cases based on user stories and bugs
Thoroughly and accurately report test results
Triage bugs using end-user applications, diagnostic tools, and SQL to isolate root causes of issues
Develop relationships with IT & business leaders to understand their current processes, near-term needs, and long-term goals
Collaboratively develop user journeys, navigation flows, data flows, and wireframes with IT & business team members
Facilitate meetings to develop and refine work products
Act as a liaison between project team members and stakeholders
Iteratively help improve Agile working methods and processes
Manage small projects


Requirements, Experiences and Qualifications

3-5 years in IT as a Business Analyst, preferably in the travel industry
Experience as a Business Analyst on data-centric technology projects
Experience writing SQL queries
Experience documenting requirements for system integrations
Experience modeling business processes visually
Experience as a functional tester or user acceptance tester
Experience with Agile methodology a plus
Experience with Salesforce a plus
Bachelor's degree in IT or related field
Skills and Abilities

Highly organized and detail-oriented
Able to clearly articulate complexity
Able to facilitate meetings
Strong problem-solving skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong people skills
Self-motivated


Comprised of more than 400 hotels in 80 countries, Leading Hotels is one of the largest luxury hotel collections in the world. Headquartered in New York City, the company maintains offices in 20 cities around the globe.

LHW is committed to offering employees the opportunity to be inspired, grow professionally, and expand horizons as part of a passionate, service-oriented, and collaborative culture. In order to do this, we offer our employees great benefits that include, but are not limited to:

Comprehensive Medical/Dental/Vision/FSA
Paid Time Off (PTO)
Travel perks
Employee Development Programs
Many other amazing perks
For more information go to www.lhw.com. For career opportunities go to www.lhw.com/careers.

liver Wyman is a global leader in management consulting. With offices in 50+ cities across 26 countries, Oliver Wyman combines deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise in strategy, operations, risk management, and organization transformation. Our 5000+ professionals help clients optimize their business, improve their operations and risk profile, and accelerate their organizational performance to seize the most attractive opportunities. Oliver Wyman’s thought leadership is evident in our agenda-setting books, white papers, research reports, and articles in the business press. Our clients are the CEOs and executive teams of the top Global 1000 companies.
Visit our website for more details about Oliver Wyman Group: www.oliverwymangroup.com
Job Overview:
Oliver Wyman Financial Services is seeking a Senior Business Analyst to join its Practice Services team. The role will be responsible for managing and reporting on all aspects of FS related project revenue as well as any direct costs incurred by the FS business, with the aim of ensuring a solid handle on the financial health of the business at any given time.
The Senior Business Analyst will be expected to build trusted relationships across the FS Partner group, including senior management, to allow them to better understand the ins and outs of the FS business. Additionally, they will be expected to work and collaborate closely with the broader FS FP&A team, the OW controllership team as well as other FS and OW Support Professionals to ensure robust data management and efficient processes are in place.
Key Responsibilities:
Ongoing understanding and management of the FS pipeline, FS revenue & backlog and FS related costs. Working with controllership to ensure revenue and expenses booked are accurate and in line with expectations based on understanding of the business
Management of the monthly close process from an FS business perspective, reviewing actual results versus plan, preparing variance analyses, analyzing current and past trends in various metrics including revenue and operating expenses.
Track, steer and report project pricing, project profitability and project investments
Lead the weekly/monthly/quarterly forecasting of the FS results, as well as provide detailed input to the ongoing capacity management modeling
Prepare financial models and perform both regular and ad hoc business and financial analysis to support strategic decision making. Analyses will regularly involve heavy data modelling and manipulation of data from numerous internal sources
Manage and streamline the year end revenue and cost budgeting process
Manage and streamline the monthly cost reporting process
Work with the FS and OW support teams to standardize and operationalize various internal operating processes across the full project lifecycle, to improve team and Practice Group efficiency
Experience Required:
BA or BS degree in Economics, Finance, Accounting, or Math preferred
Minimum of 6-7 years’ experience in a financial, consulting or other highly analytical role
Technical Skills
Expert proficiency with Microsoft Excel. Must be comfortable working with and manipulating large amounts of data in excel using advanced formulas and macros
Expert proficiency with PowerPoint. Must be comfortable summarizing and presenting analyses in a coherent way for stakeholders to discuss
Experience with Oracle Enterprise Business System suite of applications, including Hyperion Planning and SmartView a plus
Experience with Tableau a plus
Skills and Attributes:
Superior analytical skills and attention to detail
Strong initiative/seek and accept new challenges, and have a high level of intellectual curiosity as it relates to new projects, and finding solutions to problems
Adaptable to a fast paced and quickly changing environment
Thrives in a strong team environment, including willingness to assist other team members and share knowledge
Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment
Strong communication skills, with an ability to interact with, work with and advise multiple constituencies at all levels of the organization
Ensure compliance with internal security policies and adherence to established company goals, policies, and standards
M

job_title: IT Business Analyst : Rates and Credit
desc:
Your role
Do you have a knack for analyzing IT business processes? Are you able to manage projects efficiently? We’re looking for someone like that who can help us:
determine required IT business solutions and assist in implementing themconduct requirements-gathering activities, like evaluating services, using a variety of internal and external data and conducting end user interviewssupport the business engineer by describing the business processes, including the organizational structures involvedassist in quality control and project managementidentify people and systems impacted by functional and non-functional requirements
Your team
You’ll be working in the global Fixed Income Rates and Credit markets technology team. We are a fast paced, highly motivated, delivery focused but friendly team, present in 8 cities in 6 countries covering US, Europe and Asia Pacific. Our job is to create and deliver innovative solutions for business problems whilst maintaining a complex and multifaceted platform
Your expertise
You have:
experience applying business analysis techniquesthe ability to interpret a set of technical requirements and develop robust solutions (you know what they really want)the ability to tailor your message to your audience, whether to a developer, a trader or the head of the trading deska good understanding of the software development lifecycle, ideally in an agile environmentstrong analytical, problem-solving and synthesizing skillsa self-starting attitude and the desire to take ownership of requirements front start to finish
You are:
looking for a new and exciting challengepassionate about supporting the development of IT systems and applicationstechnically savvy with an appreciation for IT capabilityproactive, comfortable working in dynamic environments with fast-paced deliveries and changing requirementsAn excellent communicator
Your colleagues
About us
Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?
Join us
We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.
Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Help us Build the Future of Money
Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.
Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

The Department: Security

In the emerging industry of digital assets, there is nothing more important than trust (which is why Gemini’s very first hires were Security experts). The Gemini Security team forms the backbone of all that we do and is as diverse as the number of challenges we tackle in the crypto space. From security architecture and engineering to maintenance of cold storage systems and data centers to cybersecurity and litigation support, our team ensures that our customers, clients, and employees are safe, secure, and supported.

The Role: Security Operations Analyst

Gemini is looking for an Information Security Operations Analyst to join our growing information security operations team. In this role, you will report directly to the Security Operations Lead and we be part of a team responsible for monitoring, operations, investigations and response to events within the Gemini environment.


Responsibilities:

Analyze data feeds for event detection, and perform correlation analysis on data from multiple monitoring sources.
Analyze data, perform research, and verify information for potential misconduct or abnormal behavior.
Respond to cybersecurity events and incidents caused by internal and external threats, coordinate response activities with various stakeholders for confirmed incidents, and recommend mitigation strategies. This can involve non-traditional working hours.
Proactively hunt within Gemini’s environment utilizing a variety of tools and techniques
Triage emerging threats to protect assets and information.
Produce forensic imaging and coordinate evidence collection for investigations.
Utilize data mining tools to collect, search, sort, and organize large amounts of information.
Research, address, and resolve security-related events.
Partner with cross-functional technical teams to share expertise, research threats, and implement solutions.
Produce reports, summaries, and other forms of communication that may be both internal and client facing, to include leadership and executive management.
Draft root cause analysis reports and recommendations after cybersecurity incidents.
Identify risk areas that will require vulnerability prevention
Stay current with Security technologies and make recommendations for use based on business value
Minimum Qualifications:

3+ years of network security analysis, operational or engineering experience.
Operations in MacOS and Linux environments
Coding, scripting or automation experience (Python, Go, Ruby, Java)
Preferred Qualifications:

Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to interact effectively with executives, engineers, vendors and peers.
Team player required. Must be able to interact with peers, management, and senior engineers in a constantly evolving environment to ensure a positive team experience and atmosphere in the workplace.
Understanding of IT operations: help desk, endpoint management and server management
It Pays to Work Here

We take a holistic approach to compensation at Gemini, which includes:

Competitive base salaries across all departments
Ownership in the company via profit sharing units
Amazing benefits, 401k match contribution, and flexible hours
Snacks, Perks, Wellness Outings & Events


Gemini is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

job_title: Business Process Analyst â€“ RPA Performance Improvement
desc:
Our Team:
Bloomberg's RPA Performance Improvement team goal is to provide a digital workforce that can supplement humans and automate low value and/or repetitive task across all Bloomberg functions/departments. We are also responsible for analyzing existing processes, identifying potential improvement opportunities utilizing automated tools, and develop recommendations to successfully implement those improvements.
What’s the role?
We are seeking an experienced Business Process Analyst for our RPA Performance Improvement team. Your primary responsibilities will be to serve as Business Process Analyst to Partner with SMEs to create process flows, process maps, conduct workshops and Partner with SMEs to create process flows, process maps and other documentation as required to complete assessments and generate standard operating procedures (SOPs) for automation delivery. The role is an excellent opportunity for an experienced candidate to work closely with senior management to develop End to End process workflows and identify process improvements. Also, responsible to interact with business process owners and experts to identify and document best use cases for RPA and define business cases to support automation
We’ll trust you to:
Lead process workshops and meetings
Collect and analyze system and user information relevant to the specific business processes
Highlight insights and identify opportunities for improvement
Analyze and decompose business processes and design a strategy to improve these processes
Work closely with the related automation delivery teams to drive successful automation in an agile fashion
Provide support all phases of the RPA project lifecycle, including design, development, testing, and deployment of automations of business processes using tools such as Blue Prism
Monitor, measure, and provide feedback on process performance
Be able to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment requiring good judgment, flexibility and a hands-on approach
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s Degree
8+ years of experience in Business Process Analysis, specifically business process engineering and analysis.
3+ years of experience in reviewing opportunities related to Intelligent Automation areas
Experience of working on projects using automation and robotic tools such as Blue Prism, Automation Anywhere, or UI Path
Experienced with spectrum of offerings across basic automation to machine learning and cognitive automation capabilities
Proven ability to influence and lead with and without authority
Strong verbal, written and presentation skills
Strong planning, organization, interpersonal and problem solving skills
A passion for process improvement and the ability to work in collaboration and always look for continuous improvement
We’d love to see:
Customer Experience centric approaches such as journey maps, pain point identification & moments of truth to drive digital transformation initiatives.
Understanding of core Finance and Accounting process
Big 4 Consulting experience a plus
Project management experience a plus
Experience in creating Epics/User Stories in Atlassian JIRA
Experience in working in a dynamic Agile/SCRUM project delivery environment
If this sounds like you:
Apply! If we think you're a good match, we'll get in touch with you to let you know the next steps.v
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

American Express entered the travel agency business in 1915 and today is one of the world’s largest luxury travel and lifestyle services networks. The Travel & Lifestyle Services (TLS) business provides easy access and extraordinary service for Card Members seeking leisure, as well as a variety of lifestyle services.

This role requires an outstanding individual with excellent analytical and communication skills to join our Universal Travel and Lifestyle leadership team reporting into the Vice President, Partner and Global Digital Servicing Strategy. This individual will play a key role in the delivery and analysis of management information, developing strategic and operational project plans and driving key results. They will need to influence and partner with a wide range of leaders and employees across different global markets.

This role will be responsible for analyzing business performance across the Travel and Lifestyle markets in line with scorecard goals and longer term strategy. They will assess and share opportunities for improved performance and best practices across markets.

Description (internal/external)

The role requires a self-motivated individual who will thrive on the challenge of producing and analyzing management information data for the Travel and Concierge team, as well as be able to present the detail to Senior Management via the following responsibilities:
Collecting and analyzing data (financial and customer), and drawing conclusions with robust quantitative methodology. Deliver trend and data analysis across the reporting suite.
Track VP project portfolios and milestones to ensure scorecard and strategic objectives are achieved.
Work closely with the relevant team and experts to develop key messaging and communicate to senior leaders and key stakeholders.
Creatively problem solve with very little direction and able to drive initiatives forward independently.
Keep abreast of external trends across Travel and Lifestyle
Manage ad-hoc projects and prepare senior leader updates and strategic presentations
Partner with key stakeholders within both locally and globally


Qualifications
Qualifications
Demonstrated ability to understand, analyze data and produce meaningful conclusions to senior leaders. Previous experience of working in an analytical role which involved comprehensive reporting and data analysis.
Excellent communication skills and ability to convey a clear & compelling message
Expert with Office Suite with superior presentation skills (Excel and PowerPoint)
Experience in presenting & communicating to senior leaders.
Passion for customer experience and understanding of external customer trends.
Ability to communicate effectively with people at all levels. You will have access to sensitive data where a high level of integrity is required.

Track record building and fostering strong relationships
Extremely organized with significant attention to detail
Experience in the travel industry/ luxury market a plus
Successful experience working in a complex matrix structure
Excellent business knowledge of TLS systems and/or service center metrics/infrastructure a plus
Work location – NYC/Virtual
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for this position.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst, Data Management & Business Intellig...
desc:
This is a highly visible and exciting role within the Xandr Media Sales Operations team!
Xandr is an industry leader in audience-based targeted advertising. At Xandr we aim to Make Advertising Matter by enabling advertisers to reach and engage a targeted audience with relevant messaging across screens. With one of the world’s largest collections of digital, film and TV properties, we provide a premium option for advertisers and publishers looking to reach specific audiences at scale in premium and brand-safe environments.
To fulfill this mission Xandr is actively seeking a full-time and experienced Senior Business Analyst to join the Data Management and Business Intelligence Systems team. A successful Senior Business Analystat Xandr will be a key individual contributor to the data management and business intelligence initiatives for the Xandr Media Sales organization. In this role, he/she will drive value through the design and implementation of business intelligence systems to transform the way Xandr Media Sales produces client reporting, processes internal information, and utilizes data to make critical decisions that guide the strategy, roadmap, and execution of the organization.
This person will perform non-technical project and program-management work focused on internal Xandr Media products as well as company-wide projects or programs. The Senior Business Analyst will help coordinate delivery across multiple product managers and support teams and serve as a key liaison across stakeholders. This person will proactively identify issues, track KPIs and help manage project/program scope, quality, schedule, resources, and risk.
This role is responsible for the development of Xandr Media’s Advertising Intelligence & Reporting (AIR) platform and data management systems. The successful candidate will:
Own multiple complex cross-functional technical projects and be accountable for their success.
Partner closely with cross-functional partners such as Media Sales, Operations, Product Development, and Product Marketing etc. to conduct business process analysis to help identify gaps between existing functionality and business needs.
Develop and recommend solutions and strategies based on the analysis of customer business goals, objectives, needs, and existing systems infrastructure.
Translate business and data needs into technical project requirements and ensure that user stories, process flows, and product roadmaps are well written, and have clear, measurable success criteria.
Ensure that there is clear communication and coordination of requirements between business owners and functional/technical teams.
Collaborate with project stakeholders including Advertising Technology team to manage project work stream and backlog, assist in feature prioritization, escalate project issues and process gaps as needed, conduct user acceptance testing, provide system demonstrations, and develop end-user training.
Review vendor and internal functional spec/design docs.
Drive product evolution and improvement to support and enhance the Ad Sales business.
Advise on the use and strengths of both hardware and software products available in the market to improve digital systems solutions.
Make sound decisions despite uncertainty. Proactively anticipate and mitigate risks while optimizing trade-offs between quality, resources, scope, and time.
Troubleshoot product issues and handle user escalations of technical issues with engineering resources as needed.

Qualifications
BA/BS degree and 5+ years of experience in a technical product/project management, solutions architect, technical services or a similar role; experience in ad-tech is preferred, but not required.
5+ years of experience leading complex strategic and operational initiatives and working through technical, business, operational, and legal/compliance issues.
5+ years of experience in agile and lean startup product management processes.
Experience with supply-side platforms (SSPs) such as FreeWheel, SpotX, OpenX, AppNexus/Monetize, Google Ad Manager, etc.
Experience with demand-side platforms (DSPs) such as Dataxu, Adobe, TubeMogul, The Trade Desk, MediaMath, AppNexus/Invest, Google Ad Manager, etc.
Experience with data management platforms (DMPs) such as Oracle BlueKai, Adobe Audience Manager, Salesforce (Krux), Lotame, etc.
Experience with project management tools such as JIRA, Blossom, VersionOne, etc.
Ability to work with and influence cross-functional teams, including driving process improvement and change management.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills and an ability to effectively communicate to stakeholders at a technical, business, operational, and executive level.
Sound business judgment, strong ability to influence others, advanced critical thinking skills, and ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions and make decisions.
Ability to weigh technical trade-offs and have in-depth discussions with technology teams on the nuances of complex engineering systems.
Ability to anticipate risks and devise contingencies before they become roadblocks.
Independent and entrepreneurial drive with demonstrated ability to achieve goals and deliver results in a large, fast-paced environment.
Ability to see how integrations fit within larger systems.
Preferred Qualifications:

Advanced Degree in a quantitative field or an MBA.
Project Management Professional (PMP) or Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP) certifications are helpful but not required.
Experience with front-end sales systems, such as Salesforce, DealMaker Digital, DealMaker, WideOrbit, INVIDI, OperativeOne, etc.
Experience with publisher tools, such as Yieldex.
Experience with digital data aggregators, such as Staq or Ad-Juster.
Experience with data vendors and measurement partners such as ComScore, Nielsen, LiveRamp, Experian, Acxiom, Epsilon, Neustar, etc.
More about you:
You are passionate about a culture of learning and teaching. You love challenging yourself to constantly improve and sharing your knowledge to empower others.
You like to take risks when looking for novel solutions to complex problems. If faced with roadblocks, you continue to reach higher to make greatness happen.
You care about solving big, systemic problems. You look beyond the surface to understand root causes so that you can build long-term solutions for the whole ecosystem.
You believe in not only serving customers, but also empowering them by providing access to knowledge and tools.

company: The Jewish Federations of North America
desc:
REPORTS TO: Managing Director, Business Intelligence
Organization Overview:
The Jewish Federations of North America (“JFNA”) represents 146 Jewish Federations and over 300 Network communities, which raise and distribute more than $3 billion annually for social welfare, social services and educational needs. The Federation movement, collectively among the top 10 charities on the continent, protects and enhances the well-being of Jews worldwide through the values of tikkun olam (repairing the world), tzedakah (charity and social justice) and Torah (Jewish learning).
POSITION SUMMARY:
JFNA is looking for a Business Analyst to join a new Business Intelligence team. The Business Analyst will work independently and together with the Senior Business Analyst, Business Intelligence under the guidance of the Managing Director to support monthly, annual and ad hoc data collection from the Federation network, with a focus on revenue data. The Business Analyst will support internal and external stakeholders by helping to coordinate data collection and analysis; producing meaningful, accurate, and timely reporting; and recommending improvements to JFNA’s data environment and practices. The Business Analyst will work collaboratively across teams to collect business requirements, document business processes, and develop recommendations.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Ensure timely collection of data from the Federation network by coordinating data collection schedule, tracking completion by Federation staff, performing quality checks, and raising concerns as required
Train and advise Federations on accurate reporting of data
Coordinate data collection efforts across JFNA program areas
Design and execute meaningful and user-friendly reports for JFNA and Federation professionals and leadership
Document business processes and key performance indicators (KPIs)
Handle Salesforce customer support requests as they come in: forgotten passwords, process confusion, data upload needs, report/dashboard creation needs, etc.
Ensure data cleanliness by running duplicate merge processes and scanning for any human or computer errors in the data. Run routine and project-based database maintenance
Partner with consultants to integrate support of JFNA processes and KPIs into strategic Salesforce platform
Identify opportunities to extend data collection to support other JFNA program needs
Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor Degree or higher
Minimum 2 years of experience in a business analyst, data analyst or business intelligence role
Comfortable with data, statistical analysis, and quantitative reporting
Strong Excel skills
Strong interpersonal communication skills; excellent oral and written communication skills
Excellent project management and organizational skills with attention to detail and commitment to follow-through
Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team
DESIRED SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:
Business Intelligence software such as PowerBI, Tableau
Database design / management, query design
Understanding of the capabilities of Salesforce, including security controls (profiles, permission sets, public groups, queues, sharing settings), process automation tools (workflows, flows, process builder), and business application development (custom objects, custom fields, page layouts, record types, apps, tabs)
Experience working in an Agile environment
Knowledge of fundraising, experience with NFP, knowledge of Jewish communal organizations and Federations

BGC Partners is currently seeking a Business Analyst to support Fenics FX. Fenics FX is an emerging electronic marketplace for FX trading where liquidity is actionable and real. The marketplace will include trading for Spot, NDF and Deliverable Forwards and Options.

Responsibilities:
Business Analyst for the development and roll out of our new line of client facing FX trading systems, under the FenicsFX brand
Coordinate the IT needs of all the stakeholders.
Create and analyze detailed functional specifications that are easily understood by developers and quality assurance teams.
Create User manuals, API specifications, and Rules of Engagement for Client distribution.
Create Support documentation and train staff on feature changes.
Provide elements of system design, including data migration rules, business rules, and wireframes.
Challenge the stakeholders on presumptions of how to best execute vision.
Interpret needs of the clients and translate into requirements.
Act as the maestro to bring together each team to successfully roll out new products (including technology, sales, legal, marketing, and back office)
Create and maintain clear Roll Out plan, organizing a variety of teams across the firm
Drive implementation of changes through existing teams
Analyze and assess current processes to define and document improvements.
Maintain an in-depth understanding of the software product(s) and processes used by the organization
Understand system and operational requirements, downstream system impacts, and legal compliance obligations
Develop and document project best practices
Recommend method and procedural changes.
Handle several implementation tasks and/or projects at any given time
Work with testing teams to ensure suitable test plans are created
Organize and lead user acceptance testing (UAT) with the appropriate project stakeholders
Provide daily, weekly, and/or monthly status reporting as needed
Roll up sleeves, do what becomes necessary to see to it that quality products are delivered within realistic timeframes

Minimum Experience
Working knowledge of business processes, system development and process improvements.
Experience in launching FX trading platforms
Experience providing solutions for Foreign Exchange spot and derivative products
Proficient in gathering business requirements, such as UML, process flows and use cases.
Expertise in modeling and mapping as-is and to-be business processes.
Experience with complete software development life cycle.
Understanding of technology capabilities and limitations.
Experience designing and reviewing test cases.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Preferred Experience
Experience in delivering regulatory projects
Experience with changes required for financial services companies and their IT departments
Experience in delivering changes that impact Compliance and Front Office
Sound knowledge of financial products

Location: New York, NY

Position Summary:

The Social Media Campaign Analyst will be in charge of executing, tracking, analyzing and optimizing the boosting strategy for all organic social media content across SiriusXM's social channels (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and YouTube). S/he will be responsible for allocating boost budget to support business objectives from upper funnel awareness to conversion. This person will work closely with the Content Performance Analyst to create a holistic approach to the creation, curation and distribution of SiriusXM's organic social media content.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Paid Social Media Management
Manage paid Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and YouTube media, buying, tagging, optimization and reporting with a focus on campaign KPIs and goals
Lead campaign set-up, QA, day-to-day maintenance, optimization, pacing, analysis/reporting
Execute on paid social campaigns to optimize for company objectives, including CPA, CPE, CPC, CPV, remarketing and acquisition
Develop campaign strategies and tactics with internal stakeholders and manage planning, execution and analysis of campaigns with outside agencies
Develop a regular re-marketing flow utilizing engagements created by organic social media performance with the goal of driving trial and subscription sign-ups
Work closely with digital content team to stay on top of upcoming launches, events, content opportunities, etc.
Track social spends for each account to report to finance department
Measurement & Reporting
Set KPIs and goals to measure social performance
Lead monitoring and reporting of campaign performance and proactively communicate any issues during all stages of the campaign
Produce detailed analysis of spending campaigns, using performance data to extract key learnings to improve and inform future strategies on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis
Ability to effectively present reports to stakeholders, including senior-level executives
Work closely with Content Performance Analyst to holistically track, report, analyze and optimize content performance
Craft comprehensive reporting and insights before, during and after a campaign to meet and to clear objectives and optimizations across platforms
Strategy & Recommendations
Identify and implement optimization of current and future paid campaigns
Identify opportunities to optimize assets, copy, distribution, budget, etc.
Build out a schedule for paid tests including the setup, implementation and reporting on controlled A/B tests
Understand and elevate how our channels work together and how the dynamic paid ecosystem (search, social, native, display, etc.) interacts with our owned / operated channels and compliments earned media channels.


Supervisory Responsibilities:

None


Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree and/or equivalent combination of education and experience preferred
3+ years of experience in digital or social; specifically directly managing a paid social budget
2+ years of experience in a business, data, or statistical analyst role
Deep knowledge of social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, etc.
Demonstrated analytical expertise interpreting data, measuring campaign efficiency, and using data to drive strategies and tactics
Excellent analytical skills with an ability to translate data into actionable insights
Experience working in cross-functional teams with testing success accountability
Strong Excel data management skills
Proven experience with Direct Response paid social campaigns with experience with attribution and conversion tracking


Requirements and General Skills:

Ability to analyze data to understand budgeting, audience planning, segmentation, and behaviors
Experience preparing, analyzing and presenting campaign insights to key partners
Used to working with a variety of stakeholders and building relationships
Deep understanding of social media data caveats by channel and how these caveats can affect reporting
Good public speaking and presentation skills.
Interpersonal skills and ability to interact and work with staff at all levels.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Ability to pay attention to details and be organized.
Ability to project professionalism over the phone and in person.
Willingness to take initiative and to follow through on projects.
Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multi-task, and work under shifting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Must have legal right to work in the U.S.


Technical Skills:

2+ years experience working with Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics to include campaign reporting and dashboard development
Advanced Excel skills including experience with pivot tables, forecast, and goal seek functions
Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlikview, or Power Bi a plus
Experience in using social media analytics platforms such as Sprinklr and native channel analytics such as Facebook Insights/Business Manager, Twitter Analytics, Instagram Analytics, YouTube Analytics, etc.
SiriusXM is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, citizenship, pregnancy, military or veteran status or any other status protected by applicable law.

The requirements and duties described above may be modified or waived by the Company in its sole discretion without notice.

Overview and Responsibilities
The Viacom Digital Analytics team supports the digital presence (web sites, apps, OTT) for Viacom brands such as Nickelodeon, MTV and Comedy Central worldwide. The team is a center of excellence focused on reporting, analyzing and evangelizing data observations and experiments to quantify the health and optimization efforts of Viacom’s Digital platforms. We perform an invaluable function in the decision making of every digital team member. We are responsible for Design Data Collection Specs and working with our counter parts on the product analytics side to translate data into actionable insights and provide a fact-based space for evaluation of new ideas and creative risks.
Given the important nature of the insights, the team require leadership from an Implementations & Data Integrity Director to ensure the digital team has the data it needs to operate effectively.

Overall Responsibilities:
Manage a team that leads & maintains the analytics implementations of Adobe Analytics across all our brands and digital platforms.
Provide leadership and set the direction for data analytics implementation cross platforms.
Monitor the implementation of a data integrity process to support the data quality and validity of our data collection work.
Evaluate and Manage implementation methodologies used, data quality and synergies across various third-party data sets and develop strategic recommendations on behalf of the Analytics team
Work closely with the Product Analytics team to identify analysis needs and resolve tagging issues affecting analysis and develop solutions to continue providing value to the product teams and other stakeholders.
Support our key stakeholders leveraging our data sources to support our decisions and provide insights into audience behavior.
Demonstrate expertise with various tracking services, their methodologies and applications – continuously identify the proper information solutions for business needs.
Continually look for process and reporting improvements and implement those changes were applicable.
Develop processes to work with QA Test automation engineers to create automation scripts for QA validation to support our platform updates and launches.
Experience and understanding of web and app cycles, product development rituals & working with solutions such as Jira and confluence.
Experience with packet sniffer and debugging tools such as: Charles Proxy & VPNs for HTTP requests validation.
Basic Qualifications
Solid client management skills – experience agency side and/or supporting large, diverse internal client groups
Experience managing a highly efficient multidisciplinary team.
Minimum 5-7 years of analytics experience, preferably in the digital space
Expert level user of digital Analytics solutions such as: Adobe Analytics (omniture) or Google Analytics
Additional Qualifications
Experience with Tableau and/or Power BI and or programming languages such as R, Python is strongly recommended
Experience with A/B testing and statistical significance techniques such as t-test, ANOVA, correlation, etc.
Ability to clearly articulate and present initiatives to creative and technical teams alike
Hands-on experience with Marketing LTV analytics solutions such as: Tune, Apps Flyer, Urban Airships, etc.
Entrepreneurial, digitally savvy, creative and experimental in the approach to problem solving, with exceptional analytical and critical thinking skills
Highly organized and detail-oriented – obsessive about accuracy and the applicability of findings
Must work well under pressure and be able to meet multiple deadlines simultaneously
Self-starter who is energetic, enthusiastic, adaptable and customer-oriented
Excellent quantitative skills
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills
A sense of humor is a must, we pride ourselves with our team fit, a sense of humor and comfort in a diverse environment is key to succeed.
Advanced college degree

Position Summary
The Underwriting Analyst is responsible for processing and analytical duties in support of underwriting multifamily and commercial mortgage financing programs being offered by Hunt Real Estate Capital.
The Underwriting Analyst must demonstrate attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and analytical ability. The Underwriting Analyst must take the initiative to drive the document request, collection and underwriting process as well as independently analyze credit and financial information to determine the degree of risk associated with the loan. While working in an independent and reliable manner, team work and effective communication will also be necessary for success.

Essential Job Functions
Assists the Underwriter during the loan underwriting process by requesting, collecting, managing required documentation:
Prepare, distribute, and maintain Due Diligence Checklists and Application Workbooks, updating regularly to meet target underwriting dates.
Collect, review, and advise underwriting team regarding receipt and status of all underwriting documentation.
Establish and maintain loan files. Retain and organize loan documentation in appropriate electronic data storage folders.
Order and obtain professional reports and verifications from external parties.
Inputs and analyzes data:
Verify and update property operating information in underwriting analysis workbook.
Upon receipt of borrower/sponsor financial statements, SREO, Underwriting Certificates, credit reports and investor database credit checks:
Review and notify Underwriter of any material issues;
Transfer data from reports to underwriting analysis workbook and narrative.
Upon receipt of professional reports (e.g. appraisal, engineering, environmental assessment, seismic analysis, zoning, and market reports), transfer data into underwriting analysis workbook and narrative.
Assists the Underwriter in the preparation and submission of loan committee presentation, including drafting sections of the underwriting narrative as assigned and preparing exhibits.
Assists with assembling loan package and delivering to Investors after closing.
Processes invoices for payment and prepare final accounting.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Education
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Real Estate, or Business Administration preferred.

Experience and Qualifications
One to three years of commercial real estate experience required; multifamily strongly preferred.
Experience with Fannie Mae and/or Freddie Mac Multifamily loan programs considered a plus, but not required.
Knowledge of financial statement analysis, general accounting, cash flows and mortgage interest calculations.
Knowledge of real estate finance and/or investment real estate, including multifamily, retail and office.
Highly analytical thinking with demonstrated talent for identifying, scrutinizing, improving, and streamlining complex work processes.
Results-driven achiever with exemplary planning and organizational skills, along with a high degree of attention to detail.
Exceptional listener and communicator who effectively conveys information verbally and in writing.
Resourceful team player who excels at building trusting relationships with clients and colleagues.
Applicable knowledge of Microsoft Office suite.

Other Skills
Requires a self-motivated individual who pays close attention to detail and who can prioritize in a fast-moving environment with excellent consulting, client management and business literacy skills. Takes initiative to identify and anticipate client needs and make recommendations for implementation. While working in an independent and reliable manner, team work and effective communication will also be necessary for success.

EEO/ADA
Hunt provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

#ZRHMG

Company Overview
AllianceBernstein L.P. (AB) is a leading global investment management firm that offers high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional clients, individuals and private clients in major markets around the world. AB employs more than 500 investment professionals with expertise in growth equities, value equities, fixed income securities, blend strategies, and alternative investments, and, through its subsidiaries and joint ventures, operates in more than 20 countries. AB’s research disciplines include fundamental research, quantitative research, economic research and currency forecasting capabilities. Through its integrated global platform, AB is well-positioned to tailor investment solutions for its clients. AB also offers independent research, portfolio strategy and brokerage-related services to institutional investors.
Responsibilities
Bernstein Private Wealth Management (“Bernstein”), a subsidiary of AB, provides advanced planning strategies and a wide array of investment management services to high net worth families, endowments and foundations, and institutions to help them reach specific financial objectives. Bernstein Private Wealth Management is distinguished among major wealth managers by its single focus and the resulting alignment of interests and accountability this brings to each client relationship. Bernstein’s integrated approach allows the firm to tailor each client’s portfolio, minimizing the effects of tax and volatility, with investment strategies that draw on AB’s deep research expertise across asset classes and geographies.

Bernstein Private Wealth Management’s clients are located around the globe. Bernstein has offices in Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Cleveland, Dallas, Denver, Houston, Los Angeles, Miami, Minneapolis, Nashville, New York, Philadelphia, San Diego, San Francisco, Seattle, Tampa, Washington, D.C., and West Palm Beach. Bernstein Private Wealth Management reported $95 billion in assets under management, as of May 31, 2019.

You are an innovative and enthusiastic individual based in the New York City area who can serve as Product Owner for Bernstein’s client-facing website and mobile app. You will guide the design and development effort of a product essential to our Private Wealth platform by conveying the business vision to the design and development teams, outlining the scope and prioritization of work, and assuming accountability for successful market acceptance. You should have an enthusiasm for creating vital functionality and for innovating and expanding our product suite. This position requires commitment to exceptional results, a strong desire for continuous improvement and the ability to build strong relationships with a multi-discipline team.

The key job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Articulating the “what” and “why” of product releases by owning the entire product lifecycle management process including feature/module sunset/retirement strategy & plan.Collaborating without boundaries to ensure transparency into timelines, quality of delivery, exposure to risk, barriers to execution, business viability, and remediation plans.Define the product roadmap by absorbing, evaluating, challenging and balancing input from multiple sources including corporate vision/strategy, marketing data, engineering, UX designers, support, sales, and, most importantly, clients or end users.Orientation is towards the definition of user scenarios, use cases, and user stories through visual, verbal and written communication.Responsible for effective communication (verbally, visually, and in writing) with the design and engineering teams to determine the scope of work for a given release.Represent clients at all times and committed to delivering products that not only satisfy customer requirements but also excites them. This role is intent on going above and beyond to anticipate both user needs and invoking a pleasurable experience.Guaranteeing an effective feedback loop into development. The Product Owner communicates regularly with customers to ensure a rapid and effective feedback loop into development progress and decisions.Lives and breathes the user experience, capable of translating business constructs into detailed requirements and instigating healthy debate and ambitious thinking.Champions “whole product” thinking, ensuring sufficient consideration of non-functional requirements and implications for how the product is promoted, sold, delivered, and monetized.Gather, structure, and analyze data from a variety of sources to provide insight on data trends, traffic patterns, and anomalies to develop insights about digital customer behavior and experience.Identify new opportunities using quantitative data gathered with the Adobe toolset, combined with data from other systems.Perform cross-channel analytics that show customer behaviors across digital platforms including models that both identify and predict customer engagement and behavior.Build and automate intuitive dashboards that help visualize and answer complex business problems and/or customer behavior.
Qualifications
5+ years of professional experienceExperience managing web & mobile platforms (iOS/Android)3+ years of experience in agile/scrum development processExcellent problem-solving and relationship management skillsExcellent leadership and communication skillsCollaborative, innovative, and strong self-organization skillsPassionate about high-quality productsAdobe Experience Manager, Campaign and/or Analytics, familiarity preferredAbility to identify gaps, program risks and take pre-emptive actions to address themNatural tendency towards collaboration, curiosity, and open communication

Calypso Technology is seeking a functional and/or technical Cloud Support Analyst with at least 6 years relevant experience gained in the capital markets industry working for a software vendor, consultancy, and/or trading floor. This should include production support of Front and/or Middle Office Systems in one or more of the following: Fixed Income, FX, Interest Rate Derivatives, Credit Derivatives, Equity Derivatives, or Risk .
Responsibilities


In-depth, hands-on involvement directly with Cloud customers on Calypso system. Work directly with users of the Calypso system to ensure proper scoping, implementation, go-live, upgrade, and production daily use of the mainly front office solutions used by Cloud customers.
Work hands on with the system integration teams to guide and help configure and test the systems and environments to ensure that they meet the business requirements. This will include areas such as testing of market data, including zero curves, probability curves, correlation matrices, dividend curves, etc., and the underlying financial instruments that drive the generation of those curves.
Assist customers in identifying functional gaps in the core front office product, and to create detailed functional specifications for the gaps, and to determine whether those functional enhancements will be implemented by core Calypso development.
Manage issues and track timeline of bug resolution development deliverables, and keep the customer informed of progress. Additionally, will co-own deployment of developments into Cloud clients Environments, including identification of key setup and configuration tasks, scope considerations, timeline and scheduling, and resource requirements.
Provide partial Production Support by managing complex product and Environment issues related to the installation, use, and maintenance of Calypso products such as investigating logs, code, database queries, etc...


Skills & Requirements:


6+ years working in systems or business analysis, preferably in the capital markets industry with Production Support responsibilities.
Either detailed hands-on knowledge about industry-standard front office standards for market data management, trade capture and pricing or BackOffice standard for collateral management, Settlement platform, Cash/Security position management and accounting entries.
In addition to the above, experience in any or the entire following asset classes will be preferred: credit derivatives, interest rate derivatives, equity derivatives, fixed income or FX and money market.
Or technically self-sufficient – ability to read code will be highly valued, and experience designing/building front office systems will be especially valuable. Knowledge of Java and/or Python preferred.
Strong ability to map conceptual financial and business elements to practical system capabilities. Should be able to translate front office or back office business requirements into actual system configuration.
Excellent interpersonal skills. The person in this role will spend significant amounts of time working hands-on educating and training customers, and patience will be key to success.
Willingness and ability to travel periodically, as required.
Previous software company experience will be highly valued. In particular, previous experience with implementing Front Office or back office systems will be key to success.
High sense of Customer satisfaction in an international business context (culture and time-zone wise) with the Cloud/SaaS specificity being an extreme exposure to Clients and their environments.
4+ years’ experience with Calypso platform is preferred.


Benefits

Calypso Technology is an equal opportunity employee (EOE) and strongly supports diversity in the workforce.
