company: New York City DEPT OF INFO TECH & TELECOMM
desc:
Organization Profile
The mission of the Mayor’s Office of Data Analytics (MODA) is to help City agencies apply strategic analytical thinking to data in order to deliver services more equitably and effectively and to increase operational transparency. MODA’s work in partnership with agencies touch on a wide variety of areas including: public safety, education, emergency management, transportation, physical infrastructure, and economic development. Depending on the engagement, MODA staff may serve as analysts, strategic advisors, technical resources, or project managers.

MODA is also responsible for implementing the New York City Open Data Law, the most ambitious and comprehensive open data legislation in the country. MODA partners with the Department of Information Technology and Telecommunications (DoITT) to manage the City’s Open Data program, which has over 2,500 publicly available datasets and 30,000 weekly users, and achieve Open Data for All, the Mayor’s vision to maximize New Yorkers’ engagement with City data.

Job Responsibilities
MODA seeks a Data Analytics Manager to provide hands-on analytics project direction and oversee a team of four data scientists. The Data Analytics Manager will work closely alongside the City’s Chief Analytics Officer (CAO) and Deputy Chief Analytics Officer to implement the office’s data analytics strategy and to develop processes for effective and sustainable analytics project staffing, analysis, and reporting.

The selected candidate will provide direct project guidance and supervision for data analysts; and engage regularly with City leadership, Mayor’s Offices, City agencies including technology and analytics principals, City Council, New York City’s data science community and other internal or external audiences.

The Data Analytics Manager will:
Provide supervision for MODA’s analytics team, completing or reviewing data analysis as needed; and work with the CAO and Deputy CAO and team leads to review and assess analytics project opportunities, and prioritize new and existing analytics projects in alignment with MODA’s mission. As the direct manager for MODA’s team of data analysts, the Data Analytics Manager will be responsible for the growth and development of the team, in collaboration with the CAO and DCAO.In partnership with City agencies and MODA analytics staff, establish and review scope, timelines, reporting cadence, impact and quality measures, and technical documentation for MODA analytics projects.Collaborate with the City’s IT agency (DoITT) Data Management and Integration team and Enterprise Architecture team to define data infrastructure, integration, and software needs for MODA analytics projects.Lead in the development of best practices for municipal “open analytics” work - publishing analytics code and projects publicly when possible, in partnership with City agency partners.Support MODA as analytics center for excellence and initiatives that increase agencies’ data-driven practices, including: the Analytics Exchange (AnEx), data science workforce development initiatives, and best practice exchanges between the private sector and academia and the City’s data analysts.


Minimum Qual Requirements

1. A master's degree in computer science from an accredited college and three years of progressively more responsible, full-time, satisfactory experience using information technology in computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, database administration, planning of data/information processing, user services, or area networks at least 18 months of this experience must have been in an administrative, managerial or executive capacity in the areas of computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, data base administration, or planning of data processing or in the supervision of staff performing these duties; or

2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and four years of experience as described in "1" above; or

3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's department of education or recognized accrediting organization and six years of experience as described in "1" above; or

4. A satisfactory combination of education and experience equivalent to "1", "2" or "3" above. However, all candidates must have at least a four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's department of education or recognized accrediting organization and must possess at least three years of experience as described in "1" above, including the 18 months of administrative, managerial, executive or supervisory experience as described in

"1" above.

Qualification Requirements (continued)

NOTE: The following types of experience are not acceptable: superficial use of preprogrammed software without complex programming, design, implementation or management of the product; use of word processing packages; use of a hand held calculator; primarily the entering or updating of data in a system; the operation of data processing hardware or consoles.


Preferred Skills

The preferred candidate should possess the following broad range of skills:
Curious, flexible thinker who loves learning, coaching and managing a technical team, and tackling new challenges on a daily basis;Hands-on experience as a senior data analyst/scientist working on high visibility analytics projects with multiple stakeholders;Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and effectively help team members prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously;Project management experience and a passion for staff development and coaching to support career development;Passion for solving business and technical problems, and translating business needs into the required technologies/methodologies to translate data into analytics projects, products, and recommendations;Background and fluency in a range of analytics fields (e.g. economics, statistics, computer science, data visualization, consulting) and familiarity with open source tools and practices for working in the open leveraging agile methodologies;Excellent written and verbal communication and data presentation skills and ability to communicate with administrative and technical leaders and agency staff about data and analytics;Passion for solving New York City’s more pressing challenges with an equity-orientation;Experience or familiarity in working with New York City government is a plus.


To Apply

Candidates Must Have a Permanent Computer Systems Manager Title
-or-
Have Taken the Most Recent Computer Systems Manager Civil Service Exam

Interested applicants with other civil service titles who meet the preferred requirements should also submit a resume for consideration
Please go to Employee Self Service (ESS), click on Recruiting Activities > Careers, and search for Job ID #400387

SUBMISSION OF A RESUME IS NOT A GUARANTEE THAT YOU WILL RECEIVE AN INTERVIEW
APPOINTMENTS ARE SUBJECT TO OVERSIGHT APPROVAL

The Department of Information Technology & Telecommunications and the City of New York are equal opportunity employers.

DoITT participates in E-Verify


Hours/Shift

Day - Due to the necessary technical management duties of this position in a 24/7 operation, candidate may be required to be on call and/or work various shifts such as weekends and/or nights/evenings.


Work Location

New York, NY


Residency Requirement

New York City Residency is not required for this position

job_title: Manager, Big Data Analytics and Machine Learning
desc:
Manager: Big Data Analytics and Machine Learning Specialist

Financial Markets

Risk and Financial Advisory

75% Travel

Powered by Deloitte’s Risk and Financial Advisory’s (RFA) industry-leading expertise and technology, our Financial Markets team provides services designed to address operational, technological and regulatory challenges faced by capital markets participants, including: wealth and investment managers; broker dealers; asset servicers; exchanges; clearing houses; depositories and custodians, including companies in commodities-driven businesses.


Work you’ll do
We are developing innovative solutions that leverage the latest technologies in open source and the cloud and are building a team of top-notch software engineers to create our next generation Big Data Analytics and Machine Learning platform. You will be working with all levels of technology from front-end technologies (e.g. React framework, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, R, Scala), server-side technologies (web APIs on dotnet core, C#, Python, Node.js), backend data processing technologies (Hadoop, Spark R) and Cloud technologies in Azure and Amazon! We want you to bring your excitement and technical expertise to deliver high quality work and continuously improve the ways we can better leverage Big Data Analytics and Machine Learning. This is just the beginning of Big Data Analytics and Machine Learning and we need you to help us define the future and get us there – a huge opportunity awaits!
Responsibilities include:

Partner with Product Owner and other stakeholders to understand the high-level requirements and business objectives; and make recommendations for business prioritization, roadmaps and product improvements
 Develop trusting relationships with our business and other subject matter experts
Communicate with senior leaders regarding the architecture, discuss problems and recommend solutions and improvements.
 Provide leadership in refining the product backlog from an architectural standpoint
 Ensure architectural considerations are incorporated into building the working software
Own the successful development and implementation of business capabilities by the development teams
Ensure high quality of deliverables by conducting design and code reviews, ensuring teams are automating unit and integration tests in a timely manner.
 Design and lead the technical implementation of efficient, adaptable, scalable, and reliable data pipelines and algorithms to process unstructured and structured big data
Enable complex analytics by building usable data sets that can power various analytics like regression, classification, clustering, etc.…
Leverage industry knowledge and stay close to technology developments in the open-source and cloud communities
Provide technical direction to the development teams including hands-on development of POCs where appropriate
 Build, design and implement high-volume, high-scale responsive web front ends, web APIs, data analytics and machine learning solutions in the cloud
Develop our next level of architects and technology talent and mentor junior development staff in the art of building software systems.
Bring new ideas in cloud, big data, and machine learning software development
Leverage industry knowledge and stay close to technology developments in the open-source and cloud communities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams
Practice and enforce Agile and Scrum development methodologies

Job Details
Job Code
JPSC-8275
Posted Date
04/15/19

Jira,documenting business and functional requirements,application Prototypes,Balasamiq &MS Visio

Functional Role and Responsibilities:
In this role you will be responsible for functioning within a larger support and enhancement team. Responsibilities include- Day to day Incident and Problem Management, Application Monitoring, Release Management, and Enhancements, Production queries resolution.

Qualifications
Required Technical Skills:Actimize knowledge is a must.Good functional and technical understanding of Actimize AML SAM and Control Room solution implementation.Support Experience on Informatica or similar ETL Tool.Support Experience on a Unix platform (Sun Solaris or LINUX).Ability to write & debug basic Shell scripts, PowerShell and Batch Scripts.Experience in writing and interpreting Database SQL queries.Comfortable reading and analyzing various log files.Scheduling tool like Autosys, Control M experience.Service Now knowledge is a plus.

General Characteristics of Success:Possess the necessary skillset to quickly learn new technologies and the analytical skills required to drive critical issues to resolution within our team and/or in collaboration with external teams.Effective prioritization skills and ability to work independently.Desires to work in a dynamic technical application support environment.Good ability to convey technical information to an audience with various levels of technical knowledge, including a business user base that may lack a deep understanding of application technology.High sense of urgency and commitment to exceeding customer expectations.Ability and willingness to operate within tightly controlled policies and procedures.Demonstrated technical competencies.Good analytical and communications skills (both written and verbal)

Matrix-IFS offers a competitive base salary and a full benefit package. Benefits include: medical, dental, 401K, STD, HSA, PTO and more.

MATRIX-IFS is a dynamic, fast growing, technical consultancy helping Banks, Brokerage, and Financial Services companies with AML/fraud detection, trading surveillance consulting and systems integration. We are comprised of talented, creative and dedicated individuals with a passion for delivering innovative solutions to the market. We source and foster the best talent and recognize that every employee's contributions are integral to our company's future. MATRIX-IFS’s success is based on a challenging work environment, competitive compensation and benefits, and rewarding career opportunities. We encourage a work environment of sharing, learning and succeeding together. Come and join a winning team! You'll be challenged, you'll have fun, and you'll be a part of a highly respected organization!

Lead client engagements and educate clients on the value of adding analytical services to their business, helping them define needs and potential solutions.
Pro-actively engage with other specialty and new business teams across regions, to ensure the understanding of the Grey data strategy offering, spot new opportunities and ensure insights are put into action.
Develop 1st and 3rd party data strategies to build out a richer understanding of the customer
Help to develop a deeper understanding of the customer journey, identifying both in-market and out of market opportunities
Build audience profiles based off various syndicated and proprietary tools (IE Resonate, MRI).
Work closely with respective team members from various disciplines (Account, Creative, Strategy) within the agency and the client to deliver on the value of the emerging data strategy offering.
Responsible for measurement strategy and oversight across multiple channels including digital, social and CRM – Applying various tools in the toolset (test and learn agendas etc..) to ensure there is alignment on program KPI’s, that all relevant tracking is working correctly and there is a realistic optimization approach.
Be able to upsell data-driven projects to account and clients that are not currently within scope by provide thought leadership on innovative analytic solutions. Suggests new/innovative techniques for validating campaign performance when relevant (IE. Brand studies, offline sales impact, MMM)

Qualifications

Required Skills/Experience/Qualifications:
Data-driven orientation and the ability to leverage data strategically to link back to the higher level business objective
Leverage your capacity to identify business opportunities above and beyond the original task which will translate into you being seen as strategically valuable to the business
Ability to synthesize large amounts of information/data and translate into an easily understood story, with the ability to understand the important balance between art and science
Have a passion for understanding data, formulating and testing hypotheses, and creating and improving processes.
Must have experience with: data strategy, hands-on experience in quantitative data analysis, creative problem solving, the ability to develop/analyze business cases and excellent oral and written communication skills
Familiarity with syndicated research sources including Comscore, MRI and Nielsen
Knowledge of digital marketing and CRM disciplines (including segmentation, test design, targeting) and a familiarity with the Digital Media Landscape is required
Familiarity with web analytic tools (IE.Omniture, Google Analytics) and social listening tools (Crimson Hexagon and Digimind) is a plus
5+ years of business experience working in Strategy, Marketing, Advertising or Management Consulting
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Statistics, Economics, Marketing, Psychology, or relevant degrees
This is a client facing role and candidates must be comfortable in this environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to prepare client-ready documents

Grey provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

We offer dynamic career opportunities with growth potential in a fun work environment!

Job Overview

Our client, an award-winning marketing and transactional solutions company, is seeking for an Implementation Manager to join the digital solutions team. This role will entail working directly with clients to drive new customer implementations, leveraging the most advanced technology.

Responsibilities and Duties

Partner with sales team on client engagement to assess business needs and construct solution plan
Gather requirements for client’s business needs and translate to technical requirements
Write technical requirements and business specifications for client implementations
Collaborate with clients and key internal stakeholders to establish framework and map project implementation
Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases and elements
Work alongside quality assurance team in testing efforts
Ensure timely custom project delivery and reports
Create standard operating procedures
Provide customer product support and training


Qualifications:

2+ years of implementation experience as a BA/PM
Experience in the payments and fintech space
Bachelor’s degree in related area preferred
Demonstrated success in developing and leading projects in a B2B setting


8189

Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today's most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It's also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it's no wonder we're consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you're as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.
KPMG is currently seeking a Senior Associate in Technology Enablement for our Consulting practice.
Responsibilities:
Lead multiple client service delivery teams in the active execution of engagements in compliance with firm and practice unit service delivery standards
Utilize technical and industry knowledge to identify complex client issues and build long-term business relationships with key executives through engagement delivery and networking in professional organizations
Participate in business development by identifying new opportunities and assisting with proposal development
Contribute thought leadership to the development and evolution of our Technology Enablement Solutions (TES) methodologies and intellectual capital including publishing articles, whitepapers, or performing research in support of TES initiatives
Manage and provide leadership to teams of staff level professionals and become actively involved in staff development and practice management
Qualifications:
A minimum of three years of TES related experience with a professional services advisory firm or publicly traded company
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university; MBA or MIS from an accredited college/university preferred
Experience in process reengineering, designing and implementing business performance management applications, including budgeting, forecasting, planning, consolidation, and reporting
Knowledge of information access and delivery methods, analytics applications and tool portfolio, data sourcing and integration methods such as OLAP / ROLAP / HOLAP and an understanding of data warehousing/mining, ETL, EII, data cleansing, and architecture
Strong understanding of governance, controls, process and procedures, centers of competency, change management, conceptual data modeling, master data management, data standardization and stewardship, information integrity and compliance, and data quality management
Travel may be up to 80-100%
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future

job_title: Director of Data Science and Analytics
desc:
About The Position
Glassbox is hiring a Director of Data Science and Analytics to lead our Global Business Insights team in this exciting growth phase of our Customer Experience Analytics business.
You will lead our Analytics and Data Science efforts across the globe promoting Customer Experiences Analytics as well as supporting the customer’s leadership team with commercial insight.
The ideal candidate will have excellent communication, organizational and project management skills to capably manage multiple task while working in a fast-paced SaaS environment.

Key Responsibilities

Manage the Global Business Insights and Analytics Team

Helping the customers provide values of the Glassbox solution by providing analytics insights

Play a key part in supporting the Pre-Sales cycle and Post-sales delivery

Perform weekly and monthly management-level reports, synthesized from numerous sources, focused on actionable data

Identify key success indicators and determine best practices for measurement and reporting

Use analytics to create concepts, justify business cases and manage the implementation of improvements to the web and mobile experience

Collaborate with various interfaces in the organization, providing customer feedback and recommendations on continued development of the product
Requirements
8+ years’ experience in an analytical role (digital customer analytics, web analytics, consulting)
Deep understanding of digital channels technologies (web and mobile) and the customers experience while using them
Expert ability with Adobe, Tealeaf, Clicktale, SQL, Python, or other customer experience management tool
Excellent analytical skills including problem solving, attention to detail and clear communication of complex results
Proven ability to work with the processes and technologies of large datasets
Management Experience: High level people skills (successfully managed a team of analysts) and communication skills (successfully influenced across all levels/functions)
Deliver insights using creativity, pragmatism and out of the box thinking
An independent thinker, confident to serve as the voice of the customers
Proactive approach with hands on / can-do mindset
Ability to thrive in a global start up work environment
Travel will be required

ABOUT BRAND EXPERIENCE
The Brand Experience team at Macy’s is passionate about finding new ways for the Macy’s brand to show up to the consumer, our vendors, and our colleagues. We live to challenge the status quo, change minds, and deliver growth as a result. By creating a startup environment within a Fortune 150 company, we are developing new revenue streams, business models, and ways of working to help paint the future for an iconic 160-year-old company.


ABOUT THE ROLE
The Director of Business Intelligence will be responsible for establishing an analytical infrastructure and develop reporting tools across various businesses under the Brand Experience umbrella. You will be an analytical thought partner to leaders in Brand Experience and collaborate across the broader Macy’s organization. This role requires a strategic quantitative and financial mindset, but also the ability to execute through process and reporting solutions. You’ll be part of a cross-functional team of expert colleagues working in new ways —more agile and more adaptive— so throw the old playbook away. A typical day for this role might include analyzing prior month expenses to assess annual spend vs. plan and proposing recommendations for spending in the rest of the year, developing KPIs for a new business we are working on, review STORY at Macy’s transaction data to develop insights that store team incentives and future product assortment, or chatting with Macy’s business partners to research key assumptions to use in a financial model to forecast a new business. This role reports to the Brand Experience Officer. This role is unlike any other Director of Business Intelligence role because it requires a strong financial modeling and analytical mindset, but also contributes to execution by developing new processes to streamline operations and provides actionable recommendations based on insights from your analysis.


WHAT YOU’LL DO

Business Model Design - Develop quantitative models to evaluate new businesses, revenue streams, and cost structures. Partner with each of the Brand Experience business teams to approach P&L development for new businesses. Identify trends, successes, and opportunities and make strategic recommendations in response. Research and introduce perspectives from other industries and business models to inform new ways of evaluating new projects.

Oversee merchandise planning for Brand Experience businesses - Responsible for merchandise and location financial plans (sales and inventory) to support the overall performance plan, in-season inventory, flow, replenishment, and markdown management. Partner with Creative Merchandising to manage the development of assortment and assortment planning (breadth, depth, flow, target sell-through, style plans, markdown plans, etc.), which supports the high-level merchandising assortment vision and maximize sales, margin, and turnover.

Analytics and Testing - Set the roadmap for the analytics team, triage and prioritize requests across the organization from week to week. Develop hypotheses and corresponding metrics to evaluate new projects. Think beyond traditional KPIs to measure short-term, long-term, ROI and leading indicators of performance. Unpack complex interactions through a test and learn approach that leads to iteration on new concepts to achieve long-term success.

Analytics and Reporting Evolution - Set the roadmap to deliver analytics and reporting tools for all businesses under the Brand Experience team. Develop dashboards and reporting for key stakeholders within the team to help uncover actionable insights and inform key business decisions on a timely basis. Streamline common activities such as monthly financial planning, invoicing, budgeting, and reporting. Partner with Macy’s central Finance teams to facilitate corporate budgeting and monthly and seasonal rolling operating forecast process.


THINGS YOU’LL NEED

Bachelor’s degree required.
Strong analytical skills, with 5-8 years of experience in investment banking, corporate finance, business intelligence or other highly analytical field with complex financial and business modeling.
Prior experience or familiarity in a merchandise planning role at a retailer
Strong written and verbal skills, with ability to develop and clearly articulate insights from large, complex datasets, and ability to communicate effectively across cross-functional and executive teams
Vision and passion—to see the future of retail and want to create it.
Ability to inspire others to action through influence and advice.
Resilience, tenacity, high energy. Able to rapidly bounce back from adversity.
Extremely detail oriented
Desire to be hands-on in a fast-paced environment
Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills.
Must be able to function as part of a team and collaborate with team members.
Possess a strong sense of urgency.
Possess a thirst for learning.
Proficiency with modeling, analytics, and presentation tools such as Microsoft or Google product suites.
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality. Perform other duties as assigned.
SQL and VBA experience preferred
Available to work flexible hours based on department and store/company needs


ONE MORE THING
We love people with special sauce! Do you juggle, run marathons, plan secret dinner parties? Be sure to let us know!


This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy’s, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

job_title: Business Analyst - Investment Banking - Financial Sponsors G...
desc:
Description

Role Description:
The Financial Sponsors Group Business Analyst will support the group’s internal and external administrative functions. Internally this will include maintaining select proprietary databases, coordinating information for internal weekly calls/meetings, managing logistics for sponsored client events, distributing generic client marketing materials, and assisting with business management reporting tasks. Externally this will include a few daily and weekly tasks geared towards tracking and recording general market activity. The role will not involve transaction origination or execution, except in the form of miscellaneous tasks required for internal support.
Primary Responsibilities:FSG Group Revenue

  Provide sponsor fees for event approval to the Corporate Events team
Marketing Coordination

Schedule: Full-time
Employee Status: Regular
Job Level: Non-Management
Job Posting: Oct 18, 2019, 10:37:57 AM

Principal Pricing Analyst-1900101Q


No Visa Sponsorship is available for this position.

Preferred Qualifications

Oracle Data Cloud (ODC) provides the world's largest cloud-based data management platform for marketing, which helps enterprises personalize online, offline, and mobile marketing campaigns with richer and more actionable information about targeted audiences. Due to continued growth, we are currently seeking a Principal Pricing Analyst to join our dedicated sales operations and strategy team, based in New York City.
The Principal Pricing Analyst will be a key Individual Contributor on the Sales Operations team for the Oracle Data Cloud (ODC) Global Business Unit. As a Principle Pricing Analyst you will assist Senior Leadership with assessing the impact of proposed pricing changes for large strategic clients. The person in this role will be responsible for ensuring that Revenue, Margin and Business objectives are accounted for in all pricing decisions.
This role requires a strong analytical background along with pricing and margin analysis experience, preferably in the digital advertising space. The successful candidate will also be able to collaborate effectively across teams and clearly communicate recommendations to senior leadership.
 Preferred Qualifications
You have 7+ years of experience in a pricing related role
You have knowledge of the digital advertising ecosystem
You have a BS or BA Degree from a highly competitive school
You are tech savvy and an expert with Excel and other operational tools
You are capable of turning analytical insights into actions
You are extremely detail oriented
You are curious, insightful and have great business acumen

Detailed Description and Job Requirements

Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization*s financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.

Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.

Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills. 8 plus years relevant work experience.

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_title: Commercial Business Analyst - Continuous Process Improvement
desc:
Job Description :
Diageo has initiated a ‘call to action’ in which it envisions becoming the fast growing, highest margin drinks business, operating with a differentiated approach in our developed and developing markets with greater freedom and authority, in order to accelerate performance. The organization is globally transforming into one characterized by speed of thought, decision making and bias for action in order emerge the clear leaders of the industry.

The Diageo Business Services organization will drive value, service and business performance, contributing significantly and leading the above transformation and call to action. This means reduction in cost base, continually improving efficiency and driving greater process standardization, greater focus on market growth, ensuring outstanding services and customer satisfaction and driving stronger compliance and controls.

Purpose of Role

Develops process and technical solutions to business problems by defining, analyzing and documenting requirements, shaping solutions via process improvement or farming out requests to product owners and COEs as appropriate.
Top Accountabilities
Possesses a good level of knowledge and understanding of DBS capabilities and services offered and available to the markets
Leads ongoing reviews of business processes and develops CPI and optimization strategies by leveraging existing assets, proposing enhancements or establishing need for new solutions
Develops continuous process improvement interventions and facilitates Lean projects to improve processes. Works with key business stakeholders, as multi-jurisdictional ‘LEAN champions’, to build a continuous improvement environment to support an ongoing program of change·
Identifies local business demand and feeds through to Business Partner, User Experience and Service COEs as appropriate
Determines if/how business needs can be met through existing solutions across DBS service towers
Assists the BP with development and documentation of the business case for portfolio and CPI projects
Translated business needs into business requirements and guides this though prioritization and inclusion in Portfolio and CPI plans
Drives the design and/or review of test cases, process change requests, and manage a project’s scope, acceptance, installation and deployment.
Assesses and validates activities to determine if a solution has fulfilled the requirements.
Identifies, screens and evaluates if a new solution is required to address customer needs
Develops solution concepts and business cases for new investments
Informs BP and Regional BRM of solution trade-offs both within and between different solution platforms to help decision making.
Identifies and facilitates process improvement projects, training/ workshops to drive cultural change
Qualifications and Experience Required
Excellent stakeholder, communication and ability to influence
Ability to work and deliver through others in a multifunctional and global environment
Good understanding of business process, experience generating performance insights using performance report and KPIs,
Experience shaping compelling business case for change and quantify cost and benefits
Experience in Commercial and Business Analytics processes, service delivery, tools and applications management and maintenance (data management, SaaS, SFA, sales execution investment management tools, others)
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems or related degree
The candidate will be able to demonstrate 5 years success in a similar role.
Experience within the CPG industry and/or experience of Commercial functions
Worker Type :
Regular
Primary Location:
New York 530 5th Ave
Additional Locations :
Job Posting Start Date :
2019-06-07-07:00

Position summary
Responsible for producing standard and adhoc reporting. A strong emphasis is placed on process documentation and operational compliance. Assist with implementation and management of client reporting needs, meeting the clear target goals for account performance and efficiency, as well as the ability to identify and support the expansion of complimentary reporting capabilities. Assists with analysis of trends, metrics and authorizations/claims oversight for continuous corporate level reporting. Support on-going sales efforts with research and documentation as requested.

Job Requirements
Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Business or Health Services Administration, with course work in Business Analytics and/or equivalent of 5 years of work experience.
Experience: Prior healthcare experience required (min. 3 years); managed care experience preferred. Experience with reporting tools is required; data warehousing, SharePoint and Client Relationship Management tools in additional to the essential analytical background would be advantageous. A proven track record in process documentation and excellence in analytical oversight is required.
Skills
Excellent organizational, analytical, communication, and presentation skills required. Proficiency with Microsoft Excel including macros and pivot tables, creating and executing SQL queries, stored procedures and functions and experience with SQL Reporting Services, Crystal Reports or an equivalent report designer are required. Experience with SQL Analysis Services and Excel PowerPivot would be advantageous.

To apply, please email a cover letter, resume and salary requirement to hr@caretocare.com with the position being applied for in the subject line. No calls please.

Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: San Francisco, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA; Los Angeles, CA, USA
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, psychology or statistics, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of professional experience with brand and consumer research.

Preferred qualifications:

Advanced degree in business, marketing, psychology, or statistics.
Fluent in quantitative data analysis (e.g., multivariate regression, clustering, etc.).
Fluent in qualitative consumer analysis (e.g., consumer decision frameworks, laddering techniques, motivation theory, etc.).
Demonstrated ability to tell high-impact stories through data and insights at a high level.
Excellent project management skills and keen attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
About the job
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

You possess exceptional research skills and can address a wide range of consumer and brand problems. As a Global Strategic Insights Lead, you have a solid insights and research background and are unafraid to charter new ground, invent new ways and deliver creative solutions to some of our biggest challenges. You are innately curious, collaborative, and can think about the big picture, nail execution and be forward thinking.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems-from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can-changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
Responsibilities
Lead large scale cross-functional programs, internally/externally, that unite all research teams, work, insights, tools and data to a united front.
Develop and stand up tools (e.g., internal website, assets management, research repository, etc.) necessary for team success.
Identify business challenges and translate them into hypotheses, research needs, and/or internally led solutions. Bring answers that drive/influence strategic decisions and long-term thinking with key business leaders. Be a great collaborator/thought partner, and be comfortable working independently managing end-to-end process internally/externally with partners, from concept to conclusion.
Draft surveys, construct research tests, workshops, presentations and other mechanisms independently, or with others, to deliver insights into the business.
Deliver your work through a package that is both beautiful and human. Build highly-compelling stories, and make the data accessible to a non-expert audience.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. job_title: Business Analyst, Campaign Orchestration -Assistant Vice Pre...
CIMD - Marcus by Goldman Sachs - Channel Partner Management...
desc:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB
CONSUMER (MARCUS BY GOLDMAN SACHS)
Marcus by Goldman Sachs is the firm’s consumer business, combining the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup with 150 years of experience. Today, Marcus has $50 billion in deposits, $5 billion in loan balances and 4 million customers across our lending and deposits businesses, as well as the personal financial management app, Clarity Money. Through the use of insights and intuitive design, we provide customers with powerful tools and products that are grounded in value, transparency and simplicity. We are backed by our unique team, comprised of individual contributors from leading agile technology companies, fintechs and consumer financial services companies, allowing us to disrupt the industry, while helping consumers take control of their financial lives.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS
YOUR IMPACT

We are looking for a detail-oriented new member to join the Marcus team. You will play a key role in supporting distribution channel management. You will analyze data related to various distribution channels to help track performance trends, assess profitability and identify improvement levers. You will be responsible for managing ongoing reporting and communication with key business stakeholders.

HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL

Key responsibilities will include:
Conduct on-going and ad-hoc reporting and analytics to assess channel performance
Manage marketing initiatives with the distribution channels including testing of new marketing language or placement options on third party sites
Liaise with credit team to drive pricing strategy by analyzing take rates
Assess the funnel performance and identify any improvements in experience or onboarding process to enhance the conversation rate
Support team leadership with day-to-day distribution channel management including key customer dispute handling
QUALIFICATIONS

Characteristics of a successful candidate include but are not limited to:
Bachelor’s degree
1-4 years of relevant work experience
Strong proficiency with PowerPoint, Excel and other tools to support quantitative analysis & written presentations
SQL knowledge (required)
Understanding of digital finance or consumer and small business lending preferred
Demonstrated ability to multi-task across multiple projects simultaneously in an organized manner
CONSUMER AND INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT DIVISION (CIMD)
The Consumer and Investment Management Division includes Goldman Sachs Asset Management (GSAM), Private Wealth Management (PWM) and our Consumer business (Marcus by Goldman Sachs). We provide asset management, wealth management and banking expertise to consumers and institutions around the world. CIMD partners with various teams across the firm to help individuals and institutions navigate changing markets and take control of their financial lives.
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.

job_title: Business Analyst – Chief of Staff Office
desc:
Global Analytics & Information Management (AIM) provides central capabilities globally across Citi’s Global Consumer Bank P&Ls, which includes Credit Cards, Retail Bank, Retail Services and Mortgage to stand up enterprise level analytics capabilities and platforms. This central organization is focused on driving programs to deliver an Omni-channel and customer focused marketing and service experience across Citi relationships for our clients. This group has a transformational mandate.
Role Purpose:
The role’s purpose is to provide analytical and administrative support to the Chief of Staff for Global Analytics & Information Management. This person will allow for business continuity and domain understanding of high priority analytic initiatives utilized at the CEO level for the Global Consumer Bank. Applies an in-depth disciplinary knowledge, contributing to the development of analytic strategies and improvement of processes and work-flow for GCB.
Responsibilities:
Support the Chief of Staff on day to day strategic activities
Provide insights and content creation, assembly and structure assistance for executive deck building utilized at the CEO level on a very consistent basis
Own AIM-wide communications and meeting/agenda development (e.g. Town Halls, monthly newsletter)
Act as a creative thinker to the organization and propose new ways to look at processes
Own Employee Engagement Committee and strategize in partnership with HR on VOE-impacting initiatives
Project management and cross-function coordination with directors and above for support of business priorities, ensuring execution, and metric tracking – including the monthly report out of Executive Scorecard
Provide support in the form of ad hoc stretch assignments, such as mid-year forecasting and planning
Play a large role in building and owning analytic development and campus recruiting program
Foster and maintain relationships with business stakeholders
Data and information gathering to present a meaningful story and obtain stakeholder buy-in based on that content
Knowledge / Experience / Technical Skills:
Education: Bachelors or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or Business or equivalent
5-7 years of relevant experience
Should have demonstrated ability and proof points in executive deck building
Knowledge of analytics such as data platforms, query, governance, and deployment life cycle
Understanding of how internal and external technology providers, as well as deployment solutions platform providers, can work with advanced analytical groups in Risk and Modeling is a plus, but not required
Strong business acumen, executive presence, and analytic ability to identify business trends and opportunities
Personal Skilled:
People engagement skills, thought-leadership, change management, and stakeholder influence and buy-in skills
Excellent written and communication skills to report back finding in a structured, clear, simple way.
Energized by asking “what if”, “why not”, and “what would happen to us if” questions; e.g. how will this will affect the business, industry, or market.
Able to connect seemingly unrelated questions, problems, or ideas from different industries or fields to deliberately assemble new perspectives or realign those of others and the organization.
Ability to communicate analytic results to non-technical partners.
Able to be independent and a self-starter, comfortable in a fast-paced matrixed environment.
Strong execution skills and results oriented approach.
Act with curiosity and takes the initiative to identify problems, offer creative solutions and resolve issues.

Clearing, Markets & Issuer Services Technology (CMIST) is responsible for application development and support for more than 350 critical business systems including Repo Edge (collateral management), Enterprise Payment Hub (multi-currency payment processing), and Broker Dealer Clearance (securities clearing).
Clearance and Collateral Technology (CCT) within CMIST builds high-performance and resilient clearance and collateral management platforms to service BNY Mellon’s broker-dealer clients and is the sole provider for Government Securities Clearing Services. The group is currently focused on Repo Modernization, which will pave the way to the Future of Collateral for the business – providing strengthened platform resiliency and new trade capabilities within a unified system. All CCT applications are built for real-time operations aided by a data warehouse for reporting and business insights.

CCT team is looking to augment the team with a strong IT Business Analyst who can analyze and document the both functional & non-functional requirements in a highly complex program and create relevant artifacts like use cases diagrams, Business flow diagram, use case Scenarios, Sample Wireframe specific to user interface etc. Breaks down the program to independent modules with each work stream. Converts the business/functional requirements into use case and works closely with development team. Is accountable for overall functional delivery of their assigned functional work stream. Provides guidance in development of the technical design, test plans, and user documentation. Facilitates Knowledge Transfer sessions on a periodic basis to the team. Act as a technology product owner for the corresponding program/Product/Scrum team.
 Role/Responsibilities:
Document functional & non-functional requirements, perform gap analysis, design systems flows, and manage UAT activities leading to production release.
Develop business case and work closely with stakeholders to determine acceptable solutions.
Perform Gap Analysis and come up with solutions for attaining the target state
Create Use Case and User Stories
Participate in researching production issue and remediation
Perform User Acceptance Testing
Perform data analysis and provide reports to business/senior management on the need basis


Specialist Business Analysis Consultant->> Analyzes, defines and prioritizes the business requirements, functional specifications and operational architecture for up to and including highly complex strategic, global programs. Provides consultation to IT and business management on applying technology to business opportunities and planning and implementing cross-functional applications or systems. May allocate/coordinate work within a team/project. Elicits, challenges, and prioritizes requirements using standard processes and templates, and translates into functional design and use case documents. Develops project scope, objectives, constraints and assumptions for a given large, strategic, multi-year project. Participates and provides guidance in development of the technical design, test plans, and user documentation. Consults internal business groups on requirements, functional architecture and implementation. Tracks scope and change throughout the remainder of the initiative utilizing formal requirements management principles, including change control and requirements traceability. Gathers and analyzes information to assist in development of recommendations to address strategic business objectives that span multiple, global business and technology areas. Participates in industry forums and keeps current on domain knowledge for their specific business and application areas of expertise. Applies experiences with existing software and/or systems development processes to develop better processes to be used in the future. Actively influences software development process improvement initiatives. Provides senior level consultation to internal business groups on process improvement projects designed to improve their business results. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in business or technical-related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred
6-8 years of experience in providing consulting advice to senior IT and business management required
3 to 5 years of recent relevant IT Business Analyst experience in Financial industry
Strong understanding of capital markets; experience in clearance space is desired
Excellent Analytical/Problem solving skills
Experience in Agile/Scrum
Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.
Ability to work independently and with others
Good communication/collaboration skills
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst, Business Development Team
desc:
JOB DESCRIPTION
Job Description
TEGNA is a $2B local broadcaster with properties covering almost 40% of the country. The Premion division is a leading local OTT advertising and data business which aggregates OTT inventory, provides advanced digital targeting, and sells national and local advertisers who seek to run local campaigns in any DMA across the country.
Premion’s Business Development team manages the company’s critical partnerships with national networks (e.g. Fox), vMVPDs (e.g. Sling), new media startups (e.g. TubiTV and Newsy), and technology vendors (e.g. Freewheel, Madhive). Today, the team works with these partners to accomplish a variety of functions. Beyond that, the team provides strategic product and industry guidance on how to expand Premion’s product and extend its market advantages.
The Business Analyst on the Business Development team will be responsible for culling data from a variety of sources, analyzing it, and presenting insights in a succinct manner. He/she should be a self-starter with an analytical eye, who can articulate complex business ideas into digestible nuggets. While experience in the media sphere is preferred, an innate curiosity for today’s shifting media landscape is essential. He/she should enjoy pondering big ideas like “What’s the next big development in the evolution of OTT advertising?” He/she will collaborate on projects with Premion’s President and Head of Business Development, but independent investigation will also be encouraged. Finally, this person will be tasked with constructing presentations that encapsulate industry perspective and the decisions of the Premion leadership team.
This position reports to the Head of Business Development.,JOB REQUIREMENTS
Responsibilities
Become the Company’s Intellectual and Research Repository
Collaborate on Partner Business Reviews
Develop Premion Business Strategy and Update Reviews
Steward Data Collection and Automation for Key Business Metrics
Conduct Ad Hoc Analysis and Modeling for Senior Leadership
Construct Other Presentations with Original Data-Driven Insights
Qualifications
2+ Years of Experience as a Business Consultant or Business Analyst
Four-Year Degree from a Competitive Undergraduate University
Experience in Data Base Technologies like SQL Server and Oracle
Experience in BI / Data Visualization technologies like Microsoft Power BI and Tableau
Mastery of PowerPoint and Excel
Strong Problem-Solving Skills
Comfortable Communicating and Presenting to Senior Leadership

Overview
Engine is a global marketing solutions company. With 15 offices across the globe, and over 1,500 employees, we combine the industry’s best creative, media, insights, and technology people to build marketing solutions that are transforming today’s biggest brands and culture.

At Engine, we’ve rewritten the marketing playbook. We tore down the siloes of a traditional agency to create a more fluid, integrated environment for clients to interact with. Across the world, we push creative and media boundaries. We use innovative tech and data to help our award-winning roster of clients stand out, better connect with their audiences, and future-proof their business.

Cultural transformation is only possible with incredible employees who prompt it. That’s why, at Engine, we encourage a work culture of freedom, responsibility, and a well-balanced life. Our unlimited time off policy, combined with a comprehensive health/wellness benefits package and modern parental leave policy, are just some of the many ways we choose to value our employees, striving to match the same energy, respect, and dedication that they put into their time at Engine.
Responsibilities
Engine US has an exciting opportunity for a curious mind to join their New York or Minneapolis Business Research team as a Manager, Research Analyst with a particular focus on secondary research. The analyst will work in a dynamic, fast-paced team to solve business problems for Engine’s clients

Our clients operate in a variety of markets but some of our most common verticals include:

Private Equity
Education
Advertising & Professional Services
Consumer
Healthcare
Financial Services

Using secondary research as the foundation of our deliverables, we often work with our clients to address their business challenges by providing insight on the following:
Market sizing / Market share
Market / Company profiling
Audience demographics
Competitive and strategic intelligence
Trend / Innovation monitoring
Omnibus analysis and delivery
Social analytics
Expert industry analysis
Industry best practices
Qualifications
QUALIFICATIONS:
Proficient secondary research skills including experience with secondary and qualitative research techniques in databases like Factiva, Nexis, Thomson Reuters, etc.
Ability to organize, prioritize and handle multiple short term and longer-term research projects without compromising quality or missing deadlines.
Expert in the use of MS PPT and Word for report preparation and visual storytelling.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills - connecting research to real world business challenges.
Strong communication skills (written and verbal).
Ability to make independent choices regarding matters of significance to business operations.
Works well independently and as part of a closely-knit team.
Experience, interest, and potential to interface and partner directly with clients.
Professional, disciplined self-starter that takes initiative to solve problems.
Experience with interviewing and / or social media analysis is a plus.
Possess a general interest and curiosity to learn and experience something new every day.
EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, AND CERTIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent is required.
2 to 3 years of relevant experience is required.

Job Description :
The Advanced Retail Data Analytics Manager, EDGE TRAX Product Owner is a key leader in Diageo’s Advanced Analytics transformation with responsibility for expanding our cutting-edge TRAX/EDGE program (AIl image recognition, prescriptive analytics). This program creates visibility and drives opportunity into independent liquor retailer and restaurant partners to identify, quantify and drive significant sales improvements. This leader is responsible for managing our EDGE standards and how they are implemented through our TRAX tool.
This is a high-impact role with significant visibility across Diageo, including within our Global organization. We are looking for the right leader to deliver results now with room to grow.
Key responsibilities include:
Managing Standard Setting Process from both Advanced Analytics and Commercial perspective
Project management for TRAX product enhancements
Analyzing results to endure that we have the most effective standards
Working across the entire EDGE ecosystem including other parts of the EDGE product (EDGE 365, PowerBI), our Global Diageo Business Services partners and our business units

job_title: Tapia Data Science, Data Analytics, Technical Business Analy...
desc:
For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments & safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart.
We are delivering an integrated set of solutions for highly complex financial issues. Our expertise and infrastructure make us critical to the evolving global markets. Strength, stability, and safety are at our core. We are investing wisely for the future to bolster growth, improve returns and deepen client relationships. We always strive to provide a consistent high-quality experience and aim to deliver consistent performance for every client, every time, every day.


The Role
As a Technical Business Analyst/Lead Data Analyst, you will designs and create highly complex logical/physical data models, and data dictionaries that cater to the specific business and functional requirements of applications. You will consult with businesses to identify needs and translates those needs into data architecture solutions. You will develop comprehensive data/technical specifications that bridge business/product needs with system design/deliverables. You’ll perform data extracts and create complex data reports to analyze user metrics

Key responsibilities include:
Under moderate guidance, works with internal and external datasets and client reference data and provides analysis.
Provides analytical support and prepares drafts of standard and ad hoc reports for assigned area at the request of managers and/or other leaders.
Presents complex data in a concise and meaningful manner leveraging Excel, BI tools, SQL, data integrity tools, and data presentation tools.

Lead Data Analyst->> Analyzes application requirements and develops conceptual, logical and first-cut physical database designs (data models). Creates associated data model documentation such as entity and attribute definitions and formats. Assists in logical data designs to deliver stable and flexible high performance data solutions. Investigates and corrects data discrepancies by reconciling faulty codes. Provides data element naming consistent with standards and conventions and ensures that data dictionaries are maintained across multiple database environments (mainframe, distributed systems). Ensures data content/quality by planning and conducting moderately complex data warehouse system tests, monitoring test results and taking required corrective action. Acts as a liaison to data owners to establish necessary data stewardship responsibilities (accountability for a particular data element/verifying accuracy of the data element before loading it into the database) and procedures. Analyzes and designs data models, logical databases and relational database definitions using both forward and backward engineering techniques. Seeks opportunities to promote data sharing, and to reduce redundant data processes within the corporation by identifying common structures across application areas. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required.
Four to six (4-6) years of experience in data modeling, data warehousing, data entity analysis, logical and relational database design, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience is required.
Data Analysis skills.
Strong Excel skills (including Pivot Tables).
Experience with one of more Data Analysis / BI tools.
Experience with a programming / scripting language.
Candidate will ideally have experience in one or more of the following:
Excel Macros
‘Data’ languages such as Python, R, etc.
BI tools such as Tableau, QlikView, Power BI
SQL
Data Governance tools such as Collibra
AI / Machine Learning tools / techniques such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forecasts, etc.
Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, NumPy, MatLab, etc.
Applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.

Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.
