job_title: CIB data+design - Sr. Data Visualization & Interaction Speci...
desc:
J.P. Morgan offers a broad range of financial services. Whether we’re creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, we are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems and working together to empower people, small businesses, corporations and governments in more than 100 countries. This role is in the wholesale payments business which includes treasury services, merchant acquiring, commercial card and trade finance, together driving $11bn in yearly revenue and processing $6 trillion in payments daily.
The data and design (d+d) team in JP Morgan is a rapidly growing team responsible for transforming the way we and our clients do business - balancing the art of decision making with science. We are data scientists and engineers, design strategists and product managers. We model our payment network which represents 20% of global US$ flow, to derive insights and create new revenue generating data products. We work with our clients as well as our product, sales, service and operations teams.
We need influencers who can support our clients and internal teams with insights surfaced from our data. If you like breaking down needs in creative ways, uncovering analytical insights and visualizing them in powerful ways then the data+design team would like to speak with you. We are looking for a Sr. Data Visualization and Interaction Specialist who can leverage data, design and modern front-end technologies to help users change the way they make decisions.

What you’ll do:
Design and develop (in partnership with engineers, data scientists and product managers) interactive products that combine the power of human expertise and data science
Conduct user research (including developing hypotheses), identify user needs, distill findings into data visualization solutions
Develop high level and/or detailed storyboards, mockups, and prototypes
Quantitative background (BA/BS in Math, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Physics) with extensive experience in design and visualization,
alternatively BA/BS in a Design (interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial) or HCI with an extensive experience of working with data and analytical problems
Masters/PhD preferred
5+ years of hands-on experience in a data visualization role
Experience using analytics tools and libraries for interactive data visualizations in browsers (Plotly and D3.js strongly preferred)
Strong portfolio of data visualization-focused projects for web and mobile applications
Who you are:
Hybrid at your core - You combine deep data insight with storytelling and visualization skills marrying that with a user experience background. This is an incredible opportunity for hybrid thinkers that love to learn and synthesize in a high-performing culture.
Quantitative by nature - Demonstrated ability to conduct complex substantive analysis on large data sets to transform them into simple visuals and dashboards for analytical and non-analytical audiences.
Influence and communication mastery - Ability to communicate with high level stakeholders. Highly articulate, built upon an underlying fundamental clarity of thought. Outstanding presentation skills, including presenting technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Cognitive Skill - Ability to root out fundamental issues, bring order from chaos, synthesize elegant conceptual frameworks, and drive to clear decisions. Superb at problem structuring, integrating thinking, problem solving towards practical business insight
Aesthetic sense – excellent taste, ability to critically reflect on the quality of design work and explain design decisions. Relentless desire to balance functionality and beauty

job_title: Head of DataOps (Sr Director), Data & Analytics
desc:
Marketing Statement

Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible
NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

Job Description

Responsible for developing and executing a data operations (DataOps) strategy to ensure quality data and analytic deployments and service delviery health and performance. Optimizes relationships between the gather, prepare analyze and present teams. Promotes communication, integration, and collaboration for enhanced data resource productivity. Develops infrastructure to incorporate latest technology best practices and improve operational performance. Requires broad technical knowledge and experience across a variety of data and analytic areas, including information management, ETL, data warehouses and lakes, data analytics methods and technologies and quality assurance.
Analyzes, reviews and measures service level performance against agreed upon service level agreements (SLAs). Establishes, implements, and enforces standards, procedures, and service levels to ensure that Operational Level Agreements (OLAs) with both internal and external service providers are met. Works with the business and service providers to define the proper metrics and KPIs in evaluating service delivery quality and performance levels. Evaluates and defines strategies for improving processes and procedures. Develops and implements changes and improvements.
A Senior Manager (M4) typically manages a department or small unit that includes multiple teams led by Managers and/or Team Leaders.
Responsibilities typically include:
Ownership of short to mid-term (1-3 years) execution of functional strategy and the operational direction of the Department.
Problems faced are often complex and require extensive investigation and analysis.
Requires ability to influence others to accept practices and approaches, and ability to communicate and influence executive leadership.
Policy and strategy implementation for short-term results (1 year or less).
Problems faced are difficult to moderately complex.
Influences others outside of own job area regarding policies, practices and procedures.
IT Process Quality work is focused on planning and implementing a framework to ensure error-free data delvery (i.e., software, and data) including:
Planning and implementing programs to ensure all data systems products and services meet minimum organization standards and end-user requirements
Devising improvements to current processes and procedures, developing models of possible future configurations
Administering problem management process, including monitoring and reporting on problem resolution
Devising improvements to current procedures. Performing work-flow analysis and recommending quality improvements
Problems faced are often complex and require extensive investigation and analysis.
Requires ability to influence others to accept practices and approaches, and ability to communicate and influence executive leadership.
Minimum Qualifications

1. A Master's Degree from an accredited college or university in Hospital Administration, Health Care Planning, Business Administration, Public Administration or an approved related program and seven years of progressively responsible experience in health and medical service administration, public administration, personnel and labor relations, finance or appropriate functional discipline with an emphasis on planning, liaison and interorganizational relationships, or related administrative or managerial functions; or,
2. A Baccalaureate Degree from an accredited college or university and eight years of progressively responsible experience in health and medical service administration, public administration, personnel and labor relations, finance or appropriate functional discipline with an emphasis on planning, liaison and interorganizational relationships, or related administrative or managerial functions; or,
3. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

How To Apply

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.
If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.

Company Description
Natixis is a French multinational financial services firm specialized in asset & wealth management, corporate & investment banking, insurance and payments. A subsidiary of Groupe BPCE, the second-largest banking group in France through its two retail banking networks, Banque Populaire and Caisse d'Epargne, Natixis counts nearly 16,000 employees across 38 countries. Its clients include corporations, financial institutions, sovereign and supranational organizations, as well as the customers of Groupe BPCE's networks. Listed on the Paris stock exchange, Natixis has a solid financial base with a CET1 capital under Basel 3(1) of €11.1 billion, a Basel 3 CET1 Ratio(1) of 10.6% and quality long-term ratings (Standard & Poor's: A+ / Moody's: A1 / Fitch Ratings: A+).
(1) Based on CRR-CRD4 rules as reported on June 26, 2013, including the Danish compromise - without phase-in.
Figures as at 31 March 2019

Job Description
The Axiom Business Analyst is responsible developing, modifying and/or maintaining the Axiom application environment. Code, test, debug, document programs as well as maintain of Axiom systems architecture. Work closely with business partners in defining requirement.
Work closely with key stakeholders to deliver technology changes driven by our regulatory agencies.
Proactive planning and execution of key release and production operation processes required for smooth platform operations.
Partner with key business partners to formulate a consistent, repeatable process for manage change to our platform.
Accountable for clean platform release packaging and assembling of key technical artifacts required for smooth platform operations post release.
Manage and Lead agile process while adhering to key timelines and quality control.
Own accountability for managing and analyzing issues/risks, developing alternative approaches/mitigation plans and facilitating implementation or removal of roadblocks across partners and ensure change and project compliance with all enterprise standards.

Required Skills/Qualifications/Experience
Bachelor’s degree in accounting, system engineering or related field from an accredited college/university.
10+ years of relevant experience.
Proficient knowledge of US regulatory reporting requirements, external reporting control concepts, and financial services related products.
Proficient with Axiom SL.
Advanced Microsoft Excel.
Excellent technical project management skills, including the ability to prioritize and understand technical work and meet deadlines for multiple technology projects.
Ability to manage complex project(s) simultaneously in a fast-paced, matrixed environment with strong attention to detail and accuracy and a record of successful delivery of complex change.
Strong business-centric mind-set with ability to utilize sound business judgment and tailor approach to drive optimal business outcomes.
Strong problem-solving skills, excellent analytical and presentation skills; ability to synthesize complex data into actionable presentations / reports and communicate technical concepts to non-technical clients.
More than 7 years’ experience in the financial services industry in technical team management positions and in the Regulatory Reporting domain in particular.
Proven planning & monitoring skills with the ability to co-ordinate resources / tasks over multiple projects or tasks.
Strong customer focus with the ability to breakdown established barriers and suggest innovative change to help improve processes and systems.
An ability to think on your feet and to turn ideas and thoughts into decisions and actions
Drive and a proven ability to meet deadlines while dealing with changing and competing priorities.
Resilience, with the ability to cope with difficult situations and to handle and resolve issues to the benefit of all stakeholders.
Flexibility, with a positive approach to change.
In-depth knowledge of development tools and languages. In-depth global markets product knowledge and manage a high level of risk.

job_title: Technical Support Analyst Optimus Health Analytics
desc:
Job Description
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer or Information Science, or Information Technology.

Will analyze data processing problems to implement and improve computer systems, as well as analyze user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate or improve existing systems and review computer system capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitations, among other duties. job_title: Epic Clinical Business Analyst Level 2, EMR/Clinical Informa...
desc:
Marketing Statement

Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible
NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

Job Description

Under varying levels of direction and expertise, is responsible for the on-going assessment, design, and development and implementation of corporate –wide clinical systems. Specifically, collect and transform large quantities of information into meaningful business requirements; develop and modify requirements documentation for the design and implementation of clinical information systems; critically evaluate information from various sources, distinguish user needs from actual business needs and partner with business users, project managers, programmers, consultants and IT leadership in optimizing the scope, benefits and risks of actual and proposed projects as well as assist in managing stakeholder expectations.
We are looking to fill positions in the following Epic modules: Inpatient Clinical Documentation, Stork OB, Inpatient Orders, Infection Control, Long Term Care/ Rehabilitation, Beacon Oncology, OpTime Peri-Operative, Anesthesia, Radiant Radiology, Cupid Cardiology, Laboratory, Willow Pharmacy, ASAP Emergency Department, Care Management and EpicCare Ambulatory, MyChart, EpicCare Link, Kaleidoscope Ophthalmology, HOD, and HomeHealth.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Analyze and document business requirements and processes; communicate requirements to technical personnel through the construction of basic conceptual data, process models and flowcharts, and technical specifications.
Interview end users, stakeholders, and project sponsors in order to assess business and clinical needs; create business, functional and technical requirements documents based on captured data and in accordance with departmental protocol/standards.
Convert information gathered into details including data sources, data and user types, interface components, interface navigation needs, reporting needs, and administrative system needs.
Define external interfaces, constraints, quality issues and other non-functional requirements.
Provide project management team with identified risks, concerns, and ambiguities discovered during the gathering of requirements; assist team in developing solutions.
Partner with project managers to complete requirements documentation in accordance with project schedule.
Plan, organize, facilitate, and lead meetings and workgroups as well as oversee and execute follow-up activities.
Ensure software development team accounts for all defined requirements in coordination with quality assurance team. Ensure that all quality standards comply with internal policies and industry standards.
Document changes to baseline requirements through standard change control process. Document software test plans, technical requirements, release notes, user and training guidelines and other materials.
Plan, coordinate, and support unit acceptance testing and subsequent deployments in coordination with other team leaders.
Perform end user and application support functions including problem solving and resolution of application function defects. Provide systems and application training.
Develop and execute project presentations.
Participate in special projects as required.
Provide training to and serve as a mentor for Junior Clinical Business Analysts and/or other appropriate project team members; manage and evaluate work products for assigned team members.
Participate in the development of various departmental training initiatives.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and provide analysis and propose change and communicate strategies.
Provide supervision and guidance to junior clinical business analysts, clinical business analysts assigned at Level I, consultants, and/or other appropriate project team members.
Interview Junior Clinical Business Analysts, Clinical Business Analysts assigned at Level I, consultants, and/or other appropriate project team members.
Due to the responsibilities of your position, you will be required to work beyond your regularly scheduled hours.
Minimum Qualifications

1. A Masters degree or advanced clinical degree from an accredited college or university and one (1) year of experience gathering and documenting business, clinical, and/or functional requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis or related in a clinical, allied health, non-allied health, behavioral health, information technology, information services, business, analytics or related area; or, one (1) year of experience in a relevant clinical and/or healthcare administration role/function; or
2. A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university and three (3) years of experience as described above; or
3. A satisfactory combination of education, training, and experience.
4. Specialty certification(s) issued by a national commercially available program, state, professional society, academic or technical institution in an area(s) listed above, may be credited on a month-to-month basis toward the required work experience for a total of one (1) year.

Department Preferences

Clinical background
1-3 years experience with Epic EMR and/or other clinical or business applications
Epic Certification
We are willing to train the selected candidate. Epic Certification is required within the first 6 months of appointment to continue employment.
How To Apply

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button or mail your resume, noting the above Job ID #, to:
NYC Health + Hospitals
Talent AcquisitionHuman Resources Department
55 Water Street, 26th Floor
New York, NY 10041
Attn: Talent Acquisition
If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.

If you’re a smartphone user then you are part of an ever more connected and digital world. At Amdocs, we are leading the digital revolution into the future. From virtualized telecommunications networks, Big Data and Internet of Things to mobile financial services, billing and operational support systems, we are continually evolving our business to help you become more connected. We make sure that when you watch a video on YouTube, message friends on SnapChat or send your images on Instagram, you get a great service anytime, anywhere, and on any device. We are at the heart of the telecommunications industry working with giants such as AT&T, Vodafone, Telstra and Telefonica, helping them create an amazing new world for you where technology is being used in amazing new ways every single day.
In one sentence
Understands business needs. Assesses the impact of those needs, capturing, analyzing and documenting requirements and providing high level solutions that leverage product capabilities and best practices in order to produce an optimal solution. Communicates and implements recommended solutions.
What will your job look like?
You will have the opportunity to reflect customer needs by gathering business documents and technical requirements.
You will be a key advisor for customers based on product capabilities and best practices, leveraging reuse where applicable and ensuring high business value
You will design holistic and integrated high-level solutions that fit customers' business needs, production operability and budget.
In some cases, would lead a solution domain, managing (matrix) relevant domain experts.
In some cases, would be responsible to estimate customization of system requirements.
In some cases, would sustain Team Lead responsibilities, providing professional leadership of the team, skills development, assuring productivity and effectiveness of his/ her team and ongoing monitoring of team's performance.
You will participate in and/or leads formal and informal reviews with stakeholders, applying knowledge and experience and providing technical perspective and support.
You will be responsible for communicating the solution with customers' business and IT personnel. Will be expected to explain the new details of new solutions and their impact on business processes.
You will ensure that the customer understands the solution and receive responses to all open questions and action items.
You will support the customer during the scoping phase in a specific domain up through and including customer sign off (for example, COP process for various customer types and products, EPC lead for all product models and designs, etc.)
You will prepare solution-related documents and specifications. Configures the solution, and creates, executes and maintains accurate and detailed test plans for testing when applicable.
You will support the resolution of configuration/ implementation related issues if and when they arise.
You will identify product gaps and recommend enhancements to the product core team
All you need is...
10 years of experience in telecom industry and/or IT
5 years practical experience in business / system analysis, working with customer on requirement and business processes definition, in a variety of complex situations, preferably in cable industry and/or IT
Must have deep expertise and understanding of the Software development lifecycle. Prefer Java environment or could be .NET.
Experience in working in and/or leading a team of cross domain solutions
Proven ability to present solution using various methods (presentations, demos, etc.)
Why you will love this job:
You will be able to use your superior business analyst skills to make a significant impact on high-level solutions that best produces the optimal product solution.
You will be a key member of a global, dynamic and highly collaborative team with various possibilities for personal and professional development
You will have the opportunity to work in multinational environment for the global market leader in its field

JPMorgan Chase & Co. is a leading global financial services firm with assets of more than $2.9 trillion, over 240,000 employees and operations in over 60 countries. It operates across four business segments including Asset & Wealth Management, Corporate and Investment Banking, Commercial Banking and Consumer and Community Banking.

J.P. Morgan Asset & Wealth Management, is a global leader in investment and wealth management. Its clients include institutions, high-net-worth individuals and retail investors in every major market throughout the world. The division offers investment management across all major asset classes including equities, fixed income, alternatives, multi-asset and money market funds. For individual investors, the business also provides retirement products and services, brokerage and banking services including trusts and estates, loans, mortgages and deposits.

Asset Management:
Asset Management is a leading investment manager of choice for institutions, financial intermediaries and individual investors, worldwide. With a heritage of more than two centuries, a broad range of core and alternative strategies, and investment professionals operating in every major world market, we offer investment experience and insight that few other firms can match.

The Team:
The mission of the Business Intelligence (“BI”) team is to apply creativity, rigor, and data-driven thinking to help plan and execute the business growth of J.P. Morgan Asset Management. Our work is a blend of strategy, technology, data analysis, and execution with a key focus on defining data-driven distribution strategies for J.P. Morgan Asset Management.

In this role, you will make important contributions across a diverse array of projects and will be expected to develop a broad skill-set in business strategy, marketing, data science and technology. The role will require in-depth data manipulation, exploration and structuring as well as strategic vision and execution with management. We are a highly collaborative team - so you will have significant potential for learning and impact.

Fostering a data-driven, innovative culture

The ability to write basic code or conduct basic data science analyses (eg. SQL, Python)
Strong proficiency with Excel and all other Microsoft Office applications
Strong communication/interpersonal skills
A passion for technology, financial services and asset management
A willingness to approach problems from first principles, with the support of rigorous quantitative and qualitative analyses
A balanced approach combining judgment, analytical rigor, curiosity, open-mindedness and creativity

Our core values, Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed, guide us as we make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do.

Excellent verbal and written communication with the ability to present complex design concepts into clear and concise requirements

Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.

job_title: Business Analyst - Average Daily Balance Sheet (ADBS) Progra...
desc:
New York City
The Business Analyst would act as the point person between the finance change team, project stakeholders and the application development team(s) during all phases of the program management life cycle: initiation phase, requirement phase, design and build phase, testing phase, and implementation phase.
The Business Analyst would be responsible for collecting and documenting business requirements and for performing a gap analysis between current state and future state requirements as well as identifying and assessing change needs. The Business Analyst captures and documents requirements, analyzes the impact of changes and supports the business throughout the implementation process.

The Business Analyst would also assist in the implementation phase by ensuring the delivery of training documents, operating procedures, and Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
Primary Responsibilities:
Responsible for gathering and documenting business requirements in partnership and collaboration with project/program stakeholders (i.e. SMEs, End Users, Sponsors.)
Responsible for performing current state v. future state gap analysis and effectively documenting data/system flows for both processes.
Create and deliver relevant project artefacts supporting the end deliverable. This include but not limited to: Project Initiation Document (PID/Project Charter), Business Requirements Document (BRD), Functional Specification Document (FSD), Traceability Matrix (Problem/ Regulations, BRD, FSD, Test Case), Testing Strategy, User Acceptance Testing - Test Cases.
Responsible for conducting walkthroughs, demos in person or virtually with the stakeholders to obtain approvals and sign-offs of all project artefacts.
Perform data analysis and reconciliation to support business case/requirements as required.
Raises risks, issues, assumptions and key dependencies to Lead Business Analyst and/or Project Manager.
Supports and coordinates UAT, defining testing requirements, drafting test cases and setting up testing tools/systems together with the QA and Testing Team as well as the clients.
Coordinates with the Finance Change team in drafting of Key Operating Procedures ("KOP") for the new business processes prior to implementation.
Liaises with program / project managers, clients, functional analysts and developers to ensure solution design and implementation is aligned with the business requirements.
Coordinates the drafting of Service Level Agreement and Technical Training Documentation with the IGT solution provider team.
Required Skills:
10+ years of relevant experience including experience as Business Analyst working on projects/programs for the Regulatory Reporting team within Finance/Accounting division of a large financial institution.
Finance/Accounting/Regulatory Experience:

Detailed knowledge of regulatory reporting requirements mainly for Bank Holding Company (FRY-9C, Call Report, FRY-9LP, TIC Reports, etc...) in terms of report description, detailed schedules, and data attribute requirements, frequency, etc.
Experience with USGAAP/IFRS consolidated and standalone financial regulatory reporting requirements (Trial Balance, Balance Sheet, Income Statement, Cash Flow, etc...).
Exposure to financial consolidation processes and concepts is needed: Equity Method, Purchase method, inter/intra-company elimination, Equity Pick-Up, Minority Interest, COI Posting method, Elimination of Cost Investments.
Understanding of Dodd-Frank Enhanced Prudential Standards (section 165), CCAR, and Basel III is required to manage interdependencies of the ADBS program vs. CCAR & Basel III program.
Experiences across a range of financial products (Fixed Income, Equity, Derivatives, etc...)
Systems:
Exposure to Accounting General Ledger Systems like PeopleSoft General Ledger or SAP General Ledger and exposure to consolidation modules of these systems or other consolidation systems.
Exposure to Reporting tools like Business Objects, Qlikview, Cognos, and/or MicroStrategy.
Exposure to Regulatory Reporting Tools like AxiomSL would be a great plus.
Business Analyst Skills :
Experience writing Current State Analysis Document, Current to Future State Gap Analysis Document, Business Requirement Document and in participating in the drafting of Functional Specification Document is required.
Knowledge of the SDLC/PMLC methodology, processes, and best practices is critical.
Experience working in decentralized global projects with virtual teams within matrix organization.
Experience drafting Test Strategy Document, Test Cases, and Test Plan is necessary.
Systems:
Exposure to Change, Testing & Quality Management systems like HP Quality Center, ALM, JIRA and Business Process Mapping tools like Visio or Sparx is needed.
Experience in Business Analysis and Banking/ Financial Services Technology delivery
Communication Skills:
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
Excellent soft skills and demonstrated team player attitude.
Ability to chair working group and stakeholder meetings.
Education/Certification:

Degree from an accredited college or university with a concentration in Business, Economics and/ or Computer Science (or equivalent Business Analysis certification and/or relevant work experience).
Certifications like CPA, CFA, and Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) are a plus.

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started. Facebook is seeking a Data Science Intern to join our Data Science team. Individuals in this role are expected to be comfortable working as a software engineer and a quantitative researcher. The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in the study of an online social network, and a passion for identifying and answering questions that help us build the best products.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Work closely with a product engineering team to identify and answer important product questions
Answer product questions by using appropriate statistical techniques on available data
Communicate findings to product managers and engineers
Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources
Analyze and interpret the results of product experiments
Develop best practices for instrumentation and experimentation and communicate those to product engineering teams
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a PhD degree in CS or related technical field
Extensive experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches
Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources
A strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data
A flexible analytic approach that allows for results at varying levels of precision
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner
Fluency with at least one scripting language such as Python or PHP
Familiarity with relational databases and SQL
Expert knowledge of an analysis tool such as R, Matlab, or SAS
Experience working with large data sets, experience working with distributed computing tools a plus (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, etc.)
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Must be currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship/co-op
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Intent to return to full-time degree program after completion of the internship

desc:
Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence, Publicis Health Media - New York(Job Number: PHM001089)
Primary Location-United States-New York-New York
Description

The Sr. Analyst of Business Intelligence (hereafter “BI”) will apply their experience in data analysis to support the BI Associate Director and/or BI Senior Leadership on any of our myriad of enterprise clients within the health and wellness industry. The Sr. Analyst must have the ability to utilize the many data sources at the disposal of the BI team to not only measure the media/marketing campaigns in the marketplace, but also translate those learnings into realistic business implications for our clients.

While every engagement is unique, typical engagements require execution against the following tasks and deliverables:
As we execute on the behalf of the client, manage and ensure the accuracy of the many internal data sources and (where applicable) third-party vendors/data streams that comprise our custom measurement platform while keeping workstreams on task

within the established timelines and delivery dates
Synthesize the data available into insights/recommendations about the success of our programs in transforming the behavior of our target audience (most likely healthcare professionals, patients/prospects, or a combination of the two)
Work with the BI Associate Director and/or BI Senior Leadership to utilize the aforementioned insights/recommendations as the foundation for presentations, reports, and assorted client deliverables
Maintain professional relationships with internal (PHM) stakeholders by communicating effectively and delivering on all data needs for which BI is responsible

Role Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree (preferably a BS in a related field) is required
2 to 3 years of work experience in data/analytics consulting and/or quantitative marketing/analysis (healthcare, pharmaceuticals and life sciences experience a plus)
Understanding of how clients use all aspects of their multi-channel marketing mix in reaching their customers
Superior skills with the following core competencies:
Time Management
Problem Solving
Quantitative Skills
Effective Communication
Intellectual Curiosity
Power User of MS Excel; Proficiency in Word and PowerPoint is required
Experience tagging websites and paid media a plus

Company Description
Natixis is a French multinational financial services firm specialized in asset & wealth management, corporate & investment banking, insurance and payments. A subsidiary of Groupe BPCE, the second-largest banking group in France through its two retail banking networks, Banque Populaire and Caisse d'Epargne, Natixis counts nearly 16,000 employees across 38 countries. Its clients include corporations, financial institutions, sovereign and supranational organizations, as well as the customers of Groupe BPCE's networks. Listed on the Paris stock exchange, Natixis has a solid financial base with a CET1 capital under Basel 3(1) of €11.1 billion, a Basel 3 CET1 Ratio(1) of 10.6% and quality long-term ratings (Standard & Poor's: A+ / Moody's: A1 / Fitch Ratings: A+).
(1) Based on CRR-CRD4 rules as reported on June 26, 2013, including the Danish compromise - without phase-in.

Figures as at 31 March 2019
Job Description
The Axiom Business Analyst is responsible developing, modifying and/or maintaining the Axiom application environment. Code, test, debug, document programs as well as maintain of Axiom systems architecture. Work closely with business partners in defining requirement.

Work closely with key stakeholders to deliver technology changes driven by our regulatory agencies.
Proactive planning and execution of key release and production operation processes required for smooth platform operations.
Partner with key business partners to formulate a consistent, repeatable process for manage change to our platform.
Accountable for clean platform release packaging and assembling of key technical artifacts required for smooth platform operations post release.
Manage and Lead agile process while adhering to key timelines and quality control.
Own accountability for managing and analyzing issues/risks, developing alternative approaches/mitigation plans and facilitating implementation or removal of roadblocks across partners and ensure change and project compliance with all enterprise standards.
Required Skills/Qualifications/Experience
Bachelor’s degree in accounting, system engineering or related field from an accredited college/university.
10+ years of relevant experience.
Proficient knowledge of US regulatory reporting requirements, external reporting control concepts, and financial services related products.
Proficient with Axiom SL.
Advanced Microsoft Excel.
Excellent technical project management skills, including the ability to prioritize and understand technical work and meet deadlines for multiple technology projects.
Ability to manage complex project(s) simultaneously in a fast-paced, matrixed environment with strong attention to detail and accuracy and a record of successful delivery of complex change.
Strong business-centric mind-set with ability to utilize sound business judgment and tailor approach to drive optimal business outcomes.
Strong problem-solving skills, excellent analytical and presentation skills; ability to synthesize complex data into actionable presentations / reports and communicate technical concepts to non-technical clients.
More than 7 years’ experience in the financial services industry in technical team management positions and in the Regulatory Reporting domain in particular.
Proven planning & monitoring skills with the ability to co-ordinate resources / tasks over multiple projects or tasks.
Strong customer focus with the ability to breakdown established barriers and suggest innovative change to help improve processes and systems.
An ability to think on your feet and to turn ideas and thoughts into decisions and actions
Drive and a proven ability to meet deadlines while dealing with changing and competing priorities.
Resilience, with the ability to cope with difficult situations and to handle and resolve issues to the benefit of all stakeholders.
Flexibility, with a positive approach to change.
In-depth knowledge of development tools and languages. In-depth global markets product knowledge and manage a high level of risk.

Altice USA (NYSE: ATUS) is one of the largest broadband communications and video services providers in the United States, delivering broadband, pay television, telephony services, proprietary content and advertising services to approximately 4.9 million Residential and Business customers across 21 states through its Optimum and Suddenlink brands.
From high-speed broadband and ultra-HD video, to digital advertising solutions, local news and voice offerings, we are making connections possible around the country - to businesses, to consumers, to communities, to schools, to hospitals, and everyone in between.

The Manager of Reporting and Analysis will be a vital source of analysis and reporting to provide valuable insight into customer behavior and profiling. This role will transform complex data sets into key statistics, dashboards, trends, etc. that will drive actionable insights for senior management. The reports and presentations prepared by this role will answer key business questions for internal customers focused on new and current customer growth & behavior, retention, churn, animation, and revenue.
Responsibilities
Execution of detailed analysis of customer growth, customer behavior and customer profiles. This includes interacting with the Acquisition, Customer Base Management, and Retention teams, and other key groups within the organization to identify specific analytical needs; coordinating with Business Intelligence to develop datasets that are appropriate and sufficient for satisfaction of the analytical requirements; performing the analysis; and creating concise and articulate summary presentations to share results.
Reporting to internal customers on daily, weekly, monthly trends.
Identify opportunities for creation of new reporting and streamlining of existing reporting creating, where appropriate, automated dashboard and reports.
Prioritizing and balancing multiple projects while fielding frequent ad hoc requests.
Act as SME expert regarding reporting abilities and challenges and communicate intelligently and clearly to all stakeholders at all levels (e.g. Senior Management, Market Strategy & Insights, Performance Management, and Business Intelligence.)
Identifying data discrepancies, reporting inconsistencies and gaps, and working closely with Product, Marketing, Sales and Business Planning teams to resolve
5+ years’ experience in a highly analytical role managing large data sets and turning those insights in condensed trends for the business.
Bachelor’s degree in finance, data analytics, data science or related field.
Advanced experience with business intelligence tools and database management tools such as SAS. SQL (Structured Query Language), Microstrategy and Cognos required.
Ability to format data in order to develop analytics to compare historical performance with current delivery.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Software and technology including Excel, Word, PowerPoint.
Intermediate presentation experience.
Advanced Tableau or related Business Intelligence Tool experience.
Experience preparing reports that are appropriate for senior level audiences.
Meticulous attention to detail building in mechanisms to ensure zero defects in all deliverables.
Strong analytical skills, and the ability to analyze qualitative and quantitative data and use that data to develop an understanding of consumer behavior.
Understanding of database concepts and data transformation along with intermediate statistical concepts and calculations.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment under tight deadlines.
Solid business and financial acumen.
Advanced experience with financial analysis and/or modeling.
Willingness to seek opportunities to develop and execute plans that drive improvement and efficiency.
Tireless desire to expand knowledge base and skill set.
Ability to manage a team of supporting employees.

TECHNOLOGY SERVICES GROUP (TSG) is the central infrastructure services group with a proven track record of innovating to help BNY Mellon and its customers have most reliable, nimble and cost-effective solutions in the financial services market place. BNY Mellon App Engine technology is leading edge with industry first PasS/IaaS fully integrated solution, combined with enterprise standards for developers.

TSG is building next generation scalable, efficient data center as a service using the latest innovation infrastructure. Building on top of the cloud deployments in BNY Mellon, we are aggressively automating and bridging the green field cloud with the existing virtual computing environments.

This role will have great visibility contributing to the overall Cost Transparency and Bill of Service Program to help businesses understand technology costs and allocations. The candidate will focus on and manage the TSG Product Catalog for chargeback and allocation methodology used for each of the product offerings. Candidate will get involved in planning and rate development activities as well as some level of demand or volume forecasting. This candidate will become a SME on the chargeback process with extensive knowledge of our various asset management and infrastructure inventory system.


Key responsibilities include:
Working with product managers to review and validate inventory integrity and volumes.
Analyzing Greenfield /cloud data around current footprint and future migrations to help feed into forecasting or volume projections.
Building out a process for capacity or volume forecasting at a product level.
Understanding how IT Asset Management system is capturing volume info and providing requirements to aid future chargeback processes.
Assist with Software cost management and chargeback and help implement a process that can be leveraged for fair & accurate allocations.
Maintaining a centralized Service Catalog repository that is relevant and current to business users.
Preparing presentation contents for senior management review.

Specialist Business Analysis Consultant->> Analyzes, defines and prioritizes the business requirements, functional specifications and operational architecture for up to and including highly complex strategic, global programs. Provides consultation to IT and business management on applying technology to business opportunities and planning and implementing cross-functional applications or systems. May allocate/coordinate work within a team/project. Elicits, challenges, and prioritizes requirements using standard processes and templates, and translates into functional design and use case documents. Develops project scope, objectives, constraints and assumptions for a given large, strategic, multi-year project. Participates and provides guidance in development of the technical design, test plans, and user documentation. Consults internal business groups on requirements, functional architecture and implementation. Tracks scope and change throughout the remainder of the initiative utilizing formal requirements management principles, including change control and requirements traceability. Gathers and analyzes information to assist in development of recommendations to address strategic business objectives that span multiple, global business and technology areas. Participates in industry forums and keeps current on domain knowledge for their specific business and application areas of expertise. Applies experiences with existing software and/or systems development processes to develop better processes to be used in the future. Actively influences software development process improvement initiatives. Provides senior level consultation to internal business groups on process improvement projects designed to improve their business results. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in business or technical-related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required, advanced degree is preferred.
Six to eight (6-8) years of experience in providing consulting advice to senior IT and business management is required.
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.
Strong analytical skills and enjoy working with large data sets.
Has Business Analysis experience to provide tech or business requirements in building reporting or other technical functionality.
Strong excel skills to do pivot tables and analysis.
Advanced knowledge of Excel, PowerPoint, Microsoft Suite and analytical tools.
Independent and self-driven but comfortable working in team environment.
Knowledge of Technology Finance, cost allocations, service catalog and chargeback model.
Work with a sense of urgency and is able to deliver and execute tasks.
Organized with good project management skills to ensure timely deliverables.
Self-starter, motivated and good communication skills.

LOLA is seeking a results-driven Director of Data Analytics & Business Intelligence with ecommerce and direct to consumer web experience. We are seeking an experienced leader to head up our small, but critical, analytics function. The Director of Data Analytics & Business Intelligence will play an integral role in helping to establish the larger vision of analytics at LOLA and to be responsible for the accuracy and standardization of reporting across all of the company's functions. This role is critical in providing insights to key stakeholders to assist in the growth of our strategic initiatives. The role requires extensive experience in implementing web analytics tools and developing new methods for internal reporting. Our goal is for the analytics team to inform strategy by standardizing and automating day to day reporting; championing scalability; and providing guidance to the company on what is important to track and analyze.

In this role, you will be responsible for supporting, monitoring and analyzing data to help answer key business questions, interpret performance and provide insights. This position will also coordinate, execute and lead the efforts for creating the analytics solution design on all new initiatives; and will work closely with developers to implement and test that design.

The Director of Data Analytics will report into the CFO; and will manage the internal Senior Data Analyst.

What you’ll be known for

Serve as an analytics thought leader across the organization and provide analytical leadership in the development of the company’s plans and programs
Establish KPIs for a growing, multi channel business - especially for business partners in finance, marketing, operations, and digital product
Employ the latest quantitative and analytical techniques to synthesize all available financial, marketing, sales, operational, social media and promotional data in the development of cutting-edge business insights that enhance the performance of the business and guide future business strategy
Translate core business strategies and organizational needs into actionable analytics initiatives that include statistical and quantitative analyses and reporting of marketing and/or industry data
Access, prepare, interpret and analyze data and then present findings to relevant stakeholders and leadership to answer and/or raise business decision-questions
Manage internal data analyst(s) and coach with empathy and guidance in their career path
Set the roadmap for the analytics team; triage and prioritize requests across the organization from week to week
Own the data dictionary and standardization of metrics
Provide analytics solutions, analysis, insights and recommendations to support business needs, identify opportunities and impact strategic decisions
Leads the web analytics tag implementation, testing & reporting for onsite features/functionality, online media, marketing landing pages, websites, conversion funnels and mobile applications
Scope and lead analytics projects of varying sizes
Write queries (SQL, SAS) to develop analyses and build reports
Define data-related requirements, requests and concerns for various projects and coordinate tagging and data feed updates
Who you are

6+ years’ experience in the field of digital analytics, web analytics or business intelligence, preferably in a direct to consumer, startup environment
Is an expert in identifying and developing data collection strategies to support standard and ad-hoc reporting on key performance indicators that directly measure online campaigns, website and conversion funnel performance
Expertise in implementing and leveraging Google Analytics
Experience leading web analytics tag implementation and testing. This includes having a working knowledge of JavaScript and tag manager methodologies with web analytics systems (e.g., Google Analytics, Omniture) and tag management (Google Tag Manager, Tealium, Ensighten, etc.)
Is detail-oriented and has a strong technical and working knowledge of omni-channel digital analytics technologies, and a high aptitude toward working with data visualization technologies (dashboards) and data schema(s)
Demonstrates the expertise to design data and analytics solutions to deliver meaningful customer insights and has experience preparing and producing analytics reports on a weekly, bi-weekly and monthly basis
Experience with A/B Testing Tools and methodologies
Passion for data and the technologies used to manage, access and visualize it
Experience working with databases and ETL concepts (e.g., Oracle, Netezza, MySQL)
Experience in SQL
Experience working with BI systems (e.g., Looker, Datorama, Cognos, Business Objects, Tableau)
Expert in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and with general Web based interfaces
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
Why you'll love LOLA

LOLA is the first lifelong brand for a woman’s body. Founded and led by women, we’re dedicated to providing an ever-expanding portfolio of trusted products and candid information, so you can make deliberate decisions about your reproductive health.

We offer period and sexual wellness products made with premium ingredients like 100% organic cotton. Subscribe to get LOLA delivered on your schedule or choose products à la carte. We make it easy to customize your assortment of tampons and pads, too, because you know your body best.

In 2015, we launched LOLA Gives Back, as part of our ongoing commitment to raise awareness about menstrual inequality. With help from our nonprofit distribution partners, we’ve since donated over 1 million period products to low-income, underserved women across the U.S.

Job Title
Senior Business Analyst, Audience Insights
Job Description
I. Job Summary | Major goals and objectives.
Fascinated by the intersections of data, demographics, lifestyles, and technology? Enjoy deep dives into web analytics and quantitative research to assess and predict consumer trends? If you are a creative problem solver and a high-performance, numbers-savvy individual, consider joining Meredith Digital’s Data Team. You’ll join a progressive company leveraging the latest technologies to inspire people through web, app, video, and print platforms to be successful in their food, lifestyle, home and parenting endeavors. Our team is laser-focused on designing and building amazing, useful products to attract, retain, and delight our audience. At Meredith, we achieve daily and dream big.
We’re seeking a technology-savvy, accomplished teammate who thrives working in a collaborative, data-driven environment. Consistent superior performance, creative problem solving, and accountability are not just buzzwords but an integral part of how we operate every day. As part of the Business Intelligence discipline, you will lead and help grow our analytics practice, focusing on establishing descriptive and predictive services that enable a deeper understanding of consumers, from inspiration to intent. You will partner with Growth, Product, and Editorial teams across Meredith’s portfolio of iconic lifestyle brands, which include People, Better Homes and Gardens, and Allrecipes, to create great experiences, value, utility, and inspiration for our audience.

II. Essential Job Functions
Weight %
Accountabilities, Actions and Expected Measurable Results
40%
Drive Business Impact: Partner with the Growth, Product, and Editorial teams to drive engagement initiatives. Contribute to experiment design, measurement methodology, and analysis. Build forecasts and models to help understand potential business impact. Identify opportunities to increase market share and engagement. Deliver recommendations that help teams achieve business objectives.
30%
Manage Audience Insights Services: Contribute to the continued development and enhancement of our audience analytics services, which enable insight into consumer interests, motivations, and journeys. Design, prototype, and build reporting and dashboards. Contribute to planning, solution design, solution development, and governance.
15%
Leadership: Write case studies and socialize the business impact of the Audience Insights team’s work. Provide input on cross-team analytics and insights efforts. Foster cross-team collaboration and communication.
Seek to constantly and proactively improve and evolve our services, productivity, and efficiency through automation, prioritization, and process optimization.
15%
Contribute to Strategy and Innovation: Participate in strategic development and near and long term team planning. Stay abreast of industry trends, leading edge platforms and technical frameworks. Initiate and oversee exploratory proofs of concept with internal and external partners. Translate big ideas into actionable plans.
100%
III. Minimum Qualifications and Job Requirements | All must be met to be considered.
Education:
Bachelor’s in a quantitative field, such as computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, data science or other sci ences, such as psychology or physics or equivalent experience.
Experience:
2-3 years of experience in quantitative analysis, working with large data sets.
1 year of increasing leadership responsibility, working with diverse teams in local and remote offices.
Proven ability to understand business needs and translate those needs to technical requirements and technical solutions.
Proven ability to evolve a strategy to a set of objectives and a tactical execution plan.
Specific Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
ESSENTIAL:
Advanced skills in data analysis, including statistical and competitive evaluation and synthesis.
Advanced proficiency in web analytics platforms – Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.
Experience applying data analytics, statistics, and forecasting to solve business problems.
Intermediate proficiency in SQL and scripting languages such as R, Python, PHP, Perl, etc.
Ability to develop holistic understanding of consumer behavior by combining and analyzing data from a variety of sources, including web analytics, survey data, and third party data sources.
Ability to translate business questions to technical requirements.
Ability to communicate at all levels of the organization, including verbal, written, listening, presentation, and collaboration.
Ability to successfully manage and deliver multiple projects in a deadline-driven environment.
Be able to think strategically and act tactically. Willing to roll up your sleeves and do what needs to be done.
Ability to work in a team-oriented environment as both a leader and an individual contributor.
Be a problem-solver, not just a problem alerter.
Be humble.
Enthusiasm for food and lifestyle topics such as entertainment, fashion, beauty, cooking, decorating, building and remodeling, crafts, gardening, and parenting is highly desired. Passion for making life easier and more enjoyable.
Passion and knowledge of digital ecosystems and digital customer experience best practices
NICE TO HAVE:
A good eye for visualization – an understanding of how data can be transformed to drive more meaning from the data being presented. If data is our product, data visualization is our product UX.
% Travel Required (Approximate) : <10%

We are expanding our Regulatory Practice and we need Senior Business Analyst.

Description
We are expanding our Regulatory Practice and we need Senior Business Analyst.

We are hiring Senior Business Analyst with knowledge of the following regulatory reports: FR Y-9C, FFIEC 002 and FFIEC 009 (002 and 009 are generally called the “call reports”).

 The BA will work for the data governance team. He/she will be focused on the “controls” aspects for the above reports.
Basically, the “control” part of data governance is about validating and correcting data—and the detailed rules that oversee this process.

 It is a BA/PM role meaning that the consultant must be able to manage his/her own initiatives without receiving detailed instructions on all the tasks to perform. We are searching for experience Business Analyst with regulatory and liquidity experience.

 Most important aspect is having experience with the 3 above-mentioned reports.
 Knowledge of CCAR (FR Y-14Q and 14M reports) and/or 2052a report is a plus.

Intensive use of Excel is very important. Experience with AXIOM is a plus.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
It is a BA/PM role meaning that the consultant must be able to manage his/her own initiatives without receiving detailed instructions on all the tasks to perform. We are searching for experience Business Analyst with regulatory and liquidity experience.

About Citi
Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.
Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.
Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.
IT Business Lead Analyst - Futures Clearing and Collateral Technology
Citi Futures, Clearing and Collateral Technology supports a rapidly growing business that uses technological innovation to maintain competitive advantage in a constantly evolving market. Working closely with the business, external vendors and internal technology teams, you would build-out and maintain our next generation OTC clearing platforms.
You would manage complex projects that will involve everything from incorporating a new functionality within the existing ecosystem, to analyzing new requirements, documenting solutions, managing implementation and testing systems, ensuring that they are fit for purpose. You would regularly work with a range of high-profile stakeholders.
The IT Business Lead Analyst is a senior-level position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to continuous iterative exploration and investigation of business performance and other measures to gain insight and drive business planning.

Responsibilities:
Provide input during development and implementation phases, including formulation and definition of systems scope, objectives and necessary system enhancements for complex, high-impact projects
Identify and communicate risks and impacts and propose risk mitigation options, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and partner with multiple management teams and other units to meet organizational objectives
Evaluate new IT developments and evolving business requirements and recommend appropriate systems alternatives and/or enhancements to current systems by analyzing business processes, systems and industry standards
Provide in-depth and sophisticated analyses with interpretive thinking to define problems, develop innovative solutions and influence strategic functional decisions
Supervise day-to-day staff management issues, including resource management, work allocation, mentoring/coaching and other duties and functions as assigned
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

6-10 years of experience
Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint) with extensive experience using Excel for data analysis
Experience with all phases of Software Development Life Cycle
Comprehensive knowledge of the principles of business analysis
Education:
Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience
Master's degree preferred

job_title: Business Analyst/ Sr. Business Analyst, Ad Sales Technology
desc:
The Business Analyst/ Sr. Business Analyst is responsible for maintaining the day to day operational activities. The primary responsibility will be end user support for an integrated ad sale, commercial operations, promotions, and billing system, including integrations with other critical systems within the portfolio, with a primary focus on Local Ad Sales. This position is based in New York, NY
Support and troubleshoot issues (process and system), identify root cause, and proactively implement sustainable corrective actions.
Liaison between the technology organization and the Ad Sales business; provide consistent and frequent updates about defects and enhancements, etc.
Maintain a strong relationship with user base, including but not limited to senior executives, ensuring customer satisfaction during all interactions.
Work with a ticketing system to track, categorize, and prioritize defects, enhancements and training needs for the business.
Identify and manage software defects and work with the software vendor teams to resolve and implement solutions.
Understand and execute escalations for critical and non-critical instances.
Provide On-Air systems support within SLA driven work hours; with occasional weekend on call support if necessary.
Identify new opportunities and services to enhance the systems platform and drive more productivity/revenue.
Provide input on new and future projects.

Qualifications:
Minimum 2 years of Ad Sales, Commercial operations, and/or other TV systems experience.
Local Ad Sales knowledge and experience in the industry.
Must be willing to have a flexible work schedule to meet on-air operation’s needs.
Understanding of converged linear and digital ad sales strategies.

Desired Qualifications:
Experience in product support / training within media industry strongly preferred.
Demonstrated ability in troubleshooting, analysis, and design.
Self-motivated and accountable, with a high level of commitment to responsibility.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills; ability to work across multiple groups.
Ability to prioritize tickets and work through them in a timely and correct manner.
Comfortable in a team setting to work with counterparts on solving issues at hand but also must have the ability to work solely on tickets.
A self-starter but also willing to ask for help when needed to ensure quality of work.
SQL experience a plus.
Ability to execute multiple projects simultaneously and communicate effectively with all stakeholders (business and IT).

At NBCUniversal, we believe in the talent of our people. It’s our passion and commitment to excellence that drives NBCU’s vast portfolio of brands to succeed.
