job_title: Business Analyst, International and Digital Solutions
desc:
Business Analyst, International and Digital Solutions
The Business Analyst, International and Digital Solutions is a high visibility, client-facing role that requires you to be able to communicate with our business partners in their language to understand their operational technology and related strategic needs. The Business Analyst will need to have a broad view of all systems, process and business functions that interface with one another across International business function as well as those outside of this ecosystem that are impacting. This is a leadership and service-oriented position which requires someone who can get the job done no matter what obstacles are encountered. It is part project manager, part business analyst, part product manager and part intrapreneur.
Above all, you be part of a high performing team and create and maintain productive business relationships that will provide the foundation for delivering impactful technology solutions.
MORE ABOUT WHAT YOU’LL DO:
Analyze existing business processes and systems functionality
Propose new or updated solutions to growing and changing business needs
Document detailed requirements in a way that will be understandable and clear to all stakeholders
Work with Dev and QA teams to ensure proper delivery of solutions
Drive our Agile-based development cycles, ensuring that customer priorities are represented, the development team is progressing down the right path, and that the team delivers what we’ve committed to on-time and with a high level of quality.
Conduct UAT sessions with business partners gaining acceptance as to what was scoped and built
Build solutions, applications, tools & processes supporting critical functions of A+E enterprise and ensure that the business areas have an overall positive experience in all forms of technology.
Participate in technology driven initiatives that support the advancement of our technology stack creating a secure and up to date environment
Be an active team member of the Technology Department
WHAT YOU’LL LEARN:
On our team, you'll have the opportunity to innovate and learn. You will learn. You will not be alone. You’ll have an opportunity to build transformational technology solutions & supporting core areas of business. Also, you’ll be able to seek out new technologies and implement them where they make sense. Finally, you’ll be exposed to various A+E departments and stakeholders to learn the goals, needs and direction so you can become a trusted partner.
YOUR STORY: [+BEHAVIORS] (what you need to have)
Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university and relevant job experience.
5 years working with applications and technology solutions that are vendor supported and custom developed, as well as have experience with implementations of medium-large scale projects.
Analytical skills – The ability to take a scientific approach towards problem solving, whether involving analysis of raw data, observation or conducting interviews with key stakeholders. You can work methodically and in an organized fashion towards solving the problem.
Curiosity – Constantly be looking for new technologies on the marketplace, or new internal processes that innovate how we do things and provide new value to our business. Your attitude is that if you don’t know or can’t figure it out, you figure out a way or find the right person or resources to help you.
Desire to make things better and get it done, whatever it may take.
Integrations – Some understanding of and experience with technology components/systems talking to one another and sharing information.
Proactive – You don’t wait to be told what to do. You’re here to contribute and work hard. You want to ensure that you’re working on the right things at the right time with the right priorities. If you aren’t sure, you aren’t afraid to ask.
Project Management - Ability to manage projects and people, as well as the ability to influence and manage relationships where no direct line of report exists. The ability to make reasonable time estimates for how long work will take and support other team members in doing the same.
Communications and Presentation Skills – You’re comfortable standing in front of a group of people and explaining your work, with a clear understanding of how to gear the message towards for the specific audience.
Business Writing – skilled at clear and concise business writing.
Data – Some understanding of data and databases and how they drive systems. Some SQL experience desirable.
Digital – Some experience with or understanding of HTML, CSS, WordPress (or other content management systems).
Microsoft Office – Experience with, or the ability and desire to learn, MS Office analytical tools such as Excel and Visio, and if necessary MS Project.
Preferable – experience in the Cable Television industry and in the Rights and Programming business areas.
THAT SOMETHING EXTRA:

If you’ve read this far, you’re likely a great fit for us…and maybe you’re fluent in sign language, have studied the circus arts or are currently writing a screenplay. If you have a special skill or backstory that might directly or indirectly help you succeed in this role, we’d love to hear about it in your cover letter

Medidata: Conquering Diseases Together

Medidata is leading the digital transformation of life sciences with the world's most-used platform for clinical development, commercial and real-world data. Powered by artificial intelligence and delivered by #1 ranked industry experts, the Intelligent Platform for Life Sciences helps pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device companies and academic researchers accelerate value, minimize risk and optimize outcomes. Medidata serves more than 1,000 customers and partners worldwide and empowers more than 100,000 certified users every day to create hope for millions of patients. Discover the future of life sciences: www.mdsol.com
We know that diverse teams win and are fully committed to selecting leaders and employees that represent the markets in which we operate. We are still led by our Co-founders, Tarek Sherif and Glen de Vries, and have global operations in US, Europe and Asia with over 2000 employees.
About AcornAI - a Medidata company
Medidata’s journey started in 1999 when a scientist working on his first clinical trial waded through inefficiencies and delays – and knew that technology could improve the process. Almost 20 years later, we've grown to be the leader in clinical technology. In 2019, we launched AcornAI to meet changing biopharma need as companies rapidly progress to the age of precision medicine.
Built on our platform with the industry’s largest structured, standardized and growing clinical trial data repository consisting of 17,000+ trials and 4.5M patients, AcornAI is one of the largest AI companies exclusively dedicated to life sciences. Our team is composed of over 40 PhD/Masters statisticians, data scientists, analytical product leads, former FDA biostatisticians and computational genomicists.
Your Mission:
AcornAI’s delivery team is looking for leaders who will help us tackle some of the most complex questions facing the industry today using our proprietary AcornAI platform and advanced analytics. In this role, you will engage with clients throughout projects to ensure the best analytical approach, successful delivery and client satisfaction. At AcornAI, we never work alone. This role will partner heavily with all of the key stakeholder functions including Product, Data Science, Engineering, partnerships and Biostatistics. Successful candidates will be skilled in analytical/quantitative thinking, project management, structured communication and excited about building the next horizon of Medidata’s journey of powering smarter treatments and healthier people.
Work cross-functionally to gather and analyze information, formulate and test hypotheses, and communicate recommendations on some of the most complex issues in the industry today
Develop and own project plans and timelines end-to-end, and lead cross-functional teams to ensure on-time delivery of high quality data and analytics output
Lead problem-solving with clients, data scientists and other stakeholders to identify the analytics needed to answer client questions and generate impact in line with our mission
Track and communicate progress and decisions clearly, triage issues to the appropriate internal stakeholder and ensure timely effective issue resolution
Create processes so that each project is easier and faster than the last one
Your Education & Experience:
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience
4+ years of work experience in one of the following types of highly structured or scientific environments: management/healthcare consulting, life sciences, data and analytics role
Outstanding structured and critical thinking
A passion for understanding complex issues with a data driven approach
A technical bent and the ability to use or to learn to use tools to answer your own questions (e.g. Excel/SQL/Python)
Superb project management and a relentless drive to get things done
The following will be helpful, but are not essential:
An MBA or advanced degree
An entrepreneurial drive and a passion to advance the development of new treatments
Experience leading a team formally or informally
Enjoy iterating on different ways to solve a problem
A strong analytical background and the ability to quickly digest and evaluate complex analyses with a keen eye for detail
Experience working in Life sciences or across the healthcare value chain
Can drive a team forward even amidst ambiguity and complexity.
Medidata is making a real difference in the lives of patients everywhere by accelerating critical drug and medical device development, enabling life-saving drugs and medical devices to get to market faster. Our products sit at the convergence of the Technology and Life Sciences industries, one of most exciting areas for global innovation. Nine of the top 10 best-selling drugs in 2017 were developed on the Medidata platform.
Medidata’s solutions have powered over 14,000 clinical trials giving us the largest collection of clinical trial data in the world. With this asset, we pioneer innovative, advanced applications and intelligent data analytics, bringing an unmatched level of quality and efficiency to clinical trials enabling treatments to reach waiting patients sooner.
Medidata Solutions, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Medidata Solutions complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

OVERVIEW:
At Gain Theory, we give the opportunity to all employees to lead, and expect that everyone contributes to shaping the future of our fast-growing company. These responsibilities will include:
Strategy – Help us shape the future objectives and roadmaps to achieving those objectives
Clients – Play a role in managing client relationships and delivering on the promises we make as a business
Culture – Help us develop a strong, vibrant, people first culture that will be our ultimate differentiator in attracting the best talent, which will differentiate us with our clients
New Business – Leverage personal contacts and relationship building to help grow our client list, and participate in engaging new opportunities
Product Development – Shape our products and how we deliver them to clients across analytic solutions, software, consulting frameworks and more

While the specific responsibilities of the Senior Specialist, Data Visualization will differ depending on the needs of the organization and specific skillsets he/she brings to Gain Theory, you will be expected to engage in all of the above at various moments as a leader within the business.

ABOUT THE ROLE:
The person in this position is focused on leveraging our data platform and visualizing marketing data in compelling ways that uncover analytical insight. In this role you will have the opportunity to leverage industry standard data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau) but you will also be expected to push the envelope with new data visualization technologies. The Data Visualization Senior Specialist will take business requirements from inception to delivery, acting as a crucial team member throughout the entire project development lifecycle to ensure that user needs are met successfully. You will join a team comprised of Client Engagement Leads, Data Architects, Modelers and Consultants and have direct interaction with Executive Sponsors. The primary responsibility of the Data Visualization Senior Specialist is to create new data visualizations that service a client or business need, and propagate innovative data visualization techniques across the organization. You will also contribute to decisions in the solution and technology roadmap and must have the desire to be a thought leader, and ambition to elevate the standard of solution delivery to our customers.
YOUR IMPACT:
Contribute to our client facing interactive data visualization solutions
Build data visualizations using Gain Theory’s toolkit, leveraging best-in-class tech solution
Assure that the data visualizations are accurately representing data and enforce overall quality assurance
Work with Gain Theory client leads to understand the business needs of our end clients with regard to data insight and build visualizations that effectively deliver this insight.
Work with the Gain Theory Team to understand key business objectives, and how data visualization can be leveraged as part of the solution
Be a key contributor to the roadmap as it pertains to the selection of visualization technologies, products, and platforms.
Define and enforce best practices and design standards
Provide expertise on Tableau functionality
Manage the Tableau Server, creating client sites, managing users and permissions, and monitoring Server health (usage, space, performance)
Onboard new team members onto Tableau
Manage Tableau upgrades, internal communications and release planning
Manage Gain Theory’s relationship with Tableau (case submissions, support requests, licensing needs, etc.)
Stay abreast of Tableau roadmap and determine viability to meet Gain Theory’s client needs
Instill a culture of data creativity with the Gain Theory organization

YOUR QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree
Advanced Tableau proficiency ~4+ years with Tableau and Tableau Server experience
Experience visualizing complex data ecosystems
Experience with other data visualization/reporting solutions will be highly valued
Experience with data management/reporting solutions will be highly valued
Experience with open source visualization/user-interactive technologies such as JavaScript, D3 and R and how to operationalize client facing solutions based on these frameworks will be highly valued
Knowledge or minimal experience with data manipulation tools (e.g. SQL, R, Python, SAS, etc.)
Strong analytical skills; ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and understand how best to visualize.
Organized, detail-oriented, QA-focused
Process-driven project management a plus
Prior knowledge of the marketing ecosystem, understanding of marketing/media metrics, and analytical products offered as a service is preferred
Familiarity with big-data concepts; cloud computing and open-source tools is preferred

ABOUT GAIN THEORY:
Gain Theory brings together data, analytics, technology, and insight capabilities to weave engaging business narratives which inspire our Fortune 500 clients to impactful business decision making every day. We pride ourselves on developing and innovating long term relationships that continually propel clients forward. In serving them, we are rapidly evolving our own operating models and IP, which is leading us to greater heights of success and a bright future for the company.

When it comes to working at Gain Theory, our people are passionate about making a difference, both at work and in their lives. We are creating a culture that drives excellent delivery while giving our teams and individuals the space they need to enjoy their own passions. Pursuing these two objectives in tandem maximizes the quality of delivery for Gain Theory, but more importantly, the quality of life for the individual.
As an independent practice within the WPP Media Company, we have the resources and intellectual capital which fuels our ambition of becoming a top tier Global Marketing analytics company over the next 3 years. Our New York office sits in World Trade 3 overlooking the World Trade Memorial. Yet, we retain full independence to work for non-WPP clients (~40% of our client base is currently with non-WPP clients) and do not provide any unpaid services within WPP.

We serve clients across a range of sectors, including CPG, Retail, Finance, QSR, Healthcare, and more. Our work covers 50 markets in NA, LATAM, EMEA and APAC with regional Head Offices in New York, London, and Singapore.

Take A Virtual Office Tour: https://roundme.com/tour/368027/view/1255100/
GroupM and all its affiliates embrace and celebrate diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more great work we can create together.

job_title: Loss Prevention Business Analyst (LP Experience Required)
desc:
Overview
Bowlero Corporation, the world's largest Bowling and Entertainment corporation, is looking for a Loss Prevention Business Analyst to join our team at the corporate office in New York City.
If you are a driven, motivated professional seeking a challenging and rewarding position with a fun company and great work environment, apply today.
SUMMARY: Protects company assets and increases profitability through the analysis, response and management of various data across a broad spectrum of internal financial and technology resources such as Exception Reporting, Sales Audit, FP&A, IT and Loss Prevention. The Loss Prevention Analyst works cross-functionally in a dynamic, fast paced and demanding environment providing critical guidance to the organization’s asset protection and profit improvement initiatives. The character and ability to work effectively and independently in a demanding and fast paced team environment is essential.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Essential duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:
Assists in the development, preparation, and distribution of Point of Sale (POS) Exception Reports.
Establish trends in the Point of Sale Exception Report and investigate to ensure compliance. Investigation may involve extensive CCTV review.
Audits center paper work of Point of Sale reconciliations to actual reports.
Works directly with field operational compliance auditors and Loss Prevention Managers to ensure thorough incident response preparation and resolution.
Researches statistical and financial variances between center revenue reporting (bowling games) and reported sales.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: None

QUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily with attention to detail, possesses excellent customer service skills, both written and oral, and maintain the highest level of integrity and confidentiality. Experience with database files and Excel is a plus. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: Bachelor degree preferred in Business, Accounting, Finance or related concentration and/or 1 or more years of experience and/or training or the equivalent combination of education and experience. Loss Prevention experience and Wicklander-Zulawski Interview and Interrogation certification, or equivalent, is a plus.

ABOUT BOWLERO CORPORATION:
Bowlero Corporation is the largest owner and operator of bowling entertainment venues in the world with over 290 total centers across four brands. Bowlero combines bowling, dining, and nightlife into an experience that’s is packed with amusing throwbacks and ready to amaze. Bowlero is a blacklight bowling, retro-inspired hangout powered by interactive arcade games, signature cocktails, an outrageous menu of Oversized Shareables, and... nostalgia. Forget everything you thought bowling could be—and experience the kind of epic fun that only happens when you go Bowlero.
As a brief timeline of Bowlero history:
Bowlero started as a single bowling alley established in Greenwich Village, New York in 1938.
In the late 1990’s and early 2000’s Bowlmor Lanes revolutionized the sport with the concept of high-end, event-centric bowling.
In 2013, Bowlero Corporation was founded as Bowlmor AMF following the successful acquisition of AMF Bowling Worldwide by Bowlmor Lanes.
In 2014, Bowlmor AMF acquired the Brunswick Corporation’s bowling center business and solidified its reputation as the worldwide leader in bowling entertainment.
In 2018, Bowlmor AMF officially became Bowlero Corporation, beginning a new chapter and signaling a new direction in the company’s continued growth.
Bowlero Corporation’s mission is to “Strive to be a world-class provider of delightful guest experiences, and to provide a dynamic work environment where talented and ambitious associates will thrive.” Their core values include: Integrity, Ownership, Flexibility, Urgency, Never Give Up, Outstanding Design, and Delight Guests.

Exceptional Service. Incredible Value. Limitless Potential.

Interested candidates, please send your resume to tkaplan@bowlerocorp.com.

Job Description

Within the Dailymotion’s AdTech department, we are looking for someone to join the Business Operations & Analytics team, in our NYC office. The team’s mission statement is to drive growth, deliver insights & scale efficiency for the AdTech, Sales & Content tribes.
As Sr. Business Operations Analyst – Programmatic, you will act as a true internal consultant to support our Programmatic Business and actively contribute to the success of the Programmatic Partnerships team, with revenue growth as your #1 priority.
You will have to wear 2 hats to be successful at this job:Business Analyst: provide relevant and actionable insights, drive better business understanding and help the team make data-driven decisionsProject Manager: identify pain points, implement your recommendations concretely and drive efficiency, by providing both strategic thinking and structured project management capabilities
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
Partner closely with the Programmatic Partnerships team to develop and execute their roadmap and business planMonitor frequently our multiple buyers spend and improve reactivity of the team to fix issuesPerform regular analysis of our Programmatic Business and provide recommendations on how to unlock more revenueDevelop our Business insight via better Reporting & Dashboarding using both our internal and external dataDrive large cross-functional projects, partnering with multiple stakeholders to implement your business recommendationsHelp our Operations team develop our Programmatic Marketplace and facilitate the go-to-market of new offers to our different demand sourcesScale tools and processes to improve the DSPs/SSPs relationship cycle (automation, CRM, regular business reviews…)Provide high quality consulting and analytics support across a variety of strategic team initiatives,Qualifications

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOUJoin Dailymotion during a key period of growth and development, with multiple key projects being launched from the ground-up to achieve very ambitious goals over the next few yearsJoin a growing team with many processes to improve and projects to implement, with the opportunity to play a key role and bring new ideas to the table

job_title: Global Spread Products Technology Front Office Business Anal...
desc:
The IT Business Lead Analyst is a senior-level position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to continuous iterative exploration and investigation of business performance and other measures to gain insight and drive business planning. Excellent opportunity to gain exposure to Origination and Banking business area and help resolve business’ technology challenges. Gain exposure and deep understanding of Loans, Bonds & Real Estate businesses.

Responsibilities:
Provide input during development and implementation phases, including formulation and definition of systems scope, objectives and necessary system enhancements for complex, high-impact projects
Identify and communicate risks and impacts and propose risk mitigation options, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment

Evaluate new IT developments and evolving business requirements and recommend appropriate systems alternatives and/or enhancements to current systems by analyzing business processes, systems and industry standards

Lead multiple client service delivery teams in the active execution of engagements in compliance with firm and practice unit service delivery standards

Participate in business development by identifying new opportunities and assisting with proposal development

Manage and provide leadership to teams of staff level professionals and become actively involved in staff development and practice management

Overview
ACA Compliance Group (“ACA”) is a leading provider of risk management and technology solutions that focus on regulatory compliance, performance, financial crime, and cybersecurity. We partner with our clients to help them mitigate the regulatory, operational, and reputational risks inherent in their business functions. Our clients include leading investment advisers, private fund managers, commodity trading advisors, investment companies, broker-dealers, and domestic and international banks.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Work directly with business users / stakeholders to gather business requirements, create business process flow and help implement and development the platform.
Work closely with the Product Engineering Team to analyze and clarify requirements, understand product feasibility.
Perform analysis on business issues, define requirements and propose solutions to solve issues.
Identify, manage, resolve, and track client issues as they arise, using various agile development toolsets such as Confluence, Jira.
Assist in creation of product documentation and training materials for internal and external use.
Growth opportunity to help set standards and best practices, mentor and evolve toward project management
Qualifications
Experience within asset management industry with focus on Buy-side.
Exposure to financial asset classes.
Working knowledge of database concepts and SQL is required.
Understanding and experience in Agile software development methodologies.
Strong communication skills both verbal and written. Capable of collaborating effectively across a variety of IT and Business groups.
Self-starter: Proven ability to prioritize with good time management skills and manage multiple tasks and assignments with minimal supervision.
Dedicated to upholding ACA’s high-quality standards and customer service focus.
Ability to identify requirement conflicts and bring clarity to business objectives, requirements and priorities.
Thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
Nice to have:
C# .Net development experience
Experience in Bitbucket, continuous integration (TeamCity), automated deployment and release management (Octopus)
Knowledge of using Atlassian Confluence Wiki and JIRA tools

With over 700 employees worldwide, ACA provides services to over 4,000 regional, national, and global firms in the financial services industry. ACA clients include 89% of the top 100 hedge fund managers (Hedge Fund Alert, April 2019), 79% of the top 100 private equity firms (PEI 300, May 2019, 83% of America’s top 100 money managers (Institutional Investor, 2018), 78% of the top 50 real estate firms (PERE 100, June 2019), 79% of the top 100 Mutual Funds (Mutual Fund Directory 2019).

job_title: Risk COO IT Business Analyst, AVP-VP
desc:
Risk COO IT Business Analyst, AVP-VP # 141362
United States-NY-New York | Full-time (FT) | Corporate Functions | Job ID 141362
Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse.
We Offer

The Risk division is a highly visible, dynamic area of the firm where you can be an integral part of decisions making that supports the bank’s business. Our responsibilities range from enterprise risk management to risk and finance reporting and regional risk teams covering the risk management for our entities. The Risk division's long-term success depends on our ability to achieve our vision and fulfil our mandate. Ultimately, this depends on the skills, experience and engagement of our employees. We offer a collaborative and ambitious environment that offers direct contact with senior management and encourages leadership.
Our Team provides management support to including strategy, financial management, controls and supervision, audit and regulatory commitments, human capital, and other business management mandates.
We act as the point for interaction in respect of strategy, exposure, limits, and risk mitigation. We also ensure a comprehensive coverage of all significant risks and lead the Risk Appetite Framework. Our Team provides strategic input into any infrastructure development that changes other Legal Entity to ensure consistency with local requirements. We are looking to develop our departmental operational risk and control framework and corresponding processes.
We offer:
You will be engaged in the design and implementation of key control initiatives as well as other CRO COO mandate (e.g. strategy, management information, and audit/regulatory coordination).
You will assist the GM/IBCM CRO COO with driving key innovation and system improvement projects in collaboration with business partners across functions (e.g. FO, Risk, IT, and Compliance, etc.)
You will positively influence the control culture and assist in holding accountable to achieving the highest supervisory and control standards and produce and monitor senior Risk supervisory control & supervision balance scorecard on a quarterly basis.
You will deliver and improve an effective business management framework for the GM, IBCM, CUSO & CIB CRO, including Key performance indicatory (critical metrics), Delivery Metrics and Management Dashboard.
You Offer

Qualifications:
At least 3-5 years of relevant experience;
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and SharePoint.
Strong analytical skills and a review attitude. Knowledge of FO Trading systems or Risk/P&L systems or experience in data risk management / IT Project Management is preferable.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
You are an organized, self-starter with an ability to work independently. You take ownership of tasks, project manage them to their completion, and deliver under tight timelines with a high degree of accuracy.
You have the ability to build and maintain effective working relationships across multiple functions and levels.
Outstanding teammate with excellent interpersonal skills.
Confirmed ability to tailor communications to recipients at all levels of the organization.

Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success. Credit Suisse complies with applicable federal, state, and local laws prohibiting discrimination in employment in every jurisdiction in which it maintains facilities. Subject to applicable law and regulatory requirements, Credit Suisse complies with state and local laws regarding considering for employment qualified individuals with criminal histories.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst, Ad Sales Solutions
desc:
Sr. Business Analyst –Ad Sales Solutions
The Sr. Business Analyst for Digital Ad Sales Solutions will be primarily responsible for Digital Ad Sales Business Intelligence and reporting solutions for A+E Networks. This individual will be responsible for analysis and documentation of user reporting requirements, provide support and project management efforts to offer new solutions or enhancements related to the Digital reporting. The Sr. Business Analyst will work closely with the Ad Sales Revenue Management & Finance Groups as well as peers and management in IT to provide solutions to business challenges pertaining to Digital Ad Sales. He/She should be well-versed in the Digital Ad Sales in terms of data, process and systems.
MORE ABOUT WHAT YOU’LL DO:
Business Analysis
Digital Ad Sales expert with deep expertise in Digital Ad sales data, systems and processes.
Lead the design, building and testing of custom reporting solutions for Digital Ad Sales reporting
Participate in enhancements of Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence solutions
Review BI information architecture ensuring that designs are following industry and company best practices
Ensure that BI standards, processes and standards are being followed
Develops test schedules, reviews testing plans, tracks and document the development and results of these plans.
Provides user documentation for the reporting solution. Creates curriculum and provide classes for user training.
Ensures requirements are understood, agreed to and signed off at the appropriate early stages in a project.
Stay abreast of and continuously increase knowledge of new technology and business solutions
Project Management
Formulate and define system scope and objectives for projects
Provides overall direction and guidance to assigned project managers, reviews project requests, and coordinates activities.
Prepares activity and progress reports regarding systems for regular status reporting, including but not limited to project & support work.
Ensure that programs, initiatives & projects are delivered on-time. Manage risks appropriately & plan proactive mitigation
Alerts manager to potential risks and issues of importance.
Application Support
Work closely with development team in system support of current reporting solutions.
Ensure that repeat defects, break fixes are minimized & focus on analysis and provide recommendation for avoiding common issues.
WHAT YOU’LL LEARN:
On our team, you'll have the opportunity to innovate and learn. You will learn. You will not be alone. You’ll have an opportunity to build transformational technology solutions & supporting core areas of business. Also, you’ll be able to seek out new technologies and implement them where they make sense. Finally, you’ll be exposed to various A+E departments and stakeholders to learn the goals, needs and direction so you can become a trusted partner.
 YOUR STORY: [+BEHAVIORS] (what you need to have)
Undergraduate degree
6+ years of IT Business Analysis with focus on Business Intelligence
1-2+ years of Project Management experience
Experience with Digital Ad Sales Order Management Systems, such as, Operative.One, Fivia, etc.
Experience with Ad Serving systems, such as, FreeWheel and Google Ad Manager.
Excellent analytical, communication (both verbal and written), facilitation/organizational skills.
Understanding of Business Intelligence Related Reporting Tools, Visualization, Analytics, Dashboards, KPIs, Scorecards, Modeling and Predictive Analysis through tools and technologies such as Microsoft Business Intelligence and Tableau.
Ability to work effectively with cross-functional business and technical teams
Demonstrated business acumen and the ability to apply technology solutions to solve business problems
Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills; ability to communicate and persuade at all management levels
Highest level of ownership, accountability & integrity
Exhibits, models & promotes vision of the IT team
Being able to question, evaluate and make decision on technology platform
Desired:
Experience with 3rd party vendor system like STAQ, Operative Compete is a plus
Knowledge of SQL is a plus
THAT SOMETHING EXTRA:

If you’ve read this far, you’re likely a great fit for us…and maybe you’re fluent in sign language, have studied the circus arts or are currently writing a screenplay. If you have a special skill or backstory that might directly or indirectly help you succeed in this role, we’d love to hear about it in your cover letter

The D. E. Shaw group is seeking an analyst to join its Human Capital Systems and Infrastructure team to assist with the development and implementation of a redesigned systems infrastructure. This team acts as caretaker of the IT systems that optimize human capital processes and house employee data.

What you’ll do day-to-day
The analyst will partner with developers to conceptualize solutions that expand and improve human capital systems and will be responsible for understanding business needs, specifying technical requirements, and providing operational support for existing applications. This dynamic position offers a broad view of the proprietary systems and third-party products that make up the firm’s human capital systems landscape. Ample opportunities will be provided to partner closely with leaders in human capital, business operations, information technology, and our international software development teams.
Who we're looking for
We are looking for candidates with a bachelor’s degree or higher who have obtained three to seven years of relevant work experience. Preference will be given to those who have been actively involved in complex software implementations involving multiple stakeholders.
Experience designing and implementing data warehouses is a significant plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication abilities, organizational skills, a dedicated customer service mentality, a knack for rapid problem solving, an aptitude for translating the needs of non-technical systems users into technical requirements, and an ability to see how small details interrelate and impact the bigger picture (i.e. systems thinking) are all critical for this role.
Applicants with functional expertise in technical writing, process mapping, process re-engineering, and data modeling will excel in this role.
A holistic understanding of the software development life cycle gained from experience running an agile release cycle process (such as experience as a scrum master) is a plus.
The willingness and ability to dive into details, collaborate effectively with teammates of varying technical knowledge, drive projects to completion, and exercise extreme discretion with confidential information is also essential.

ASME (American Society of Mechanical Engineers) is a world-renowned, member-based not- for-profit professional organization focused on serving the technical, educational and other programmatic needs of the engineering and technology communities on a worldwide basis. ASME generates approximately $115 million annually from the sale of products and services and provides a wide range of mission focused programs and activities.
We have a challenging opportunity for a Senior Business Analyst to join our team and serve as a subject matter expert on business applications. Core responsibilities include performing detailed analysis, documenting business functional and non -functional requirements, and evaluating system impact to ensure the successful delivery and support of corporate applications. This role acts as a liaison between the business units and IT and is key to achieving organizational goals and resolving issues using technical solutions.
Position requires a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or additional, equivalent work experience. We also require a minimum of 8 years’ BA or equivalent experience; a project management background is a plus. Knowledge of Business Analysis best practices and tool sets is needed. Must have proven track record of successfully working as a Lead BA for complex projects and display the ability to lead a BA program and in front of large groups. Qualified candidates will have excellent communication and presentation skills and have demonstrated expertise and excellence in the following skills and competencies:
Power Point, Visio, and prototyping tools for creating UI mockups
Creating and maintaining requirements and user stories in JIRA (SaaS)
Understanding Traceability Matrix
Gathering and preparing solution based estimates using Case Studies and User Stories
Process Flows High Level Solution Diagrams short of architecture
Providing Gap Analysis and Defect Root Cause Analysis
Conducting JAD sessions with White Boarding / Data Mapping Documents
Experience with and working knowledge of the following are preferred:
Project management software - Clarizen a plus
Salesforce
Cloud computing platforms – Azure
This role is based in our New York headquarters but requires periodic travel to our Little Falls, NJ office location.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. NYU School of Medicine is one of the nation's top-ranked medical schools. For 175 years, NYU School of Medicine has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history and enrich the lives of countless people. An integral part of NYU Langone Health, the School of Medicine at its core is committed to improving the human condition through medical education, scientific research, and direct patient care. For more information, go to med.nyu.edu, and interact with us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

Position Summary:
We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Sr Data Analyst

In this role, the successful candidate The successful applicant will join DataCore, an innovative team within NYU Langone Health's Medical Center Information Technology department that utilizes state-of-the-art technology and informatics products to meet the clinical research and analytics needs of a prestigious institution. S/he will primarily support the Center for Healthcare Innovation and Delivery Science (CHIDS). CHIDS is a locus for collaboration among clinicians, researchers, educators, and administrators, who are working together in accelerating the transformation to a learning healthcare system and to improve patient outcomes. S/he will collaborate closely with faculty, clinicians, fellow data analysts, and biostatisticians to advance research and practice in healthcare implementation science, quality of care, and patient safety. In particular, s/he will perform a key role in organizing databases, creating and aggregating datasets, and contributing to analyses for studies in the areas of outcomes-related research, chronic disease management, standard care pathways evaluation, and patient care quality and safety. S/he will also be a key contributor to a federally-funded grant to create a Patient Imaging Quality and Safety Laboratory. Applicants are required to have strong programming and data management skills, including but not limited to proficiency in SAS, R, and SQL and experience in retrieving and analyzing data from clinical and claims databases.

Job Responsibilities:

Optimize utilization of patient-generated data for research and care; develop rapid-cycle analytic processes with associated feedback to drive improvements in quality, efficiency, and financial performance.
Extract, analyze, and present insights from clinical, administrative, and operational data; manage and improve existing databases; develop programs, methodologies, and source files for data analysis and presentation.
Provide clinical data for research projects and operational improvement initiatives; perform data analysis in support of ad-hoc requests; collaborate with researchers and administrators in refining query parameters of clinical data extraction/analytical support requests.
Combine disparate data sources into an integrated database or dataset.
Develop data extraction programs/routines for data transfer to authorized agencies or individuals.
Support DataCore clinical research projects in programming tables, listings, and figures (TLFs) using SAS (e.g. for DSMC, QA/QC, etc.).
Minimum Qualifications:
To qualify you must have a Typically requires 4 or more years of experience and BA/BS degree or equivalent.

Preferred Qualifications:
SAS Certification preferred, Experience with Population Health information and Clinical Trials

Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization.

NYU School of Medicine provides its staff with far more than just a place to work. Rather, we are an institution you can be proud of, an institution where you'll feel good about devoting your time and your talents.

NYU School of Medicine is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of recruiting and employment. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender dysphoria, national origin, age, religion, disability, military and veteran status, marital or parental status, citizenship status, genetic information or any other factor which cannot lawfully be used as a basis for an employment decision. Functional Area:
IN - Investment

AIG ASSET MANANGEMENT US LLC
Job ID: JR1905560 Business Analyst - Securities and Portfolio Analytics Services
Your Future Team
Asset Modeling Operations and Analytics Services (AMOAS) is a team within Securities and Portfolio Analytics Services function (SAPAS). SAPAS resides within COO function of AIG Investments. The AMOAS team is a highly quantitative operations team responsible for executing standard and specialized production processes that operate asset valuation and other models to produce analytics content based on unique business process and customer specifications. The AMOAS team also supports model governance and life cycle management, process analysis and documentation, service level agreements for major production processes, and operational risk initiatives including RCSA (Risk Control Self-Assessment).
Effectiveness in this role requires a unique blend of knowledge and skills, while providing exposure to virtually all asset classes and asset valuation models, and plus all production processes and content requirements as driven by a wide breadth of customers or stakeholders, both internal and external. This role provides opportunity to develop in asset valuation modeling, and transition into related roles long term.
Your Contribution at AIG
Operationalize and Manage Service Level Agreements (SLA’s)
Develop mechanism and track against stated targets
Develop and report KPI’s associated with processes and deliverables, and operational risks
Maintain and update SLA’s as processes or people or services levels change
Develop knowledge of analytics processes, production planning, production coordination, asset modeling systems, input data and data schemas, and output data schemas and data flows.
Provide back-up to lead production coordinator
Assist in operational risk management, including RCSA
Facilitate, track progress and or raise concerns on action plans associated with elevated operational risk identified via the RCSA Process and or otherwise
Assist on model life cycle management
Assist with managing model plans for new models as well as ensuring that all information associated with existing models is up to date by working with model owners/ developers and the model administration reporting system (MARS) team
Assist with quarterly updates to the model committee and yearly attestations
What we are looking for
Bachelor's degree in relevant discipline such as Business Management, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Operations Research, Information Technology or Engineering. Master's degree will be considered. Willingness or objective to pursue CFA and/or FRM Charter is a plus.
Ideally, a year or more of experience in a business analyst role; candidates with no work experience but have the related educational background and/or internships will be considered.
Someone who aspires to grow as an investment professional, but in an operations role with broad perspective.
Strong interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills, combined with process and project management orientation or foundations a must.
Exposure to process systems from experience in either IT or operations is beneficial, plus strong interest in developing expertise in both data and process systems applied in operating asset models and generation fixed income analytics is a must.
Enjoys role with a broad scope across assets, data, models, analytics, and processes, versus a role that requires deep subject matter expertise in a narrow asset class or discipline a must.
Some foundational knowledge of asset valuation modeling and/or analytics systems and processes is beneficial to this role
Ability and willingness to collaborate with internal control or monitoring functions, including Internal Audit, Operation Risk Management, Finance Control Unit, and/or Enterprise Risk Management.
Ability to work in dynamic and evolving work environment that includes tight deadlines, multiple processes operating simultaneously, plus changing or competing priorities.
Exposure to various types of stress tests or capital assessment frameworks for financial institution, or strong interest in developing knowledge about scenario based processes applied in stress tests or capital assessments.
Willingness and ability to develop a very broad, but also quite deep knowledge of the entire data and modeling infrastructure at AIG Investments, as well as all unique production processes.
Model Operators typically require intensive development and training over a period of 12 – 18 months in order to develop foundation of institutional knowledge needed to operate effectively, and relatively independently. Due to complexity of models and analytics, a strong applied quantitative modeling capability and grounding in investment analytics is also a strong plus for this position.
It has been and will continue to be the policy of American International Group, Inc., its subsidiaries and affiliates to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.

Through a wide variety of programs and initiatives, we invest in each employee, seeking to ensure that our people are not only respected as individuals, but also truly valued for their unique perspectives.

The Technical Development Business Analyst (TD-BA) is responsible for facilitating the operations data process and creation of artifacts relating to activities ensuring operational effectiveness. The TD-BA owns project goals by developing project plans, establishing deadlines, monitoring milestone completion, providing timely reporting of issues that impact progress and resolving conflicts. This includes performing research and analysis to describe and communicate the future state in a cohesive and comprehensive format. The incumbent will contribute to defining and implementing process improvement opportunities and technical design activities.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Facilitates analysis meetings and sessions in support of departmental and enterprise initiatives
Analyze, trend, report and present findings as well as create high quality visual representations for broad and diverse audiences within the organization
Create precise documents to describe specifications, capabilities, and processes associated with the assigned projects demonstrating efficiency and effectiveness
Participate in process and technical solution creation activities
Develop and maintain SAS/SQL/VBA/SharePoint reporting tools, databases and processes
Query and manipulate data to identify variance and root cause, analyze trend, summarize findings and develop recommendations for stakeholders
Work departmentally and interdepartmentally to address deficiencies and recommend implementation of creative efficiencies and modifications to existing process
Prepare routine reports as needed (financial, quality, production, operational efficiency, etc.) and other duties as assigned
Collaborate with business units to understand strategic goals and promote an environment conducive to creativity, change and information exchange
Minimum Qualifications:
High School Diploma or GED from an accredited institution
Hands on technical experience with database tools and structures
Experience in creating, editing and running queries using SAS Base, SAS Enterprise Guide, or SQL Server applications
Experience in creating, reverse-engineering and maintaining Excel/Access VBA
Demonstrated ability to create visualizations and presentations with hands on experience in PowerPoint (Themes, animations, transitions), Word (templates, outlining, themes, embedded objects) and Excel (advanced functions and formulas, pivot tables, visual presentation)
Experience gathering and communicating complex analytical business requirements in a simple and easy to understand manner to other staff. As the SME, the BA will need to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization, including technical staff, internal non-technical staff, testing teams, and business stakeholders
Ability to diagnose system deficiency and issue and provide quality assurance testing
Experience in facilitating analysis sessions
Experience with delivering presentations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work under minimum supervision with excellent time management and prioritization skill
This is a collaborative team environment. You must be able to effectively work with others, provide and implement project solutions while understanding process flows
Demonstrate consistent multi-tasking skills and planning for prioritizing workload within tight deadlines
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution
Experience and knowledge in Claims Operations, Enrollment & Billing, Members Services, or Providers Operations
Agile Experience (Scrum, Scaled Agile Framework)
VersionOne Software and/or Kanban Software Experience
Knowledge of other programming/reporting applications (i.e. Visual Basic Studio, Qlikview, Tableau, Cognos, Python, etc)
Knowledge and relevant work experience within the healthcare industry (such as a managed care organization, commercial health insurance plans, hospital, etc)
Hands-on experience with rules based table and systems (i.e. PowerMHS, Biz Talk, PEGA Preprocessor, SaleForce CRM, etc)
Knowledge of Macess or other workflow systems (i.e. MS Project, SharePoint or any other time management system or project tracking tools)
Experience with Visio
Experience with Business Process modeling

License/Certification: N/A

desc:
NY/NJ Area Business Class Lead – Transportation Data Analytics - (155163)
Description

About Us
At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.

Watch our 'About Us' video

We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward.

NY/NJ Area Business Class Lead – Transportation Data Analytics
HDR is searching for the ideal candidate to lead a diverse team of engineers and programmers to help analyze and visualize diverse sets of transportation data by leveraging the most current technologies.

As the NY/NJ Area Business Class Lead – Transportation Data Analytics, you will get the unique opportunity to work across several disciplines at HDR by applying computer science and engineering principles to solve highly complex issues and develop processes and workflows allowing others to take advantage of the streamlining. This position will require the applicant to help oversee a successful analytics team by effectively overseeing technical staff, managing resources, strengthening client relationships, work on challenging and rewarding transportation projects across the country and develop innovative processes and solutions that best serve our clients.
Keyword(s): Transportation Data Analytics

Qualifications

Required QualificationsBS/BE in Computer Engineering, Computer ScienceMS/ME in Computer Engineering or Engineering8+ years of experienceStrong communication and listening skillsAbility to handle multiple assignmentsGood leadership and organizational skillsSoftware languages include C#, python and RAdvanced Excel userExperience with traffic microsimulation software (VISSIM, Aimsun, Transmodeler)Experience with Tableau/Power BIAWS experience, elastic computing, Apache Spark and DockerProficiency with Linux

Why HDR
At HDR, we know work isn't only about who you work for; it's also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way.

Primary Location: United States-New York-New York
Industry: Highway + Road
Schedule: Full-time
Employee Status: Regular
BusinessClass: Advanced Technologies for Surface Transportation
Job Posting: Aug 5, 2019

How will this role have an impact?
This is a highly visible role as a Senior Technical Business Analyst (BA) within the healthcare space. The BA will be not only be responsible for implementing technical changes within our data pipelines, but will also take the lead on other data management initiatives throughout the organization.

What will you do?

Use your communication and analytical skills to take the lead on developing new healthcare related business processes, capabilities. This includes the implementation of company wide metrics, new data monitoring pipelines, and data ingestion tasks.
Use your Data Analyst skills to investigate data discrepancies via SQ and perform UAT.
Use your Business Analyst skills to properly document business requirements and translate those requirements to technical specs, as well as create workflow diagrams, business process maps, etc to aid in the process.
Use your critical thinking skills to help define strategies for data flow processes and be responsible for quantifying and improving data quality across multiple elements of our applications.
We are looking for someone with:
Strong technical and analytical skills with proven ability in identifying weaknesses in data flow design, recommending solutions and improving quality.
Strong experience as an Analyst creating complex SQL queries for data requests.
The skill to effectively gather requirements and translate those requirements to technical specifications that can be used for implementation of new data pipelines.
Healthcare background a plus.
Experience with AWS services such as S3, Lambda, Glue, etc a plus.
Experience with Python (Pandas, Numpy, etc) a plus.
Our benefits include but are not limited to:
 Paid Time Off
 401(k) Savings Plan with match
 Medical, Vision & Dental
 Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits
 Parental Leave
 Gym Reimbursement
 Tuition Reimbursement
About Us

Remedy Partners delivers software and services that enable payers, employers and at-risk providers to organize and finance healthcare delivery around a patient's episode of care. For healthcare providers, Remedy Partners’ software, analytics and administrative services support bundled payment contracts with Medicare and Commercial Insurers, often through shared-risk partnerships. For payers, Remedy Partners empowers the development of bundled payment contracting programs and guides development of bundled payment networks. Remedy Partners presently delivers its services to partners at more than 1,000 healthcare locations nationwide.

Please note that all Remedy employees are required to adhere to all organizational policies, the Code of Conduct and participate in all compliance-related training and education.

Morgan, Lewis & Bockius LLP, one of the world’s leading global law firms with over 4,000 lawyers and staff in 31 offices is currently seeking a Digital Marketing Analyst. Reporting to the Digital Content Manager, the Digital Marketing Analyst is responsible for collecting data, analyzing significance, and sharing learnings with our marketing and communications team and across other departments. Successful candidates will have a strong understanding of digital media and must be able to interpret results for purposes of understanding and optimizing campaigns and informing business decisions across the firm.
The position will analyze data across our digital channels to find actionable insights that will enhance user experience, gain visibility for the firm, and inform content strategy.
The analyst will own and refine the digital analytics tools and setup for all of our channels. Building useful reporting tools and dashboards will be a focus of this role. The ideal candidate is highly collaborative and brings a passion for learning, testing and data-informed decision making. Candidates must be self-motivated and detail-oriented, have outstanding organizational skills, and a strong commitment to client service. This position requires a very high energy level and flexibility with occasional overtime hours and business travel.
Responsibilities:
Leads the development of performance reporting and analyses across multiple channels and campaigns for our digital marketing team
Identifies analytics requirements for each business group (e.g., industries, practices)
Identifies and implements methods to easily organize and extract data for reporting
Manages consistent content tagging system across all platforms
Generates reports on a scheduled and ad hoc basis
Creates and maintains performance dashboard
Works with Digital Content Manager to guide optimization and test new channels and tactics
Summarizes findings and communicates updates and recommendations within the department; Keeps team updated on changes, best practices
Informs, influences, and supports stakeholders through presentation of work and consultative approach
Identifies, advocates, and implements new reporting technologies
Experience and Qualifications:
Must possess a Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Information Systems, Math, Business, or related quantitative discipline
At least three years of relevant digital marketing, web analytics, and research experience.
Advanced understanding of Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, business intelligence and reporting tools. Google Analytics Certification preferred
Knowledge of current standards in digital and interactive marketing reporting, including trends and best practices
Ability to analyze and synthesize data elements; ability to problem-solve and think strategically
Ability to explain technical complexities to non-technical colleagues and communicate results in a concise manner
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple deadlines and concurrent projects along with excellent time management
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment working successfully with all levels of seniority
Successful candidates must have a basic technical proficiency in the following:
PC Platform
Document Management software including Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel), iManage, and Adobe Acrobat
Project Management tools such as Jira, Basecamp, and Zoho
Accounting Software including Chrome River
Web analytics Software including Google Analytics. Experience with Sitecore, Siteimprove, and Sprout a plus
Social media analytics including Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, SnapChat, Instagram, and WeChat
Business Intelligence tools such as Qlik, Tableau, and MS Power BI
Communications tools including Outlook, Citrix, Blackberry, Internet Explorer, Firefox, Safari, Chrome, Opera, and WebEx
This position will be resident in the firm’s New York or Philadelphia office.
Qualified candidates must apply online by visiting our website at www.morganlewis.com and selecting “ Careers ”.

Position Summary
The Company
Operating in one of the most interesting, innovative and fluid industries, a role within Discovery’s Direct-to- consumer business offers a fantastic career opportunity.
Discovery's Digital Direct-To-Consumer business operates a group of both well established brands and well-funded start-ups. We operate teams working at the crossroads of tech and entertainment. We are fast, nimble and have fun developing new, innovative and immersive digital content for iconic brands, including Discovery Channel, Food Network, HGTV, MotorTrend Group, as well as newer brands such as GolfTV.
As content creators in the digital space, we’re building on the Discovery legacy by using technology to evolve the viewing experience… telling better, more immersive stories to millions of viewers across the Internet every day.

Our Team
It takes an army of incredibly talented, passionate and creative individuals to make this amazing content and the tech that distributes it, and that’s where we come in!
Discovery’s Talent team recruits the best talent the industry has to offer. We pride ourselves on hiring recruiters and researchers who are absolute experts at what they do. Passionate, with a keen eye for talent, well networked and up to date on industry innovations. We’re now adding to our team a Senior Data & Analytics Manager, with that same level of passion, dynamism, industry knowledge and ‘get things done’ attitude!
If this sounds like you, keep reading.

The Opportunity
Discovery Inc’s Direct- To-Consumer business is looking for a Senior Recruiting Data and Analytics Manager, who will help guide the next chapter of the business’ growth.
This role will produce business-critical people insights which enables the recruiting organization to move faster and make better decisions through the successful delivery of People analytics. This is a new role and will lay the foundation for data and analytics within the recruiting and people organization.
You’ll have the opportunity to influence the business by creatively exploring & using data to inform our decisions. You’ll be responsible for understanding what works differently for each lines of business and recommend business strategies for improving operational efficiency for a global team of recruiters, sourcers, and coordinators.
This role collaborates closely with the Director of Talent, People and Culture leadership and the business leaders help move from data and analysis to action.
Responsibilities
1. Drive and partner with people analytics to build our recruiting data roadmap and analytics reporting framework.
2. Define, evaluate and report on key metrics for the recruitment organization on a global level.
3. Partner across all levels of recruiting leadership to provide data that will lead to more informed decision making.
4. Design, build and maintain dashboards and visualizations.
5. Translate complex findings and data in a compelling and easy-to-understand narrative for the end user
6. Communicate analyses and recommendations to various cross-functional stakeholders.
7. Make recommendations to improve existing data-collection methodologies.
Use basic tools such as Excel, PowerPoint or infographics to deliver reports and dashboards
8. Create routine reports and prepare analysis of recruiting trends for existing programs and new initiatives
9. Assist in the creation of models, templates, and documentation
10. Design and recommend key metrics for talent acquisition operations to better align resources and drive better decision making
11. Identify, analyze and forecast trends into meaningful visualizations and develop presentations for leadership as needed
12. Produce and present ad hoc, monthly and quarterly talent acquisition analysis reports to support business line data activity reporting needs
13. Work with recruiting managers to develop and maintain user dashboards that display real time and on-demand KPIs for the recruiting and sourcing teams.
14. Evaluate trends on process and measuring organizational effectiveness and make recommendations for further optimization.
15. Ensure high integrity and accuracy of recruiting data through audits and governance.
Requirements
5-8 years of work experience in Data & Analytics, systems, or reporting function.Experience in statistical analysis and complex data interpretation with the ability to present. information and insights to all layers of the organization in a concise, clear, and timely manner.Advanced Excel keynote and PowerPoint Skills.Strong problem-solving capability and ability to analyze complex problems or situations and develop practical solutionsDemonstrated analytical skills and proven experience in applying a systematic and disciplined approach to resolving complex issuesAttention to detailProven ability to understand and translate customer requirements/needs when making decisionsSelf-directed with the ability to work independently and as well as part of a teamExperience working with virtual teams across diverse geographical locationsOperates with a keen sense of urgencyMust have the legal right to work in the United States
New York City, New York, NYC, NY, Bellevue, Washington, WA, Seattle

Medidata: Conquering Diseases Together
Medidata is leading the digital transformation of life sciences with the world's most-used platform for clinical development, commercial and real-world data. Powered by artificial intelligence and delivered by #1 ranked industry experts, the Intelligent Platform for Life Sciences helps pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device companies and academic researchers accelerate value, minimize risk and optimize outcomes. Medidata serves more than 1,000 customers and partners worldwide and empowers more than 100,000 certified users every day to create hope for millions of patients. Discover the future of life sciences: www.mdsol.com
We know that diverse teams win and are fully committed to selecting leaders and employees that represent the markets in which we operate. We are still led by our Co-founders, Tarek Sherif and Glen de Vries, and have global operations in US, Europe and Asia with over 2000 employees.
Your Mission:
Work independently under the direction of business leaders and product management to provide feature-based solutions that support Medidata product strategy
Develop product requirements and processes for tools that make it easy for customers and internal teams to integrate and map to our services
Work with product members to finalize product priorities, including bug fixes
Create and own the business/product requirements documentation, including user stories
Interact with other Business Analysts, Product Owners, and internal stakeholders to understand new business requirements and enhancement requests.
Collaborate with the User Experience team to design amazing workflows for our customers
Interact with architecture, engineering, and quality assurance teams during the software build and/or configuration process and testing process.
Be the subject matter expert and product expert for multiple products/services
Directly interface with business users by responding to support calls escalated by the Help Desk.
Ensure efforts to continually improve domain knowledge.
Ensure the quality of the deliverables as per the defined defects meet specific standards
Provide accurate and timely information and escalates when there are issues.
Actively participate in meetings, including all agile ceremonies, and make valuable contributions.
Your Competencies:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to interact with technical resources and effectively communicate technical information and processes to relevant stakeholders
Ability to translate business needs to a technical team, including creating user stories, documenting use cases, acceptance criteria, and feature overviews
Critical thinking: Analysis and problem-solving skills to address core business problems; Ability to effectively evaluate a problem or situation from all angles to determine the most appropriate solution
Ability to prioritize your own time and juggle many competing priorities
Technical/software development experience a plus
Possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy
Skilled at creating business cases that meet product and strategic company objectives
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, continually evolving environment
Your Education & Experience:
Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 8 years of related experience; or an advanced degree 5+ years experience
Relevant experience with SaaS products, Life Sciences, and/or highly regulated industries strongly preferred
Agile experience strongly preferred
Medidata is making a real difference in the lives of patients everywhere by accelerating critical drug and medical device development, enabling life-saving drugs and medical devices to get to market faster. Our products sit at the convergence of the Technology and Life Sciences industries, one of most exciting areas for global innovation. Nine of the top 10 best-selling drugs in 2017 were developed on the Medidata platform.
Medidata’s solutions have powered over 14,000 clinical trials giving us the largest collection of clinical trial data in the world. With this asset, we pioneer innovative, advanced applications and intelligent data analytics, bringing an unmatched level of quality and efficiency to clinical trials enabling treatments to reach waiting patients sooner

job_title: Sr. Specialist, Business Technology Liaison-Business Analyst
desc:
Consults with stakeholders to analyze, define, and prioritize business requirements and functional and operational specifications for a functional work stream. Formulates and defines program scope and objectives for the work stream with thorough understanding of business processes in a specific business domain. Represents the business to all areas of IT in resolving issues and developing technology solutions. May lead staff on specific projects. Elicits, challenges, and prioritizes business requirements. Translates into functional design and use case models. Develops project scope and identifies objectives, constraints, issues, risks and assumptions for large programs. Is accountable for overall delivery of assigned functional work stream on a large-scale program. Aligns resources, seeks input from key constituents, and manages others to achieve desired results. Provides guidance on development of the functional requirements and user documentation. Assists in developing implementation/conversion strategy and implementation plan. Manages scope and change throughout the initiative utilizing formal change control and requirements traceability. Gathers and analyzes information and develops recommendations to address major business objectives that span multiple, global business and technology areas. Works with business and technology teams to develop technology roadmap strategy. Trains users on new or enhanced applications and/or systems of higher complexity. Serves as point of contact or subject matter expert for the business on specific systems. Provides technical consultation concerning business implications of complex application development projects. Supports testing of new or enhanced applications and/or systems and provides guidance to junior team members on complex testing tasks including case development, requirement traceability analysis, test preparation, script writing, and functional test execution. Uses deep expertise and broad knowledge of regulatory and legal requirements and BNY Mellon corporate policies involving risk and control to support the development of improved business processes through technology. May lead a small team on moderately complex projects. No direct reports, provides guidance to less experienced colleagues. Leads projects and allocates work accordingly. Contributes to the achievement of related teams objectives.

Qualifications
Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 7-10 years of total work experience preferred. Technical experience preferred.


BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.
Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.
