job_title: Product Owner (Business Analyst with Healthcare IT Experienc...
Business Analyst II /Senior Business Analyst - GRS Actuarial...
desc:
Advance your career at Liberty Mutual - A Fortune 100 Company! Global Risk Solutions, Home Office is seeking a Business Analyst II or Senior Business Analyst to join the team. GRS Actuarial HO is responsible for maintaining balance sheet integrity by ensuring reserves are enough to meet our obligations to our policyholders. The HO team partners with key stakeholders to ensure the necessary methodologies and tools are in place to analyze our reserve adequacy by providing critical information and tools on a recurring basis and continuously finding ways to improve the effectiveness of reserving methods and processes.
In this role, you will use your analytical skills to assist in resolution of thought provoking business problems and bring value to various internal teams. You will be directly involved in the maintenance and improvement of existing reserving processes, methodologies and tools, working closely with different stakeholders throughout the company.
This position will be located in New York (potentially Boston).
 Responsibilities:
Supporting the quarterly reserving process by maintaining and validating data for use in tools and systems.
Enhancing and preparing reserving and reporting tools.
Assisting Reserving analysts with ResQ reserving software, other reserving tools and output results.
Validating data results, partnering with the data strategy team to investigate, quantify and communicate drivers of data changes and their resulting impacts and potential risks.
Supporting numerous ad hoc projects.
Driving opportunities to improve process improvement initiatives in support of GRS reserving team goals and cross-functional needs.
Develops, modifies and distributes standards and ad hoc reports/dashboards to better understand the overall business and/or unit. Develops presentations and shares findings as well as recommendations.
Working collaboratively with internal parties such as finance, IT, audit and other partners and stakeholders using strong communication skills.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree required.
2+ years of relevant experience to include business analysis work.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Effective communication skills.
Ability to work independently or part of a team.
Solid knowledge of business practices and processes.
Strong proficiency with Excel spreadsheets and data manipulation is expected.
Proficiency in SQL is required.
Familiarity with VBA, R, Python a plus
Strong knowledge of available data sources, strengths and shortcomings.
Benefits: We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits Overview: At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed. We’re dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

Job Brief
Data Analyst- Advertising and Brand

Position Title; Data Analyst

Location: NYC

About Phoenix Marketing International:

At Phoenix, you will experience an entrepreneurial culture and collaborate with team members who are innovative and passionate about their work. Founded in 1999, Phoenix Marketing International has over 400 employees across the globe, including New York City, Oldsmar, Boston, Branchburg, Atlanta, Chicago, Detroit, Philadelphia, San Francisco, Hamburg, Mexico City, Toronto, Shanghai, Sydney, Munich, and London. Phoenix MI is considered one of the Top Research Firms in the US (American Marketing Association Gold Report), and is one of the fastest growing Market Research firms in the world. Phoenix MI works in all major industries, helping its clients build and measure brands and communications, create and refine the products and services that they deliver, and optimize their customers’ experience.

Come join the Phoenix team!

About the Position:

Phoenix's AdPi group is seeking an experienced advertising researcher to join the team. Overall, we are looking for someone with passion for research and a desire to develop skills related to custom advertising research – from message testing, to copy testing, to sponsorship evaluation. This individual would join the existing team based in New York and work on an array of custom projects, with responsibilities spanning client management, project management, and data analysis.
What you will be doing:
The Data Analyst, Communications and Brand Analytics will:

Working on multiple projects/priorities at a time
Independently managing data collection and data processing on projects with varying complexity
Execution, Development and / or proofing of various PowerPoint and excel-based deliverables
Interpretation of higher-level analytics to articulate findings for client-facing deliverables
Troubleshoot and / or identify potential data issues when they arise and recommend approaches/solutions
Daily communication with vendors, other Phoenix teams, and Phoenix client managers


The ideal candidate has:

A Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or similar field
Experience working in an Advertising Environment
At least 2 years of work experience involving data management
Strong proficiency in SPSS, data manipulation, PowerPoint, and Excel
Strong analytic ability and attention to detail
Effective communication skills
Ability to multitask
Individual time management skills to maintain schedules and meet deadlines
Successful applicants will be asked to provide documentation certifying that they are legally eligible to work in the United States.

company: VISITING NURSE SERVICE OF NEW YORK
desc:
Overview
The Visiting Nurse Service of New York (VNSNY) is the nation's largest not-for-profit home- and community-based health care organization, serving the five boroughs of New York City, and Nassau, Suffolk, and Westchester Counties. For 125 years, VNSNY has been committed to meeting the health care needs of New Yorkers with compassionate, high-quality home health care. We offer a wide range of services, programs, and health plans to meet the diverse needs of our patients, members, and clients from before birth to the end of life.
Each day, more than 13,000 VNSNY employees - including nurses, rehabilitation therapists, social workers, other allied professionals, and paraprofessionals - deliver compassionate care, unparalleled medical expertise, and 24/7 solutions and resources to more than 48,000 patients and members, helping them to live the best lives possible in their homes and communities.
Responsibilities and Qualifications
Compiles, analyzes, and reports on CHOICE health plan product data for the by leveraging relevant data to support strategic business decisions. Provides reporting and analytical support in the use of clinical, financial, and operational data as well as in the interpretation of healthcare policy in order to ensure that effective, timely, and accurate information is supplied by the department to internal and external business customers. Coordinates with the CHOICE business operations and the product management team in reporting on key performance indicators and driving efficiencies through better data capture and process improvement. Works under general supervision.
Designs queries, collects raw data from disparate sources and database systems, and provides analysis to identify operational trends in efficiency, turnaround times, utilization patterns, productivity, etc. as well as develops analytical plans aimed at improving specific performance indicators, such as reducing call center call-handling time, raising member retention rate, reducing hospitalizations, and tracking utilization trends.
Gathers requirements from stakeholder units, performs systems analysis and solution design, tests new or enhanced systems and workflows, and develops support documentation to meet new operational needs.
Performs root cause analysis to identify gaps in current workflows; meets with department leadership to solicit cooperation, establish priorities, and resolve problems. Provides business owners with analytical support for resolution of data management and business problems.
Uses mathematical and analytical methods to assess efficiency of health plan processes; investigates workflow, data management and other operational issues; identifies and solves problems; and makes recommendations for new systems or related procedures.
Develops a strong understanding of how clinical operational workflows, care management workflows, and business process changes map to data stored within database systems and ensures that this knowledge is disseminated to team members and other data consumers.
Participates in defining the scope of projects, developing project plans, and ensuring momentum of projects toward stated goals. Tracks and monitors project work plans, including objectives, tasks, and time frames, to ensure deliverables are completed on time. Identifies and responds to changing project circumstances and communicates issues to project leadership.
Assists various health plan operational areas to develop reports that increase visibility into operations and facilitate process improvement.
Promotes efforts to improve access to information and the ability of business staff at all levels to use data to generate change and improvements. Utilizes the most effective technology to distribute findings and disseminate information.
Ensures presentation of metrics and data is consistently defined, formatted, and labeled across end-user deliverables and reports.
Keeps abreast of developments in Medicare and Medicaid payment models, value-based payment models, and relevant industry quality, process, and performance metrics.
Works with the business leads to make process enhancements that allow for appropriate data capture and defines the requirements for the business intelligence and analytics teams to build dashboards for oversight and monitoring.
Coordinates and performs data quality exploration and validation on new data sources.
Participates in special projects and performs other duties as required.
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration, statistics, epidemiology, mathematics, computer science or social sciences, or related field of study required. Master’s degree in related field preferred.
Experience: Minimum of two years of progressive work experience in applied health care, consulting, clinical data analysis, or a related field required. Experience with large data sets and/or the analysis of member/patient-level healthcare data required. Experience with data extraction and manipulation required. Intermediate to advanced level of proficiency with data modeling and analytics required. Proficiency with MS Excel functions, including macros, pivot tables, filtering and formatting, required. Strong data application, informatics and analytical skills required. Knowledge of relational databases and programming experience in SQL required. Knowledge of home care, community-based service delivery, and Medicare/Medicaid payment policy preferred. Experience with statistical software (R, SAS, Python) and business intelligence applications (Microstrategy, Tableau, R-Shiny) preferred.
CA2019

EquiLend is seeking a Business Analyst to be responsible for managing and executing projects, and implementing solutions that build upon and enhance Trading or Post trading global electronic platforms. As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with Trading or Post Trading Project Manager, Product Owner, and Scrum Team to execute projects from inception through production release. This individual will be hands-on and involved in all phases of a project, from analysis and requirements gathering to functional design, testing, and implementation. The selected candidate will often be involved in multiple projects and will work closely with clients, Developers, Product Strategy, Sales, Application Support, and QA teams.
Strong skills required in project management, communication, project implementation, and agile development methodologies. A working knowledge of SQL/TOAD and UNIX is also required.

Responsibilities
Manage all project tasks; ensure that all milestone dates are met on-time and on-budget with a high degree of quality
Lead and facilitate client meetings and internal discussions in order to define and prioritize business requirements
Dissect high-level information into details and communicate these details in a manner understood by relevant audiences
Analyze client business requirements and Production data, and present findings and recommendations to internal teams
Analyze and identify required changes to the system based on client/business needs
Dissect a complex problem into component parts and identify the most efficient technical solution
Formulate logic for new systems, prepare workflows and flowcharts, and create documentation to communicate requirements to developers
Develop detailed user stories and acceptance criteria outlining the solution to be implemented
Work with the Development team during the functional design phase to confirm the viability of designs
Work with QA team to:
Complete internal test preparation by creating test cases, test conditions, and test data
Execute testing internally, inclusive of documenting results, tracking defects, and trouble-shooting defects and issues that arise out of testing
Plan, coordinate, and execute User Acceptance Tests with clients
Create and/or update platform documentation to support new releases
Assist the Application Support team with production implementation, issues, and inquiries during the initial release phase
Learn the underlying securities finance business at a detailed and technical level

Requirements
3-5 years of Business Analyst and Project Management experience
Experienced in agile methodologies from an implementation standpoint
Experienced in the development of associated artifacts
College Degree required
Graduates with a technical degree background preferred (MIS, CS, mathematics, software engineering)
Knowledge of:
Agile
SQL/TOAD
UNIX
XML
Visio
MS Office tools
Detail-oriented and ability to effectively manage multiple work efforts
Excellent organizational, time, and project management skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to handle complex information with accuracy and attention to detail
Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities
Strong presentation and written/verbal communication skills
Experienced in facilitating discussions with clients and internal teams
Demonstrated ability to build rapport and interact effectively with all levels and areas of an organization
Good judgment, high ethical standards, and a strong work ethic are a must
Knowledge of securities finance or capital markets is a plus

job_title: CIS Quality Assurance Analyst (Clinical Business Analyst Lev...
desc:
Marketing Statement

Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible
NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

Job Description

The Quality Assurance Analyst, Level II will be responsible for testing various CIS systems/applications as a part of a multidisciplinary functional team. This position is responsible for working closely with the clinical business analysts, developers, and QA peers to create and execute test cases/scenarios derived from design/business/technical specifications and requirements; performing manual testing with guidance from QA leads and testing coordinator; identifying and logging defects found in testing and retesting to verify defect resolution. The QA Analyst will perform and coordinate testing efforts to support implementation, development and enhancements as well as document and communicate the results to the project team. The analyst is also required to have proficiency with standard quality assurance processes and related standards with the ability to work independently as well as in a team. Positions in this function are involved in developing and implementing efficient and effective test plans for new systems, problems and/or enhancements, including thorough understanding of QA methodology, processes and associated testing tools.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Create and maintain test documentation as defined by the H+H CIS Standard Software Testing Life Cycle (STLC) process including but not limited to:
Test Scripts/Test Cases/Test Scenarios
Test Plans
Peer/Technical review logs o Collaborative Review notes o Meeting minutes/agendas
Project Status
Reports (Feasibility study, recommendations, suggestions etc.)
Comply with and enforce the standards and strategies of the H+H CIS Standard Software Testing Life Cycle (STLC).
Assist in designing test strategies and implement test cases to ensure highest quality deliverables.
Identify, request and review test data for testing.
Communicate with Clinical Business Analysts, Developers and QA peers to understand/clarify requirements.
Analyze test result, identify and report defects/issues in defect tracking system.
Work collaboratively with Clinical Business Analysts, Developers and QA peers to identify, replicate and resolve issues.
Participate in business workflow and systems requirement review when necessary.
Perform peer reviews on other team members’ deliverables.
Control and manage daily test activities for assigned area or application(s).
Be able to assess risk and work with QA lead in formulating approaches for mitigation of risk.
Be able to participate in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Go-Live deployment support at various H+H facilities, if required.
Participate in production support when required.
Must be able to multi-task in order to work concurrently on several projects, each with design/business/technical specifications that may differ from project to project.
Provide project management team with identified risks, concerns, and ambiguities discovered during the gathering of requirements for testing; assist team in developing solutions. Partner with project managers to complete requirements documentation in accordance with project schedule.
Plan, organize, facilitate and lead meetings and workgroups as well as oversee and execute follow-up activities.
Must be able to focus on deadlines and deliverables and be detail oriented.
Must be able to work independently yet be a strong team player supporting a positive work environment, encouraging teamwork and flexibility with superior work ethic and integrity.
Ensure software development team accounts for all defined requirements in coordination with quality assurance team. Ensure that all quality standards comply with internal policies and industry standards.
Document changes to baseline requirements through standard change control process. Document software test plans, technical requirements, release notes, user and training guidelines and other materials.
Plan, coordinate, and support unit acceptance testing and subsequent deployments in coordination with other team leaders.
Perform end user and application support functions including problem solving and resolution of application function defects.
Provide systems and application training as required
Develop and execute project presentations.
Participate in special projects as required.
Provide training to and serve as a mentor for Junior Clinical Business Analysts and/or other appropriate project team members. Manage and evaluate work products for assigned team members.
Participate in the development of various departmental training initiatives.
Interview Junior Clinical QA Analysts and/or other appropriate project team members.
Due to the responsibilities of your position, you will be required to work beyond your regularly scheduled hours.
Minimum Qualifications

1. A Masters degree or advanced clinical degree from an accredited college or university and one (1) year of experience gathering and documenting business, clinical, and/or functional requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis or related in a clinical, allied health, non-allied health, behavioral health, information technology, information services, business, analytics or related area; or, one (1) year of experience in a relevant clinical and/or healthcare administration role/function; or
2. A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university and three (3) years of experience as described above; or
3. A satisfactory combination of education, training, and experience.
4. Specialty certification(s) issued by a national commercially available program, state, professional society, academic or technical institution in an area(s) listed above, may be credited on a month-to-month basis toward the required work experience for a total of one (1) year.

Department Preferences

Work experience of 4+ years in software quality assurance, preferably Healthcare domain
Knowledge of various types of testing like Application, Functional, Negative, Regression, Integration, UAT etc.
Exposure to various Change management, test management and automation tools like Remedy, ServiceNow JIRA, etc.
Epic certification is a plus
Excellent interpersonal skills (Listening, Written and Verbal communication
Strong desktop skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio).
Participate in special projects as needed and perform other duties as assigned
Must be able to work independently as well as work as part of a fast moving team
How To Apply

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button or mail your resume, noting the above Job ID #, to:
NYC Health + Hospitals
Talent AcquisitionHuman Resources Department
55 Water Street, 26th Floor
New York, NY 10041
Attn: Talent Acquisition
If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.

job_title: Clinical Business Analyst- Level III- EITS

desc:
If you’re passionate about becoming a Nationwide associate and believe you have the potential to be something great, let’s talk.
Number 57 on the Fortune Magazine 100 Best Places to Work.
*ADDITIONAL INFORMATION - PLEASE READ CAREFULLY*


Compensation Grade: F2


Please note that the job may be filled at either the Spec, Lead Business Info or Sr Business Info Analyst level depending on the qualifications and related experience of the chosen applicants.


About the Job

Support the development, enhancement, and delivery of monthly and ad-hoc reports that aid the surety underwriting team
Extracting data from multiple data sources using SQL for Oracle
Manipulate data in SQL and/or Excel
Present data in an organized and professional manner that provides surety leadership with the information that is relevant to their decision making and evaluation process
Support the development of Gross Written Premium forecasts for each team within the surety organization
Assist in the surety team's transition from a legacy underwriting account management system to a new platform
Assist in the optimization of underwriting procedures by identifying trends and inefficiencies in current practices
Communicate with members of the surety underwriting team to develop an understanding of their business information needs
Provide general analytical support to help the surety team plan for profitable growth
Build bond configurations in the new account management platform on an as requested basis
Support the documentation of best practices and job aids that would provide the needed continuity if new analysts joined the team or ever needed to replicate existing procedures
Tracking of underwriting authority to ensure that appropriate procedures were followed when processing bonds
Self check work by consistently performing reasonability checks on reports before sending to the surety underwriting team

About You

Strong Excel Skills required
SQL for Oracle environment comfort preferred
Work well with a collaborative, all hands on deck, team environment and provide the willingness to support tasks outside of the scope of responsibilities listed above



JOB SUMMARY: Partners with internal customers in determining data and information needs, and in determining the use of information to aid them in making business decisions. Identifies and executes appropriate research methodologies that will provide the information needed in an understandable format. Serves as lead to other analysts and/or as a subject matter expert for information needs and analysis . Plans and supports information project needs, special reporting, and new technology.
Job Description
Reports to: Manager/Director; may serve in a group/team leader role over 1-6 business information associates.

Key Responsibilities:
JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. Functions as the expert in data extraction from databases, tables, data warehouses, and other sources Observes customer operations and proactively presents recommendations that will assist customers in making decisions regarding their operations. Develops, produces and maintains ad hoc and custom reports for information needs and analysis. Determines the level of information analysis needed based on customer needs and data availability. Uses various data access tools to pull information for reports and analysis.


2. Maintains the integrity of information in internal data bases. Using statistical analysis, identifies gaps in the data presented and makes recommendations for data maintenance.


3. Retrieves data from internal and external sources and data files in order to keep internal databases current and usable. Exports information to external sources.


4. Determines appropriate information and analysis to be shared with customers. Shares reports and information with appropriate area of the company as assigned.


5. Supports the research, analysis and presentation of information by: monitoring external sources, creating custom reports, compiling and summarizing information, producing supporting documentation and exhibits, and verification of information received from external sources.


6. May maintain personal computer hardware. and software.


7. Assists other associates with preparation of reports and use of information systems, software and related sources of information. Trains other users on report preparation and data base access.


8. Leads special projects, and serves as point of contact for projects.


9. Presents actionable recommendations , presentations, reports, and documents to help with the use of the information. Monitors, reviews and analyzes the external environment to support the research and analysis done with data extracted form internal sources. Presents and discusses these findings with customers.


10. Performs other duties as assigned.


MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS :

Education: Undergraduate studies in business, insurance, mathematics or related field. Prefer degree or professional insurance coursework.


Experience: Six years experience in a business information analysis role, or similar business related position that involves analysis, problem solving, planning, coordinating and organizing.


Knowledge: In-depth knowledge of business information analysis concepts, data mining, various data sources insurance policies and procedures, customer service concepts and practices. Familiarity with product terminology, processes, regulatory and compliance issues is desired.


Skills: Verbal and written communication skills for interaction within the functional area, information documentation and report formulation. Ability to understand business information needs and to analyze data requests. Ability to work under tight time constraints. Ability to effectively operate a personal computer with business software applications for data import/export, manipulation, reporting and analysis.


Staffing Exceptions to the above Minimum Job Requirements must be approved by the: Business Unit Director/Officer and the HR Representative.


JOB CONDITIONS:

Overtime Elibigility: Not Eligible (exempt)


Working Conditions: Normal office environment. Extended periods of personal computer usage and report/information verification. Occasional extended and non-standard hours based on business information needs.


ADA: The above statements cover what are generally believed to the principal and essential function of this job. Specific circumstances may allow or require some associated assigned to the job to perform a somewhat different combination of duties


Job Evaluation Activity: Evaluated 05/07/2004 SMP

Additional Job Description

How will this role have an impact?
This is a highly visible role as a Senior Technical Business Analyst (BA) within the healthcare space. The BA will be not only be responsible for implementing technical changes within our data pipelines, but will also take the lead on other data management initiatives throughout the organization.

What will you do?

Use your communication and analytical skills to take the lead on developing new healthcare related business processes, capabilities. This includes the implementation of company wide metrics, new data monitoring pipelines, and data ingestion tasks.
Use your Data Analyst skills to investigate data discrepancies via SQ and perform UAT.
Use your Business Analyst skills to properly document business requirements and translate those requirements to technical specs, as well as create workflow diagrams, business process maps, etc to aid in the process.
Use your critical thinking skills to help define strategies for data flow processes and be responsible for quantifying and improving data quality across multiple elements of our applications.
We are looking for someone with:
Strong technical and analytical skills with proven ability in identifying weaknesses in data flow design, recommending solutions and improving quality.
Strong experience as an Analyst creating complex SQL queries for data requests.
The skill to effectively gather requirements and translate those requirements to technical specifications that can be used for implementation of new data pipelines.
Healthcare background a plus.
Experience with AWS services such as S3, Lambda, Glue, etc a plus.
Experience with Python (Pandas, Numpy, etc) a plus.
Our benefits include but are not limited to:
 Paid Time Off
 401(k) Savings Plan with match
 Medical, Vision & Dental
 Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits
 Parental Leave
 Gym Reimbursement
 Tuition Reimbursement
About Us

Remedy Partners delivers software and services that enable payers, employers and at-risk providers to organize and finance healthcare delivery around a patient's episode of care. For healthcare providers, Remedy Partners’ software, analytics and administrative services support bundled payment contracts with Medicare and Commercial Insurers, often through shared-risk partnerships. For payers, Remedy Partners empowers the development of bundled payment contracting programs and guides development of bundled payment networks. Remedy Partners presently delivers its services to partners at more than 1,000 healthcare locations nationwide.

Please note that all Remedy employees are required to adhere to all organizational policies, the Code of Conduct and participate in all compliance-related training and education.

job_title: Business Analyst - Securities and Portfolio Analytics Servic...
desc:
Functional Area:
IN - Investment
Estimated Travel Percentage (%): No Travel
Relocation Provided: No
AIG ASSET MANANGEMENT US LLC
Job ID: JR1905560 Business Analyst - Securities and Portfolio Analytics Services
Your Future Team
Asset Modeling Operations and Analytics Services (AMOAS) is a team within Securities and Portfolio Analytics Services function (SAPAS). SAPAS resides within COO function of AIG Investments. The AMOAS team is a highly quantitative operations team responsible for executing standard and specialized production processes that operate asset valuation and other models to produce analytics content based on unique business process and customer specifications. The AMOAS team also supports model governance and life cycle management, process analysis and documentation, service level agreements for major production processes, and operational risk initiatives including RCSA (Risk Control Self-Assessment).
Effectiveness in this role requires a unique blend of knowledge and skills, while providing exposure to virtually all asset classes and asset valuation models, and plus all production processes and content requirements as driven by a wide breadth of customers or stakeholders, both internal and external. This role provides opportunity to develop in asset valuation modeling, and transition into related roles long term.
Your Contribution at AIG
Operationalize and Manage Service Level Agreements (SLA’s)
Develop mechanism and track against stated targets
Develop and report KPI’s associated with processes and deliverables, and operational risks
Maintain and update SLA’s as processes or people or services levels change
Develop knowledge of analytics processes, production planning, production coordination, asset modeling systems, input data and data schemas, and output data schemas and data flows.
Provide back-up to lead production coordinator
Assist in operational risk management, including RCSA
Facilitate, track progress and or raise concerns on action plans associated with elevated operational risk identified via the RCSA Process and or otherwise
Assist on model life cycle management
Assist with managing model plans for new models as well as ensuring that all information associated with existing models is up to date by working with model owners/ developers and the model administration reporting system (MARS) team
Assist with quarterly updates to the model committee and yearly attestations
What we are looking for
Bachelor's degree in relevant discipline such as Business Management, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Operations Research, Information Technology or Engineering. Master's degree will be considered. Willingness or objective to pursue CFA and/or FRM Charter is a plus.
Ideally, a year or more of experience in a business analyst role; candidates with no work experience but have the related educational background and/or internships will be considered.
Someone who aspires to grow as an investment professional, but in an operations role with broad perspective.
Strong interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills, combined with process and project management orientation or foundations a must.
Exposure to process systems from experience in either IT or operations is beneficial, plus strong interest in developing expertise in both data and process systems applied in operating asset models and generation fixed income analytics is a must.
Enjoys role with a broad scope across assets, data, models, analytics, and processes, versus a role that requires deep subject matter expertise in a narrow asset class or discipline a must.
Some foundational knowledge of asset valuation modeling and/or analytics systems and processes is beneficial to this role
Ability and willingness to collaborate with internal control or monitoring functions, including Internal Audit, Operation Risk Management, Finance Control Unit, and/or Enterprise Risk Management.
Ability to work in dynamic and evolving work environment that includes tight deadlines, multiple processes operating simultaneously, plus changing or competing priorities.
Exposure to various types of stress tests or capital assessment frameworks for financial institution, or strong interest in developing knowledge about scenario based processes applied in stress tests or capital assessments.
Willingness and ability to develop a very broad, but also quite deep knowledge of the entire data and modeling infrastructure at AIG Investments, as well as all unique production processes.
Model Operators typically require intensive development and training over a period of 12 – 18 months in order to develop foundation of institutional knowledge needed to operate effectively, and relatively independently. Due to complexity of models and analytics, a strong applied quantitative modeling capability and grounding in investment analytics is also a strong plus for this position.
It has been and will continue to be the policy of American International Group, Inc., its subsidiaries and affiliates to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.
At AIG, we believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our future and our mission – creating a foundation for a creative workplace that leads to innovation, growth, and profitability. Through a wide variety of programs and initiatives, we invest in each employee, seeking to ensure that our people are not only respected as individuals, but also truly valued for their unique perspectives.

job_title: Data Analytics and Quality Assurance Manager, Royalties and...
desc:
We are looking for a Data Analytics and Quality Assurance Manager to work with our Royalties and Accounting data team. Your mission will be to perform analytics over royalties and financial data to provide insights to internal and external stakeholders, operate and enhance the end to end data controls, and support the data operations for monthly royalty calculations.

What You’ll Do

Who You Are

A self starter with the ability to work independently to propose and lead the development of solutions to address business needs

You have a strong control and quality mindset and experience in designing, developing and testing data controls
You have excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills and the ability to prioritize and deliver results in a fast moving company with a wide variety of strategic initiatives
The ideal candidate has previous experience working with configuring and testing financial systems, and/or performing analysis royalties related data

SQL
Python / Pandas
Big Query / Google Cloud Platform
Tableau, Qliksense, or other visualization tools
Command Line Operations

Job Description

Within the Dailymotion’s AdTech department, we are looking for someone to join the Business Operations & Analytics team, in our NYC office. The team’s mission statement is to drive growth, deliver insights & scale efficiency for the AdTech, Sales & Content tribes.
As Sr. Business Operations Analyst – Programmatic, you will act as a true internal consultant to support our Programmatic Business and actively contribute to the success of the Programmatic Partnerships team, with revenue growth as your #1 priority.
You will have to wear 2 hats to be successful at this job:Business Analyst: provide relevant and actionable insights, drive better business understanding and help the team make data-driven decisionsProject Manager: identify pain points, implement your recommendations concretely and drive efficiency, by providing both strategic thinking and structured project management capabilities
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
Partner closely with the Programmatic Partnerships team to develop and execute their roadmap and business planMonitor frequently our multiple buyers spend and improve reactivity of the team to fix issuesPerform regular analysis of our Programmatic Business and provide recommendations on how to unlock more revenueDevelop our Business insight via better Reporting & Dashboarding using both our internal and external dataDrive large cross-functional projects, partnering with multiple stakeholders to implement your business recommendationsHelp our Operations team develop our Programmatic Marketplace and facilitate the go-to-market of new offers to our different demand sourcesScale tools and processes to improve the DSPs/SSPs relationship cycle (automation, CRM, regular business reviews…)Provide high quality consulting and analytics support across a variety of strategic team initiatives,Qualifications

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOUJoin Dailymotion during a key period of growth and development, with multiple key projects being launched from the ground-up to achieve very ambitious goals over the next few yearsJoin a growing team with many processes to improve and projects to implement, with the opportunity to play a key role and bring new ideas to the table

company: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
desc:
Senior Business Analyst (Fedwire Securities Services)-261346
Federal Reserve Bank of New York
Primary Location NY-New York City
Full-time / Part-time Full-time
Employee Status Regular
Overtime Status Exempt
Job Type Experienced
Travel No
Shift Day Job
At the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, the work we do is consequential and challenging. Our environment encourages growth and diversity. Our employees flourish in a team-oriented atmosphere and are dedicated to the important mission of the New York Fed.

What we do:

The Federal Reserve Banks’ Fedwire® Securities Service is an electronic central securities depository (CSD), maintaining 1.3 million securities with a par value of $85 trillion at the end of 2018. It is also a real-time gross securities settlement system (SSS) that in 2018 processed on average $1.2 trillion of transfers every business day. The Service supports 18 domestic and international organizations in the issuance of new securities and the payment of principal and interest on outstanding securities, including the U.S. Treasury, Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac, and Ginnie Mae. The Service also provides securities account maintenance, transfer, and delivery-versus-payment settlement services to the issuers and approximately 3,830 depository institution customers as of year-end 2018. Its goal is to foster the integrity, efficiency, and accessibility of U.S. wholesale payments and settlement systems in support of financial stability and economic growth.

The Wholesale Product Office (WPO) at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York is the central office responsible for product management, oversight, and coordination of the Fedwire Funds Service, Fedwire Securities Service, and National Settlement Service, collectively known as the Wholesale Services. The team seeks a well-rounded business analyst with primary responsibility for analytics, data modeling, and process improvement, in support of the Fedwire Securities Service.

Your role as Fedwire® Securities Service Associate:
Build subject matter expertise to lead or provide business support for initiatives or projects related to enhancing the Fedwire Securities Service
Participate in projects geared towards the implementation of repeatable product development, technological enhancements, contingency planning, risk reduction, and/or improved customer service
Collect, research, and analyze volume, value, market, and industry trends and other data, drawing appropriate conclusions, in support of projects related to the Fedwire Securities Service. Present results in written reports or through verbal presentations using visual aids
Provide extensive data analytics to maintain, enhance, and create new models to support discussion of pricing strategies for the Fedwire Securities Service to ensure full cost recovery while maintaining price competitiveness
Support initiatives which will include downloading and assembling data sets; preparing charts, tables and presentations; creating and maintaining spreadsheets; using statistical, econometric and other software packages to perform analyses, model estimation and simulations; and be able to summarize findings
Actively participate in or lead workgroups and meetings with internal and external stakeholders and provide support to industry meetings as needed
Create and monitor dashboards for tracking activity and trends across product lines
Develop and maintain business and technical documentation
Provide recommendations to leadership related to projects, functions, and processes
What we are looking for:
Approximately five to seven years of related experience working with and analyzing complex data sets to draw conclusions and working on initiatives to improve a product or service
Bachelor degree in Economics, Mathematics, Finance, Statistics or related field; Master’s degree preferred
Demonstrated experience in using complex databases and statistical packages (e.g. Stata, Matlab, SAS, R, Gauss, TSP, RATS, PROCSQL), or other significant computer programming experience (Python, Java, C++, Mathematica, etc.)
Proven experience in business and data analysis and an ability to analyze large amounts of information and data to draw conclusions
Strong analytical and problem solving skills including the ability to provide clear, concise, and accurate management summaries
Proven ability to manage multiple priorities/projects and work under tight deadlines, while providing high quality products
Proficient computer skills, such as Excel, Word, Access, Power Point, Tableau, etc.
An understanding of the Fedwire Services and U.S. payment systems, with knowledge of marketable securities preferred but not necessary
Experience questioning assumptions and conventional thinking/practice to continuously improve processes
Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills, including formal presentation skills for executive audiences
Background in taking the initiative to enhance analysis that deepens the understanding of business drivers, trends, and market developments
Ability to interact with all levels of management, other Federal Reserve Banks, and external market participants
Strong collaboration skills with teams, particularly remote working relationships

The Federal Reserve Bank of New York is committed to a diverse workforce and to providing equal employment opportunity to all persons without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, disability, or military service.

Screening Requirement: This position has additional screening requirements due to the information accessed while performing the job. These additional screenings would be initiated at the time of offer acceptance and can take up to two months to be completed. You can begin work before the screening is completed; however, continued employment is contingent on acceptable screening results. The screening includes areas such as education/employment verification, criminal history, credit history, and contact with your references and people that know you well.

Why the Fed:
Working at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York positions you at the center of the financial world with a unique perspective on national and international markets and economies. You'll work in an environment with a diverse group of talented professionals to foster and support the safety, soundness, and vitality of our economic and financial systems. It's a challenge that demands the skills of a financial service professional and the intellectual curiosity of an academic—all combined with a passion for public service.

The Federal Reserve Bank of New York is committed to a work environment that respects and fully values the strengths and differences of its people. Working at the New York Fed provides talented professionals the chance to grow their skills at an institution that has served a critical role in the financial system of the United States and the world for over a century. An important component of the Bank’s diversity effort is our partnership with several professional non-profit organizations, including INROADS, JumpStart Advisory Group, NBDC Emerging Leaders, Seizing Every Opportunity, National Black MBA, Out for Undergrad, Prospanica and Reaching Out MBA. Click here to learn more.

company: VISITING NURSE SERVICE OF NEW YORK
desc:
Overview
The Visiting Nurse Service of New York (VNSNY) is the nation's largest not-for-profit home- and community-based health care organization, serving the five boroughs of New York City, and Nassau, Suffolk, and Westchester Counties. For 125 years, VNSNY has been committed to meeting the health care needs of New Yorkers with compassionate, high-quality home health care. We offer a wide range of services, programs, and health plans to meet the diverse needs of our patients, members, and clients from before birth to the end of life.
Each day, more than 13,000 VNSNY employees - including nurses, rehabilitation therapists, social workers, other allied professionals, and paraprofessionals - deliver compassionate care, unparalleled medical expertise, and 24/7 solutions and resources to more than 48,000 patients and members, helping them to live the best lives possible in their homes and communities.
Responsibilities and Qualifications
Evaluates encounter data and identifies errors created by operational, claims and eligibility processes. Researches, analyzes, summarizes and categorizes encounter rejects from CMS and NYSDOH. Works closely with other departments, delegated vendors and government agencies to monitor, analyze and communicate aggregate and individual encounter data metrics. Provides administrative, organization and technical support to the department in the tabulation and analysis of data. Shares data analysis expertise, experience and findings with other team members and provides guidance to new and less experienced staff. Works under moderate supervision.
Retrieves, compiles, reviews and ensures accuracy and completeness of encounter data from VNSNY CHOICE systems and delegated vendor sources.
Summarizes large volumes of complex encounter data in analytical reports that include tables, graphs, qualitative and quantitative analyses for management review and use. Reviews and ensures accuracy of reports and corrects discrepancies.
Leads the development of reports and projects, including documenting methodology, protocols, analysis, and design. Recommends and implements efficient means of data collection and maintenance.
Programs using various softwares to generate reports based on input/direction from management and other report users.
Collaborates with other departments and vendors to identify missing data, errors or other anomalies; works with them to correct these encounter data errors, gather necessary information and provide guidance on regulatory reporting needs.
Monitors encounter data integrity of various databases and creates monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc reports.
Initiates and maintains internal contacts to secure current/correct encounter data necessary for clear presentations of all reports, special projects, etc.
Assists management with review of analytical techniques, methodology and results from other data analysts. Provides guidance, training and mentorship to data analysts, as needed.
Instructs, orients and trains department staff on new and existing reports and reporting tools.
Performs special projects and other duties as needed.
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business, health-related or related quantitative discipline, or equivalent work experience required. Master’s degree preferred.
Experience: Minimum of three years performing encounter data analysis of Risk Adjustment Processing System (RAPS), Encounter Data Processing System (EDPS) & All Payer Database (APD) or analysis of healthcare claims, members and provider data, in a managed care organization required. Proficiency in standard business applications such as Microsoft Office suite required. Proficiency in data analysis software such as SAS or SQL required. Demonstrated strong analytical and reporting skills required. Excellent verbal and written communication and analytical skills required. Demonstrated ability to work in a team-oriented environment interacting with all levels of staff required. Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and effectively prioritize and execute tasks independently with minimal supervision required.
CA2019

Advance your career at Liberty Mutual - A Fortune 100 Company! Responsibilities:
Provide advanced operational and consultative support to conduct complex business operations analysis and reporting for distribution operations.
Perform research, analyze information, present findings, and recommend changes based on findings (e.g., data insights, regulatory changes, feedback from quality assurance reviews, market information, etc.) to improve business outcomes.
Identify business process to review and perform complex research by gathering data from a variety of sources, which may include operational data, metrics, competitor information, and feedback from business partners.
Conduct analyses based on operational, economic and/or financial data in order to quantify the competitive performance of business segments, evaluate potential operational changes and design new approaches and methodologies.
Analyze information to identify trends, patterns, gaps and insights using descriptive analytics and data visualization tools to further business insights.
Build the business case for making a change to current practices, programs or procedures.
Conduct current state assessment, opportunity assessment, cost/benefit analysis, and feasibility assessment.
Partner with stakeholders on the design, testing implementation, and evaluation of business process changes to improve business outcomes.
Lead implementation and evaluation of business process changes or a portion of a larger initiative.
Develop, update, and analyze metrics used to determine operational performance, staffing needs, productivity, or other measures deemed valuable to an organization.
Own report development for reports and dashboards considered complex in nature.
Develop, modify, and distribute standard and ad hoc reports and dashboards to better understand the over business or unit.
Develop presentations and share findings as well as recommendations.
Receive, evaluate and respond to data-related inquiries by applying knowledge of data and business operations and obtaining information from various sources.
Qualifications: Position requires a Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in business, economics, mathematics, statistics, actuarial science or a related technical field plus five (5) years of experience in the job offered, as a business analyst or in a related field or position. Position also requires: three (3) years of experience with advanced functions of Microsoft Excel for data manipulation, report creation, macros, VBA, and database connections; three (3) years of experience with data base software and coding (SQL) and business intelligence tools, including Tableau or PowerBI; and three (3) years of experience with insurance value chain business practices, processes and market conditions.
To apply, please visit https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/, select “Search Jobs,” enter job requisition #109610 in the “Job ID or Keywords” field, and submit resume. Alternatively, you may apply by submitting a resume via e-mail to RecruitLM@LibertyMutual.com. Reference requisition number in subject of e-mail. Benefits: We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits Overview: At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed. We’re dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

desc:
Overview
The Visiting Nurse Service of New York (VNSNY) is the nation's largest not-for-profit home- and community-based health care organization, serving the five boroughs of New York City, and Nassau, Suffolk, and Westchester Counties. For 125 years, VNSNY has been committed to meeting the health care needs of New Yorkers with compassionate, high-quality home health care. We offer a wide range of services, programs, and health plans to meet the diverse needs of our patients, members, and clients from before birth to the end of life.
Each day, more than 13,000 VNSNY employees - including nurses, rehabilitation therapists, social workers, other allied professionals, and paraprofessionals - deliver compassionate care, unparalleled medical expertise, and 24/7 solutions and resources to more than 48,000 patients and members, helping them to live the best lives possible in their homes and communities.

Provides data and analytic support, including quality dashboards, outcomes studies, program evaluations, and internal and external reporting. Founded in 1908, CIT (NYSE: CIT) is a leading national bank empowering businesses and personal savers with the financial agility to navigate their goals. We believe in helping customers turn their ideas into outcomes. Whether those customers are building a business or building their savings, CIT has the experience and agility to empower them to achieve their goals. At CIT, how we do business is just as important as what we do. Our social responsibility programs focus on driving financial and personal empowerment, supporting the environment and advancing wellness. CIT contributes to communities where we live, work and do business through charitable donations, community investments and employee volunteerism.
CIT is looking for a Business Analyst to engage with our various stakeholders within the Business, Operations, and Technology, focusing on business analysis activities across various strategic business/project initiatives. BA will be responsible for maintaining financials for the key initiatives, following up with project/program tasks, action items, and issues/risks. BA will populate the portal and sharepoint sites with the required artifacts, ensuring compliance with audit requirements. BA will create decks, dashboards, and other visuals for recurring and special meetings, including items for Steering Committee. The BA will report into the program management lead, who reports into the ePMO.
He/she must possess a strong sense of project management rigor, leadership, organization and communication with the ability to respond to a dynamic environment. This position works with stakeholders to elicit, understand, analyze, document, refine and communicate business needs so that business and/or technical delivery teams can build effective solutions. This requires a detailed understanding of internal customer needs, as well as business vision and strategy, to prioritize investment, business value and delivery. This role will also work with the business and IT delivery teams to identify and mitigate risks including business operational risks.
Responsibilities include:
Work closely with stakeholders to identify needs, gather requirements, develop user stories, and propose business solutionsWork closely with the Product Owner, IT/Data teams, and vendors to ensure user requirements, stories, and acceptance criteria are well understoodProduce project materials at all stages of project development lifecycleLead project coordination effort with business and technology stakeholdersManage timely execution of the plan working with stakeholdersBalance short term needs with long term strategic view and wherever necessary create short term solutions until the long term solution is ready

Candidate should be experienced in projects/programs and managing execution from inception to deliveryCandidate should be a self-starter and be able to navigate through multiple lines of businesses, stakeholders and manage delivery across multiple technology teamsAbility to work independently and remain flexible and organized throughout projects in a fast paced environmentStrong analytical background, problem solving and communication skills are requiredExperience in Senior arena (e.g., creating executive summaries, creating dashboards)Proficiency in Excel, MS Project, Visio and SharePoint is necessaryExperience with worksheets/data sets, SQL, writing VLOOKUP formulas, manipulating data with PivotTables, and presenting resultsExperience with project lifecycleExperience with Data, data lineage, financial reportingMore experience in business and finance (rather than tech)Has 5 years experience in the Finance Industry

As a global investments company, BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments, and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. Every day, our Technology employees make this happen while also seeking out new ways to do it more efficiently and effectively.

As part of BNY Mellon’s global Technology organization, you’ll have the opportunity to engage with some of the best and brightest, technology, business, and financial minds to find new and better ways to exceed our clients’ expectations and build the future of financial services. With more than 230 years of industry leading experience under our belts, you might even say that we are the original fintech.
Clearing, Markets & Issuer Services Technology (CMIST) is responsible for application development and support for more than 350 critical business systems including Repo Edge (collateral management), Enterprise Payment Hub (multi-currency payment processing), and Broker Dealer Clearance (securities clearing).

Treasury Services Technology (TST) within CMIST leads the development and maintenance of state-of-the-art technology solutions for the Treasury Services business. TST is aligned with the business into five sub-segments including: Global Payments, Information & Liquidity, Payments and Receivables, Enterprise Financial Messaging (EFM) and Trade Services. Because of TST’s industry-leading solutions, BNY Mellon is the first bank to participate in Real-Time Payments processing and provide full transparency into the status of payments.

Work with the business on requirements, system specifications, Test plans, configuration of the new Liquidity application .
 Qualifications Specific job duties to include:
Create or update knowledge artifacts like Business Analysis, System specifications, Interface control documents and Test cases
Create and present powerful narratives and presentations including UX wireframes
Interact with Product and Operations partners to elicit business requirements and product vision
Will learn the configuration of parameters of the new Liquidity system and train operation users
Should be able to query the application database and pull reports or required information.
Principal Business Analysis Consultant->> Provides technical leadership in a specific business domain within a line of business. Serves in a cross-program role to ensure quality of the deliverables within their areas of expertise and drives innovation and strategic solutions within global, mission-critical, large-scale programs. Provides expertise for a specific domain within a line of business. Directs and assists team to elicit, challenge, and prioritize requirements, translate into functional design and use case models. Manages the project scope, objectives, constraints and assumptions for a large, strategic, multi-year program. Provides guidance in development of the technical design, test plans, and user documentation. Leads implementation/conversion strategy planning and implementation. Manages scope and change throughout the initiative utilizing formal change control and requirements traceability. Gathers and analyzes information and provides recommendations to address strategic business objectives that span multiple, global business and technology areas. Participates in industry forums and keeps current on domain knowledge for their specific business and application areas of expertise. Applies experiences with existing software and/or systems development processes to define and collect metrics and develop better processes to be used in the future. Actively influences software and/or systems development process improvement initiatives. Contributes to the achievement of related area objectives.
Qualifications
Qualification
10+ years on Treasury and Cash Management. Expertise on Cash and Liquidity area is required
Working knowledge of Corporate Cash management, cash forecasting, Interest Enhancement structures, Sweeping, Physical and Notional Pooling, Virtual Accounts and other Liquidity solutions is required
Must have experience in creating Business Analysis, System Specifications, Interface documents, and Test specifications. Working Knowledge of SQL is required.
Should be able to create powerful narratives, presentations including UX wireframes
Should be able to develop a big picture of the end to end flow for Liquidity including interactions with DDA, Payment Systems, FX Client master etc.
Prior experience working in a large bank or financial institution in the area of Payments or Liquidity solutions or Corporate Treasury function is highly desirable
Future work will involve enhancing application capabilities in the area of AI/ML for cash forecasting and investment decision making

Bachelor's degree in business or technical-related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred 10-12 years of experience in providing consulting advice to senior IT and business management required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

Argo Group’s focus is specialty insurance. Our products help power the businesses that drive the world economy. We approach our chosen markets with unmatched expertise, a spirit of innovation and sense of urgency in everything we do.
Argo Construction offers a range of primary and excess coverage to the contractor segment. Construction insurance requires flexible, creative and customizable underwriting, and Argo Construction’s specialized underwriters understand the rates, pricing and coverages to meet contractors’ insurance needs and help project owners succeed.
Due to a growing book of business, we are looking for an exceptional Business Operations Analyst to join our Argo Construction Team. The position is located in New York, NY. The purpose of this position will be to assist and facilitate business planning with key partners (internal & External) by driving analysis, through the creation of reports to drive key metric results.
We offer a work environment that inspires innovation and is open to employee suggestions. While we work hard, a work/life balance is just as important so that our employees are fully focused while working. We believe in building an inclusive and diverse team, and we strive to make our office a welcoming space for everyone. We encourage talented people from all backgrounds to apply. We hire the best people, so we can deliver the best solutions.
In this role you will:
Conduct ad-hoc analysis of metrics and data mines reporting to drive actionable insight and support decision making
This role will continually review historical and ongoing accuracy of data and performance on a regular basis with business partners.
Utilize data and reports to identify top and lower performing brokers to reward and rehabilitate as appropriate.
Monthly and quarterly analysis and identify areas to improve underwriting relationships and maximize resources
Improve growth and efficiently metrics
Identify, implement and monitor production/submission flow to maximize distribution
Engage in daily/weekly huddles, generate suggestions by understanding and drive goal alignment across both internal and external clients
Stay abreast of trends in the market place by collecting information from internal and external clients
Closely work with Finance Business Insight Manager
In order to be successful in this role you will need:
A bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or similar field of study from an accredited university and a relentless desire to continually update your skill level through continuing education and self-development.
Minimum of 1-2 year of experience supporting financial analysis or commercial insurance with a desire to create and analyze management reports.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Detail oriented with initiative and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent analytical skills. Be inquisitive.
Ability to travel.
Advanced knowledge of computer programs, including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
You’ll also want to make sure you embody our core values as they are the key to our success:
We desire to excel
We are committed to our clients and to each other
We have the courage to do the right thing
We apply original thinking
Argo will provide to you with:
An opportunity to be your best and work with talented and inventive professionals at a Company Forbes magazine named to its list of America’s 50 Most Trustworthy Financial Companies for the last two years and that A.M. Best has rated an ‘A’ (Excellent) for thirteen consecutive years.
An attractive Total Rewards package that includes:
Base pay and profit sharing.
Comprehensive benefits designed to protect and enhance your life and your dependents’ lives by way of health and wellness plans, life insurance, a matching 401(k) Plan, generous PTO and an opportunity to become a shareholder at a 15% discount.
Argo Academy, a digital and instructor-led platform that helps us focus on continuous learning and which, by the way, got us named in Training magazine as one of the Training Top 125 Companies!
Opportunities to support your local community though various outreach programs or by matching your gift to charitable causes by 150%.
An Employee Referral program, that resulted in 30% of all new hires last year.

Contexte

Vous interviendrez sur des missions à forte valeur ajoutée, sur des fonctions de Business Analyst ou de Gestion de Projet pour nos clients, acteurs en Finance de marché (principalement des Banques d’Investissement et des Gestionnaires d’Actifs).


Votre mission


Analyser et formaliser les besoins exprimés,
Analyser le système existant et étudier les impacts de modélisation sur le système d’information actuel et les process,
Rédiger les spécifications fonctionnelles détaillées,

Homologuer la solution mise en place,
Former et assurer un support fonctionnel aux utilisateurs,

Ce projet est-il fait pour vous ?
