Excellentes compétences en communication, en analyse et en synthèse,
Autonomie discipline, et initiative.

job_title: Sr Manager Business Intelligence & Operational Excellence (L...
desc:
JOB SUMMARY

As a Senior Manager, you will be responsible for standing up Business Intelligence & Operational Excellence practices for Content Distribution Digital Products & Operations team. Through collaboration with all functional leaders, transform how we utilize data to make critical decisions that impact the organization. A successful applicant must possess attention to detail, strong analytical skills, advanced excel knowledge, and a desire to work in a fast-paced environment. They must have the ability to understand business operations, processes, and translate data into business insights that "tell a story"
The Senior Manager, Business Intelligence & Operational Excellence will be the expert visionary in the data and analytics space utilizing a mixture of internal expertise, technologies, operational processes & business understanding to deliver your objectives. This role will create and measure KPIs to drive success for the organization. They will quantify each step in the distribution supply chain to drive measurable results for the business and create dashboards for team members/leads to assess in real time. Leveraging data from various sources, this role will gather, connect & analyze to identify process improvement areas as well as product requirements to optimize & modernize the digital supply chain. This is a critical role to facilitate the accomplishment of departmental goals, objectives and budgetary requirements as they support the mission, vision, values and strategic plan of the organization.

CORE JOB DUTIES

Responsible for collecting, connecting & analyzing product & operational data through the distribution supply chain. E.g: publishing, delivery, availability, entitlement data
Responsible for translating the data into real time dashboards in order to measure organizational KPIs
Responsible for using data, dashboards to drive POV & build compelling presentations
Responsible for driving insights, ideas to optimize business processes & product solutions
Work collaboratively with Operations, Product, and Partner Strategy teams; helping to prioritize business information needs
Interpret data, analyze results and provide ongoing reports
Bring analytic skills to financial, quality and operational data to develop insights on where and how to focus organizational or departmental improvement efforts
Evaluate if/how improvement efforts are affecting performance indicators and outcomes
Use knowledge of industry practices to turn generalized opportunities into specific tactics and advise operational leaders and their teams on how to connect key metrics to the work performed
Be an integral part of a systematic approach using data to enhance the quality of performance through improvement of systems, processes, and outcomes
Qualifications/Requirements
4+ years of experience in Business Intelligence
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business, Economics, or Operations Management
Highly proficient in Microsoft Office, advanced Excel knowledge.
A deep understanding of analytics, experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Domo, Looker, MicroStrategy, etc.
Ability to analyze, aggregate, and interpret data across multiple disciplines
Experience in establishing KPIs and targets including working with functional teams to achieve
Great presentation skills, and the ability to convey complex data results in a simple and concise way including the ability to tell the story via compelling decks using data, dashboards for executive teams
Familiarity using SQL, R, Python and other similar tools to elicit data from very large data sets a plus
Strong passion for asking the why’s and being a problem solver
Experience with operational and/or sales data analytics strongly preferred
Effective time management and prioritization skills. Strong interpersonal & collaboration skills.

Eligibility requirements:
Interested candidates must submit a resume/CV online to be considered
Must be willing to work in New York, NY
Must be 18 years or older
Willingness to travel, work nights and on weekends with short notice
Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States
Sub-BusinessContent Distribution Digital
Career Level
Experienced
CityNew York
State/Province
New York
CountryUnited States
About Us
At NBCUniversal, we believe in the talent of our people. It’s our passion and commitment to excellence that drives NBCU’s vast portfolio of brands to succeed. From broadcast and cable networks, news and sports platforms, to film, world-renowned theme parks and a diverse suite of digital properties, we take pride in all that we do and all that we represent. It’s what makes us uniquely NBCU. Here you can create the extraordinary. Join us.

Content Distribution Digital Products & Operations is responsible for driving consumption, monetization and brand presence for NBCUniversal programming across o/o and distributor digital products - set top box, TVE, dMVPDs.

Sprinklr’s mission is to help the world’s most valuable brands create happier customers. We do this with the world’s #1 social suite, which helps enterprises deliver memorable customer experiences with an integrated suite of Market Research, Customer Care, Social Media Management, and Social Advertising.
Headquartered in New York City with 1,500 employees in 24 offices, Sprinklr works with more than 1,500 of the world’s most valuable brands, including: McDonald’s, Nike, Procter & Gamble, Samsung, Santander, Shell, and Visa. Sprinklr’s partners include Accenture, Deloitte, IBM, Microsoft, and SAP.

Sprinklr is looking for a seasoned Salesforce Business Analyst to lead and drive our ongoing Salesforce development and growth, while simultaneously supporting the business needs of associated business platforms. You will work with key users from different business groups to understand current business processes and business requirements, identifying areas that have opportunity to be improved and/or streamlined, and designing CRM solutions that meet the business need and are in line with industry best practices. No “brilliant jerks” allowed! We are a team who feed each other’s successes and take shared responsibility for failures.
This position is based in New York City.
About the Role (what you’ll be doing)
Translate detailed business requirements into implementable features for our development team.
Develop a solid understanding of department-specific business processes
Update and maintain system documentation and Salesforce best practices
Develop and document views, processes, fields, reports, custom objects, page layouts and workflows
Support the Salesforce release manager to coordinate proper scoping of requirements and ensure all appropriate tickets are open and required documentation approvals are complete for monthly deployments.
Assist with requirements gathering and testing and ensure user stories and test evidence are accurate and complete
Assist with Salesforce configuration changes and coordinate changes with development team to be included in Production releases
Manage technical debt and platform life cycles for Salesforce and related platforms.
Measure and improve the release cycle internally
Support and improve associated business systems (BI, services, finance)
About You
5+ years designing and supporting large scale, technically complex solutions on Salesforce and associated platforms in a high-tech/SaaS high-growth environment
Previous experience supporting Salesforce CPQ (Steelbrick)
Previous experience supporting BI platforms (Domo, Looker, Tableau, etc)
Bachelor’s degree in business, IT, or commensurate, demonstrable experience
You know the limits of Salesforce, the difference between what can be done and what should be done, and can clearly articulate, with technical accuracy, the difference.
Salesforce certifications are a *must*.
Prior experience supporting a sales field of at least 100 sellers.
Hands-on experience writing user stories with acceptance criteria
Expert knowledge of Google and Atlassian software suites.
You are methodical and detail oriented.
Once more: you are methodical and detail oriented

job_title: Libor Transition - Project Manager/Business Analyst Hybrid
desc:
The resource will be engaged as a cross Lines of Business PM/BA hybrid in the HSBC LIBOR Transition program. You will be responsible to work with the Lines of Business PMs and Stakeholders to help ensure a successful transition from U.S. dollar (USD) LIBOR to a more robust reference rate, its recommended alternative, the Secured Overnight Financing Rate (SOFR). The responsibilities will include the creation and management/tracking of the Americas plans and corresponding dependencies, RAID, and Working Group / Steering Committee Pack preparations. Additionally, you will support and help with analysis requests as needed.

Technical knowledge:

Knowledge of industry shift away from LIBOR and the effects to impacted products and services is a plus
Previous project management experience (at least 5 plus person teams) in a tier 1 financial institutions
Change Management experience is a must (specifically within a large-scale regulatory / change initiative)
Knowledge of investment banking processes and services (i.e. institutional lending / liquidity management, treasury services)
SME skills in one line of business are not needed, but you will need strong capital markets knowledge (product knowledge, trade lifecycle, relevant regulations)
Must be able to engage the business, interact with senior stakeholders, participate in / facilitate meetings with senior stakeholders, gather requirements, manage project plans
Ability to analyse and assess various data points on product exposures, contract inventory, model inventory, conduct risks, etc. and provide meaningful actions to move forward with, mitigating any observed risk.
Ability to successfully navigate / operate in a high pressure environment
Expert level experience with Microsoft tools, particularly Excel, Power Point, and Word
Impact on the Business

Responsibility for defining current and future state Operating Models for the Transition
Supporting the definition of high level requirements to satisfy business needs
Responsibility for documenting detailed requirements for associated technical solutions to address the Operating Model optimization
Responsibility for planning the solution delivery and managing dependencies
Identify and remove barriers to project success. Always acts in the HSBC’s best interests and willing to openly discuss potentially difficult topics
Responsibility for standardizing requirements cross product/LOB and across regional hubs, where possible, to ensure that the alignment to an overarching strategic approach and avoidance of duplication
Work closely with related Portfolio or Group teams to ensure alignment of the project with the wider change portfolio strategy.
Creation of end to end process maps supporting requirements
Other supporting activities within the project as required.
Customers / Stakeholders

Strengthen Stakeholder Relationships. Uses relationship management skills/tools to responsibly influence decisions and stakeholder advocacy
Effectively engages customers, colleagues and stakeholders to build a trust-based relationship and deliver an organized and effective BA Service
Support the identification of stakeholder goals and effectively manage their expectations, addressing any misalignment
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills (written and spoken) – comfortable with detail, comfortable with senior stakeholder engagement.
Leadership & Teamwork

Motivate the broader team to focus on identifying the critical areas for change and offer the optimum long term sustainable solution.
Work with wider change team to collaboratively embed new processes and procedures.
Lead by example – deal with others as one wants to be dealt with, exert discipline and focus in overcoming challenges.
Cultivates a collaborative and cooperative attitude
Self-motivated, enthusiastic and proven fast learner
Operational Effectiveness & Control

Understand, follow and demonstrate compliance with all relevant internal and external rules, regulations and procedures that apply to the conduct of the business in which you are involved, specifically Internal Controls and any Compliance policy including, inter alia, the Group Compliance policy.
Maintain HSBC Internal Control standards, including the timely implementation of internal and external audit points together with any issues raised by external regulators.
Be aware of the Operational Risk scenario associated with your role and act in a manner that takes account of operational risk considerations.
This job description is non-contractual and is intended only as a summary of your role and responsibilities from time to time. This document will be subject to review by you and your line manager as appropriate during the course of your employment.

Management of Risk

The jobholder will ensure the fair treatment of our customers is at the heart of everything we do, both personally and as an organization.

This will be achieved by consistently displaying the behaviors that form part of the HSBC Values and culture and adhering to HSBC risk policies and procedures, including notification and escalation of any concerns and taking required action in relation to points raised by audit and/or external regulators.

The jobholder is responsible for managing and mitigating operational risks in their day to day operations. In executing these responsibilities, the Group has adopted risk management and internal control structure referred to as the ‘Three Lines of Defense’. The jobholder should ensure they understand their position within the Three Lines of Defense, and act accordingly in line with operational risk policy, escalating in a timely manner where they are unsure of actions required.

Through the implementation the Global AML, Sanctions and ABC Policies, supporting Guidance, and Line of Business Procedures the jobholder will make informed decisions in accordance with the core principles of HSBC's Financial Crime Risk Appetite.

Observation of Internal Controls

The jobholder will adhere to, and be able to demonstrate adherence to, internal controls and will implement the Group compliance policy by adhering to all relevant processes/procedures.

The term ‘compliance’ embraces all relevant financial services laws, rules and codes with which the business has to comply. This will be achieved by adherence to all relevant procedures, keeping appropriate records and, where appropriate, by the timely implementation of internal and external audit points, including issues raised by external regulators.
Qualifications
Business Experience:
Global Banking and Markets or Commercial Banking Experience
Experience analyzing and documenting business processes
Business Analysis skills gained in financial services environment
Experience in change initiatives and an understanding of the full project life cycle

EEO/AA/Minorities/Women/Disability/Veterans

Bluecore is a retail marketing technology company that is reimagining the way retailers communicate with shoppers. The 2019 launch of Bluecore Communicate™ introduces retailers to a fundamentally different email solution that replaces manual processes with an intelligent, AI-driven workflow. More than 400 retail brands, including Staples, Tommy Hilfiger, The North Face, TomboyX, and Bass Pro Shops, increase their marketing performance with less effort through Bluecore. Bluecore has been recognized as one of the Best Places to Work by Glassdoor and is ranked No. 241 on the Inc. 500 List, the most prestigious ranking of the nation’s fastest-growing private companies. We are looking for someone to support Sales Operations team in development requests, CRM maintenance, manage sales enablement tool support, marketing tool support, and data hygiene.

As Salesforce Admin / Business Analyst, you’ll be supporting the Sales Operations team maintaining and enhancing our CRM and administering our sales enablement tools. You’ll be responsible for supporting multiple departments in the areas of application configuration using native in-app development frameworks, enhancing and creating divisional reports, and collaborating with various business leads to implement work stream optimizations. You should be comfortable with assembling business requirements, documenting workflows, hands-on configuration and troubleshooting issues.
Responsibilites
Create automation in Salesforce using tools like workflow, process builder, and flows processes
Identify core operational issues and propose new work streams, application solutions, and process improvements for core business units
Keeping abreast of new Salesforce features and functionality and providing recommendations for process improvements
Analyze processes and recommend more efficient paths for the sales and client success team
Collaborate with team to design improvements to UI, reporting and business processes
Modify and scale existing processes to support more users and new business requirements
Develop and implement operational efficiencies that increase the sales team’s output and contribute to the company’s bottom line
Own Sales Enablement tools and Contract Management Systems, managing licenses, renewals, access, support and troubleshooting user issues
Responsible for data hygiene, and maintaining data accuracy and integrity through merging duplicate leads and performing mass uploads and updates of data
Fulfill ad-hoc reporting requests and identify opportunities for improved reporting
Partner with Sales Operations Manager to prep new employees for onboarding as well as maintain and update process documentation
Requirements
At least 5 years of Salesforce experience
Salesforce Administrator Certification required
Experience working in SAAS industry prefered
Extensive knowledge of Salesforce’s automation capabilities and best practices, including workflow, visual workflow, process builder, and order of operations
Exceptional problem solving skills with a strong drive to seek resolution to issues
An obsession with data quality, accuracy and standardization
Detail-oriented
Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team, on multiple projects
Project management experience a plus
Undergraduate Degree from an accredited University
Benefits:

Highly competitive compensation package including salary and equity as well as the opportunity to work for one of the fastest growing marketing technology companies.Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insuranceDaily catered lunch and snacks401(k) planMonthly fitness reimbursement for a gym membership or fitness classesMonthly public transportation reimbursementGenerous Parental Leave & flexible vacation policy

At Bluecore we believe in fostering an inclusive environment in which employees feel encouraged to share their unique perspectives, leverage their strengths, and act authentically. We know that diverse teams are strong teams, and welcome those from all backgrounds and varying experiences.

Bluecore is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.

Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today's most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It's also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it's no wonder we're consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you're as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.
KPMG is currently seeking a Manager in Technology Enablement for our Consulting practice.
Responsibilities:
Lead multiple client service delivery teams in the active execution of engagements in compliance with firm and practice unit service delivery standards
Utilize technical and industry knowledge to identify complex client issues and build long-term business relationships with key executives through engagement delivery and networking in professional organizations
Participate in business development by identifying new opportunities and assisting with proposal development
Contribute thought leadership to the development and evolution of our Technology Enablement Solutions (TES) methodologies and intellectual capital including publishing articles, whitepapers, or performing research in support of TES initiatives
Manage and provide leadership to teams of staff level professionals and become actively involved in staff development and practice management
Qualifications:
A minimum of five years of TES related experience with a professional services advisory firm or publicly traded company
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college/university; MBA or MIS from an accredited college/university preferred
Experience with information access and delivery methods, analytics applications and tool portfolio, data sourcing and integration methods such as OLAP, ROLAP, and HOLAP and an understanding of data warehousing and data mining, ETL, EII, data cleansing, architecture, and master data management
Experience serving as an architect and designer for data warehouse and reporting services
Experience with data strategy, governance, stewardship, data management, and data quality programs
Strong understanding of governance, controls, process and procedures, centers of competency, change management, data modeling, master data management, data standardization and stewardship, information integrity and compliance, and data quality management
Travel may be up to 80-100%
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future

job_title: Manager, Global Data & Analytics Solutions Architecture
desc:
Manager, Global Data & Analytics Solutions Architecture

Description

Experience with data pipeline architecture and implementation
Hands on experience with data modeling methodologies, such as Kimball and Inmon
Experience with Data Strategy development
Excellent organization, interpersonal, communication and presentation/meeting management skills

Houlihan Lokey has extensive expertise in mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, activist shareholder and takeover defense, and other related advisory services for a broad range of U.S. and international clients. Our experience in M&A has earned us consistent recognition throughout the industry. In 2018, we were ranked the No. 1 M&A advisor for all U.S. transactions.
Data & Analytics Group
Houlihan Lokey’s Data & Analytics Group specializes in providing high-quality, relationship-based advice to clients whose businesses offer data and analytics solutions to a broad range of end markets. We have an extensive track record of working with domestic and international clients and delivering creative, effective, and successful outcomes based on our deep understanding of our clients, their business models, and the markets in which they operate. With a team of ~50 bankers with extensive sector expertise, we have closed in excess of ~80 transactions in the last three years.
The industry end markets in which our clients operate include B2B Information, Energy & Commodities, Fintech & Financial Information, GRC, Legal & Regulatory, Healthcare & Pharmaceutical, Information Technology, Insurance, Media & Marketing Communications, Real Estate, Research & IP, Transport, Supply Chain & Logistics.
Responsibilities
As an Associate, you will:-
Prepare, analyze and help explain historical and projected financial information.
Create financial models.
Coordinate and perform business due diligence.
Prepare confidential information memoranda, management presentations, marketing pitches and other presentations.
Value companies and businesses.
Lead the planning and execution of marketing engagements.
Build relationships and maintain direct contact with clients and prospective clients, professional advisors and other stakeholders.
Supervise junior staff members.
Support / lead the planning and execution of sell- and buyside engagements.
Requirements / Qualifications
The environment at Houlihan Lokey is results-driven and entrepreneurial and, as such, rewards top performers with substantial responsibility and interaction with senior-level professionals and clients.
The following qualifications / skills are required:
Bachelor's Degree in Accounting/Finance or related discipline and/or MBA, with a strong academic track record.
4+ years of investment banking experience within either an M&A, generalist or Industry team.
Fundamental understanding of financial valuation methodologies, and applications
Advanced Financial modeling and analytical abilities; Strong LBO and DCF modelling skills
Strong qualitative and quantitative research skills
Understanding of financial statements analysis with the ability to work through key assumptions, implicit caveats, and limitations
Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential
Strong knowledge of Excel
Independent thinker and resourceful problem solver driven to succeed
Strong work ethic, organizational skills and ability to multitask is crucial
Demonstratable ability to work cooperatively with all levels of staff in a rapidly changing, demanding, but ultimately rewarding environment
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment

As a global investments company, BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments, and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. Every day, our Technology employees make this happen while also seeking out new ways to do it more efficiently and effectively.

As part of BNY Mellon’s global Technology organization, you’ll have the opportunity to engage with some of the best and brightest, technology, business, and financial minds to find new and better ways to exceed our clients’ expectations and build the future of financial services. With more than 230 years of industry leading experience under our belts, you might even say that we are the original fintech.

job_title: Director, Data and Analytics Strategy Hub (DASH)
desc:
Planned Parenthood of New York City is seeking a Director, Data and Analytics Strategy Hub (DASH) to join our Innovation and Analytics Centre Team. This position will be based at our Administrative office at 26 Bleecker Street, New York, New York 10012.

The Director, Data and Analytics Strategy Hub (DASH) will play a lead role in conducting and managing multiple analytics initiatives to guide PPNYC through strategic decision making for different areas in the organization including but not limited to Clinical, Finance, Development, Call Center, Public Affairs and Human Resources. They will gather business requirements sessions with stakeholders, and facilitating large-group/cross-functional sessions with customers, while containing the scope of the initiative, serve as the subject matter expert on the data warehouse and dashboard reporting standards, support and build capacity to leverage the new data and enhance reports, develop and maintain the suite of web-based dashboards for the organization at all levels – from executive reporting to front-line staff, manage the road map for new and enhancements to dashboards, implement, support and administer PPNYC’s Data and Analytics Strategy Hub (DASH), the organizations integrated data warehouse and reporting platform (using MS SQL, Talend and Tableau technologies), oversee and support the data warehouse growth and data quality as well as liaise with technical consultant staff to support enhancements and bug-fixes, and serve as the main point of contact to manage vendors and consultants who support the DASH platform

This is an exciting and important time at Planned Parenthood of New York City. We are building on our strength with dynamic new leadership, talented staff members, engaged donors and activists, and amazing community partners. We are determined to thrive and grow in these times of transition and resistance.

Planned Parenthood of New York City (PPNYC) stands strong as a trusted provider of sexual and reproductive health (SRH) care, an accurate source of sexual health information, and a steadfast partner in the ongoing fight to achieve sexual and reproductive justice, especially health and racial equity. Working at PPNYC is more than a job. It is an opportunity to help ensure that all New Yorkers have access to affordable, high-quality sexual and reproductive health care and evidence-based education programming so they can lead healthy lives and fulfill their dreams. We approach our work through a reproductive justice lens, seeking to break down the barriers that prevent individuals from accessing the health care and information they need and deserve.
What the Director of Data and Analytics Strategy Hub (DASH) does:
Gather business requirements by conducting meetings/interviews, and facilitating large-group/cross-functional sessions with customers, while containing the scope of the initiative
Develop new dashboards for all levels of organization from front-line teams to executive leadership.
Test, troubleshoot and resolve data transformation processes end-to-end from source systems to the data warehouse to dashboards in order to ensure high quality data reporting
Understands the concepts and standards for common ETL design techniques such as change data capture. Ability to follow existing ETL specifications and design. Lead a team of consultants as they build out the data processing ETL workflows.
Research and support end-to-end data workflows, particularly the ability to pull new data (ie- ADP workforce management, case management software, etc) from source systems and enhance data availability in the data warehouse.
Analyze, design, implement and support data processes using ETL tools for new data sources to augment to the dashboard portfolio.
Be the technical subject matter expert on the data warehouse and dashboard reporting standards, support and build capacity within the IAC team and PPNYC as a whole to leverage the new data and enhance reports.
Provide first level of administration of the SQL Data warehouse, Talend and Tableau. Liaise and be the main point of contact for IT technical support for complex support and enhancements. Own, manage and lead the road map for enhancements for new data sources and new dashboards.
Develop web-based dashboard reports in Tableau and create processes to input data for monthly indicators reports using PPNYC’s business intelligence tools, systems and databases.
Produce efficient processes to replicate and automate reports monthly.
Audit data sources and analyses to ensure data and deliverables are accurate and complete
Collaborate with many areas across PPNYC (financial, IT, administrative, clinical, public affairs, HR, education and training) and maintain working relationships with staff to collect requirements and deliver
Performs other ad-hoc analyses and business intelligence reporting related duties as assigned.
Leverage existing processes for tracking and prioritizing deliverables, suggesting enhancements as needed
Complete all responsibilities according to established protocols, policies and standard practices in the areas of ADA and regulatory compliance programs such as HIPAA.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent with an emphasis in Computer Science, Application Development, Database Development and Management, Data Visualization, or similar studies
2+ years of experience integrating and administrating complex data sources and implementing business intelligence tools
Strong experience developing and administering large scale integrated data warehouses
Ability to conduct database manipulation (e.g. SQL, Talend and Tableau, as well as other ETL tools, such as MS Office tools – Excel and R)
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to build successful relationships and partner with Director level leaders
A demonstrated understanding of the role that racial inequity plays in our society and its impact on healthcare systems and institutions
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s Degree with an emphasis in Computer Science, Application Development, Database Development and Management, Data Visualization, or similar studies
Creative and innovative team player with a positive approach and a focus on business issues
Ability to work independently, take initiative, and think creatively
Advanced time management and project planning skills
Strong work ethic to drive projects to completion
PPNYC's benefits package includes:
Medical, dental, and vision coverage options for you and eligible dependents
Free basic life/AD&D policy with additional voluntary coverage options
Short Term Disability, Critical Illness and Accident policies
401(k) Retirement plan with 4% employer contribution after 1 year of employment
Medical and Dependent Flexible Spending Account plans
Public Transportation and Commuter Pre-Tax Reimbursements
Generous vacation, sick, and holiday benefits

All positions at PPNYC require:
Proof of immunization or immunity to certain communicable diseases (including influenza during the flu season) and testing for tuberculosis. These certifications are required by the NYC DOHMH Health Code, NYSDOH and OSHA.

Plans to expand in New York State
In a major step to amplify our impact and ensure better health outcomes for all New Yorkers, PPNYC is engaged in a planned merger process with four other New York State Planned Parenthood affiliates, becoming Planned Parenthood of Greater New York*. The new, unified entity will include half of New York State’s counties, covering 65% of the state’s population. This exciting shift will allow for standardized operations and quality improvement across the merged organization’s 29 health centers – advantages that will exponentially improve our service provision for patients and communities statewide.

This is an exciting and important time at Planned Parenthood as we build on our strength with dynamic new leadership, talented staff members, engaged donors and activists, and amazing community partners. We are determined to thrive and grow in these times of transition and resistance, and significantly increase our impact, affecting hundreds of thousands of New Yorkers.
The Planned Parenthood Federation of America and all the Boards of Directors of the Federation and of all five Planned Parenthood New York State affiliates have approved this merger. We are currently awaiting authorization by the New York State Department of Health and Attorney General, and plan to go live as the official new entity on January 1, 2020.

At PPNYC, we provide the absolute best care to our patients and our communities through innovative health care delivery and education programming. We care for everyone who walks through our doors regardless of insurance, ability to pay or immigration status. As a leading voice for reproductive freedom, PPNYC fiercely advocates for policies to ensure that all New Yorkers will have access to the full range of reproductive health care services and information.

Planned Parenthood of New York City is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value a diverse workforce and inclusive workplace. People of color, people with disabilities, and lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender people are encouraged to apply. We consider all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, disability, socio-economic status, marital or veteran status, pregnancy status or sexual orientation.

desc:
DB USA Core Corporation seeks an Assistant Vice President, Lead Business Analyst in New York, NY to deliver solutions to meet regulatory requirements and add business value by performing business analysis and program management tasks. Prior experience must include at least two (2) years of experience analyzing science, engineering, business, and other data processing problems to implement and improve computer systems for financial services institution; analyzing user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate and improve existing systems and reviewing computer system capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitations of financial software; planning, scheduling, and controlling all activities for system enhancement and related release initiatives; and creating and contributing appropriate artifacts for plans, milestones, measures, budgets, team and stakeholder communications. #DNI

OVERVIEW OF THE COMPANY
Fox Corporation
Under the FOX banner, we produce and distribute content through some of the world’s leading and most valued brands, including: FOX News, FOX Sports, the Fox Network, and the FOX Television Stations. We empower a diverse range of creators to imagine and develop culturally significant content, while building an organization that thrives on creative ideas, operational expertise and strategic thinking.
JOB DESCRIPTION
At Fox, we are building state of the art Data Products to improve the way that our media company transacts; interacts with consumers and customers; and makes vital business decisions with large revenue impacts. As a Visualization and BI Lead, you will be working with a full range of data technologies and architectures including big data platforms, data products, pub/sub data messaging, master data management, AI/ML predictive analytics, and multiple reporting and analytics frameworks and tools.


You will be working in a complex, challenging, fast-paced and rewarding environment, with other like-minded peers who are objective and results oriented, and who enjoy collaboration. Besides being experts in their respective fields, our architects and developers are smart, curious, innovative, solutions-oriented, respectful, highly collaborative and continuous learners.

A SNAPSHOT OF YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for architecting and delivering solutions for Business Intelligence, Reporting, Data Visualization & Analytics
Responsible for helping set technology strategy for Business Intelligence, Reporting, Data Visualization & Analytics
Responsible for vendor product evaluations and tool selections, and leading proof-of-concept projects
Provide strong technology leadership and technology guidance in the transformation from traditional BI and reporting to modern insights-driven analytics , data visualization and AI/ML and predictive analytics
Responsible for data security and compliance
Translate business requirements into conceptual and detailed technology solutions
Collaborate closely with partners across the organization including other architects, engineering and product managers, and business partners
Design and document data architecture at multiple levels (high-level to detailed) and across multiple views (conceptual, logical, physical, data flow and sequence diagrams)
Provide active “hands-on” architectural guidance and leadership through the entire lifecycle of development projects
Remain fluent in the industry and marketplace evolution-staying current with vendor product offerings and common and emerging data solutions in use across the industry; continuously learning new BI & Analytics technologies and introducing these into the organization

WHAT YOU WILL NEED
10 years plus experience architecting enterprise data solutions
10 years hands-on data design in large-scale and complex data solutions development projects
Expertise in BI, Reporting, Data Visualization and Analytics
Strong understanding of enterprise business data domains ( especially Media and Entertainment, Ad sale , Affiliated reviews ) and related BI & Analytics use cases
Proficiency with BI & Analytics tools, including Tableau, Looker, MemSQL, Redshift, No SQL
Current with new technologies and vendor solutions available in the marketplace
Fluent understanding of data security and compliance
Fluency in architecting and documenting architecture at multiple levels (high-level to detailed) and across multiple views (conceptual, logical, physical, data flow and sequence diagrams)
Ability to translate business requirements into conceptual and detailed technology solutions
Ability to develop and lead proof-of-concepts
Strong collaboration skills and ability to establish and manage effective working relationships in a matrixed organizational structure
Strong communication and executive presentation skills, both oral and written. Ability to communicate well to both technical and business audiences
Innovative thinking and embraces innovation by constantly seeking new or contrary ideas and approaches to what has been done in the past. Thinks big and broad, without being constrained by existing norms or business models
Results oriented, biased toward action
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.

What you’ll do day-to-day
The analyst will partner with developers to conceptualize solutions that expand and improve human capital systems and will be responsible for understanding business needs, specifying technical requirements, and providing operational support for existing applications. This dynamic position offers a broad view of the proprietary systems and third-party products that make up the firm’s human capital systems landscape. Ample opportunities will be provided to partner closely with leaders in human capital, business operations, information technology, and our international software development teams.
Who we're looking for
We are looking for candidates with a bachelor’s degree or higher who have obtained three to seven years of relevant work experience. Preference will be given to those who have been actively involved in complex software implementations involving multiple stakeholders.
Experience designing and implementing data warehouses is a significant plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication abilities, organizational skills, a dedicated customer service mentality, a knack for rapid problem solving, an aptitude for translating the needs of non-technical systems users into technical requirements, and an ability to see how small details interrelate and impact the bigger picture (i.e. systems thinking) are all critical for this role.
Applicants with functional expertise in technical writing, process mapping, process re-engineering, and data modeling will excel in this role.
A holistic understanding of the software development life cycle gained from experience running an agile release cycle process (such as experience as a scrum master) is a plus.
The willingness and ability to dive into details, collaborate effectively with teammates of varying technical knowledge, drive projects to completion, and exercise extreme discretion with confidential information is also essential.

NYU School of Medicine is one of the nation's top-ranked medical schools. For 175 years, NYU School of Medicine has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history and enrich the lives of countless people. An integral part of NYU Langone Health, the School of Medicine at its core is committed to improving the human condition through medical education, scientific research, and direct patient care. For more information, go to med.nyu.edu, and interact with us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
Position Summary:
We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Data Analyst.

In this role, the successful candidate We are seeking a qualified Junior Data Analyst/Data Analyst to provide support for evaluation and data management for the Division of Healthcare Delivery Science. The Junior Data Analyst/Data Analyst will work closely with NYU staff and faculty. The successful candidate will have a high degree of professional maturity, commitment to excellence, independence, flexibility, and initiative, and will possess the ability to work collaboratively with diverse individuals, teams and populations both internally and externally. The Junior Data Analyst/Data Analyst reports to the Division Director.
Job Responsibilities:
Maintain existing data collection and analysis systems in support of the research protocol
Under direct supervision by the Division Director and with the guidance of the team's lead biostatistician, conduct basic statistical analyses and present them to the team
Support the development of publications and conference presentations, including drafting academic and nonacademic publications, writing conference abstracts, conducting lit reviews and creating tables and other data visualizations for presentations
Assist the Division Director with the development of standard reports for research sponsor
Work with staff and others to facilitate automation of standard, recurrent data acquisition, management, analysis and reporting
Design and conduct analyses pertaining to data acquired thorough various data sources
Create descriptive data summaries including visualizations and written descriptions of data findings for a wide range of audiences
Provide technical assistance to analysts and researchers in accessing and analyzing datasets, as needed
Minimum Qualifications:
To qualify you must have a:
1. Master's degree in pertinent field (clinical informatics; information management; statistics; biostatistics; epidemiology; public health; health care administration; computer science or similar field).
2. At least 1 year of professional full-time experience coding in R
3. Experience in REDCap is preferred.
4. Experience in a professional environment is preferred.
5. Excellent written and oral communication skills.
6. Works well with other team members
Preferred Qualifications:
1. Knowledge of principles and methods of biostatistics; principles, theories, and procedures of epidemiology, including study design, statistical analysis, and causal inference; 2. Appropriate computer processing methods used to generate, organize and display statistical and research data; and standard English grammar, spelling, and usage; 3. Strong attention to detail; 4. Problem-solving and critical thinking skills; 5. Planning/organizational skills; 6. Personal motivation
Qualified candidates must be able to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization.

NYU School of Medicine provides its staff with far more than just a place to work. Rather, we are an institution you can be proud of, an institution where you'll feel good about devoting your time and your talents.

job_title: Technical Business Analyst- School of Med
desc:
NYU School of Medicine is one of the nation's top-ranked medical schools. For 175 years, NYU School of Medicine has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history and enrich the lives of countless people. An integral part of NYU Langone Health, the School of Medicine at its core is committed to improving the human condition through medical education, scientific research, and direct patient care. For more information, go to med.nyu.edu, and interact with us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.


Department: Institute for Innovations in Medical Education


Reports to: Director

Direct Patient Caregiver: No

A Technical Business Analyst is sought for the Division of Educational Informatics (DEI) within the Institute for Innovations in Medical Education (IIME) at NYU Langone Health. IIME drives world-class technology and informatics-based innovations in teaching, learning, evaluation, and assessment at the undergraduate, graduate and continuing medical education levels.

Position Summary:

The Business Analyst engages stakeholders across the education mission and helps them to define, validate, and document business requirements, mapping them to potential technology based solutions. The candidate will ultimately help to provide high-quality solutions and

deliverables within defined timelines, collaborating closely with technical implementation teams throughout the systems development life cycle. This translates into well-engineered, tested, and deployed business application systems. He/she will be responsible for developing project proposals, plans, timelines and resource estimates. The candidate will also be responsible for supporting the development of training and implementation material, participating in implementation, and providing post-implementation support.

This position will report to the Director of the Division of Educational Informatics.

General Responsibilities:
Reviews, analyzes and evaluates business systems within the NYU Langone Health education mission as well as user needs for education IT projects and initiatives.
Determines operational objectives by studying business functions and gathering information.
Understands the needs of multiple stakeholders across the education mission.
Leads discussions with project stakeholders to determine and document project and application requirements. Facilitates the negotiation of requirements among multiple stakeholders as needed. Defines scope and objectives and formulates systems that support overall business strategies.
Develops the design and functional specifications, produces deliverables related to the project(s) assigned and assists in post-implementation support and system enhancements.
Responsible for gathering, compiling and synthesizing information with regard to technology processes or systems.
Analyzes a chain of events and applies technical knowledge following established procedures and/or detailed specifications.
Troubleshoots problems in their area of expertise and escalates as appropriate and needed.

Specific Duties:
Facilitates design sessions with the implementation team to define solutions.
Delivers elements of systems design, including data migration rules, business rules, wireframes and other deliverables. Constructs workflow charts and diagrams.
Identifies project milestones, phases and elements; forms project teams; monitors project budget when applicable. Monitors project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, and publishing progress reports. Recommends actions for project owners and sponsors.
Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends.
Reviews user stories, system requirements, business rules and scenario documentation to verify they meet business requirements. Determines prioritization of functional scope and works with team members to set Agile sprint plans and release schedules.
Manages stakeholder needs and expectations.
Communicates effectively, both verbally and in writing, in one-to-one and group settings.
Other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications and Skills
Bachelor’s degree and 4 or more years of work experience in higher education setting or equivalent experience in complex organizations
Experience applying technology in a business setting
Ability to organize and manage large amounts of detailed information
Detail oriented, analytical and inquisitive
Ability to work independently and with others
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills
Comfort in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with multiple stakeholders
Ability to support multiple initiatives simultaneously, prioritize work to meet and/or

exceed established service levels

Preferred Qualifications
QA or developer background
Demonstrated knowledge and experience with project management
Demonstrated knowledge of business process analysis and improvement methodologies
Proficiency or experience with Business Intelligence software (Tableau)
Proficiency or experience with Jira

Business office setting.

Required Experience

Clearly defining success criteria for each stage of the project and ensuring successful completion of all tasks within the project plan on time and within budget.

Strong leadership skills with the ability to influence and motivate others.

Strong analytical capability with close attention to details.

Fox Corporation
Under the FOX banner, we produce and distribute content through some of the world’s leading and most valued brands, including: FOX News, FOX Sports, the Fox Network, and the FOX Television Stations. We empower a diverse range of creators to imagine and develop culturally significant content, while building an organization that thrives on creative ideas, operational expertise and strategic thinking.

We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join our team and deliver Salesforce development projects, including integrations with 3rd party systems. You will play a key role in business change management and monitor post-implementation satisfaction, and we want you to bring your unique skills to the table!

Team-focused and strong individual contributor

Morgan, Lewis & Bockius LLP, one of the world’s leading global law firms with over 4,000 lawyers and staff in 31 offices is currently seeking a Digital Marketing Analyst. job_title: Uber Eats Regional Operations Manager, Business Intelligence
desc:
At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.
About the Role

On the Uber Eats Regional Operations team, we're helping to scale our most impactful processes and initiatives, support markets, and drive innovation in the business. As the Business Intelligence Manager, you’ll be responsible for developing data-driven insights, creating strategies, and managing projects to improve the delivery experience for restaurants in the US and Canada. You’ll provide analytical support to Eats’ restaurant operations teams and work closely with Product, Engineering, Legal, and Finance to launch your projects and drive Eats’ growth.
What You’ll Do
Drive analysis on strategic decisions & operating initiatives, using data to help the team improve restaurant selection, reliability, and performance
Define KPIs and develop dashboards to track business performance
Identify operational weaknesses in the restaurant experience and build automated, scalable processes to address them (may utilize Python scripts, data pipelines, etc)
Develop analytical frameworks to support data-driven decision making
Present models, findings and insights to senior management to drive business decisions.
Partner with Product & Engineering to create and roll out new products to improve restaurant experience & reliability
Collaborate with other operations teams, Data Science, Product, CommOps, and more to ensure insights inform broader strategic initiatives
What You’ll Need
Bachelors in a quantitative discipline (Economics, Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance)
Prior experience in management consulting, banking, product, technology, data science, product analytics, economic consulting or a similar role
Comfort working with large amounts data
Python and SQL proficiency are a big plus
Proficiency with Tableau or other dashboarding tools is a plus
Exceptional communication and project management skills
Experience with building automation scripts or web applications is a plus
A “driver” personality - biased toward action, great collaborator and master simplifier - constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery
Self-motivated, works independently and possess strong organization and time management skills

Medidata: Conquering Diseases Together
Medidata is leading the digital transformation of life sciences with the world's most-used platform for clinical development, commercial and real-world data. Powered by artificial intelligence and delivered by #1 ranked industry experts, the Intelligent Platform for Life Sciences helps pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device companies and academic researchers accelerate value, minimize risk and optimize outcomes. Medidata serves more than 1,000 customers and partners worldwide and empowers more than 100,000 certified users every day to create hope for millions of patients. Discover the future of life sciences: www.mdsol.com
We know that diverse teams win and are fully committed to selecting leaders and employees that represent the markets in which we operate. We are still led by our Co-founders, Tarek Sherif and Glen de Vries, and have global operations in US, Europe and Asia with over 2000 employees.
Your Mission:
Work independently under the direction of business leaders and product management to provide feature-based solutions that support Medidata product strategy
Develop product requirements and processes for tools that make it easy for customers and internal teams to integrate and map to our services
Work with product members to finalize product priorities, including bug fixes
Create and own the business/product requirements documentation, including user stories
Interact with other Business Analysts, Product Owners, and internal stakeholders to understand new business requirements and enhancement requests.
Collaborate with the User Experience team to design amazing workflows for our customers
Interact with architecture, engineering, and quality assurance teams during the software build and/or configuration process and testing process.
Be the subject matter expert and product expert for multiple products/services

Provide accurate and timely information and escalates when there are issues.
Actively participate in meetings, including all agile ceremonies, and make valuable contributions.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to interact with technical resources and effectively communicate technical information and processes to relevant stakeholders
Ability to translate business needs to a technical team, including creating user stories, documenting use cases, acceptance criteria, and feature overviews
Critical thinking: Analysis and problem-solving skills to address core business problems; Ability to effectively evaluate a problem or situation from all angles to determine the most appropriate solution

Technical/software development experience a plus
Possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy
Skilled at creating business cases that meet product and strategic company objectives
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, continually evolving environment
Your Education & Experience:
Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 8 years of related experience; or an advanced degree 5+ years experience
Relevant experience with SaaS products, Life Sciences, and/or highly regulated industries strongly preferred
Agile experience strongly preferred
Medidata is making a real difference in the lives of patients everywhere by accelerating critical drug and medical device development, enabling life-saving drugs and medical devices to get to market faster. Our products sit at the convergence of the Technology and Life Sciences industries, one of most exciting areas for global innovation. Nine of the top 10 best-selling drugs in 2017 were developed on the Medidata platform.
Medidata’s solutions have powered over 14,000 clinical trials giving us the largest collection of clinical trial data in the world. With this asset, we pioneer innovative, advanced applications and intelligent data analytics, bringing an unmatched level of quality and efficiency to clinical trials enabling treatments to reach waiting patients sooner

Revlon has developed a long-standing reputation as a color authority and beauty trendsetter in the world of color cosmetics and hair care. Since its breakthrough launch of the first opaque nail enamel in 1932, Revlon has provided consumers with high quality product innovation, performance and sophisticated glamour. In 2016, Revlon acquired the iconic Elizabeth Arden Company and its portfolio of brands, including its leading designer, heritage and celebrity fragrances. Today, Revlon's diversified portfolio of brands is sold in approximately 150 countries around the world in most retail distribution channels, including prestige, salon, mass, and direct to consumer. Revlon is among the leading global beauty companies, with some of the world’s most iconic and desired brands and product offerings in color cosmetics, skin care, hair care, hair color and fragrances under brands such as Revlon, Revlon Professional, Elizabeth Arden, American Crew, Almay, Cutex, Mitchum, Elizabeth Taylor, Christina Aguilera, Britney Spears, Juicy Couture, Curve, Shawn Mendes and John Varvatos.

Develop ROI business cases to support new and existing product development.
Flag trends and issues where relevant and offer data-backed recommendations
Ensure data integrity across all performance-based metrics, tracking and reporting.
Interpret and communicate information in a manner that can be comprehended by non-analytical audience.
Strong experience at writing SQL queries against complex databases for the purpose of data extraction
Additional Responsibilities:

Knowledge of the Internet landscape, including a comprehension of display advertising, lead-oriented/search-oriented (cost per click, cost per lead, cost per call) business models.
Ability to translate business questions into problems solvable using analytics tools, and enjoy converting the results of your analyses into visual stories tailored to the needs of the audience.
Strong written and verbal communication skills and have experience working on and communicating with fast-paced, dynamic teams.
Team-oriented, self-motivated, success-driven, roll-up-your-sleeves attitude
Experience & Education:

Undergraduate or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. engineering, business, economics, finance, statistics, and analytics).
Experience:

7+ years’ experience in Business intelligence and analytics

Summary:
The Alternatives Operations team is looking for a dynamic individual to perform Operations and Business Analysis to help drive process re-design and implementation. This role is supporting the rapid growth of the NB Private Markets business working directly with Investment professionals, fund controllers, and other support and control teams. The role will also involve day to day support functions as needed to shore up existing and transition of new functions. Tool sets to be used for supporting this change agenda will include robotics, functionalization of processes, as well as implementation new applications for work flow, treasury, CRM and other 3rd party vendors.
The NB Private Markets business includes all significant strategies in private equity and credit as well as other Private Market products such as funds of hedge funds and consumer brands. Additionally, new product development is an important component of this business. Developing efficient processes and implementation of control framework for new products is a component of this role. This individual should be able to work in a fast paced environment and work well under pressure.

Demonstrated skill performing business analysis and process design
Must be able to perform requirements analysis and write business requirements documents including current and proposed process, workflow diagrams and business process flows, procedures and operating documents.

Ability to critically analyze information and make sound judgments and recommendations
Must have strong communication/presentation skills. Proven ability to commutate effectively cross Technology, Operations, investment professionals and senior management.
Must be detailed oriented, demonstrate excellent organizational and follow through skills.
Demonstrate the ability to manage multiple initiatives at the same time
Hard working, self-motivated, demonstrate high level of initiative, assertive and be flexible.
Requirements:
B.A. degree in Accounting or Finance or equivalent experience
4+ years’ experience in financial services operations – preferably in, Private Equity, Asset Management, Hedge Fund Accounting or Consulting.
Knowledge of Hazeltree, Salesforce, Apien, Tableau is a plus
Derivative and Bank Loan knowledge is a plus
Professional team player; ability to work with a variety of personalities
Proficient with Microsoft Excel, with an ability to work with large data sets.

Job Description:
The Cross Asset Exchange Traded Funds (ETF) Technology Team is building next generation of technology solutions to solve for business, competitive and regulatory requirements in the ETF landscape to enable Citi to be platform of choice for ETFs.
The role of ETF Lead Business Analyst involves being part of a dynamic team and contributing towards the product rollout and software development of core components within this next generation ETF Platform. Specifically, acting as lead BA for projects in ETF Market Making, Create Redeem and Liquidity Sourcing using ETFs.
The ideal candidate will have experience in building and optimizing ETF platforms and will work closely with our systems architects, development managers, traders, quants, and analysts to help define and analyze business requirements and manage delivery of the projects. Strong senior level stakeholder management skills are desirable and ability to work with geographically distributed team on multiple projects is essential.
Development Value:
The candidate would get opportunity to work on projects across Equities, Fixed Income & Commodities asset classes, be part of a team building unique cross asset solutions and contribute towards the goal of increasing revenue by building robust and scalable platforms. The candidate will work directly with bright and innovative individuals on both the business and technology side, and the successful candidate can make a significant difference to business performance.
Key Responsibilities:
Work as lead business analyst in the Cross Asset ETF team with traders, quants and technology teams
Manage & oversee deliverables & resources distributed across many different technology teams across the front to back application stack
Gather business requirements, perform detailed analysis, and produce associated functional specifications across multiple functions
Ensure adherence to and develop best practices supporting Citi’s Project Management Standards
Produce implementation approach, timelines, go-live strategy
Develop Subject Matter Expertise on the key ETF technology solutions
Partner with business, technology and quant stakeholders to suggest innovative solutions to existing issues
Ensure the ETF business needs are met with the most elegant and timely technology solutions
Work with technology leads across various teams to accomplish the ETF project objectives
Partner with business & technology leads globally to deliver an E2E solution
Define cutover strategy from existing solutions to newer strategic solutions
Provide regular updates to senior management in technology and business
Participation in large-scale “highly-visible” SIT/UAT testing cycles managing technology and business stakeholders
Training of relevant teams prior to go-live of new business processes/products, functionality or applications
Go-live support, investigation of issues
Qualifications:
Graduate or undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent
8+ years of business analysis experience in client facing business management roles
Significant Business Analysis experience across the full project lifecycle (requirements, design, development, testing and deployment).
Solid experience in Equities, ETFs, Electronic Trading, Market Making, Order & Execution Management Systems, Front to Back Trade Lifecycle
Experience in Trading Applications, Trading GUIs and Multi Dealer Platforms
Strong understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle
Strong understanding of FIX message specification
Proven delivery record of multiple projects involving process change and technology enhancements
Ability to handle complex projects independently
Problem-solving and facilitation skills
Self-motivation and prioritization of tasks and actions to hit deadlines according to business priorities
Strong inter-personal skills
Enthusiastic and proactive approach
Good attention to detail and relevant product knowledge
Excellent analytical and process-based skills, i.e. process flow diagrams, business modelling, and functional design
Experience with Global Markets Product Knowledge (Equities & Fixed Income)
Experience with modern software development practices (test-driven development, Agile continuous integration)
Excellent communication skills and experience in communicating with sales and traders
Willingness to learn
Comfortable in presenting suggestions for change and or improving work flow

Ability to leverage strong interpersonal collaboration skills in a fast-paced team environment
The candidate is expected to be dynamic, flexible with a high energy level as this is a demanding and rapidly changing environment

The Enterprise Business Analysis team partners with Project Managers, IT Domains, System Analysts, Enterprise Architects, Business Owners, and Subject Matter Experts to elicit, analyze, and document Business Requirements, User Stories, and Functional Requirements within Waterfall and Agile development methodologies that will be used by the IT Domain’s Development and Delivery teams for creation and enhancement of products and services.


Enterprise Business Analysts represent the end to end business value streams across a given line of business, domain or segment. They are accountable for conceptualizing, eliciting, analyzing, documenting and communicating innovative solutions to meet or exceed business objectives. They are responsible for defining the scope and objectives of the overall business strategies, reconciling short-term solutions with long-term objectives and infrastructure strengths and formulating solutions and core system capabilities that will strategically drive efficiencies in the business.
Job Description & Responsibilities:
Elicit complex requirements (business, functional, non-functional, and technical) using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, task and workflow analysis.
Document and maintain requirements by performing requirements analysis.
Perform upfront analysis to better present the EPICs and Features and the Program and Portfolio level.
Facilitate requirement sessions within the SAFe Framework.
Within the SAFE framework, collaborate closely with both the development team and QA.
Closely liaise with the business to fully understand their initiatives and perspective and to verify that the User Stories reflect the same.
Provide assistance in maintaining the backlog on SAFe initiatives.
Work closely with the Enterprise Architecture team to assist in developing the solution.
Write User Stories and determine the proper level of Acceptance Criteria.
Verify that the Stories that are written are in line with the value identified.
Own the requirements dealing with all integration points.
Manage dependencies among separate trains.
Work with the Business Units on process changes that occur due to the initiative.
When an outside vendor is involved, work with the vendor to understand configuration of the application plus any customizations made and retain that knowledge.
Utilize industry standard BPM principles, such as hierarchical decomposition, clear separation of business and systems to promote reusability of processes on projects.
Elicit, develop and specify detailed requirements according to standard templates, using natural language.
Deliver and maintain SDLC analysis artifacts as needed (including, prospectus, requirement management plan, requirements in ALM, user stories, use cases, etc).
Proactively communicate and collaborate with business and internal IT team members to analyze information needs and requirements.
Collaborate with IT team members and subject matter experts to establish the implementation strategy to support the business vision.
Develop an understanding of business problems and opportunities in the context of the requirements.
Perform enterprise analysis to understand the needs of the business as a whole, its strategic direction and work with System Business Analyst and Enterprise Architects to identify solutions to enable the business to achieve its strategic goals.
Support junior team members in similar roles and job functions.
Perform other related duties as assigned by appropriate management.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science or related field or five (5) years of equivalent work experience in a related field.
Five to Seven (5-7) years of experience in: Business analysis including eliciting, analyzing, and documenting business, system, and/or non-functional/technical requirements to include scope analysis, process modeling, data modeling, use case development, etc. & Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) including developing and managing business and technical documentation for software development in the form of user stories, test cases, functional and/or non-functional specifications.
Minimum of three (3) years of experience in a senior or lead role.
Preferred Requirements
Previous work experience in the health insurance or insurance industry.
Experience in Agile, with emphasis on the SAFe framework and Waterfall methodology.
Experience with VersionOne
SAFe PO/PM and or Scrum Master Certification.
SAFe Practitioner Certification.
Understanding of the Scrum Master role within SAFe.
Understanding of the Product Owner role within SAFe.
Understanding of Enterprise Architecture and how it meets the business’ needs.
Experience in Microsoft Project Server and HP ALM
Experience working in a team environment to help drive assignments to conclusion.
Research and information gathering skills.
Ability to organize deliverables in order to accomplish multiple and changing priorities within specified timeframe.
Strive to achieve high levels of individual and organizational performance.
Seeks opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen stakeholder relationships.
IIBA (CBAP) or other Business Analysis certification preferred

desc:
SENIOR BUSINESS ANALYST, TRADE & TRANSACTION REPORTING OPERATIONS (TTRO)
NEW YORK, NY
About the Team:
Capital Markets is part of Capco’s DNA. In fact, the Capco name was inspired by this domain. The Capital Markets team delivers expert consulting skills and deep product and functional knowledge across all areas of the front office, operations, technology, risk, finance and compliance. Our clients include the largest investment banks, global universal banks and capital markets divisions from regional banks across the country and around the globe.
Our delivery expertise spans across launching new lines of business, coordinating high-impact regulatory response programs, leading complex integration projects and analyzing the dependencies in an application rationalization effort. We have a consistent track record in helping clients with significant cost reductions and ensuring our clients grow, change and compete.
About the Job:
The Trade and Transaction Reporting Operations (TTRO) team is responsible for the successful delivery of existing and new regulatory reporting efforts globally. This role is for the CFTC (Commodity Futures Trading Commission) team under the TTRO umbrella.
What You’ll Get to Do:
The individual in this role will be involved in the Business analysis for several new and Existing regulatory reporting implementations.
The individual will actively participate in writing requirement JIRAs, and work with developers and QA team as required during implementation.
What You’ll Bring with You:
Bachelors degree.
6 plus years of senior consultant experience.
Experience in Derivatives, Agile Change management, regulatory reporting, regulatory change projects and/or regulatory reporting efforts.
Ability to translate requirements stated in the regulatory rules into delivery efforts.
Strong knowledge of investment bank operations and front to back processes.
Strong derivative product knowledge.
Ability to prepare project reporting and business requirement documents.
Strong MS Office and Jira skills. Nice to have testing skills.
Why CAPCO?
You will join a company that supports and encourages an entrepreneurial outlook and independent thinking. Capco is not about organizational charts and layers – we operate with little hierarchy because we want all employees to feel that Capco is their firm.

We offer highly competitive benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan, tuition reimbursement, and a work culture focused on innovation and creation of lasting value for our clients and employees.

Ready to take the Next Step
If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. This is an opportunity to make a difference and contribute to a highly successful company with a significant growth trajectory.
